column40: Our platform focuses on a multi-player approach via our family portals. A few product features include   Care Circle  My CareLinq’s service revolves around the concept of a Care Circle. There is at least one family caregiver in a Care Circle. At the nucleus of a Care Circle is the identity and profile of the person receiving care (the care recipient or person-in-care). All activities and communications orbit around the Care Circle and are documented within various sections of the care plan associated with a person receiving care.   There is a Care Plan associated with a Care Circle. The Care Plan is a record of care planning activities, decisions, suggestions, communications, wishes and instructions made for the person-in-care.  When an end-user creates an account, the Care Plan begins to document and track all participant activities. This Care Plan is associated with the Care Circle. A Care Plan can be shared among caregivers in the Care Circle as well as the designated Care Concierge for the Care Circle.    We believe a family caregiving service and solution must account for multiple participants that are involved in some capacity in providing care.  To empower family caregivers they need the communication and collaboration tools that enables transparency, support, and faster decision making.  Even Care Concierges must be invited into the Care Circle to be a participant and assist, although not necessary to get services.

column55: Providing services in this category of benefits really takes a special touch.  Our Care Concierges go to great lengths to solve problem and remove barriers that may appear to be insurmountable for a family caregiver.  We are committed to do the right thing by our customers and ensure we deliver with a high degree of integrity.  Our customers may change their mind or make different requests, our job is to support each customer along their journey and guide them to ensure the best outcomes.

column40: Talkspace is the Leader in Comprehensive Care:  We are THE pioneer in the virtual mental health arena, building the first virtual national network of clinicians and first asynchronous messaging model. Now, our Comprehensive Care model covers all areas of individuals’ needs and interests. We lead the industry in research, efficacy and impact and are the most trusted and recognized brand in our space.  We provide same day access:  With all of our services, individuals can start the same day they sign up. Whether matching with a therapist, psychiatrist or engaging in self-guided programs and classes, individuals can start right away with Talkspace, and not wait weeks, or longer to begin.  We are committed to Diversity:  With our ongoing mission to provide better access, affordability, and choice, we foster inclusivity and diversity in our network, helping individuals access the care that’s right for them.  We provide effective care:  Through our 20+ research studies, Talkspace is proven, professional and effective. We work with our partners to drive high utilization, deliver satisfaction, valid results & outcomes through clinical expertise, marketing & strategy, along with robust reporting, analytics & data.  Our clients love us:  Our Comprehensive Care model is easy to use, convenient, and allows individuals to access the care and services they need, when they need it. And they show us the love with over 60,000 5-star reviews!

column54: Customer support provides coverage seven (7) days a week, from 9am - 7pm EST during the week, and 9am - 5:30pm EST during the weekend Support staff may be reduced on Talkspace observed holidays (list of holidays will be provided upon request).  The Talkspace Customer Support Team holds BA/BS degree and have at least a year of experience in customer service or a related field. The ProtoCall team answering the 24/7 crisis hotline are masters-level clinical mental health professionals who have specialized training to respond with crisis intervention and stabilization services.
column55: Talkspace places great importance on our customer partnerships and allocates significant resources to address concerns swiftly, provide clear insights regarding data, services, and our processes, keep our partners updated on Platform improvements and new offerings, and establish trust as a cornerstone of our business relationships. We have established a dedicated email box exclusively for our key stakeholders, which is monitored and managed by a core team of specialists well-versed in the inner workings of our Platform and services. Our commitment is to ensure that all inquiries receive a response within one business day. Furthermore, our core team of specialists directly oversees any questions or issues experienced by Client's population.  To enhance your experience, a Talkspace account manager will serve as Client's advocate, proactively collaborating with internal departments to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions in alignment with Client's business objectives. As your primary point of contact, your Talkspace account manager will provide exceptional service by furnishing crucial data through regular reports, possessing in-depth knowledge of Talkspace Platform functionality and enhancements, and serving as "the voice of the customer," effectively conveying market needs to internal stakeholders.
column56: Our therapists undergo rigorous onboarding training and receive continuous, ongoing support and education to ensure they deliver the highest standard of care. The Talkspace provider network is a diverse collection of experienced professionals, spanning more than 20 clinical specialties. To maintain the quality of our services, all Talkspace providers are credentialed in accordance with NCQA standards and have an impressive average of 8 years of clinical experience.
column67: Our Standard Implementation with each [ClientEmail] will take around 2 - 4 weeks. Talkspace guides every client through five essential phase gates to ensure a successful journey:  Kick-Off -Team Intros: Introducing the Talkspace team to your organization, fostering open communication and collaboration. -Goals: Defining clear goals and objectives for the Talkspace implementation process. -Org/Culture Orientation: Gaining a deep understanding of your organization's culture and values to align the implementation strategy accordingly.  Planning: -Developing a comprehensive project plan, including timelines, milestones, dependencies, and user experience considerations.  Implementation: -Configuration: Customizing Talkspace to meet your organization's specific needs and requirements. -Communication & Marketing: Developing effective communication and marketing strategies to promote Talkspace within your organization. -Integration & Training: Integrating Talkspace seamlessly into your existing systems and providing comprehensive training to ensure a smooth transition for your team.  Launch: -Production Launch Metrics: Implementing robust metrics and measurements to track the success of the Talkspace launch and adoption within your organization. -Testimonials: Encouraging users to share their positive experiences and testimonials to showcase the value and impact of Talkspace.  Partnership: -Strategic Planning: Collaborating with your organization to develop long-term strategic plans for maximizing the benefits of Talkspace and continuously enhancing mental health support. -Reporting: Providing detailed reports and analytics to monitor progress, identify trends, and make informed decisions for ongoing optimization.  Expansion: -Exploring opportunities for expanding Talkspace services and benefits to more departments or locations within your organization, based on successful implementation and positive outcomes.  Through these phase gates, Talkspace ensures a comprehensive and well-structured implementation process, fostering a strong partnership with your organization and driving ongoing success in promoting mental health and well-being.

column74: Our enrollment materials are the result of collaborative efforts, involving our Marketing team in conjunction with the Product and Network teams. These materials undergo a comprehensive legal review before being disseminated externally. This array of resources includes brochures, one-page overviews, wallet cards, and product demo videos. To maintain accuracy and accessibility, we diligently update these materials on a quarterly basis, ensuring they are readily accessible to your Product, Marketing, and Account teams via our communications portal.  For pre-enrollment educational materials, meticulous attention is given to their creation and peer review by Talkspace's Clinical Content Team. This team comprises experienced and licensed therapists with diverse expertise in various behavioral health fields. They generate content for groups, producers, and members, and also contribute to Talkspace's consumer blog. Their insights have been featured in renowned media outlets, including The New York Times and Cosmopolitan Magazine. Common content formats include articles and videos, with new content becoming available every quarter. Just like enrollment materials, these resources can be accessed by your teams through our communications portal.  Post-enrollment, members receive account-related and marketing communications through our app, email, and push notifications, which accompany them throughout their care journey. Each member receives Talkspace's welcome series via email, providing them with valuable information about our services and setting them up for success. Account-related messages, appointment reminders, message notifications, and assessment result notifications are delivered securely through the app, email, and push notifications, while respecting HIPAA guidelines. We take extra care to ensure that sensitive treatment details, such as clinical survey results and messaging transcripts, are not shared via email or push notifications. Account-related messages are meticulously crafted by our Clinical product team and undergo legal review before being deployed through our automation platform.  Our marketing messages primarily focus on experience surveys, benefit availability reminders, and new service features. These messages are thoughtfully developed by our Marketing team, ensuring compliance with regulations and undergoing review by multiple teams, including Product, Legal, and Clinical Network, based on the subject matter.  Our automation platforms operate on a de-identified data basis, delivering personalized communications to members to assist them in navigating their care experience. These communications are tailored based on registration date, benefit plan (such as payer), chosen care (therapy vs. psychiatry), and care plan, including live session bookings.
column79: At Talkspace, we believe in the immense value of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). Our DEIB policy is a testament to our commitment to building a thriving and supportive workplace that appreciates the unique experiences, perspectives, and talents each team member contributes. We understand that a diverse and inclusive environment not only enhances our organization's creativity, innovation, and problem-solving abilities but also strengthens our dedication to making mental health care accessible and culturally competent for everyone. By advocating for DEIB, we are actively working toward a more just, equal, and empathetic world where everyone can flourish and achieve their full potential.   Currently, our network diversity statistics are as follows:  35% experienced in LGBTQ-specific issues 48% identify as a race other than white (BIPOC) 45% are over the age of 40 13% specialize in First Responders 35% specialize in Teens  The Talkspace network is continually evolving and information is updated on a bimonthly basis and is available to partners at their request.
column81: Although we don't mandate eligibility or demographic files, we gladly accept them if you have them on hand. We do require user's email domain.
column91: Access to AWS is strictly enforced with the requirement of Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA). The majority of our tools are either Single Sign-On (SSO) enabled or incorporate Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for added security. Additionally, Talkspace employs a robust access control system, which is pivotal in the process of granting or revoking access to any functionality within our platform. This system is fortified with Segregation of Duties (SOD) principles and is subjected to biannual access audits. The roles managed by this system are endowed with varying security levels to ensure the highest standards of data protection and system integrity.
column92: For our core therapy/psychiatry app, these are the primary elements included in quarterly reporting:    Registration - Defined as the number of members who are aware of the Talkspace benefit and decide to sign up. The number of registrations is often closely tied to how an institution communicates the benefit to their members, and reflects the demand/need for therapy.   Engagement - Defined as the average length of time users stay active with Talkspace and what modalities they are using. Many members sign up for therapy just to try it out, while there are also those who find it very helpful, so they commit to the completion of the program. Engaged users over time shows the proportion of users active over time (per week since conversion), scaled by the initial number of users active in the first week of the timeframe.   Clinical Effectiveness - The measurement of if and how much users are seeing improvement in their mental health over time, taking into consideration if they are simply feeling better coupled with true symptom reduction. Effectiveness is measured through clinical assessments (i.e. depression, anxiety, etc.) that users are prompted to complete in order to assess improvement. We administer clinical surveys at 21-day increments and track the progress of users by comparing baseline scores to follow-up survey scores. If a user scores lower on a follow-up survey than on their baseline, this user is deemed to show improvement.  Users Improvement by Gender: We track and analyze the progress made by users based on gender, providing valuable data on gender-specific improvements and trends within your member population.  Users Improvement by Age: By examining user improvement across different age groups, we offer insights into how various age demographics benefit from Talkspace, allowing you to understand the effectiveness of our platform across different life stages.  Users Improvement by Presenting Problem: We monitor and assess the progress of users based on their presenting problems or mental health concerns, providing valuable insights into the effectiveness of Talkspace in addressing specific issues.  Effectiveness on Depression: We measure the effectiveness of Talkspace in alleviating symptoms of depression, providing data on the positive impact our platform has on individuals struggling with depressive symptoms.  Effectiveness on Anxiety: We evaluate the effectiveness of Talkspace in reducing symptoms of anxiety, offering insights into how our platform supports individuals in managing and overcoming anxiety-related challenges.  Effectiveness at work: We assess the impact of Talkspace on member related issues, such as stress management, work-life balance, and overall mental well-being, demonstrating the positive influence our platform can have on employees' professional lives.  User Profile - User profile data includes demographics and data collected at registration for each user. It is manually inputted by the user when prompted. Understanding which members are more likely to utilize the service is helpful. You can view data on how many users are trying therapy for the first time, in addition to a breakdown of age, gender, location, and the most common presenting issues.   Provider Satisfaction - When users reach certain life cycle thresholds, they will be prompted to complete a therapist check-in survey. They will provide a rating from 1 to 5 for their therapist, as well as satisfaction reasons. Satisfaction is measured on a scale of 1-5, with 5 being very satisfied with the therapist.    With the Talkspace Self-Guided program, via the admin user Talkspace Engage portal, the dashboard is provided in real-time and shows:  Utilization - Users can see how many people have registered and how many are actively using the app and utilization percentages.  Self-Guided Sessions Taken - Users may view at any time the number of sessions their members are completing as well as the top five topics.  Classes Booked - Users can view the number of people attending live classes and the top five class subjects.  Assessments - Users can also view the types of assessments members are taking and then view the ranking by topic, e.g. relationship issues, anxiety, & burnout.
column101: Talkspace provides Comprehensive Care  for a wide variety of behavioral health  and general wellness/wellbeing needs. Our three core services; Therapy, Psychiatry, and Self-Guided, are accessed through our secure, proprietary apps and/or website.   Therapy, is conducted via both unlimited asynchronous communication, and scheduled live virtual sessions. Individuals aged 13 and above  can message their 1:1,dedicated therapist via text, audio or video, as often as they wish, anytime of the day or night, 7 days a week; their therapist engages via the same types of messaging, daily, 5 days per week (5 days based on therapist’s chosen schedule, not only Monday through Friday). Asynchronous messaging eliminates the significant barrier that prevents people from accessing strictly appointment-based behavioral care; scheduling and commuting to a recurring therapy appointment. If they choose, users can also engage in virtual sessions with their dedicated therapist, conducted live, via video, phone or chat, and can conveniently schedule just 2 - 4 days in advance, often sooner.   Psychiatry is conducted 1:1 with a dedicated state Board Certified Psychiatrist or state Licensed Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner through live video appointments. Individuals aged 18 and above can access initial consultations, assessments, evaluations, diagnoses, and ongoing medication management. The seamless communication between Talkspace therapists with Talkspace licensed prescribers on the platform simplifies the sharing of treatment plans. Upon registration, individuals can typically schedule their first session within 4-7 days, all from the comfort and privacy of their home, or private location of their choice.  Talkspace Self-Guided is dedicated to expanding wellness/wellbeing and behavioral health services through evidence-based solutions. Self-Guided empowers individuals 13 and older to take control of their progress, offering clinically supported programs that address various aspects of their lives, in core areas, including personal well-being, work-life issues, couples & relationships, teen & young adult concerns, and parenting. These programs cover a wide array of both common and unique topics such as anxiety, depression, burnout, alcohol and substance use, diversity, equity, and inclusion, as well as healthy relationships, work/life effectiveness and so many others. Individuals take part in each program they choose at their own pace and convenience, through a series of brief 3 - 7 minute exercises (called “sessions”) designed to be stimulating and engaging, such as self-assessments, journaling, meditations, videos, gamification, and more. When they complete one program’s exercises, individuals are encouraged to begin another program that fits their needs. Additionally, Talkspace Self-Guided includes Live Interactive, Group Classes led by licensed therapists, addressing essential aspects of the human experience, including topical, current, popular issues and situations realted the core Self-Guided areas of personal well-being, work-life issues, couples & relationships, teen & young adult concerns, and parenting. Each week there are 4 - 6 new and unique live classes held; some examples are Managing Work Stress, Tracking Anxiety triggers, Aligning Parenting Styles, Healing broken Trust, Sleep Management & Exam Fatique, Dealing with Difficult Classmates. Upon completion, all classes have been recorded and become a part of our on-demand class library, of 400+ classes and growing, accessible to users 24/7/365.  Self-Guided also has daily reflections to keep individuals engaged, supplementary resources, and an ever-growing content library.
column104: The Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA) is by its title, an Employer’s issue, not directly a Talkspace issue. Talkspace does not take a role in the reporting required of the Employer. ERISA generally applies when an employer establishes and maintains, through the purchase of insurance or otherwise, an “employee welfare benefit plan” for the benefit of its employees and their beneficiaries. An “employee welfare benefit plan” includes any plan, fund or program providing medical, surgical, or hospital care or benefits, or benefits in the event of sickness, accident, or disability or unemployment.  Because the potential benefits available through Talkspace include mental health counseling, the Talkspace Benefits (including EAP) do fall within the Employer’s ERISA reporting requirements.   ERISA requires that an employee welfare benefit plan be set forth in writing and that each participant be provided with a summary plan description (“SPD”), which includes certain required information to inform participants of their rights and sets forth the plan’s claims procedures. Talkspace can provide the Employer assistance in creating the report by offering the Talkspace Description of Standard Services.  If the Employer’s plan covers 100 or more participants, the employer will be required to file annual reports (using Form 5500) with the Department of Labor. If an annual report Form 5500 is required, ERISA requires that covered participants and certain beneficiaries must receive an annual statement summarizing the latest annual report for the plan. Again, Talkspace role is only in offering the required description of the Talkspace benefit.  Employers typically consider EAP benefits as a sub-plan or component of their overall group health benefit program and part of their Form 5500.   Another common approach is for employers to maintain a welfare “WRAP” plan whereby all of the employer’s welfare benefit programs are wrapped together under a single umbrella plan for purposes of ERISA. Adopting a WRAP plan document enables the plan sponsor to collapse Form 5500 filings (life, disability, medical, mental health, dental, vision, etc.) into a single filing. Thus, the Talkspace Program would simply be an additional benefit program offered under the WRAP plan reporting.  Even if an employer chooses to treat the Talkspace Program as a separate stand-alone plan, the employer should again be able to attach the required SPD disclosures and claims procedures using the “Talkspace Standard Description of Services” to create an ERISA compliant document.
column106: The Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (COBRA) gives employees who lose their health benefits the right to choose to continue group health benefits provided by their group health plan for limited periods of time under certain circumstances, usually for 18 months following the end of employment. Both Talkspace Direct to Employer offerings and EAP offerings are likely to be considered part of a “Group Health Plan” for purposes of determining COBRA eligibility. Talkspace can, at the Employers' guidance, continue to charge the PEPM charge for the eighteen months (or as long as the employee wants COBRA up to 18 months) and the employer will decide to pay the minor cost or pass along only the monthly PEPM to the ex-employee to pay as part of their now privately paid health care cost. The same applies to an EAP cost transferred to the employee.

column40: In the realm of benefits, Joshin is redefining inclusive support. Traditional services often prioritize child caregivers, but we step in to serve the nearly 50% of our members who are adults with disabilities.  Joshin offers more than just therapy or EAP; it's a safe space for neurodivergent individuals. Many of our members deal with conditions like autism, ADHD, epilepsy, and mental health issues, and we understand that these experiences are interconnected. Our navigators and coaches are well-equipped to provide comprehensive support for all aspects of life.  We believe in tailoring the Joshin experience to your preferences, whether you seek self-service or guidance from a Navigator. We offer flexibility through phone, messaging, or video, ensuring your engagement is tailored to your needs.  Unlike traditional models that may limit sessions or close cases, Joshin provides continuous support. Our focus is on empowering individuals, recognizing their unique journey, and ensuring that everyone receives the support they deserve, regardless of their needs or life stage.
column43: We offer a flexible pricing structure that takes into account both the services you select and the size of the employee base you wish to support. Whether you're at the initial stages of your disability inclusion efforts or fully dedicated to making a substantial impact, our pricing options are designed to be customizable. This approach allows us to create a tailored program that not only aligns with your budget but also precisely fits your selected services and the number of employees you intend to support.
column54: Joshin provides employees access to message or schedule Navigator support through the Joshin mobile or web application during regular business hours, Monday through Friday 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM CST, except for holidays.
column55: At Joshin, we take a unique approach to customer service that goes beyond simply opening and closing cases. Instead, we are committed to providing ongoing, sustainable support for our clients. We understand that the needs of individuals with neurodivergence and disabilities can be diverse and ever-evolving. As a result, we don’t just treat cases as isolated incidents; rather, we tailor our support to each employee’s specific and evolving needs.  Our holistic approach involves continuous engagement and a proactive stance in adapting to the unique requirements of each individual. We provide expert-led virtual coaching, digital programs, and personalized navigation to create an environment that fosters more engaged employees. This comprehensive approach ensures that our clients receive the support they need over the long term, contributing to the creation of strong workplace cultures. Like Sequoia, we stand by our commitment to come through for our clients, demonstrating our dedication to their success and well-being.
column56: Our providers offer a unique blend of personal and professional experience in disability and neurodivergence. They bring a wealth of insights to our members, ranging from their firsthand experiences living with a disability to their professional expertise as Occupational Therapists, Certified Job Coaches, Organization specialists, and more.  It's important to note that the support provided is not therapy; instead, it focuses on delivering social and emotional support to our members.
column67: Our implementation process typically spans 4-6 weeks, during which we engage in the following key activities:  Single Sign-On (SSO) Integration: We kick off the process by seamlessly integrating the Single Sign-On (SSO) feature to ensure a secure and user-friendly experience.  Customized Communication Strategy: We work closely with your team to create a tailored communication strategy that aligns perfectly with your unique requirements and objectives.  Comprehensive Marketing Toolkit: To support your strategic outreach efforts, we provide you with a comprehensive marketing toolkit equipped with the necessary resources and materials.  Planned Launch Event: To ensure a impactful start, we assist in planning and executing a well-orchestrated launch event that sets the stage for a successful implementation.  Included in our tailored strategy is setting up introductory meetings to pertinent departments to rollout Joshin for most effective engagement and education (e.g., Accommodations, Talent Acquisition, ERGs, DEI)
column73: Either Party must provide notice of its intent to terminate the partnership at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of the then-current term.
column74: At Joshin, we understand that effective communication is vital for our clients' success. We go the extra mile to provide personalized and high-touch communication support through a dedicated Client Success Team. This team is committed to tailoring their approach to meet the unique needs of each client.  Our tailored communication support includes:  Personalization: We take the time to understand your specific requirements and the intricacies of your data. By doing so, we can customize our communication strategies to resonate with your audience, ensuring that every message is highly relevant and impactful.  Diagnosis-Specific Communications: We believe in precision when it comes to communication. Our team is adept at crafting diagnosis-specific messages that are not only accurate but also sensitive to the individual needs of your clients. This approach helps in fostering trust and engagement.  Enhanced Engagement: The tailored communication approach is designed to improve engagement levels significantly. By delivering content and messages that resonate with your clients on a personal level, we enhance their overall experience, making them more likely to actively participate and seek support.  Heightened Satisfaction: Ultimately, our goal is to enhance client satisfaction. By providing the exact assistance they need, clients are more likely to feel understood, valued, and supported, leading to improved satisfaction levels and long-lasting, positive relationships.  We take pride in offering a communication support system that not only meets your needs but also exceeds your expectations, ensuring that every interaction with your clients is meaningful and beneficial.
column79: Addressing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) is crucial in today's workplace, but it's often overlooked when it comes to disability inclusion. The statistics reveal that only 4% of companies have plans that include disability in their DEI initiatives. At Joshin, we recognize this gap and strive to bridge it by offering comprehensive support both internally and externally.  Internally, we prioritize creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. Our commitment to DEI starts with our own team, fostering a culture that values differences and embraces them. We promote awareness and understanding of disabilities, including non-visible ones, and actively encourage employees to disclose their disabilities in a safe and confidential environment. This open approach allows us to learn from one another and continuously improve our practices.  Externally, we provide modern support solutions that contribute to more inclusive workplaces. Joshin offers:  Expert-Led Virtual Coaching: Our expert-led coaching is designed to empower employees with disabilities and neurodivergent conditions. By offering personalized guidance and support, we enable them to thrive in their roles and become more engaged contributors to your organization.  Digital Programs: We offer digital programs that are tailored to the needs of diverse employees, making the workplace more accessible and accommodating. These programs cover various aspects, from professional development to improving overall well-being.  Personalized Navigation: Our personalized navigation services help individuals navigate the complexities of their disabilities, ensuring they can access the support and resources they need. This personalized approach fosters a sense of belonging and inclusivity.  By leveraging Joshin, you can actively support your DEI initiatives by creating a more inclusive and supportive workplace environment. We firmly believe that building cultures of disability inclusion not only drives engagement but also encourages employees to feel safe and comfortable disclosing their disabilities. Together, we can work towards a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive future, where everyone's unique abilities are celebrated and valued.  Joshin is dedicated to making a positive impact on the landscape of DEI by addressing the underrepresented area of disability inclusion and helping organizations build more inclusive cultures.

column92: Utilization reporting includes the following: Member onboarding and demographic information, including diagnosis, self-id to their organization, persona (self, loved one, ally, manager), race, pronouns, and more. Top 5, Quarterly, and Total Coach booking, engagement topics, and goals Top 5, Quarterly, and Total Navigator booking and goals Quarterly and Total Care booking metrics Top 5, Quarterly, and Total Training Enrollments and Resources Sought CSAT scores  An Admin Website is being developed for Q1 2024.
column101: Live 1:1 Virtual Coaching with Professionals Employees have access to 1:1 live coaching sessions with professionals - just as they can with caregivers, employees can message and book coaches right in the Joshin platform. Coaching sessions are 20-minutes in length and can be done in video or voice format through the Joshin platform. Our coaches are experts with vast professional and lived-experience. Whether on IEP planning for special education or coaching on inclusion and accommodations in the workplace - every coach has a background in neurodivergence or disability and have been screened by our team. Users can book coaching sessions on 100’s of different topics that guide employees through Work Integration, Home Management, Financial Services, Health and Wellness, and Education Support.   Self-Guided Digital Programs All enrolled employees have access to an extensive library of Joshin-created resources, videos and trainings which can be filtered based on the employees needs / topics.  Over 90% of employees using Joshin say they’ve accessed resources they haven’t had - you can't google the content that’s in Joshin - it's exclusive for our employer partners. We’re adding content weekly to the library based on the data we have available through enrollment (age, need and diagnosis). We meet weekly to ensure the data sets of our employees match our content, training, resources and providers.  Personalized Navigation and Specialized in-home Care Employees who are caring for themselves or a loved one can access personalized navigation and specialized care with Joshin. Employees are assigned a dedicated Navigator (Joshin employee) to help navigate the disability system, company care benefits, create care plans, and build care teams. They also ensure that every benefit you offer can be easily accessed and connected to their needs and goals. Our team of Navigators recruit on-demand for in-home care providers that meet each person’s unique needs. The recruiting process includes background checks, interviews, and a minimum of 6-months of disability related experience. Once the quality checks are completed, the caregiver onboards into the Joshin network and we provide checkpoints like feedback loops and ratings/reviews to ensure ongoing quality assurance.  Employees have all the digital tools they need through the Joshin platform  to manage their care team, they can message, book and pay for care (if out of pocket) all in one place. They can access historic booking information, review and rate their care provider.  Joshin’s Digital Support Community Navigating challenges is always easier when you know you're not alone. Our digital community provides employees a platform to connect, share insights, and offer support. Moderated by Joshin, it’s a safe space where professional discussions intertwine with personal stories, offering both advice and understanding.

column40: Whole organization focus: Our strategic approach is focused on understanding the organizational elements that impact the mental health of its people, using data and insights to help companies understand- and act on- systemic and root causes. We've described ourselves as a culture change platform, as we aim to support our clients in controlling up-stream and down-stream individual challenges that ultimately impact wellbeing and performance. It's not just about providing a single solution, but ongoing consultative support. Each client is partnered with a Client Success manager, and we offer leadership and executive consulting rooted in our Unmind Blueprint.  Dual approach to providing talk therapy:  While many solutions providers have modern approaches to therapy, we distinguish ourselves in ensuring that the experience for our practitioners is just as seamless as it is for the employee. This includes everything from scheduling to quick and fair payment. Our Enterprise package, whereby we provide a flexible bank of sessions predicted based on company size, with no cap per individual, supports a continuous care model. Disruption of care once coverage runs out is a disservice to the patient and to the practitioner. For the user, we aim to remove barriers by offering a network of therapists where employees can book time directly with a practitioner with no gatekeepers.  Measurement backed by science: Unmind has organizational and individual measurement assessments, built in collaboration with clinical psychologists and academic partners. These measurement tools are scientifically validated and designed to measure the impact of wellbeing across cost to the business, absenteeism, presenteeism, and attrition. Our individual assessments are scientifically validated against GAD7, PHQ9, CORE-OM.  Global: Unmind-run network in 5 continents and 50 languages, not requiring external partnerships. Committed to global consistency and cultural relevancy.   Comprehensive: Proactive tools, early intervention support, human-centered therapy, and EAP services all under one platform.

We've described ourselves as a culture change platform, as we aim to support our clients in controlling up-stream and down-stream individual challenges that ultimately impact wellbeing and performance. It's not just about providing a single solution, but ongoing consultative support. Each client is partnered with a Client Success manager, and we offer leadership and executive consulting rooted in our Unmind Blueprint. Outside of this, we also have an in-house content studio and have worked with our clients in creating custom content and championing their stories.
column56: In-house Science team, with 2 streams: Psychology and Research.  Science team is led by a clinical psychologist (Director of Science) - an experienced clinical psychologist with a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology. 10+ years in the National Health Service (the UK's Public Health Service), working with common mental health problems and supervising other therapists.  Psychology Team  *Backgrounds and qualifications*  Head of Psychology is also an experienced clinical psychologist with a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology and Masters in Occupational Psychology. 10+ years working in the UK's National Health Service, with expertise in common mental health problems and supervising other therapists. Experienced in research within the field of digital mental health prior to joining Unmind.  Clinical Psychologist, also with a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology, vast experience in the UK's National Health Service, with expertise in common mental health problems across the lifespan.  All 3 are full time, permanent members of Unmind staff.  *Roles and responsibilities*  The role of the Psychology team at Unmind is to ensure clinical quality and safety across the board.  This includes content development (e.g. developing the content roadmap, writing and overseeing the creation of platform content) and product development (inputting into the product lifecycle, from discovery to delivery, to maximise effectiveness and ensure ethical principles are followed). It also include management of the Help page, which contains signposting info, to help users connect with trusted sources of support (e.g. charities, bodies providing accessible therapy). The team also lead on webinars and online sessions, ensuring we cover the most important topics, with credible experts.  Research Team  Led by Head of Research, who has a PhD in clinical neuroscience, and a wealth of experience evaluating digital mental health apps.  The Research Scientists all have PhDs in the field of psychology, e.g. psychopharmacology and experimental psychology.  Everyone in the Research team are full time, permanent members of Unmind staff.  Third party consultants  We also employ consultant content creators who are experts in their field. This can include clinical psychologists, occupational psychologists, fitness experts, nutritionists, mindfulness experts (depending on the specific content that is being created). All experts are always appropriately qualified, experienced professionals, well-known in their field.  Unmind Talk practitioners who provide support to our clients employees undergo a multi- step vetting process that includes:  1. active membership with an approved accrediting body in their locale (ie. UKCP in UK) 2. fulfillment of total professional hours required by the accrediting body/association - usually min of 500 client hours 3. fulfillment of supervision hours required by the accrediting body/association 4. professional indemnity insurance in their country  5. possession of relevant qualifications for the therapies they provide (ie. CBT, hypnotherapy) 6. screening call with the Unmind team 7. has required tech capabilities re hardware, internet connection, audio qual etc.

column79: At Unmind we want to create a world where mental health is universally understood, nurtured and celebrated.  We see mental health as a kaleidoscope of colors. And we know the same is true of the human experience. There is a whole spectrum of ethnic and cultural perspectives, class, race, gender, sexual orientation and ability. We passionately believe this uniqueness should be reflected in our content.  Our approach to equality, diversity and inclusion sits at the heart of the product that we’re building and the people that we’re building it for.‍ Our strategy is focused around ensuring that every one of our users can see themselves reflected in our content.  We’re committed to creating content that celebrates the diversity of humankind and our user base. We know that the individual differences we all have in areas like sexuality, gender, ethnicity, emotional processing and neurodiversity and our hope that we can empower each of us to see the world through our own lens.  *We keep this diversity in mind throughout our processes, ensuring we are inclusive and that everyone is able to relate and connect with our content. Our content library includes:*   - Content to *help managers create and promote diverse and inclusive cultures with topics including Intersectionality and Neurodiversity* - *Content that supports users through different life stages and events including menopause, positive parenting and more* - *Content to support identity, intersectionality & equity - *We aim to feature at least 50% BIPOC representation in all new content releases - We aim to have a diverse range of collaborators (the experts creating content) - Our practitioner network is global, representing over 50 languages and different backgrounds and ethnicities  Although our content is created with a global audience in mind, this is a core area that we continue to improve on. A key focus is to increase the diversity of our collaborators and experts to bring in an even wider range of backgrounds and perspectives to our content. It's important to us that our users see themselves represented and can relate to our content. To do this, we’re starting to work alongside a DE&I advisor with valuable insights to guide us on this as well as forming a DE&I advisory group to bring more perspectives into these decisions.*   We've also brought on a consultant to help us effectively reach a more diverse network of clinical psychologists.  *We also conduct regular user research to understand our global users better. By hearing from the users themselves where they are based in the world, what content they would like to see more of and whether they feel represented in the platform, this will help us to craft our future content - who we collaborate with and what we collaborate on - to ensure our global audience is as represented as possible*  Internally, we have an OKR of nurturing an inclusive environment with an engagement score of 95%. Ways we are doing this is with early career and hiring partnerships with Diverso and Mentorme, an internal community group, and frequent surveys and insights.

column40: There are some platforms that focus on budgeting, and others on investing, but Penny is the only platform focused on holistic financial health for women. For the 70% of women in the United States who don't yet have wealth and can't afford a financial advisor, Penny is their financial mentor. Everything about Penny is personalized – including our education. Once our members receive our proprietary insights, they can quickly find EXACT answers to pressing financial questions like "How much can I afford to pay in rent?" with our self-guided educational modules.   Money in the US is typically a subject that isn't talked about. But we've created a community forum where our 21,000 +members go to ask questions and get support––without judgement or shame.

column40: In the realm of benefits, Joshin is redefining inclusive support. Traditional services often prioritize child caregivers, but we step in to serve the nearly 50% of our members who are adults with disabilities.  Joshin offers more than just therapy or EAP; it's a safe space for neurodivergent individuals. Many of our members deal with conditions like autism, ADHD, epilepsy, and mental health issues, and we understand that these experiences are interconnected. Our navigators and coaches are well-equipped to provide comprehensive support for all aspects of life.  We believe in tailoring the Joshin experience to your preferences, whether you seek self-service or guidance from a Navigator. We offer flexibility through phone, messaging, or video, ensuring your engagement is tailored to your needs.  Unlike traditional models that may limit sessions or close cases, Joshin provides continuous support. Our focus is on empowering individuals, recognizing their unique journey, and ensuring that everyone receives the support they deserve, regardless of their needs or life stage.
column43: We offer a flexible pricing structure that takes into account both the services you select and the size of the employee base you wish to support. Whether you're at the initial stages of your disability inclusion efforts or fully dedicated to making a substantial impact, our pricing options are designed to be customizable. This approach allows us to create a tailored program that not only aligns with your budget but also precisely fits your selected services and the number of employees you intend to support.
column54: Employees have access to message or schedule Navigator support through the Joshin mobile or web application during regular business hours, Monday through Friday 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM CST, except for holidays.
column55: At Joshin, we take a unique approach to customer service that goes beyond simply opening and closing cases. Instead, we are committed to providing ongoing, sustainable support for our clients. We understand that the needs of individuals with neurodivergence and disabilities can be diverse and ever-evolving. As a result, we don't just treat cases as isolated incidents; rather, we tailor our support to each employee's specific and evolving needs.  Our approach involves continuous engagement and a proactive stance in adapting to the unique requirements of each individual. We provide expert-led virtual coaching, digital programs, and personalized navigation to create an environment that fosters more engaged employees. This approach ensures that our clients receive the support they need over the long term, contributing to the creation of strong workplace cultures. Like Sequoia, we stand by our commitment to come through for our clients, demonstrating our dedication to their success and well-being.
column56: Our providers offer a unique blend of personal and professional experience in disability and neurodivergence. They bring a wealth of insights to our members, ranging from their firsthand experiences living with a disability to their professional expertise as Occupational Therapists, Certified Job Coaches, Organization specialists, and more.  It's important to note that the support provided is not therapy; instead, it focuses on delivering social, emotional, and tactical support to our members.

column67: Our implementation process typically spans 4-6 weeks, during which we engage in the following key activities:  Single Sign-On (SSO) Integration: We kick off the process by seamlessly integrating the Single Sign-On (SSO) feature to ensure a secure and user-friendly experience.  Customized Communication Strategy: We work closely with your team to create a tailored communication strategy that aligns perfectly with your unique requirements and objectives.  Comprehensive Marketing Toolkit: To support your strategic outreach efforts, we provide you with a comprehensive marketing toolkit equipped with the necessary resources and materials.  Planned Launch Event: To ensure an impactful start, we assist in planning and executing a well-orchestrated launch event that sets the stage for a successful implementation.  Included in our tailored strategy is setting up introductory meetings to pertinent departments to rollout Joshin for most effective engagement and education (e.g., Accommodations, Talent Acquisition, ERGs, DEI)
column74: Tailored Communication Support: At Joshin, we understand that effective communication is vital for our clients' success. We go the extra mile to provide personalized and high-touch communication support through a dedicated Client Success Team. This team is committed to tailoring their approach to meet the unique needs of each client.  Our tailored communication support includes:  Personalization: We take the time to understand your specific requirements and the intricacies of your data. By doing so, we can customize our communication strategies to resonate with your audience, ensuring that every message is highly relevant and impactful.  Diagnosis-Specific Communications: We believe in precision when it comes to communication. Our team is adept at crafting diagnosis-specific messages that are not only accurate but also sensitive to the individual needs of your clients. This approach helps in fostering trust and engagement.  Enhanced Engagement: The tailored communication approach is designed to improve engagement levels significantly. By delivering content and messages that resonate with your clients on a personal level, we enhance their overall experience, making them more likely to actively participate and seek support.  Heightened Satisfaction: Ultimately, our goal is to enhance client satisfaction. By providing the exact assistance they need, clients are more likely to feel understood, valued, and supported, leading to improved satisfaction levels and long-lasting, positive relationships.  We take pride in offering a communication support system that not only meets your needs but also exceeds your expectations, ensuring that every interaction with your clients is meaningful and beneficial.
column79: Addressing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) is crucial in today's workplace, but it's often overlooked when it comes to disability inclusion. The statistics reveal that only 4% of companies have plans that include disability in their DEI initiatives. At Joshin, we recognize this gap and strive to bridge it by offering comprehensive support both internally and externally.  Internally, we prioritize creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. Our commitment to DEI starts with our own team, fostering a culture that values differences and embraces them. We promote awareness and understanding of disabilities, including non-visible ones, and actively encourage employees to disclose their disabilities in a safe and confidential environment. This open approach allows us to learn from one another and continuously improve our practices.  Externally, we provide modern support solutions that contribute to more inclusive workplaces. Joshin offers:  Expert-Led Virtual Coaching: Our expert-led coaching is designed to empower employees with disabilities and neurodivergent conditions. By offering personalized guidance and support, we enable them to thrive in their roles and become more engaged contributors to your organization.  Digital Programs: We offer digital programs that are tailored to the needs of diverse employees, making the workplace more accessible and accommodating. These programs cover various aspects, from professional development to improving overall well-being.  Personalized Navigation: Our personalized navigation services help individuals navigate the complexities of their disabilities, ensuring they can access the support and resources they need. This personalized approach fosters a sense of belonging and inclusivity.  By leveraging Joshin, you can actively support your DEI initiatives by creating a more inclusive and supportive workplace environment. We firmly believe that building cultures of disability inclusion not only drives engagement but also encourages employees to feel safe and comfortable disclosing their disabilities. Together, we can work towards a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive future, where everyone's unique abilities are celebrated and valued."  Joshin is dedicated to making a positive impact on the landscape of DEI by addressing the underrepresented area of disability inclusion and helping organizations build more inclusive cultures.

column91: We can integrate using Single Sign-On (SSO) for authentication and easy access with a single set of credentials, such as a username and password. With SSO, users can log in once and gain seamless access to various services and resources without the need to re-enter their login information. This not only simplifies the user experience but also enhances security by centralizing user authentication and reducing the risk of password-related security issues. Joshin can be implemented with most HRIS systems including but not limited to Okta, Workday, and more.

column101: Live 1:1 Virtual Coaching with Professionals Employees have access to 1:1 live coaching sessions with professionals - just as they can with caregivers, employees can message and book coaches right in the Joshin platform. Coaching sessions are 20-minutes in length and can be done in video or voice format through the Joshin platform. Our coaches are experts with vast professional and lived-experience. Whether on IEP planning for special education or coaching on inclusion and accommodations in the workplace - every coach has a background in neurodivergence or disability and have been screened by our team. Users can book coaching sessions on 100’s of different topics that guide employees through Work Integration, Home Management, Financial Services, Health and Wellness, and Education Support.   Self-Guided Digital Programs All enrolled employees have access to an extensive library of Joshin-created resources, videos and trainings which can be filtered based on the employees needs / topics.  Over 90% of employees using Joshin say they’ve accessed resources they haven’t had - you can't google the content that’s in Joshin - it's exclusive for our employer partners. We’re adding content weekly to the library based on the data we have available through enrollment (age, need and diagnosis). We meet weekly to ensure the data sets of our employees match our content, training, resources and providers.  Personalized Navigation and Specialized in-home Care Employees who are caring for themselves or a loved one can access personalized navigation and specialized care with Joshin. Employees are assigned a dedicated Navigator (Joshin employee) to help navigate the disability system, and company care benefits, create care plans and build care teams. They also ensure that every benefit you offer can be easily accessed and connected to their needs and goals. Our team of Navigators recruit on-demand for in-home care providers that meet each person’s unique needs. The recruiting process includes background checks, interviews, and a minimum of 6-months of disability-related experience. Once the quality checks are completed, the caregiver onboards into the Joshin network and we provide checkpoints like feedback loops and ratings/reviews to ensure ongoing quality assurance. Employees have all the digital tools they need through the Joshin platform to manage their care team, they can message, book, and pay for care (if out of pocket) all in one place. They can access historic booking information, and review and rate their care provider.  Joshin’s Digital Support Community Navigating challenges is always easier when you know you're not alone. Our digital community provides employees with a platform to connect, share insights, and offer support. Moderated by Joshin, it’s a safe space where professional discussions intertwine with personal stories, offering both advice and understanding.

column40: Leva is the ecosystem that helps working mothers thrive. Leva provides pregnant and postpartum women with the support they need to be successful at home and at work. Leva connects new and expectant mothers with experts in all forms of baby feeding, pre and post-partum wellness, career support, and assists them in tracking their baby’s feeding, growth, and milestones.   Suicidality amongst pregnant and postpartum women in the US has increased 30% in the last 10 years. 80% of maternal deaths in our country are preventable. We must do a better job of making sure Mom is OK, and at Leva, the health and well-being of Moms are our focus. From live support to on-demand answers and mindfulness meditations created for the working mom, we put the mother in the center of everything we do.   Further, we assist Moms in taking care of their children and understanding what is happening. There is no other time in a child’s life that is more important than the first twelve months. Their brains and bodies grow faster than at any other time and since they cannot talk for most, if not all, of this time, paying attention to their growth, milestones, and health provides Moms with peace of mind and information to share with their pediatrician should it be needed.
column43: Our pricing is utilization-based. We cover only pregnant/postpartum individuals whether employees or spouses. Our starting price is $100/user though businesses typically offer support between $500/user to $2000/user depending on the amount of robust live support they want to cover.
column54: Our hours of support are typically between 8 AM and 9 PM CT.
column55: Our customers receive a dedicated account manager that is there to support them any time they have a question. We pride ourselves on responding to our customer inquiries within 24 hours or less. We can have new clients onboarded in less than a day and are incredibly responsive to requests and questions.   Our values speak to our perspective on customer service:  We are Passionate: - about making a difference  - about communicating and sharing - about our moms and customers   We are Determined: - to be action-oriented self-starters - to let nothing get in the way of reaching our goals  - to creatively problem-solve  We are Collaborative: - with our customers to give them the best experience - internally to share our wisdom - with our users to develop exceptional products, services, and support
