column40: Forma helps employers design and deliver flexible, inclusive and global benefits programs at scale and in a modern, intuitive way. We offer a customizable spending account platform that enables benefits teams to run employer-sponsored programs including Lifestyle, Wellness, Caregiving, Work-from-home, as well as pre-tax programs like FSA, HSA, Commuter and COBRA. Employees benefit from our platform that makes understanding and accessing their benefits easy! Employees also have choice as it relates to their spending and can use the Forma visa debit card (so they are never out of pocket), the traditional claims reimbursement approach (with direct deposit) or can choose to shop via our marketplace which has over 250 curated vendors with discounts up to 40%. All methods are customizable and clients can choose to turn on all three spending options, or potentially choose 1 or 2 options only.   Our differentiators include:   1. Three ways to pay Employees spend benefit funds on their terms via the Forma Store, the Forma Visa Card, or claims reimbursement.  2. Dedicated support We'll handle procurement, administration, fulfillment, and compliance. Plus, enjoy fast claims review with 24/7 support. All humans. No bots.  3. Award-winning UI/UX Employers seamlessly define, manage, and adjust benefits anytime for employees to use with ease.  4. Truly global We’re live in 100+ countries so you can deliver all of the unique customizations and processes at scale.  5. Enterprise-grade tech Forma is SOC 2 certified, GDPR compliant, and adheres to WCAG standards expected of global enterprises.  6. A beautiful backend The tech behind the scenes is world-class. Payments, HR integrations, and managing different taxation processes are easy and just work.
column42: Forma has no headcount minimums or maximums and our clients range from 6 employees to 140,000. Forma does however have an annual contract minimum. Forma’s standard annual contract minimum is $10,000, for Sequoia clients we will adjust that minimum to $8,000 once the agreement is in place. For smaller employers where the PEPM fee annualized is less than 8,000, Forma will charge that customer 8,000 until they are above the minimum threshold at which time it will adjust back to the PEPM cost.
column43: Forma’s standard pricing based on a PEPM fee for our Customizable Spending Accounts. The PEPM is only inclusive of eligible populations. So if for example, there is a combined population of 1,000 part time and full time employees, but the Forma benefit will only be given to full time, and the full time population is 700, we would base the pricing off of 700.   There are some situations where we can provide a platform and utilization model. This specifically is requested for organizations who are more comfortable with that type of set up and is more often requested on HRA programs like gender affirming care and / or medical travel. We'll always assess and provide the most favorable pricing for clients based on expected utilization.   We have begun development of a custom pricing strategy if chosen to be included in the Sequoia Wellbeing Bundle. In this following attachment you'll find the specialist pricing for Sequoia based on your book of business as well as some standard pricing. We're happy to continue the pricing conversations to implement the best structure for shared clients.
column45: Sequoia LSA bundle options and price .pdf
column54: Employee / Member support - 24/5 email / in portal chat; - Monday - Friday phone: 6AM-5PM PST (available for an additional cost or for Ent clients)   For individual customers, a dedicated Customer Success Manager (Account Manager) is assigned. They are available based on regular working hours Monday - Friday varying by time zone.
column55: Customer love is part of the Forma DNA. We invested in our member support / operations and service teams even before hiring our sales team! Providing an exceptional customer experience is what we've become known for and is a big differentiator for Forma in the benefits space. We believe in dedicated support and all customers regardless of size have access to a strategic Customer Success Manager who acts as their internal advocate at Forma. They are available to not only answer questions but offer best practices and make suggestions and recommendations regarding their programs and what’s trending in this space. We have high standards for ourselves so that we can truly deliver a delightful employee and customer experience. We understand what employees expectations are (especially those in the tech space) and work with their employees to be seen as an extension of their HR/Benefits teams. Without being able to deliver on this, we wouldn’t have the amazing logos we have in our book of business today. Throughout the commentary in this RFP you’ll learn more about how we train our staff, how we support employees and what tools and resources we make available to our customers that will help paint a better picture of how we’re able to deliver on such high NPS and CSAT scores.
column56: Forma’s support team members are required to have 2-3 years of prior customer service or hospitality experience. They participate in a 2-month training and onboarding program and their progress is measured with exams at various checkpoints. The representatives must go through several shadowing sessions and pass the onboarding exam to officially start providing service.   Many of our support team comes from pre-tax carriers and the health and rewards space. All hires also must have at a minimum a bachelor's degree.   While our support team becomes experts in the spending account space they may not have a particular focus on physical care, mental health or financial aid. While they are not experts in those areas, they are experts in navigating the Forma platform and if a client allows for our Forma store to be turned on, the support team will provide corresponding resources related to the vendors within the store in those areas.   Forma also created a team who supports compliance and overall go to market positioning related to data collection and market research so we can advise on benefits strategy.
column67: Forma uses DocuSign to send out order forms / contracts to the customer. Once contracts are finalized the customer transitions to onboarding.   New clients implementing Lifestyle Spending Accounts can have anywhere between a 4 week and 8 week implementation depending on the complexity of the program. (Current clients adding new accounts can have those added as quickly as 5 business days).   Internally the Account Executive schedules a transition call with the assigned Onboarding Manager to discuss what sold, the customers timeline, any customization requests and completes a transfer document that confirms systems, program details and other notes taken during the sales process.    The Onboarding Manager then sends a welcome email to the new customer. This email requests availability for a kick off call and includes a link to the electronic onboarding tool that collects client information. Forma uses an electronic onboarding site to collect program decisions and parameters about the plan being implemented.The email suggests the client begins to complete key details about the company under the general information section ahead of the scheduled kick off call and will review the other sections during the call.   The agenda of the kick off call includes: introductions, an executive summary to confirm key information, an implementation timeline with key milestone dates and deliverables discussed, an overview of the different workstreams throughout onboarding including system integrations / SSO, Accounting, Communications culture / launch, post launch and more.   A section regarding “working together” is also covered which set expectations of who may need to join certain calls, how they prefer to be communicated with and discusses any potential holidays / time off that could impact implementation calls.   The onboarding manager is responsible for sending a weekly agenda to set expectations and post call notes to confirm key deliverables are moving forward week over week. If at any point the launch is at risk because of missed deadlines the onboarding manager loops back in the Account Executive to help escalate with their key contacts.   During onboarding the onboarding manager also shares a customer specific notion page that includes all details related to the implementation a customer may need. Sections include: links to onboarding confirmations, meeting notes, program policy, a resource center which contains help articles on SSO, SCIM, file testing, etc, communication / launch toolkit, employee support reminders.   Additional video tutorial regarding the electronic onboarding site can be found here, under “Forma Basics”. The videos includes overviews on: creating the program parameters, reviewing and signing off on the program policy, file testing (if managing in house and not with a Third party vendor), and more!  https://customer-hub.joinforma.com/ Password: Benefit$Hero  Close to the launch date once the demographic file is in place, the onboarding manager does internal testing with operations and Q/As the customers site. The employer also shares what type of launch support is needed and the Onboarding Manager works to transition the customer to ongoing service. The Customer Success Manager will support any webinars / Office Hours or LSA launches to the customers employees.   Please find the corresponding onboarding materials attached:  - Onboarding Kickoff deck template  - Sample onboarding implementation timeline (combined pre-tax and LSA)  - Sample demographic file (LSA only)  - Notion page Onboarding template. This is customized by client and shared with them directly to access links to important items, resources and notes.
column69: Templated Notion page for Newly Onboarding Customers (Sequoia RFP).pdf
column74: During onboarding we confirm with the customer what their preferences are on Forma outreach to members. Some employers have strict communication requirements to employees so we like to align with them on what resources they’d like Forma to share and what communications they’d prefer we turn off.   We are very proud to have an average of 85% member engagement month over month however more engagement leads to higher utilization of program funds. With every customer, we take their unique goals of the program into consideration and that can impact what types of communications are turned on.    Options for employee engagement include: 1.) system generated emails include: activation emails, emails communicating when funds are loaded and available, emails communicating when funds are close to expiration, approved, pending, denied claims. Forma also allows for these types of communications to be sent over text and in app push notifications as well. 2.) Additional templated emails customers can also leverage include emails related to new vendors / discounts in our store and custom communications based on client needs.   Forma will support Business Reviews with customers where the dedicated Customer Success Manager reviews program data and metrics. Based on the findings of the data and the customers original program goals, that CSM may suggest certain types of engagement / communication strategies.  Lastly here is a link to our communications resource site available to all clients:   https://customer-hub.joinforma.com/ Benefit$Hero
column79: Forma as an employer has a strong focus in our own DEIB initiatives   For Forma employees: - Has ERGS to support BIPOC, Parents, Women, LGBTQ+ - Has partnered with The Rise Journey to host and educate Formies on why DEI matters  - Statement from our HR / Recruitment team: At Forma, we value diversity, and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. As we continue to scale our business, we'll focus on ensuring that representation is at the center of our recruiting strategy. As a fully remote company, we have access to talent pools from across a wide variety of geographical locations. This gives us a greater ability to prioritize diversity in our staffing and hiring efforts, as we're not tethered to a particular location.In the future, we're looking forward to further maturing our diversity and inclusion efforts by partnering with organizations and individuals focused on increasing representation in our industry. Additionally, we know that hiring great people is not enough. In order to build a truly inclusive environment, we'll need to support folks from different backgrounds once they become associated with our business. This means building community and connection inside our business that encourages people to be honest and authentic about their experiences. Our customers come from all walks of life, and we strive to build processes across hiring & talent development that will foster a strong environment for our employees and partners, no matter what their background is.  For our clients:  - Collect preferred name on file and gender not required - Offer a store and marketplace so the employee is never out of pocket (equity)  - Support COLA consultation for global employers. Educate on the different philosophies regarding type of program they are implementing. (equity) - Look for DEIB-focused vendors to join our discounted store. We have over 250 vendors globally with some examples including Grayce (elder care), pet care, childcare, fertility, digital health apps,  apps that support learning, coaching, support for neurodivergent employees or children, The list goes on!  - We also have 22 vendors that identify as minority-owned or female-owned businesses and can promote these vendors directly to your employees if this is important. We are currently speaking to vendors focused on menopause, and gender-affirming care concierge (LGBTQ services) to see if they can be added as well. (Marketplace list attached) - Have hosted and partnered with clients/consultants on DEIBA-focused webinars to discuss how LSA helps support our customer's goals. You can listen to those here: How to Integrate DEIBA in your Perks and Wellness Benefits Strategy  (I will send these links in a follow up email since i'm not able to link here)
column82: At a minimum it’s employee name, ID, email and country (if global). Employers can add in additional fields to enable custom reporting but additional fields are not required.
column91: Forma offers pre-built SSO solutions as well as the ability to integrate with custom SSO solutions with SCIM 2.0 standards.  Pre built SSO integrations include: Okta, OneLogin, and google  If the organization uses a different provider that's not listed above, or if they use an in-house custom solution to initiate SSO, they can always manually configure Forma by using the instructions provided during onboarding.
column92: For LSA/HRA, The admins could export the following reports with real-time data on the admin portal at any time including: * Balance report * Spending report * Transaction report * Contribution report * Demographic report * Employee change report * Customized report  We also offer a reporting dashboard on the admin portal that includes the following metrics in real-time: * Active employees percentage * Total budget spent * Employee satisfaction score * Claim approval rate * Average spend per employee * Employees' popular spending methods * Popular Spending Categories  * Top Claim Rejection Reasons * Top Store Merchants (If applicable)
column101: Forma supports many types of spending accounts and wallets. I’ve broken up the different types of accounts to provide more details by compliance services and descriptions.   *Lifestyle Spending Account (Wellness, Caregiving, Learning & Development, Broad programs): Program document creation, best practices regarding taxation (although not tax advice), COLA philosophies and best practices.   *Home Office / Work From Home / Cell / Internet reimbursement: Program document creation, best practices regarding taxation (although not tax advice) including overview on accountable plans and setting up the programs as tax-free under the business expense regulation.   *Health Reimbursement Arrangements (Gender affirming care, mental health, Fertility, Medical Travel): SPD and Plan document creation in addition to Program document creation, overview of compliance considerations including who is eligible (integration requirement), HSA coordination, 5500 filing, PCORI, Non-Discrimination testing, and COBRA. Forma also provides: 1.) COBRA: COBRA premium equivalent rates for the employer to choose to leverage and next steps on getting COBRA set up which discusses eligibility and where elections should be sent to. 2.) PCORI annual reminders with an overview of calculator and pre-filled form for the client to choose to leverage. 3.) annual reminders regarding NDT   *Tuition / Student Loan repayment: Section 127 plan document creation, best practices regarding taxation (although not tax advice) including overview on what can be set up as tax free and what program parameters make the eligible items taxable, and non-discrimination testing education / reminders.
column103: For plans subject to ERISA (HRAs), we provide a customized plan document and SPD to the customer to assist with those ERISA requirements. The documents are not legal advice, and the customer is responsible for reviewing with counsel, if they wish. The customer is also responsible for distribution of the SPD to participants. The SPD includes the claims and appeals procedures applicable to the plan in accordance with ERISA’s requirements. We administer claims and appeals per ERISA’s rules. We can support the customer’s 5500 filing by providing the relevant counts of HRA participants. We also have a full-time compliance professional on staff to answer questions and assist with compliance plan administration. Of course, we can’t offer legal advice, so customer’s should rely on their own counsel when needed.
column106: HRA’s are subject to COBRA and Forma will discuss COBRA eligibility during the sales process. Once onboarded, the onboarding manager will send an email confirm COBRA premium equivalent rates and next steps to have Forma added as an eligible carrier in their COBRA vendor. I've attached the COBRA template you can review in a future section.    LSA’s are not subject to COBRA.
column109: For plans subject to ERISA (HRAs), we provide a customized plan document and SPD to the customer to assist with those ERISA requirements. The documents are not legal advice, and the customer is responsible for reviewing with counsel, if they wish. The customer is also responsible for distribution of the SPD to participants. The SPD includes the claims and appeals procedures applicable to the plan in accordance with ERISA’s requirements.   We administer claims and appeals per ERISA’s rules.   We assist customer PCORI filings by providing them with a completed Form 720. The customer simply needs to review, sign, and submit to the IRS along with payment.   We can support the customer’s 5500 filing by providing the relevant counts of HRA participants. W  e also have a full-time compliance professional on staff to answer questions and assist with compliance plan administration. Of course, we can’t offer legal advice, so customer’s should rely on their own counsel when needed.  HRA’s are considered to be self funded plans. LSAs are not.   Clients can reach out to their dedicated Customer Success manager regarding compliance questions. The CSM will filter specific questions then to our internal Compliance Slack channel. The CSM will own the response back to the client. If the client needs additional support such as a call, Chris Macali, Forma’s Director of Compliance can be available for a live discussion.   As it relates to supporting key areas related to compliance, please see below:  - PCORI: Annual email sent regarding deadline for submission, calculation of fee (based on our own eligibility file) and pre-filled form - SPD and Plan document creation for Section 125 and Section 127 plans completed during onboarding and reviewed if client requests any changes to the plans  - Claim procedures outlined in plan documents

column117: LSAs are a fringe benefits, but are generally taxable. We can provide general information regarding taxation of these benefits but cannot offer tax advice.   We proactively discuss compliance / taxability during the sales cycle and onboarding to let the employer know LSAs are generally taxable programs.   Within onboarding there is a section by account type and eligible item to code how taxation should be treated. For eligible items that are taxable, Forma sends a report to the customer to communicate spend and taxation. While we can’t legally provide tax advice we can provide general overviews and confirm how our clients today generally set up plans and eligibility. As we continue to grow and scale we hope to have more taxation resources in the future and are looking at taxation services and partnership. This is not public knowledge so please keep this confidential but are going through an RFP with taxation consulting vendors for support of additional global services.
column119: During the sales process Forma will review compliance and tax considerations related to LSA / HRAs with the client.   Materials we review include slides from our sales deck to help with the overall education and understanding.   We'll review the compliance around HRAs and what the required set up is to have a compliant plan along with employer responsibilities. This includes: HIPAA, ACA, COBRA, PCORI and Non-Discrimination testing. For LSAs we communicate what's typically included and excluded and that the plans are generally taxable with some exceptions.    Please see attached slides (and previously uploaded to onboarding section) to review some of these compliance areas.   During onboarding, the onboarding manager reviews the list of eligible expenses the employer wants to include in the plan. If we notice an employer who is trying to reimburse for 213(d) medical expenses under the LSA we'll call that out for them and share why that's not best practice under a LSA and what the compliance impact to them is if they choose to have Forma include as an eligible item. After reviewing the compliance if the employer still wants to move forward we get their confirmation in writing. I've attached an example email template communicating this information.   As it relates to taxability, we'll provide tax guidance on:  - LSA: Taxable - HRA: tax advantaged  - Work From home: Some items can be treated as tax free if employer follows accountable plan rules - Tuition Reimbursement / Student Loan: tax free up to the IRS maximums   If an employer has specific tax questions we'll always defer to their tax advisor for additional confirmations. We cannot give tax advice and only provide program best practices and reviews of what's allowed under benefits compliance.
column121: Sample Email regarding including medical expenses in a LSA .pdf
column124: We proactively discuss compliance / taxability during the sales cycle and onboarding. Throughout the year, clients can reach out to their dedicated Customer Success manager regarding compliance questions as well. The CSM will filter specific questions then to our internal Compliance Slack channel. The CSM will own the response back to the client. If the client needs additional support such as a call, Chris Macali, Forma’s Director of Compliance can be available for a live discussion.
column127: We do not need compliance assistance from Sequoia. We have an in house ERISA attorney to support compliance guidance for US ERISA benefit programs and fringe benefits. However, we are not a law firm and cannot provide legal advice. If the need for legal advice regarding the plan arises, the employer should consult with their own counsel. Many times customers will want to review our guidance with their broker for a second opinion but this is not a requirement of Formas. For employers who have global populations where taxes change country to country, we’ll provide guidance but always recommend they reach out to their tax advisors for confirmations of tax treatment.

column40: Highway sets itself apart in a few ways, namely our immediate impact on employee financial wellness and the power of dollars contributed. Given student loan repayment is a tax-free benefit, if an employee has student loans, this is the best dollar of compensation they can receive. Additionally, all dollars contributed reduce the taxable income of the company, making it a complete win-win for those offering the benefit.  With regard to our competitors, we are the most cost effective solution, have the shortest implementation period, and are the most customizable. We recognize that offering student loan repayment as a benefit is not a one-size fits all solution and give the employers the ability to set specific rules that help their attraction and retention goals. For instance, if a company is focused on retention, through Highway they can offer tenure based rules that contribute higher amounts to employees who have been with the company longer. Additionally, our clients can be up and running in as little as one call. All we need at Highway is to set rules with the employer and access to a monthly roster, otherwise we will manage the entire benefit, adding no extra work to HR's plate.
column43: We charge $8 per participant per month and a $1000 implementation fee. Our clients only pay for those employees who have loans and take advantage of the benefit.
column54: Users can submit customer service requests at anytime through their portal or to our support email address and they will get a response within 1 business day if not sooner!
column55: Customer experience and feedback is a priority to Highway. Every Highway customer receives a dedicated customer success manager when they onboard with Highway. Our CSMs help our customers through each step of the launch process and are available to help field any questions or support issues throughout the lifetime of the account (and beyond). We do our best to respond to all support requests within 1 business day and approach customer service with an ethos of being proactive, professional, and helpful. Our customers are the reason we exist and we can’t forget that. We go above and beyond to create a positive, low-touch experience for both our customers and their employees.
column56: Our support team does not offer direct financial support or advice. We do however provide suggestions and links to resources that we have compiled through 100's of hours of research to assist employees along their student loan journey.
column67: A typical implementation happens in three steps with both a dedicated account executive and customer success manager. We can move as fast as the client would like with very minimal work needed from the customer.   First, on an initial call our team will work with the client to develop custom desired rules for their tax-free educational plan such as tenure rules, maximum lifetime contributions etc. Our team will then create a custom educational assistance plan to comply with the IRS tax code 127. Additionally on this call our team will help clients connect their HRIS system to our platform. With this connection, employers don't have to worry about managing onboarding or off-boarding of employees or monthly file feeds. If preferred we can always collect monthly census files instead.   Once the plan has been finalized we provide the client with custom launch collateral to announce their benefit to the team. We are always willing to manage the announcement on our end, however, typically we like our clients to make the first announcement to maximize adoption but more importantly so the HR team gets the credit they deserve for launching such a forward looking impactful benefit.   That's it! Employees can then enroll at anytime. Beyond these steps, Highway manages everything, including onboarding of employees, automated emails to employees and admins about the benefit and the payment direct to eligible employees loans.
column74: Highway has a robust automated communication platform for both the employer and employee. We take over communication entirely with employees after a customer has announced their new benefit. On the official launch date of the benefit (approximately 2 weeks after announcement), Highway sends a broadcast email to all active employees with information about the benefit and instructions on how to enroll. One week after that announcement, we send a reminder to any employees who have not yet enrolled. If an employee has signed up but has not completed their enrollment, we send an enrollment reminder instead.   For any new employees, Highway sends a welcome email when the Employee officially joins the company and then follows the same reminder cadence. This will automatically be picked up by our rostering system and does not require notification from the employer about new employees.  In total, Highway sends 1-3 emails to each employee during their onboarding period to notify and engage eligible employees without spamming their inbox.   After an employee has enrolled, Highway sends an email every month after the benefit has been processed and sends a celebratory email when a loan has been paid off.   Employers have on-demand access to an admin dashboard with enrollment details. However, we will also send communication each month when contributions are released and when an employee meets key milestones.
column79: The student debt crisis has an outsized impact on minority communities and women, therefore student loan repayment as a benefit is a great way to support DEI initiatives.
column82: At a minimum we require first name, last name, address, birth date, email, start date and employment status.
column92: On the admin website clients can see enrolled employees, contributions, and monthly reports. Our reports are available at a monthly level or at an annual level by employee to see total contributions. Clients can always reach out if they would like additional reporting included, we are always looking to improve our admin dashboard and value our customer's feedback.
column101: Our core product is student loan repayment as a benefit which allows employers to contribute to their employees student loans, tax-free, without adding extra work to their plate. This product includes: -A tax-free compliant educational assistance plan -Platform for employees to connect their student loans -Verification of eligible loans and payments directly distributed to employees student loans -Custom employer set rules such as tenure rules, max contributions etc.  -Admin dashboard to track enrollment and contributions by employee or month -Automated communication from Highway to employees and admins -Complimentary access to our student debt Tools & Resource Center (see below) -No annual platform fees  Additionally we have a Student Debt Tools & Resource Center which can be purchased as a standalone product or is included with student loan repayment as a benefit. This is a more budget friendly way to support employees with loans, but has less of an immediate and direct impact by itself. Features include: -Student Debt Profile -Payoff Scenarios & Calculators -Refinancing Platform -Income Driven Repayment Assistance -Extensive Additional Resources (locate your servicer tool, refinancing assistance, instructions on telling your servicer where to put your extra payments and our options for managing your student debt series)   Finally Highway offers a Tuition Reimbursement platform that employers can choose to offer as a stand alone product or combine with student loan repayment as a benefit:  -A tax-free compliant educational assistance plan (with or without student loan repayment) -Central location for past and current employee applications to be managed -Conditional approval by the Highway Team prior to final admin approval -Custom rules supported such as grades, class requirements etc.  -Bundle with student loan repayment as a benefit
column104: ERISA generally does not apply to tuition reimbursement programs and student loan repayment now falls under tuition reimbursement programs and 127 plans. While there are certain regulations and requirements to stay tax-compliant that Highway helps manage for clients, our plans are not subject to ERISA.
column107: Student loan repayments and tuition reimbursement are not considered health benefits and therefore not subject to COBRA.
column111: Section 127 educational assistance plan.
column117: Highway allows employers to offer educational assistance plans to their employees in the form of tuition reimbursement or student loan repayment as a benefit which per the IRS is a tax-free fringe benefit up to $5,250 per employee per year.   There are a few basic rules that employers must follow in order to stay tax compliant and Highway helps manage this entire process and ensure compliance. First and foremost to be eligible an employer must have a written plan which Highway provides prior to launch. Some additional requirements include announcement of the benefit, that employers don't favor towards highly compensated individuals, and employees can't be offered the benefit in exchange for taxable benefits.   Finally and most importantly Highway verifies that an employee has a qualified educational loan that is in their name and sends contributions directly into those loans. Without Highway, employers would have to manually verify screen shots from each employee every month and then add a payment to their paycheck.
column119: We walk all clients through the rules that must be followed in order to remain tax compliant prior to launch. Additionally, all of the rules are laid out in their educational assistance plan that we create and must be approved prior to launch. When employers create rules that could potentially break the tax law we will walk through rules, run any necessary tests to ensure compliance and propose alternative solutions if needed.  The main rule we see clients running into issues with is favoring towards highly compensated employees when they only want this benefit to apply to certain employees. While there are certain scenarios where this can work, we have turned away clients who want to create rules that would not be tax compliant.   We have a blog post with more information here as well (https://www.highwaybenefits.com/post/section-127-plans-ultimate-primer).
column124: Our customers can always reach out to their dedicated customer success manager, account executive or support account regarding compliance questions and concerns. In situations where we believe it is necessary, we engage with a benefits specific lawyer to confirm rules would not break tax-compliance. Many of the compliance rules are satisfied at the creation of a plan and our compliance experts review all created plans. Our philosophy is to always error on the side of caution when it comes to creating specific rules that may break tax code.
column127: The tax-free status of our benefit is one of the many reasons employers launch a student loan repayment program and therefore it is talked about from the first call all the way through launch and beyond. The rules are clearly defined and any requirements are laid out in onboarding with the client.

column56: Baruch Levy is co-founder and CEO at Fijoya. Baruch has more than 22 years of leadership and operational experience in the Healthcare industry across US and Israel. column40: At Wellthy, we champion a holistic approach to caregiving and whole-person care. Our solution covers both employees and their loved ones across all phases of life. We don't put any parameters around what constitutes a loved one of an employee. This can include care for spouses, relatives, dependents, friends, or even non-blood relatives. We feel strongly that Wellthy is best-in-class in the caregiving space:    Market Leader  Wellthy is the clear market leader with 2M covered lives, a marquee client base including 30 Fortune 500 clients, and strategic partnerships with influential organizations including Voya, Prudential, and WTW.   We’re “Doers”  When caregivers face crisis situations, they don't need an added list of "to-dos." That's why our Care Team steps in, completing logistical and administrative tasks on behalf of families, rather than merely providing resources or action items for caregivers to take on themselves. By actually doing the work, we alleviate stress, enable employees to remain in their careers, and create more time for families to focus on what matters.    Largest Dataset  With the largest industry dataset, a skilled Data Team, and significant investments in our data technology and infrastructure, Wellthy is able to leverage its proprietary data to drive better performance and generate deeper insights.    World-Class Net Promoter Score  Wellthy has consistently maintained a user NPS of 80+ and client NPS of 90+.   Proven Economic ROI  The average ROI across Wellthy clients is 366%, tied directly to retention and absenteeism. Independent of industry, 95% of clients achieve an ROI between 314%-417%.   Personalized, 1:1 Tech-Enabled Support  Through a perfect blend of best-in-class technology and high-touch human support, employees are quickly matched with their personal Care Coordinator within one business day. Based on their individual needs, each employee is expertly paired with a Care Coordinator who stays with them throughout their entire care journey.    In-House Care Team Structure and Widest Range of Expertise  Wellthy has the largest, highly-skilled group of in-house care professionals consisting of over 220 talented Care Coordinators, Care Advisers, and Care Managers. The depth and breadth of the care team's expertise and structure enables Wellthy to deliver industry-leading support in areas such as health conditions, childcare, veteran care, financial services, neurodiversity, disabilities, end of life and loss, and other complex care related needs.   Multi-Language Support and Localized Knowledge  Wellthy’s platform and resources are offered in the U.S., Canada, Ireland, and U.K., and translated into English, Spanish, and Canadian French. Additionally, our Care Team is fluent in each of these languages to ensure seamless support for our members.
column42: Wellthy does not have a minimum employee count but does have a minimum annual contract value amount.
column43: Wellthy offers a PEPM model that includes program, marketing, reporting, and servicing fees.
column54: Wellthy supports thousands of service requests on a daily basis, over the phone, through the Wellthy platform, live chat tool, and email. The grand majority of "member inquiries" come through our web platform. Our live chat tool has an average response time under 2 minutes. We employ a fully remote workforce of agile, flexible, committed team members and as such, we don’t operate or outsource to a call center. Instead, our Care Coordinators work closely with each family to create the right communication rhythm. Care Coordinators will regularly schedule calls with families before or after working hours and will respond to messages nearly around the clock. We also operate an 877 number staffed from Monday - Friday from 8am - 10pm ET.  This line assists with any general questions or concerns member might have. Please note that if a family is experiencing a medical emergency, we recommend they dial 911.
column55: At Wellthy, exceptional service is embedded in our culture. We pride ourselves in delivering not only excellent service but also a profound impact to both our clients and members. Each client gets a dedicated Client Success team, as we believe in proactive engagement, anticipating client needs, and acting with urgency. We view ourselves as more than just a vendor – we aim to be a true partner and an extension of our clients' employee experience. Our commitment to strong partnerships is reflected in our 90+ Client NPS score and long-lasting relationships with clients. Like Sequoia, we go above and beyond, ensuring our clients always feel valued, understood, and prioritized.
column56: The Wellthy Care Team is made up of Care Coordinators, Care Advisers, Care Managers, and Member Support. The majority of Wellthy’s Care Coordinators are social workers by training and can personally relate to the families they work with. Many have previously worked in hospital, insurance, and other healthcare and clinical settings. We carefully screen all candidates before certifying someone as a Wellthy Care Coordinator. We provide Care Coordinators with specific guidelines on the “Wellthy Way,” as well as processes, protocols, and a central knowledge-base.   We are the largest administrator of social workers in the caregiving industry. Nearly 70% of Wellthy Coordination team members have experience in clinical and/or medical social work. About 20% hold a Master’s degree in social work, and 50% have a Master’s degree or higher in a social work-related specialty (such as counseling, nursing, patient advocacy, health administration, gerontology, or human services). Care Coordinators have an average of 6+ years of work experience in relevant clinical or non-clinical healthcare settings. They must also have a college degree, and most have an advanced degree relevant to the role, i.e., Master’s or Ph.D. in social work, certification in patient advocacy, etc. Wellthy requires a minimum of 5 years of work experience, while our Sr. Care Coordinators and Managers have upwards of 10+ years of experience.   Our Client Success team works directly with employer clients. Client Success Managers have an average of 7 years of client service and account management experience. Implementation Specialists, who temporarily work with clients during implementation, have an average of 5 years of implementation related experience.
column65: Our recent Client NPS is 91 and Member NPS is 80.
column67: Implementation is turnkey and is managed by a dedicated Implementation Specialist who is responsible for establishing a project plan that outlines key implementation milestones. We also assign a dedicated Wellthy Client Success Manager who provides ongoing, proactive support during and post-implementation. We partner closely with our clients during implementation to ensure our service and technology will meet the needs of their specific employee population. The process includes an implementation form that helps Wellthy gather important information, including the following:  List of office locations and employee headcounts Many of the employers we work with have multiple offices. We love to plan events like lunch and learns, office hours, and pop-ups to raise awareness of Wellthy. We also host virtual events so remote employees can tune in!  Company communications and events calendar We create custom content that highlights a hot topic in healthcare or trend we’re seeing in the caregiving space. Each month, we will send your team a specific deliverable along with a forwardable note related to that topic. We hope that our message templates make it easy to distribute to all employees or integrate into any form of internal communication or onsite events.  Up-to-date benefits guide We like to arm our Care Coordinators with information on your insurance plans, other benefit offerings, and perks so they understand what resources employees have available to them, and so we can cross-refer when appropriate.  Eligibility verification Employees must confirm their eligibility to set up a Wellthy account. We offer the following eligibility verification options: SFTP eligibility file, email domain, and unique code.     We'll host a kickoff call prior to launch to discuss tactics to build awareness of Wellthy, learn more about your other benefit offerings, and develop a marketing plan for your entire team. Our standard implementation timeframe is 45 days. The entire implementation process can take 4-6 weeks, sometimes even less, once the contract is finalized and countersigned. The implementation fee is a one-time fee incurred when the project kicks off.  We partner with our clients to execute marketing campaigns, webinars, and other bespoke initiatives like direct-to-employee email campaigns, direct-mail postcards, translated materials, ERG workshops, and management training resources as part of our engagement strategy. Additionally, we provide content around specific client business objectives and initiatives, for example, developing webinars and resources for veteran support where a client is specifically aiming to engage that segment of their population.
column69: 2023_What to Expect During Your Wellthy Implementation .pdf
column73: We typically do not offer termination for convenience as our pricing is dependent on contract length. In rare instances where we do agree to it, we don't allow termination in the first year, require 90 days notice to ensure that families are not adversely affected, and seek to recoup any discounts or free services given as part of a longer-term agreement.
column74: Caregiving can be a silent and hidden burden. It won't come up in claims data, and almost anyone, at any time, could be shouldering this extra responsibility. On top of that, there’s a stigma in our society, and people often don't share the tough family care issues they're grappling with at home.   At Wellthy, we feel strongly that part of our job is to raise awareness of the very-real challenges of caregiving and to bring down the barriers that are preventing help for those who need it.  In collaboration with our clients, we work hard to craft a marketing and awareness-building program for caregivers. We build messaging and materials and strive to keep a steady drumbeat of communication around awareness and to drive engagement. Additionally, we find manager support and word of mouth are critical drivers of utilization. Often, managers can help identify team members who are distracted, stressed, and struggling with mental health issues, all of which are common warning signals of caregiving stress.  Here's a quick overview of how Wellthy plans and executes an engagement strategy to drive ongoing utilization:  At launch:  -Create a custom marketing toolkit for your company with messaging templates, talking points, and digital collateral to help get the word out. -Host a live "Meet Wellthy" workshop with Q&A to promote awareness among employees and to introduce our services.  Post launch:  -Execute an engagement strategy to drive ongoing utilization including: -Monthly newsletters to our clients contain forwardable blurbs, downloadable content, and links to upcoming Wellthy webinars. -Direct-to-employee communications to share gated content and receive other opt-in marketing communications messaging. -Build relationships with employee resource groups (ERGs) and other employee-led groups to support their populations through training materials, messaging templates, webinars, and events. -Our ever-expanding content infrastructure and integrated resources within our platform and apps foster an educational experience that facilitates the creation of an account by employees, before they may even need one — so getting started will be that much easier when they do.
column79: At Wellthy, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) are embedded into our organizational DNA. As a female-founded and led company, our current team is 83% female and 36% ethnically diverse. Wellthy has built robust measures and practices to ensure a diverse hiring pipeline. We use sourcing platforms tailored around diversity and inclusion, and our job postings include Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) statements and encourage candidates who need accommodations to contact us. In addition, Wellthy maintains an Ideal Candidate Profile Guide to focus on skill-based evaluations to minimize potential bias in candidate selection. Our Talent team also has set clear goals to ensure diversity across hiring: 60% of initial phone screens and 40-50% of candidates advancing through the interview process are targeted to be from diverse backgrounds. Furthermore, we partner with DE&I consultant groups who collaborate with our internal DE&I Council to provide training to our teams, and continually fine-tune our recruitment and retention strategies to align with our DE&I commitments.  At the product level, we are sensitive to the unique needs of each family and incorporate Social Determinants of Health. Our onboarding and communication processes are designed to help Care Coordinators understand each family's specific circumstances and preferences, ensuring our services are culturally and linguistically appropriate. We provide localized caregiving support in the U.S., Canada, U.K., and Ireland, with Care Coordinators fluent in English, Spanish, and Canadian French. Wellthy provides a broad range of services that go beyond common complex care situations to support families with diverse needs. We provide support across the full spectrum of care and regularly support families with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum, Dyspraxia, Dyslexia, Tourette Syndrome, and others. Many of our team members have personal experience with neurodiversity and disabilities, making our support services particularly meaningful. Our expertise covers areas such as behavioral health, women's health, childcare, HIV, chronic conditions, veteran support, and gerontology. We're also dedicated to LGBTQ+ advocacy and support, assisting with mental health support, gender-affirming care, and LGBTQ+ friendly provider identification, among other services.  When we help a family find outside support, we want to ensure that the family and care recipient are fully comfortable with the caregiver, living facility, or another provider. Families can request attributes like gender, religious background, and personality. These preferences can be collected as part of our onboarding process, on a call with a Care Coordinator, or within communications on the platform. Please note that Wellthy prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, and national origin in accordance with Title VII of the Civil Rights Act.
column81: An eligibility file is our preferred method of verifying eligibility, but we have other options such as domain name and Single Sign-On (SSO).
column91: Our platform has SSO capabilities and we use Auth0 to power this experience. We can support any number of different linkages, and the cost will vary depending on the number of linkages chosen. There is an implementation and annual fee for SSO support.
column92: Wellthy provides monthly client utilization reporting and insights, which are reviewed by our Client Success Managers. Please note that all reporting is aggregated and anonymous to respect the privacy of employees. We normally include the following metrics:  -New signups: Number of new sign-ups from that month -Active with Wellthy: Number of active Care Projects for that month -Relationship to care recipient: List out the top three relationships -Tasks that we’re focused on: List out the top three tasks from that month -Total Care Project months: Aggregate of active Care Projects across contract (*if applicable. This only applies for clients who purchased a package or Care Project months or has a cap/target utilization in the contract) -NPS and employee quotes/stories: Sharing some more insight into how we’re supporting, depending on what NPS scores we have from AskNicely and highlights we received from the Service team   Wellthy also recommends a monthly touchpoint call to answer any questions, talk through upcoming events, highlight service-related topics, provide feedback, and align on next steps or action items. In addition to our standard reporting, we'd love to understand any specific metrics or customizations that our clients are interested in. We're committed to ensuring reporting can be used for insights into program utilization and help shape our clients' future strategies.
column101: Wellthy is a caregiving support solution for individuals and families with chronic, complex, and ongoing care needs. With an extensive team of care experts and a robust digital platform, Wellthy provides personalized and dedicated support for family caregivers. Unlike other care companies, we aren’t just resource providers or navigators — we are doers. By completing the logistical and administrative tasks of care, Wellthy helps improve retention, reduce time away, give time back, and increase productivity, all while giving people the support they desperately need to care for themselves and those they love. Wellthy's platform consists of the following key components: Care Concierge, Backup Care (coming in Q1 of 2024), Wellthy Community, and Care Planning, each integrating digital and human elements to offer comprehensive caregiving support.  Through Care Concierge, Wellthy helps families get things done. Families can create and manage Care Projects in the Care Dashboard, a centralized hub with tools, resources, tasks, and to-dos all in one place. After creating a Care Project, Wellthy matches families with a best-fit Care Coordinator who can support families across all phases of life, including aging, childcare, teen support, health conditions, disabilities, neurodiversity, mental and behavioral health, veterans support, financial support, end of life and loss, and LGBTQ+ gender affirmation and advocacy, and more. Care Coordinators help unburden and uplift family caregivers by accomplishing tasks on their behalf. The Care Coordinator will serve as the single point-of-contact for the family and create a custom plan based on the needs of the caregiver, the care recipient, their current situation, and the family's goals.   Wellthy's Backup Care offering will officially launch in Q1 of 2024. With this service, our experts will identify and vet local, flexible, and reliable backup care options, guide and educate families on the reimbursement process, and promote proactive planning through allowing employees to build a Care Circle, a personal backup care network that families can create in the Wellthy platform, for unanticipated circumstances and gaps in care. The Care Circle can include not only trusted providers but also friends, family members, and neighbors.  With Wellthy Community, we help families feel less alone. Wellthy Community is an expert-moderated peer-to-peer network where families can gain support and share knowledge with other caregivers. Wellthy Community offers a variety of caregiving forums for connection and more focused discussion on topics that are most relevant to members’ own care situations. Moderators regularly host discussions and post tips, questions, featured content, webinars and events for members to participate and engage with others. Families can feel less alone by exchanging caregiving advice and sharing their stories.  At Wellthy, we help families plan ahead and learn. Care Planning is a planning tool that empowers and guides families to prepare in advance for both expected and unexpected life events, offering support for logistical, administrative, emotional, legal, and financial planning needs. Families can create comprehensive, step-by-step Care Plans to stay organized, keep track of action items, and access digital resources that guide them through their future caregiving journeys.
column104: Wellthy's position is that it's not our decision to make whether we will be deemed ERISA or not. Wellthy leaves this decision to our clients and their legal and tax professionals.
column106: The client decides whether or not their employees are eligible for Wellthy through COBRA benefits. In the event an employee is terminated and the client wishes to give them access to Wellthy through COBRA, our team will work with the client to provide guidance for a smooth transition and how to best support the terminated employee.
column119: Wellthy is not an ERISA plan. However, your Wellthy Client Success Manager will be available to help answer questions or address concerns. We see ourselves as a partner and are committed to finding the most suitable approach to meet your unique needs.
column124: We have a dedicated Compliance team that is available to answer questions and address concerns related to Wellthy's services. Wellthy builds products, programs, and culture around the foundations of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). We also operate under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), one of the most stringent privacy policies worldwide. This ensures the utmost protection of employee privacy rights and meticulous management of personal data — from collection and processing to disclosure — upholding the highest standards of data integrity and confidentiality in every aspect of our service.
column127: Although we cannot provide formal legal or tax advice, we will provide some considerations.  For companies like Wellthy (and many others), tax law is not explicit and is quite vague on whether our service should be taxed or is exempt. Currently, 97% of our employer clients consider Wellthy an exempt benefit, including a large consulting company that has a tax practice. Our legal counsel’s view is that Wellthy’s services fit within the de minimis exclusion given that the annual PEPM spend is below $100, and given that the benefits of Wellthy are received by the employer (retention, reduced leaves, increased productivity) in addition to the value received by the employee. That said, we are happy to accommodate your preference. We do have four clients that consider Wellthy taxable. Of the four, two have selected to gross up the cost and cover it, and two have selected to impute income and have the employee pay the tax expense. In all four cases, the taxable period is during the months when an employee has an active care project within our Concierge, and we do not recommend taxing for employees who sign up, download the app, attend webinars or events, use Community, engage with content, or utilize any other non-Concierge experience.

column40: About Juno  Juno, named for the Roman goddess, protector of families, is a first-of-its-kind insurance parents.   Juno's co-founder, Snaebjorn Gunnsteinsson, is a PhD in economics who studied the long-term financial and career impact of severe child disability on women in the workforce. He and a team of like-minded parents created Juno to help fill this financial protection "gap" for all parents that hadn't been addressed in the United States.  Background  While large employers protect families from the financial risk of premature death and disability, parents are universally exposed to potentially severe financial hardships if their child becomes severely disabled, ill, or injured. Forward-thinking employers now have an opportunity to fill a gap in core coverage, demonstrate leadership in family benefits and deliver a return on investment that wows employees.  The impact on parents and employers  2 million working families have a child with a severe disability 73% of these parents report cutting back working hours or leaving the workforce due to increased caregiving needs that can average 53 hours per week Businesses also pay the price in lost productivity and turnover disproportionately impacting women's careers as well as their mental and financial wellbeing   How Juno protects all working parents  Juno covers all children, including adopted, foster, and step children to age 26 Parents receive personal guidance plus tax-advantaged cash benefits for up to 10 years totalling up to $500,000 if their child has a severe condition that requires long-term caregiving Gives powerful peace of mind and shows all employees their employer "has their back" in the moments that matter for an unmet need in our society  The business case for Juno  Fills a financial protection gap for every current and future parent   Highly valued and unique benefit 90% of surveyed employees (both parents and non-parents) say they would want Protects the business by improving productivity and retention for impacted parents in a way that is ethical, fair, and consistent Enhances benefit equity and complements state paid family leave (PFL), company caregiver leave, and return to work programs
column43: Juno is company-paid, group insurance. We underwrite each group based on their census. The typical cost of Juno is similar to a company's group basic Life or Long-term Disability Insurance premiums, i.e. about $200 per employee per year.   Think of Juno as financial protection. All employees are automatically enrolled, and we cover all dependent children up to age 26, including adopted, step, foster, or grandchildren regardless of medical enrollment status.  This model allows for everyone to benefit from Juno's insurance protection without having to think about it. Similar to group Life and Disability Insurance, employers hope NO ONE needs to file a claim, but the benefits are life changing to a family if the unexpected happens.

column55: Claims are handled with empathy, respect, and sensitivity. Claims examiners have on average 17 years of experience handling complex disability claims.

column67: Juno is extremely easy to implement. Underwriting (pricing) requires the same census you use for your major medical insurance eligibility file. All benefit eligible employees are automatically enrolled in Juno. All children, including adopted, foster, step, and grand children are automatically covered from age 0 up to age 26. No payroll or benefits system integrations are required. Very limited employee information needed for ongoing eligibility. Employees do not need to enroll or engage with Juno unless they are filing a claim. No plan, network, or vendor changes are needed to implement Juno. There is no agreement to sign, beyond our 2 page insurance application.
column74: We work hand-in-hand with your stakeholders and consultants to develop a launch plan that is tailored to your culture and your program goals. Generally, we have two types of launches:  Soft Launch High Visibility  As part of the planning process we recommend partnering with your employees and leaders who have been personally impacted by a severe child disability, serve on charitable boards for organizations that support children, and lead ERGs that support:  Disability Inclusion Parents and Caregivers Women  Many of Juno’s investors, advisors, and stakeholders have been impacted by child disability. We’ve also engaged with the child disability community, including ERG leaders at Fortune 500 companies, charitable board members, leading pediatric disability experts, and rank-and-file employees to ensure we are appropriately communicating all aspects of the Juno benefit.   Working with you, we engage identified employees and leaders to help craft communications that will resonate with your employees and align with your culture. Key elements of our communications include:   How Juno works Value and purpose “What’s in it for me”  Pre-existing conditions  For all implementations, we provide the following to ensure the best experience for your people:  Template emails, messaging content, and FAQs Template Summary Plan Description (SPD) Education for your relevant HR administrators and vendors Culture and program training for our claims team Cost-benefit analysis for full coverage of pre-existing conditions
column79: Child disability creates barriers towards advancing gender-equality and impacts women’s long-term rise to executive leadership and success as an entrepreneur. For example, a child’s cancer diagnosis negatively impacts a woman’s wages for over 12 years on average.  Implementing Juno makes a powerful statement that Mastercard cares about an unmet need in our society.   As a public benefit corporation (PBC) Juno donates 2% of premiums to charities supporting research on childhood disabilities and rare diseases and organizations that provide direct support to families.   If we are fortunate to count Sequoia as a partner, we would be delighted to collaborate on contributing to relevant causes the firm supports.

column40: Meeko Health makes it easy for employers to offer employees access to safe, effective, FDA approved psychedelic-assisted psychotherapy.  America’s workforce is facing a mental health crisis - even though access to mental healthcare is more convenient today compared to ever before.  Digital EAP’s, virtual therapy, online provider consultation and prescribing.  Still - America’s workforce is facing a crisis - meaning that the treatments we’ve traditionally relied on aren’t always working.  Meeko allows employees to get inclusive, accessible care - and with the Meeko Platform, we manage the entire member experience Meeko is shaping the future of how we think about treating mental health. Meeko is an employer sponsored benefit that allows members access to root cause focused mental health care using FDA approved Psychedelic-Assisted Psychotherapy, currently offering Ketamine-assisted therapy.

column40: Bitewell has created the first Digital Food Farmacy, a food-as-medicine benefits & rewards platform, which guides and educates employees to make healthier food choices - at meal-time and beyond.    Most FAM or nutrition programs only offer prepared meals and/or nutrition coaching.  Both expensive options.  - Bitewell is a marketplace of all the healthiest food options around you - restaurants, grocery, and prepared meals.   There are no personalized FAM platforms that take into account an employees total self.  - Bitewell looks at an employees health conditions, food preferences, and health goals when guiding their choices.   There are no points systems or tracking to keep a tally of.   - Bitewell's proprietary metric the FoodHealth Score gives members a score on each item of food or meal you are buying - based upon the food composition & your personal health profile.   Nutrition coaching is expensive and not a sustainable solution for most.    - Bitewell's AI food coach, Carrie, is there on-demand to help you with food decisions, recipes, and meal-planning.  Very few are able to reward for healthy behavior.   - Bitewell allows employers to incentivize healthy behavior based on adoption, activity and FoodHealth score improvement.   Most don't explain why certain foods are better or worse for you.  - Bitewell educates you along the way with drop-downs on why certain foods are scoring higher or lower for you.   - Bitewell is extremely affordable.

column40: StashWorks is the first automated savings solution that rewards employees for achieving their financial goals.  Leveraging 8 years of helping customers build over $3B in savings, Stash is now also partnering with employers to make it easy and fun for their employees to save money.   For most people saving money is hard and feels out of reach. Lack of meaningful savings creates stress and impacts employees’ physical, mental, and professional well-being. StashWorks solves this problem - giving employees the ability to automatically deduct money from their paychecks, effortlessly save for life goals, and earn cash rewards for making consistent contributions and hitting “savings streaks.”  With no minimum balance or contribution requirements, no fee banking services, and no AUM fees, StashWorks makes it easy to get started and stick with it for the long run.  We’re fully integrated with all major payroll systems, ensuring a set up that takes just minutes for employers and employees.    Nearly 90% of working Americans saying they would participate in a workplace savings tool and 60% saying they’d be more likely to stay at a job that offered financial wellness benefits - StashWorks is on a mission to become the most utilized benefit and effective employee engagement solution.     What makes us different?  Combination of education and action: Unlike most providers in the financial benefits space, StashWorks offers both financial education and actionable accounts, tools and solutions. We call it “earn as you learn” and the experience is designed to help users utilize our financial content to take empowered, informed actions based on learnings.   Focus on savings and investing, accessible funds and portable accounts:  Across every segment of the population, people are most concerned about the amount  of money they have saved for emergencies. To this end, unlike many other providers in the space employees can choose from a variety of products and solutions including, savings and investing as well as retirement planning. In addition, we have integrations with all major payroll providers and can power automatic deductions from employees’ paychecks for deposit into a Stash account. Stash accounts move with employees so there is no work for employers to facilitate transitions. Whether employees are just surviving or thriving, Stash puts employees in the driver’s seat and gives them choice, access to their funds, and ease of portability.   Innovative, attractive rewards:  StashWorks is a first of its kind benefit that offers innovative rewards through sign up incentives, milestone rewards (i.e “savings streaks”) and spend based perks all with the goal of providing near term and long term value, encouraging enrollment and optimizing for long term engagement.    The rewards are branded, positioned and messaged as a ‘perk’ and convey a sense of optimism, levity and ‘value’ (i.e. a smart way to get ahead in life). The goal is to leverage a rewards driven experience to help turn money into a source of hope and opportunity.   Proven track record:  Stash is not new - we bring 8 years of experience to StashWorks and a tried, true “formula” from helping millions of users build wealth.

column56: Stash is a web and mobile app based tool - our leadership team does not personally provide financial advice or communicate directly with the end user. That being said please see below for our CEO and Co-Founders' bios:  Liza Landsman:  Liza Landsman joined Stash as CEO in February 2023, bringing extensive expertise scaling world-class organizations in consumer finance, e-commerce, and retail. She’s passionate about products that help people save and spend, and is deeply committed to the financial wellbeing of everyday Americans. Prior to Stash, Liza was general partner at NEA, and also served in key operations and leadership roles at Jet.com, Citigroup, BlackRock, E*TRADE, and IBM. She sits on several boards of directors and has been listed amongst Fortune’s Most Powerful Women.  Brandon Krieg: After nearly eight years as CEO whereby Stash surpassed $100 million in revenue, Brandon is now focused on helping companies large and small jumpstart their employees’ journey to financial wellness with Stash. He also serves as CEO of Stash Capital, our broker-dealer. Prior to Stash he co-founded Edge Trade, one of the first and largest agency trade execution and software firms (later acquired by Knight Capital Group), and served as Head of Electronic Execution at Macquarie Securities Group.  Ed Robinson: Since founding Stash, Ed has led the Product, Marketing, Operations and Engineering teams to serve millions of active subscribers across the U.S. His passion is democratizing financial services through innovative products that are simple, affordable, and accessible. Early in his career, Ed provided financial advice to high-net-worth families focusing on asset allocation. Following that, he spent nearly a decade on equity trading desks across London and New York with Macquarie, where he met his eventual Co-Founder,
column67: We leverage Atomic to connect with our employer partners' HRIS. Employers receive an authorization link from StashWorks and click on this link to give us permission and grant us access. The end to end process for employers can be completed in minutes.  In addition to granting us access, employers are asked to review and sign a brief partnership agreement.   Lastly, we provide employers with training materials and content to leverage on their intranet and during open enrollment season to help educate employees about StashWorks.
column74: Our communication strategy is informed in large part by 8.5 years of experience working directly with millions of consumers to drive awareness, enrollment and engagement.  We have mapped out a comprehensive pre-launch, activation, welcome and ongoing engagement communication strategy and messaging plan. In addition, we offer employers onsite and/or virtual training sessions, a launch kit, creative resources and messaging for their internal channels and ongoing support to manage FAQs and employee customer service requests.  The tactics listed above are designed to help drive awareness of what StashWorks is, explain why employees will benefit from utilization and also provide an easy to understand overview of the product to ensure employees can take full advantage of the offering.
column79: At Stash, our mission is to help everyday Americans invest and build wealth. We believe everyone has the right to be treated with fairness, dignity and respect. We recognize that building a diverse and inclusive culture is therefore central to our mission.  Our goal is for every employee to feel welcomed from day one, able to make an impact and thrive with the full support and advocacy of their colleagues and leaders. This is a crucial part of The Stash Way and achieving these goals is critical to our success as a business - and as human beings.  We take a diverse slate approach when it comes to hiring which ensures diverse pipelines and an inclusive process.   We don’t just measure representation but we also measure inclusion through a bi-annual inclusivity index, which is a 7 question survey that measures things like psychological safety and belonging to name a few.   Our CEO Liza Landsman this year signed the CEO Action pledge for diversity, publicly acknowledging our commitment to DEI. We also have an internal pledge that all employees have a chance to sign We have an annual Unconscious Bias training that ensures we recognize and combat the many biases that we encounter on a daily basis.  We dedicate April specifically to Allyship (Allyship Awareness Month) a month where we learn what it takes to be an Ally and its importance.  We have five Employee Resource Groups (ERGS) each with an executive sponsor and have been instrumental in building our culture.  We have someone in a full-time role dedicated to DEI.

column101: StashWorks is a workplace benefits program powered by Stash. We securely connect with employers' HRIS system, so that employees can allocate money from their paycheck into a StashWorks account. They’ll earn automatic stock rewards in a Stash Investment Portfolio as they continue to save money for the future. We offer a suite of financial tools and education to support their financial growth. Employees don’t pay any subscription fees and there are no account minimums. They can adjust their paycheck contribution amount in their StashWorks Dashboard, where they’ll also have access to their full Stash banking and investing account.   StashWorks users gain access to Stash's solutions, advice and rewards:  Solutions: employees grow their money and build financial stability by contributing to Stash’s assisted saving, retirement, and investment tools via automated payroll deductions.    Advice: Ongoing guidance, tutorials, and content support employees in gaining confidence and building positive financial habits.  Rewards: Stash continuously deposits rewards into an automated personalized investment account when employees allocate a portion of their paycheck into a Stash account and achieving savings streaks and goals.
