column40: Key Differentiators - Access: Due to our proprietary Network Management System, which combines real-time provider capacity tracking, machine learning, and provider quality management, Modern Health is known for setting the industry-leading access to care.  - <1 day average time to first-available session, globally - Instant in-app provider matching — available both in and outside of the U.S. - 24/7 Helpline — for clinician access, navigation, or technical support   - Effective Care across the Spectrum: Modern Health manages risk and supports people across the mental health spectrum — including rapid response systems to detect and stabilize employees in crisis, treatment for conditions, and proactive interventions to provide support before concerns escalate. - Clinically-proven global network quality: 90% of members confident in their provider match & 4.9/5 post-session rating for providers - 80% of members, globally, clinically improve, recover or maintain well-being - 53% using multiple care modalities: Integrated care options are critical for long-term effectiveness   - Global Equity & Reach: Modern Health prioritizes equitable access to care, globally. Our end-to-end mobile and web-app experience, including assessments, care recommendations, programs, meditations on-demand Circles, coaching, and therapy are available globally, and all care offerings are informed by our Global Inclusion Council of providers.  - 70% of our customers have an international presence -  Large multinational corporations like Stripe, Uber, Palo Alto Networks, and Electronic Arts have switched to Modern Health from peer solutions due to our consistent global member experience - Customers see consistently high engagement and member satisfaction across global regions   Care Offerings: - Crisis Support:  - At-risk Member Support: Proactive risk detection, 24/7 clinician line for stabilization & navigation - Onsite Critical Incident Support: Next-day onsite counseling, employer & manager guidance - Effective Treatment: - One-on-one: Clinical Therapy, Psychiatry & Med Management, Coaching, Care Coordinators, as well as Pathways (specialized 1:1 structured programs) - Group: Award-nominated Modern Health CirclesTM - Self-guided: Clinician-developed courses, meditations, and programs - Specialized Support: - Substance Use - Children & Adolescents - ERGs and DEIB - Managers & Leaders - Coaches & Therapists supporting all pillars of well-being: Mental, Professional, Social, Physical, Financial Well-being
column43: A complete detailing of our pricing model is as follows:   1. Modern Health implementation fees are in the form of the PEPM that we begin charging on the contract effective date which is typically 4-6 weeks prior to the employee launch date for a company of this size and containing this geographical footprint.   2. Our services are primarily priced using a PEPM pricing model that provides a fixed annual cost based upon: number of employees, number of sessions (coaching & therapy) and whether dependent coverage is included. This PEPM pricing model takes into account cost of administration and platform. - If utilization-based pricing is preferable, our sales team is happy to address that with you in the sales process. 3. Depending on the size of the contract agreement: - Company-specific webinars (Circles) may also be included at no cost with the option to purchase more - Benefit fairs may also be included at no cost with the option to purchase more - Custom marketing may also be included at no cost, with the option to purchase more
column54: Members and managers who call our phone line (available 24/7/365) can immediately connect with masters-level clinicians. These counselors can provide real-time clinical support and help navigate the member’s benefits. They can support both individual and organizational crisis, including coordinating on-site critical incident support.    Participants may also receive support with onboarding, registration, app navigation, or questions about longer-term care options through Modern Health. This type of support can be selected at the beginning of the call and can only be accessed during US business hours.
column55: Modern Health is on a mission to improve access to high-quality mental health across the world. We are pursuing this mission by partnering with forward-thinking companies committed to expanding and improving access to mental health for their employees.    We are currently supporting over 470 clients who have deployed Modern Health to their employees around the globe. Our team supports clients of all sizes, from smaller customers to large enterprise organizations with tens of thousands of employees. Our clients also range across a diverse set of industries including technology, banking, and financial services, professional services, entertainment and media, non-profits, and many more.
column56: Modern Health providers are vetted to ensure adherence to strict regulatory and compliance standards for contracting with providers. For Therapists: Modern Health recruits licensed providers with advanced degrees in clinical psychology or a related field (e.g., Ph.D., Psy.D., LCSW, LMTF, LPC). All coaches must be certified by the International Coaching Federation.    Providers delivering ongoing care are trained and vetted in the usage of evidence-based methods, including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), Motivational Interviewing, and mindfulness.    We also conduct a practical evaluation of therapists and coaches delivering ongoing care for adherence to culturally responsive care and ethical care standards.   Work-Life Credentials Master's level counselors answer all calls. If the caller is interested in work-life or legal/financial services, the clinician will warm transfer the individual to a specialist who can fulfill the case. Our counselors are also trained to complete work-life intakes and provide coverage details.  Financial Credentials Financial counselors hold certification as an Accredited Financial Counselor (AFC), accredited through the Association for Financial Counseling, Planning, and Education (AFCPE), which requires the completion of 15 hours of Continuing Education Units (CEU) and an annual fee for renewal.

column67: Modern Health recommends a standard timeline 4-6 weeks for implementations. The timeline and launch project plan will be created in collaboration with you and your Client Success Manager at the beginning of your relationship with Modern Health. The implementation plan is tailored to meet [Client Name]'s unique program goals, company processes & culture. Your CSM specializes in helping your team get up and running with best practices and launch resources.    The following components are often involved in the implementation process: - Kick-off call: call with your dedicated Modern Health Customer Success Manager & Launch Manager - Communication project plan: call to discuss custom communications and marketing program plan  - Executive sponsorship: Modern Health assists in identifying champions and supporting the program internally - Technical set-up: configure eligibility and other integrations with your Launch Manager - Communications calendar: develop ongoing adoption plan and annual calendar informed by member utilization trends.   If you have a global workforce, we can work with your team or with global stakeholders from your local offices to build out a comprehensive engagement plan that's tailored to culturally relevant needs.
column73: For contracts that are more than 12 months, we are open to discussing a termination clause during the sales process if that is standard practice for contracts with your company. Timing will be determined during contracting.
column74: Your Modern Health Client Success Team ensures successful engagement at launch and over time by way of promotional messaging, targeted communications, enablement sessions, workshops and engagement with ERGs and cross-functional groups including Medical Leave of Absence, DEI, L&D and other relevant programs. Examples of targeted communications: - Launch/Product Overview Emails - FAQ Documents - ERG Resources - Newsletters - Posters - TV Displays - Product Overviews - Gamification Efforts - Deck Sample Slides - All-Hands Material and more Your CSM will also deliver Modern Health overviews & trainings and help create ongoing engagement strategies based on aggregate employee engagement data on focus areas, well-being scores, and registration data.
column79: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging are incredibly important to Modern Health. We are highly committed to a culturally centered model of mental health, which means that we want to center on each unique company’s and person’s well-being. Our internal Clinical Strategy and Research team includes DEIB experts who focus on the care we provide to our members and how we source and educate providers.    Moreover, we consult with external experts in order to augment our internal expertise, including our Global Inclusion Council (GIC), a group of our own providers who provide care around the world and who have specialized expertise related to mental health equity, diversity, and culturally centered mental health care. The GIC provides expertise on a wide variety of topics, including things like how best to engage people in different regions, how risk of self-harm is handled in a given culture, or translation of clinical materials for our members.    For each member, we offer services that account for their own multifaceted culture, the cultures they exist within (for example, their employer or their geographic location), Modern Health’s culture, and the care providers’ cultures.    For our provider network, we aim to offer our members a broad range of providers who both specialize in serving people like them and can identify with their lived experiences. While we understand that a shared identity with a provider may be important for some, we also know that cultural identity is complex and adjusts across situations and time. With this in mind, we take a multi-prong approach in sourcing our network and matching members:    First, we're always working to increase the diversity of our network of therapists and coaches across a broad spectrum of specializations, expertise, and cultural identifications (such as race, nationality, and languages spoken).    Second, we also look for providers who have specialized training and experience serving diverse populations, and we are continuing to increase provider training on cultural humility and competence, which allows us to meet an individual’s needs as they change and allows providers to flexibly serve the whole person.    Third, when specific requests are made that we can’t fulfill from our existing network, we can “reactively” source a provider (for example, someone may request a therapist in a specific city who identifies as Latinx and who specializes in working with LGBTQ+ people).    Finally, and as noted, we actively work with our providers in order to make continuous improvements in our care model and offerings. Through all of these efforts, we are constantly working to improve how we source, support, and educate providers, as well as how to make our product and platform more welcoming and inclusive for all people. This work is also intended to increase our internal capacity to ensure that we are a leader in the DEIB space and that this is seen as the work of all teams at Modern Health.
column82: Modern Health's requirements for an eligibility file are as follows: - A full file containing all eligible employees must be sent at a regular cadence (monthly, biweekly or weekly) - File must contain at minimum first name, last name, and either work email or date of birth - File formatting must meet our exact data specifications (eg. CSV UTF-8) - File to be transferred via Box or SFTP These requirements remain the same regardless of whether HPI is turned on. Modern Health currently integrates with Workday via SFTP. We have set up an automated SFTP transfer between our client's Workday system and Modern Health for multiple clients and will partner closely with your team to do so.
column91: We integrate with multiple SSO providers and can also accommodate eligibility file feeds from HRIS systems. There is no additional cost for setting these up.
column92: Modern Health offers an integrated portal to manage access to care, identify at-risk populations, and extend timely, targeted support to your workforce. Modern Health Central provides on-demand access to key metrics on your organization’s health and well-being, areas of need, and utilization of care across office locations and departments — so you can see how your teams are doing at any time.   Additionally, our Customer Success team will conduct Quarterly Business Reviews to analyze metrics and confirm alignment with your organization's strategic initiatives and goals.
column101: Our global experience mirrors the one for US-based members, providing video and in-person therapy, coaching, EAP services, and digital well-being tools. Domestically we can support employees in all 50 states & U.S territories. Internationally, Modern Health has built our own global network of coaches and therapists spanning 69+ countries and 58+ languages — this means that the vetting & quality of providers that you get through Modern Health is higher than a solution that relies on EAP networks for international therapy, where there are fewer quality controls and lots of unresponsive providers.    Employees will be empowered with: - Access to our mobile and web applications - Unlimited access to evidence-based digital programs and meditations, 24/7 - Unlimited access to chat with our global network of ICF-certified Coaches (including specially trained mental health coaches) - Virtual coaching session on our platform with ICF-certified Coaches (including mental health coaches) - Virtual visits with licensed therapists* - Virtual group care sessions ("Circles") - Visits with psychiatry & medication management providers** - 24/7 crisis-support phone line (additional costs apply) - Access to other EAP-related services (additional costs apply)   As a benefits leader at your company, your team will have the support of a Client Success Manager and: - Personalized implementation, project and communication plans - Access to our Modern Health Central, which houses a range of marketing and engagement materials - Self-service, real-time reporting and quarterly business reviews - Enablement sessions for HR Business Partners - Other mental health-related programs and innovation (additional costs may apply)
column103: Modern Health typically offers its services to employers as an excepted benefit under applicable federal regulations. Specifically, we view our therapy services as short-term and do not believe they constitute a significant benefit in the nature of medical care. As a result, we think that it’s reasonable for our customers to continue to treat such care as an accepted benefit under applicable federal regulations.   In addition, Modern Health does not offer therapy benefits in coordination with the employer's group health plan. That is, the arrangements Modern Health concludes with employers do not require employees to exhaust the benefits provided through its platform before employees are able to access benefits through their group health plan, nor does Modern Health structure its arrangements to make its benefits dependent on participation in another group health plan. Further, Modern Health does not charge any premiums to, or require any contributions from, employees to access these benefits. Finally, Modern Health does not impose any cost-sharing requirements, such as co-pays, in providing these benefits.   With regard to psychiatric/prescribing care, most customers offer these benefits as a wrap plan to ensure compliance with federal regulations.
column106: Modern Health’s benefit is subject to COBRA. For COBRA, Modern Health has continued to provide benefits to COBRA participants through different mechanisms, such as under the terms of the arrangement at the employer’s expense. That said, we are cognizant of the requirements imposed on employers under COBRA with respect to continuing coverage, including certain nuances associated with an EAP-type benefit, and would be willing to work with customers to help them address these requirements.     Because most customers cover the full cost of the Modern Health benefit through a PEPM pricing model, we have developed an approach that enables an employee who wishes to continue the Modern Health benefit following a COBRA-qualifying event/termination of employment to elect COBRA continuation coverage and to pay the PEPM amount on a monthly basis during the COBRA period.   Because COBRA requires a group health plan to charge a COBRA-eligible employee no more than 102% of the premium charged for the employee’s plan benefits before such employee experiences a COBRA-qualifying event, Modern Health has only required an employee who elects COBRA coverage to pay during the coverage period the same PEPM amount that the employer had been paying.   For certain existing customers, Modern Health has continued to provide benefits to COBRA participants under the terms of the arrangement at the employer’s expense.  That said, we are cognizant of the requirements imposed on employers under COBRA with respect to continuing coverage, including certain nuances associated with an EAP-type benefit, and would be willing to work with employers to help them comply with these requirements.
column109: Modern Health: Statement of Compliance for Mental Health Services  Modern Health has a robust compliance program designed to prevent and detect violations of applicable laws and regulations relevant to the provision of Mental Health Services. The Corporate Compliance & Ethics program incorporates multiple components and controls to ensure Company compliance, including but not limited to:   - All personnel are required to complete compliance and ethics training within 30 days of hire and annually thereafter. Employees are also required to complete role specific new hire training prior to their access to the organization's critical systems.   - All personnel are required to review, attest to, and adhere to the Code of Conduct and all company policies and procedures.   - The Company conducts routine auditing and monitoring of various business activities.   - The Company contracts with a third party vendor to host the Modern Health integrity Line, which is available 24 hours a day/7days a week for employees to report concerns of actual or suspected violations of the Code of Conduct, policies and procedures, or the law.   - If potential misconduct is reported or detected, the Compliance team would take prompt action to conduct a thorough investigation to determine potential discipline, remediation, and corrective action.

Lastly, Healthee captures ALL the employer sponsored benefits in one place so employees have just one place to go.
column43: Healthee charges $4 PEPM without our telehealth solution and $6 with.  As the size of the customer increases, these costs are lower, and can go as low as $1.5-3 PEPM  Healthee's telehealth is at no co-pay, no co-insurance, no out-of-pocket cost, and no claim associated with the use of our telehealth. It is also available for dependents and employees who are not enrolled on the employer health plan.
column54: Benefits specialist/live support is available from 8am - 8pm Monday - Friday On weekends, support is available over email
column55: At Healthee, we are user obsessed, we define customer service by prioritizing a user-centric approach, utilizing innovative technologies for prompt responses, and ensuring confidentiality in handling benefits related inquiries. Our goal is to not only resolve issues efficiently and on-the-spot but also provide a seamless and empathetic experience, setting new standards in the healthtech industry.  Our platform is hyper personalized, meaning each employee will get a tailored platform based on their coverage, demographics, health profile, etc.  We are very proud of our engagement metrics and believe it a sign of our platform's unique UX - we strive to constantly improve our user experience in order to make the user journey much more intuitive and successful
column56: Our team comprises highly skilled professionals with expertise in healthcare, technology, and customer service. They undergo rigorous training to ensure proficiency in handling diverse inquiries and maintaining the confidentiality required in the healthtech sector. They also all speak English and Spanish.   Each one of our customer support team members becomes an expert in the benefits for each specific employer, and is able to conduct even further research to find the best answer to our users.   On the other hand, our AI platform is designed in a way that customer support is almost not needed and most users needs are self served.
column67: Once the agreement has been signed, the Salesperson will introduce the Implementation Manager to the client. We strive for a seamless onboarding process with minimal lift from the employer's team or the broker.  Implementation manager will follow up with the customer to schedule a kick off call to go over the required documentation and steps in the implementation process. We will be utilizing Monday.com as our home for documentation along with Couchdrop.com as our SFTP provider. Client responsible for sharing required documentation inclusive of:  Medical, Dental, and Vision plan SBCs, SPDs, and/or EOCs Summary documentation for ancillary benefits Group Numbers Eligibility file with employee elections and demographic information Plan Premium information  Once all plan information has been shared with the Implementation Manager, they will share it with Healthee’s Data Analyst team to review and ensure that we have everything we need to get the client’s instance of Healthee up and running.  After the plan documentation has been reviewed, the Implementation Manager will schedule time with the client to go over any questions that arose during the Data review process and to confirm launch dates.  Once everything is confirmed, the Data Analysis process will begin. This typically takes 4 weeks to complete, validate, and test.  About 3 weeks prior to the launch date, the Implementation manager will set up a meeting with the customer to discuss progress and marketing materials/deployment. It is during this call that we’ll look to schedule a training session for the day of the launch to get employees up to speed.   The last step is then to launch the client which includes Healthee sending a Welcome Email to employees and conducting a training session.  Each customer at our healthtech company is paired with a dedicated Customer Manager (CM) who serves as a primary point of contact, offering personalized and attentive assistance. These CMs are extensively trained professionals with a deep understanding of both our technological solutions and the intricacies of the healthcare domain, ensuring a high-touch experience that caters to the specific needs of each client.
column74: Healthee has a whole engagement team that is fully dedicated to build and execute a communication strategy with our users and customers. Engagement is one of our main KPIs and we invest many resources on this metric.   Our communication strategy involves utilizing various channels such as email campaigns, webinars, and personalized consultations, we aim to effectively notify and engage eligible members about our revolutionary benefits navigation platform, ensuring comprehensive understanding, utilization, and adoption.   As part of the on-boarding, we will also conduct training sessions to employees, if possible - we will come on site to meet employees and tell them more about our platform.   We are also flexible with how to reach employees - text, email, in-app notifications, etc.
column79: By ensuring health benefits are easy to access and straightforward to understand, we’re closing care gaps and creating true equity. Our platform makes it simple to know how much a doctor's visit or treatment will cost ahead of time, so there are no surprise bills or unaccounted-for expenses (all-too-frequent obstacles to care). Users can even search by provider language and gender. We’re creating an increased level of comfort and personalization in care that puts the user in control of their care journey.
column82: At least - first name, last name, email, plans enrolled   Nice to have DOB  Phone number  Dependents
column91: We can support any type of SSO
column92: We can provide a very rare glimpse into what benefits employees are really interested in. Healthee tracks anonymously every question asked, every click of a mouse or a doctor appointment booked.  We can share data with the broker or the employer on which benefits employees care about the most, how much are they using telehealth, which benefits they're currently missing, etc.  Employee ID#, First Name, Last Name, Work Email Address, Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Phone Number, Address, Zip Code, Birthdate, Gender, and Ancillary Benefit elections (LTD, AD&D, etc)
column101: Plan comparison and recommendation tool - Healthee can help users understand their options during OE and recommend the best plan for them and their families   Healthee app - employees can navigate their health benefits, search providers, understand costs of care, book appointments, etc.   Telehealth - employees and their family members can leverage our no-cost telehealth support for both behavioral and medical
column104: We're not touching retirement
column106: We continue to support the member when they're on COBRA
column118: We do not provide benefits, just a gateway to them
column119: We provide price transparency compliance
column124: Our customer success managers and chief security officer can answer any question or concern about compliance, we take security and compliance very seriously.
column127: We don't discuss taxation

column40: Goodpath virtual care treats the entire person, both mental and physical - and we're polychronic, so we support all major conditions in one place - allowing benefits teams to manage MSK, Mental Health, Cancer Survivorship, Digestive, Sleep, and long Covid in a single place. Members love it too! Goodpath care has both the highest enrollment and engagement rates, driving truly equitable care for all.   Employers want a single solution that can address many conditions, that will impact a large portion of their population, and drive high impact. And they want a solution that fits within their budget. Goodpath has cracked the code on providing a single platform for the most common and costly conditions, using utilization based pricing to keep costs reasonable while also guaranteeing an ROI through a claims analysis and reduction in disability. This value based approach works for employers who have been unsatisfied with current singular point solutions in the market that drive minimal enrollments and are costly.   Goodpath is the first service that combines personalized digital care with physical products and medically-degreed coaches that both educate employees and enable them to execute their personalized care plans. Programs start with a dynamic, digital health assessment that helps us understand every member's medical condition and their willingness to change, goals, and preferences. Through both AI and human review, a uniquely personalized program is created for each member. Evidence-based treatments in our program include physical therapy, mind-body techniques, educational materials, cognitive behavioral therapy, and OTCs, devices, and other physical items that provide symptom relief.  Goodpath's whole person care approach is unique in the following ways:  1. Employee experience: Employees get access to personalized and complete care that targets the chief complaint (such as back pain) and the contributing factors (e.g. poor sleep, stress, diet) with proven treatments in one simple location. Because it's designed for them, it works for employees - leading to Goodpath's enrollment rates of 14% or greater 2. Depth of care: Goodpath care model follows the evidence-based practice of integrative health, making multi-disciplinary care accessible to all and uniquely bringing the breadth and depth of medicine needed to care for complex chronic conditions 3. Diversity, equity and inclusion: Employees have a voice in their care journey.  Program and coaching preferences are honored for  ethnicity, language, gender - culturally specific guidance; from nutrition plans to care kit contents and more.  4. Significant health improvement: Our average employee health improvement is 54%, absenteeism due to a health condition drops by 71%, and productivity increases by 53%. These results hold true for every 9 out 10 enrolled members, making it a powerful tool in employee happiness and retention. In addition, our member NPS says it all, acros our book of business, we measure it at 82 5. Cost reduction:Goodpath impacts a population at scale, which leads to significant cost reductions. This unique approach leads to industry-leading enrollment (14%+), strong employer ROI (3.1x), and healthier employees (85% see significant improvement in physical and mental health). In addition, across employers, we've measured a 30-50% reduction in incidence of short term disability as a result of rolling out Goodpath  For mental health, Goodpath is able to address a far larger share of people with mental health issues. Only 25% of people with a mental health condition actually seek care (either with talk therapy or self-directed - both of which Goodpath addresses). However, the remaining 75% of people with a mental health condition only ever seek care for physical conditions. With Goodpath, we address this ""missing majority"" because they come to us for physical health issues (e.g. MSK, Digestive, Sleep) and through our digital health assessment and integrative approach, we can discover and address their mental health issues at the same time. This results in a significant and measurable increase in the number and severity of mental health conditions that Goodpath addresses relative to mental health-only solutions.  For cancer survivorship, our aim is to improve quality of life. While we don't diagnose or treat the cancer itself, we help with the mental health, sleep, diet, and/or pain issues around having and surviving cancer, as well as the common side effects from cancer medication (e.g. digestive issues, sleep issues, joint issues). Our medical coaches and licensed pharmacists guide members through whole-person care that improves quality of life outcomes.  Finally, Goodpath impacts an employer's entire risk profile: from intervening early with proven reductions in health claims and incidence of disability, to treating employees on absence which reduces the duration and severity of disability.
column43: We price at $850 per participant per year / case rate. This is standard price for all companies but we tend to work best with companies with 1,000 employees or more.
column54: 6am - 10pm EST 7 days a week. All members can communicate with their coaches through our app, through email, SMS, or a video call. During non-business hours, coaches may respond, or wait until business hours to respond. We require coaches to respond within 24 hours of a message, but the average response time during business hours is 2 hours.
column55: Our entire identity is about improving quality of life, and that applies to our members as well as our client partners.   For our members, we personalize every part of their program and pair them with a dedicated health coach who is a resource for them at every step. This could mean creating specialized diets, extending coaching calls for 2 hours to help a member through turbulent periods, etc. We see this approach validated in our 100% coaching satisfaction rate and industry-busting NPS of 82.  For our clients, we personalize the experience for them as well, from a custom communication approach for their populations, to regular check-ins, even to how we structure the agreement - where we have guaranteed health savings and health outcomes. This aspect is validated with our 100% retention rate and positive case studies with all our clients.
column56: Everyone on our medical team has active licenses and are registered to practice in the US. Team members are board-certified by their respective board of specialty. Our MSK physician leads have additional credentials covering: Pain Management, Orthopedic Surgery, Internal Medicine, and Genetics. They are just one part though of the full field of 20+ fields of medicine, with professional credentials of: MDs, PhDs, Registered Dieticians, Doctorates in Physical Therapy, Registered Behavioral Therapists, Registered Nurses, Registered Pharmacists, and other practitioners across 20 fields of medicine.    Our team members are additionally trained and experienced in public health, epidemiology, methods of research, education, and coaching. Our physician advisory board consists of scientists and academicians, in addition to practitioners in busy clinical practices who are affiliated with prestigious academic medical centers.   Our health coaches, who work directly with members, all have a master's degree or greater in a clinical specialty and at least 2 years of clinical experience. They receive additional training on integrative care and behavioral change.   Our medical and research teams are continuously working to ensure our medical protocols stay up to date. Our protocols are based on the highest level of scientific evidence from thorough reviews of the medical literature (clinical trials, systematic reviews, and meta-analyses). The quality assurance process includes periodic reviews of the progress and improvement of our members, monitoring of the performance measures of our coaches, solicitation of feedback from members regarding their experience, and member simulation whereby medical staff enroll in our programs incognito (in a way that is close, but not identical, to "secret shopping").  The full team and their credentials can be found here: https://www.goodpath.com/team
column67: We have a detailed customer success process to ensure each and every client is happy with Goodpath.  We have a three-tiered account management team. We have the VP of Customer Success that manages the entire team and joins quarterly and annual business reviews for our largest clients. Account managers are the main points of contact for each client and manage the client on a day-to-day level. For our largest accounts, we do have account specialists that support the account managers.  Prior to launch, we set up a discovery implementation session with the client to understand their communication best practices and create a joint launch communication plan. This includes multiple types of communications (email, SMS, flyers, at-home mailers, in-person events). This entire communication kit can be branded for the client, come directly from Goodpath, or a mix of both.  We set up a recurring monthly meeting to share a report on enrollment and engagement (quarterly report on health outcomes and annual report on ROI), to finalize the next set of communications, and share any other updates.  We collaborate very closely with potential partners to customize our experience to suit the client's needs. This includes creating a roadmap to launch new conditions based on the client's needs, white-labeling the experience, and collaborating with the client's other health solutions.
column74: We communicate with members in two ways:  1. To employees who have not yet enrolled with Goodpath: Typically, we launch our communications to an entire employee population since our program is relevant to a majority of the employee population (65% of working adults have one or more of the conditions we treat). All communications are customized for each client, including their branding and specific communication styles/languages.  We can tailor our communications in a variety of ways: Use different communication methods and messages for different workforces, e.g. email is very effective for corporate employees but SMS is much more effective for manufacturing employees Target communications and messaging to specific populations - e.g. high cost claimants Change messaging based on region  2. To members who have enrolled in our programs: For members, we have reminders, notifications, and status messages that are set as a standard part of any program. This reminds them of coaching sessions, treatments to pursue, and keeps them engaging regularly in their care. These messages are emails, text, and/or push notifications. Additionally, members receive personalized communication directly from their coach with notes or updates about their care.
column79: We require all employees to take a DEI training on a yearly basis. We also have a quarterly all company meeting to discuss DEI and take into account employee feedback, including on a quarterly survey.  In our care programs, we hire providers to match the populations we serve. Personalization is also a key element of our care programs. Employees have a voice in their care journey. Program and coaching preferences are honored for ethnicity, language, gender - culturally specific guidance; from nutrition plans to care kit contents and more.
column82: Preferably shared in CSV or XLSX format (Comma delimited) Eligible population File Naming: MMDDYYYY_Goodpath_Eligibility_EmployerName.csv  First Name Last Name Claimant number / Employee ID number Email Phone Number Mailing Address
column92: Clients will receive reports monthly, quarterly, and annually. The monthly report is available 1 week after the month ends, the quarterly report is available 2 weeks after the quarter ends, and the annual ROI report is shared either 1 month after the year ends or 6-9 months after if a claims analysis is taking place.  We share monthly engagement reports that show enrollment numbers by condition, compared to total employer population, and the % of actively engaged members per month. We also share quarterly health outcomes reports which show on average the % of employees that have shown significant improvement in quality of life (defined by a 50% improvement in health severity score). If there are over 100 participants per quarter, then we can share a more detailed breakdown of change in severity scores by condition. On a yearly basis, we share ROI metrics using change in self-reported medical intent or a pre/post claims analysis. Reporting can be shared weekly, though frequency of reporting is decided by the client.
column101: Chronic Condition Management for MSK, Mental Health, Cancer, Sleep, Digestive Health. All programs include an app, coaching, and customer care kits shipped to the home. We do have an add-on for therapy sessions for the Mental Health Program.
column104: Goodpath is a wellness program that sits outside of the insurance plan. Since Goodpath is paid for completely by the employer, and Goodapth is not billed through the insurance company or paid for by the employee, thus covered under an HSA, HDHP first dollar coverage does not apply.  In addition, Goodpath does not provide telehealth sessions, diagnoses, or any other services that constitute licensed care (except for behavioral health sessions, which are also completely paid for by the employer).

column40: With more than 35+ years of experience, our success continues to be driven by our commitment and leadership across the following areas:   Brand Awareness and Trust: With 7-10x more brand awareness than the next provider, Care is the most recognized brand in the industry. Your employees will likely already know and recognize the Care brand as trusted source of support for their care needs.  Product Breadth & Depth: Care offers the most comprehensive suite of family care benefits and the largest, most recognized, caregiver network. Our breadth of services combines forward-thinking digital solutions with personalized access to Care Specialists to support the diverse needs of employees across all life stages. Innovative User Experiences: Care invests heavily in innovating caregiving services where providing a best-in-class and customer-first experience will always be a priority. Both employers and employees have a unified product experience where all services are easily accessible.  Flexibility & Choice: We provide flexibility for both you and your workforce. We offer agnostic care options that empower employees to choose the care they feel most comfortable with. Plus, we offer flexible no-risk pricing models, such as bundled caregiving solutions and pay-as-you-go models.   Care for Business' other competitors offer point solutions that only compete with portions of our business. However, no competitors offer a full suite of Work-Life and premium buy-up services-all conveniently accessible via one portal and toll-free number.
column42: Care partners with more than 780 clients across every industry, from small businesses to some of the largest employers in the United States. Family Care benefits are appropriate for every business size, because working families need care, regardless of where they work. While there is no employer headcount minimum, Care for Business does have a minimum contract amount. This can be discussed on a case-by-case basis, as it is subject to change.
column43: Pricing is dependent on the services selected and may include a combination of utilization based pricing, PEPY, and flat rates.
column54: Backup Care and Care Specialists are accessible to assist employees 24/7/365. Employees can also contact customer service 24/7 via email. Telephonic and chat support from the Care.com Help Center are Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. EST for the Care Membership support. The Care.com Help Center also hosts FAQS and resources to guide users on the Care Membership platform.
column55: Care's company vision is that every single person will need and/or provide care at some point in their lives, most likely more than once. Every family should have access to quality, affordable care quickly and safely, and our goal is to make that possibility a reality. We aspire to have the best technology and the biggest array of solutions available so every family can easily access the care they need—no matter when, where, and how they need it, and regardless of social or economic status.  Care's mission is to help families find the care they need, wherever, however, and whenever they need it. We’re disruptors aiming to change the world, one family at a time. We’re focused obsessively on building better care solutions for families. Below, we have provided our Care values that support this mission:  Accountability: We are passionate about the work that we do and strive to make a positive impact on our customers. We aren’t intimidated by any challenge and we jump on opportunities to take action and drive excellent results. When we own our stuff, we are self-motivated to take the lead and see things through. We remain focused and persistent.  Trust & Integrity: We believe relationships are built on trust and integrity. It is central to a successful business. When we each show personal integrity, we will be trusted and given the reins to lead. Without trust, there is very little we can accomplish that is worthwhile. Experimentation: Change is an inevitable constant, but our approach is thoughtful and planned. Creating purposeful change that sticks requires us to influence and persuade others to see things differently and we must have the courage to take risks and challenge the status quo. We embrace change by having an open mind, an ability to adapt on the fly and demonstrating a willingness to do something in a new and different way. We are agile and resilient, even in the face of uncertainty.  Product Stickiness: We are broad thinkers- driven by curiosity and a passion to solve problems. We understand things aren’t always what they seem to be, and we keep an open mind to dive in, ask questions and peel back the layers to truly understand what’s going on. We are interdisciplinary thinkers and have a growth mindset. We value different perspectives and embrace our similarities and differences to resolve complex business challenges and foster meaningful relationships.  Leadership: We are all leaders. Whether you are a leader of self, or a leader of others, we are all empowered to reach our full potential. We believe in setting clear paths, providing direct coaching and inspiring all employees to do their best and we hold ourselves accountable for both our successes and failures.
column56: When working with Care for Business, new clients will be assigned a dedicated Account Manager who has years of experience in account management. Your Account Manager will be your primary point of contact who will oversee all aspects of the program, along with cross-functional teams who will be directly involved in overseeing your Care benefit programs. Within each of these teams, we have highly qualified staff who are extensively trained to deliver exceptional customer service. For example:   Our network development team who fully vets and manages our network of centers and in-home care agencies available through our Backup Care program. They also continuously monitor and grow our network to meet our client's evolving needs.  Our Operations team and customer service representatives, who are trained to provide the highest level of customer support. Our Marketing team who will work with you to strategically market the program to your employees.  In the event that your account manager is unavailable due to illness, vacation or any unforeseen circumstance, Sequoia will have direct access to another member of the Client Services team who is familiar with your account. Our Head of of Account Management will also assist with any client needs, in addition to providing executive level oversight of your account.  Mike Kosinski, Director of Consultant Partnerships Mike Kosinski joined Care in 2011, and has been the Director of Consultant Partnerships since July, 2023. He has a background in childcare, senior care, people management, sales, and relationship management. In his current role, Mike is responsible for fostering strategic alliances with leading benefits consulting firms, driving revenue growth, and expanding our market reach. Mike leans on his knowledge and experience to cultivate mutually beneficial programs to deliver increased value to our shared clients. He assists throughout the entire lifecycle of the deal and is a resource for consultant partners when onboarding new clients, as well as assisting existing partners. Mike is also responsible for ensuring seamless collaboration across all teams that support our shared clients. Mike lives outside Boston and is an avid sports and music fan.  Ajith Segaram, Head of Account Management Ajith Segaram currently serves as the Head of Account Management for Care for Business. Ajith has a background in Computer Science with a specialization in Computer Programming and Analysis, and has over 20 years of experience in sales, account management, and operations. He has worked for several companies throughout his career including Monster.com, Joveo, and Care.  Ajith is based in Toronto, Ontario and has been with Care for two and a half years, previously overseeing Care’s Client Success and Sales Operations teams.  His vast experience across the different teams positions him to lead Care’s Account Management division to support our clients, exceed expectations, and drive client satisfaction.  As Ajith’s team supports all of Care’s existing customers, his time is spread across all our clients.   Danielle Kilgour, Director of Client Success Danielle Kilgour was appointed Director of Client Success in 2020 and is responsible for onboarding new customer programs and delivering program support for existing clients. Danielle joined Care.com in 2013 as Client Account Manager. Responsible for key Fortune 500 clients, Danielle has led account planning strategies to increase engagement and overall client success and retention. In 2016, Danielle was promoted to Client Success, helping to develop and scale Care for Business’ client onboarding process & team. Danielle and her team are the front door of Care for Business, creating a customized onboarding experience for each partner. The Client Success team had a 100% CSAT score in 2022 and is widely regarded in guiding clients as they embark on their new program with Care.com. Danielle received her Bachelors of Science in Sociology from the University of New Hampshire.   Desiree Leung, Vice President of Operations Desiree Leung is the Vice President of Operations leading Care’s Backup Care servicing, Care Specialist, and HomePay operations. She is responsible for ensuring excellent client service in both the front end and back-end operations. Desiree joined Care.com in 2007. Prior to leading Care’s operations teams, Desiree was responsible for accounting and financial planning as a Sr. Director of Finance. Her financial acumen and passion for problem solving help her to run smooth operations across three unique business lines with products ranging from finding backup care for busy employees to helping families with taxes/payroll for household employment to finding any resources for life’s daily distractions or major decisions. Customer service is a top priority with her teams winning several awards for excellent client service. Desiree received her bachelor’s degree in business economics from the University of Texas and her MBA from Texas State University.   Jill McNamara, Senior Director, Care for Business Jill McNamara is the Senior Director of Care for Business for Care.com, the world’s largest online destination for finding and managing high-quality family care. Since joining Care in 2011, Jill focused on growing the company’s senior care services nationally and has since expanded her role to focus on development for the entire Enterprise solutions through strategy, partnerships and growth operations. Prior to Care.com, Jill worked with adults with mental and physical disabilities, supported children in foster care, assisted homeless veterans and provided in-home counseling in and around the Boston area to families facing an array of complex challenges. Jill’s expertise in senior care and experience with numerous populations has allowed her to expand Care’s Enterprise programs to meet the various needs of families. Jill has her Masters degree in Social Work, is a Licensed Independent Clinical Social Worker and a Certified Advanced Social Work Case Manager. She received her Bachelor of Arts degree in Social Work from Gordon College and obtained her Master of Social Work from Simmons College School of Social Work.
column65: In 2022, we maintained  an NPS score of 64, well above the overall median NPS score which is 44.
column67: Our Client Success Team has helped leading companies implement family care benefits into their organizations for 35+ years. The following process has been perfected after thousands of implementations, while allowing flexibility to fulfill any unique requirements for Sequoia.   Kickoff: During this time, all key players will be identified. Your Client Success Manager will review a project plan with a timeline and key milestones to achieve your desired launch date. During this phase, we may also work with your HRIS or Benefits Admin teams to develop & integrate for eligibility.    Phase 1: We’ll work together to identify communication materials needed to educate employees about this benefit, develop the Eligibility File, and discuss programmatic details including ongoing reporting needs.    Phase 2: Communication materials will be provided to you and continue working with our team on the development of your eligibility file. Your dedicated company website will also be created at this time.    Phase 3: Before launch, we will finalize the eligibility file development with SFTP connectivity testing and put the eligibility product file into place. We’ll host a webinar for internal HR and key stakeholders to learn about the benefit prior to launch. Pre-identified “early users” will enroll in your dedicated website for final testing.    Launch: On launch day, we will make sure you’re armed with FAQs and communication materials to raise awareness about the benefits and to help employees enroll.  A member of our experienced Client Success team will be your main point of contact during implementation until launch and will:   Lead all meetings, agendas, follow-up items Manage implementation timelines and milestones Lead eligibility file creation and implementation Create your custom website Approve and finalize launch based on group consensus and meeting of all benchmarks   The Client Success Manager also manages all deliverables needed from other internal partners including:   Marketing for pre- and post-launch communication strategies and materials Network and Servicing for provider and coverage related questions  You will also be assigned a dedicated Account Manager who will be involved during implementation to ensure they are already familiar with your program. After launch, your Account Manager will serve as your primary point of contact and help you to set benchmarks for success that align with your corporate goals.
column74: Care is proud to have an experienced in-house communications and creative team that creates campaigns for our clients to drive awareness, enrollment, engagement, and utilization of Care’s services. We can provide Sequoia with flyers, posters, digital screens, intranet content, emails, and more to promote services through your internal communication channels. For optimal convenience, we can communicate directly with eligible members via email and promotions.  In addition to pre-launch and launch materials, your Account Manager and our communications team will continually work with you to communicate the program and ensure benefit awareness, while boosting utilization all year round. Seasonally-relevant themes will be incorporated to ensure that materials appear timely and resonate with your employee population. Continuous messaging throughout the year will also keep Care's services top-of-mind.  Care for Business personalizes our outreach efforts to ensure each enrolled member receives timely and relevant communications. To achieve this, we target and tailor the content of our messaging to deliver the most relevant themes for the products the member is eligible to receive from their employer. We also use this same approach for trigger communications. Specifically, in our welcome onboarding series, we guide newly enrolled members through up to four emails that are customized based on the benefit mix their employer provides to them. This series has clear logic that will show Backup Care-focused messaging, or Care Membership messaging only if Backup Care is not offered. We also provide timely reminder trigger messages that are customized to show the member's name and dynamic number of Backup Care days remaining. Most of these messages are personalized with the member name, their employer name, and at least one featured benefit that is available to them.
column79: Care's roadmap for DEI is ever changing. We believe it is our responsibility as an industry leader to help drive conversation with families, clients and the general public. To that end, we regularly host webinars and podcasts with notable experts and authors on a wide range of topics including talking about racism with children, women in the workforce, and the care ecosystem, among many other subjects. Just as we hold ourselves accountable, we expect the same from those with whom we do business. We have a formal Supplier Diversity Program that includes supporting external supplier diversity organizations such as the Women’s Business Enterprise National Council, the Minority Business Development Agency, and the Small Business Administration. For more information, please visit https://www.care.com/about/dei/. Care is also committed to working with Salesforce on DEI efforts and we will make all reasonable efforts to provide and support Salesforce initiatives.
column81: The alternative options to an eligibility file are:   Email Domain Verification where the employer provides a list of eligible email domains and as employees enroll, they sign up using their work email. They receive a verification email which they must click through to complete their enrollment. Administrator Approval where the Admin (HR contact) on the group is responsible for approving or declining approval requests as employees enroll.
column91: While the vast majority of Care clients elect direct registration rather than Single-Sign On, Care is able to support SSO. Our typical protocol is SAML.  Clients can choose between three login options for their employees:   (1) SSO + Direct Registration: With this option, employees can use either SSO or Direct Registration, or both. This is the option we recommend as it provides the most flexibility for the employee, makes enrolling and logging in quickly & easy, and most importantly, provides optimal security.   (2) SSO Only: With this option, employees must authenticate via SSO to enroll and log into the Care platform.   (3) Direct Registration only: With this option, clients can opt-out of SSO. This means their employees will only be able to log in using the username and password they create during enrollment.
column92: A broad range of reports and real-time program performance data are accessible 24x7 via the Care Enterprise HR dashboard, available to those with administrator privileges. column104: Care has determined that it does not currently offer or provide the types of employee benefits plan (i.e., health, disability, and other welfare benefits, pension plans, and programs) that fall within the spectrum of ERISA governance. Recognizing that most employee benefits programs are, in fact, subject to ERISA, Care services do not involve, through the purchase of insurance or otherwise, provision of medical, surgical, hospital care, or benefits related to sickness, accident or disability. Given the importance of compliance in this area, Care would be happy to partner with clients on a case-by-case basis to further this analysis to ensure all parties are comfortable and confident in the approach.
column107: Care services are not related to the provision of group health plan coverage for employees. Given that COBRA requirements do not extend to non-health benefits, Care services are not subject to COBRA.
column117: Care provides standard reporting to its clients that may assist in analyzing its own obligations. We advise our clients to consult with their own legal counsel and tax advisers concerning IRC compliance.

column127: Imputed income is non-cash compensation, meaning the value of a service or benefit provided by employers to employees. Employer-provided backup care (child and adult care) is a benefit that may be considered taxable compensation to an employee.  A small percentage of Care clients choose to impute income. For those organizations that do impute income, we provide an earned benefits report that can include care job type, employee name and email, date of care service, paid amount, fair market value and earned benefit value.  We advise our clients to consult with their own legal counsel and tax advisers concerning IRC compliance.

column40: Aiberry is an AI-powered mental health assessment platform designed with privacy as a core principle. We use the latest techniques like differential privacy to ensure users' data remains confidential. Our conversational interface delivers clinically-validated insights in an engaging way, mimicking a caring friend rather than a cold questionnaire. We iterate constantly based on user feedback to provide the most helpful and supportive experience possible. Ultimately Aiberry exists to empower people with self-knowledge and connect them with the right mental health resources when needed. We believe supportive technology, steeped in compassion, can transform mental healthcare.

column81: An eligibility or demographic file is not mandatory for implementation. Aiberry can work with either an eligibility file OR based on SSO integration. In the case of SSO based integration obviously there is no need for any file exchange for as part of the integration.
column91: Yes, Aiberry supports SSO based integration. Aiberry uses SAML 2.0.   The Aiberry system will act as the “resource server” and the external 3rd party system will be referred to as the “Identity Provider” (“IdP”). The manner in which the SAML token is signed & constructed by the Identity Provider must be aligned with the Aiberry resource server for proper verification.   The entire SSO login flow is as follows:   A user will click on the SAML login button (“Aiberry Logo”) from their customer portal, which will initiate the SAML login process.   The client should then POST to the Aiberry SAML login url    (E.g., https://system.aiberry.io/login/saml/{uniqueid})   The client will then be redirected with an authorization request to the 3rd party Identity Provider   Upon authentication with the IdP, the user should POST a SAML token to the Aiberry SAML login URL.   Upon verification of the SAML token, Aiberry will parse the user profile payload   If the given Organization does not exist,    Aiberry will fail the login request and return an error description   If the given user does not exist,    Aiberry will automatically create them in the respective organization.   Otherwise, if the user exists,    Aiberry will find and load the profile of the user   At this point, the user will be logged in to Aiberry and can perform a screening   At the end of the screening, the user will press a ‘Back’ button (label is configurable) and will be directed back to a configurable URL
column92: Yes, Aiberry can provide a screening TRX report via a file (sFTP) or in real-time via a Web hook. This allows for basic tracking over completed screening. The screening TRX report does not reveal any information about the screening results, but the mere fact that a screening was completed. This can be used for record update or as a basis for a reward system (if one exists).     In addition to the screening TRX report, Aiberry has a robust analytics capabilities that can show various stats around screening such as: Utilization, AVG screening length, score trends, Screening to Members ratio, etc...

column40: We know there are lots of companies out there trying to get into the ever-important mental health market, hence leadership matters. Using our 10+ years of successful experience, we continue to build what people need most and get them quickly/easily started with Calm Business  We have 3x more sign ups compared to other digital health apps (source)  Our reputation for relaxation is real: nearly 2x more users rate Calm as a place of relief in comparison to other industry competitors  We continue to invest in staying fresh and relevant: we have 3.5x more content than the next major industry competitor   We have more than 3,000 pieces of content including meditations of different lengths, helping beginners build the foundational skills they need while supporting those who have been meditating for longer to advance their practice. We have sleep stories to help employees fall asleep, curated music to help employees focus, and a Calm body section to help employees take stretch breaks, etc.  Over 350 different narrators of all different ethnicities, genders, religion, sexual orientation across the globe, with 44% of them being BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color).Calm is available in 7 native languages across 190+ countries. 75% of our content is international content and supported in one or more languages. Calm's content is truly localized. We work with local narrators and language consultants who are familiar with mindfulness and meditation and how they are discussed from country to country to provide “regionalized” mindfulness and sleep story content. Calm has 7 localized languages: English, German, Spanish, French, Korean, Portuguese, Japanese. We have real, recognized people narrating our stories to help normalize mental health. Some examples include: Harry Styles, Matthew Mcconaughey, Bridgerton’s Rege Jean-Page, Idris Elba, Laura Dern, Kate Winslet, Lucy Liu, Professor Megan Reitz, Jay Shetty, & Jeff Warren. An important nuance about Calm narrators is the idea that hearing from someone relatable further lowers that stigma. One prime example: we worked with Lama Rod Owens to create a Coming Out meditation series to support the LGBTQ+ community - where he shares from a place of expertise AND cross sections of his own life being a queer, black buddhist teacher.  We offer a variety of tools and content formats to meet people wherever they are in their mental health needs (we are so much more than meditations!). At its core, Calm’s content and variety of formats of delivery are what make it easy for people to get started and entice them to continue coming back. Each employee can add up to 5 dependents to access Calm (ages 16 and older). Calm Kids has kid specific content and sleep stories and narrators they will love. Additionally, we have content focused on other non-work aspects of life: pregnancy, coming out, etc.

column55: We’re your strategic business partner the entire way (from pre-launch into the future): We’re focused on making sure you can drive a culture of mental wellness at your organization and help employees feel happier and healthier, leading to more productive and engaged people. We’re with you every step of the way to understand your goals, pain points, and unique organizational need. [NOTE: this was an important differentiating factor for buyers, they really wanted a partner who would spend the time to understand their business and make their lives simpler] We help your organization launch quickly, from supporting a successful technical setup (in as short as one day) to enabling your announcement of the Calm benefit to your entire organization Within Partner Portal, we provide recommended actions (think of this as a checklist) that are dynamic depending where you are in the Calm partnership to help you maximize the most of your Calm benefit  Our 12-month engagement roadmap gives you confidence that there is a foundational plan to speak to meaningful mental health issues  Our Customer Success Managers are best in the industry (NPS of 66+) and committed to meeting with you and your internal stakeholders whenever you need; they are ready to help you understand your organization’s performance with Calm, provide recommendations to meet your near- and long-term engagement goals, and ensure that continued strategic conversations and actions occur on at least a quarterly basis.  Our award-winning customer experience team is ready to support your employees with any questions they may have  We’re your communications and marketing partner: We also know how important it is to engage your employee population regularly. column73: TERM AND TERMINATION 7.1. Agreement Term. Unless terminated earlier as provided in the Agreement, this Agreement commences on the Effective Date and continues as long as one or more Orders remain in effect.  7.2. Order Term. Unless provided otherwise in an Order, each Order will remain in effect for the initial term specified in such Order (or, if no such initial term is specified, for one year) and will automatically renew for consecutive one year terms unless a Party provides written notice of non-renewal at least thirty (30) days prior to any renewal of each such Order.  7.3. Termination for Cause.  A Party may terminate this Agreement (including any Orders) if the other Party materially breaches this Agreement and such breach is not cured within thirty (30) days after the non-breaching Party has provided the breaching Party written notice thereof.  7.4.  Effects of Termination. In the event of any termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Services and all of Customer’s rights under this Agreement (including all Orders) will immediately terminate.  Calm will destroy all Customer Data, other than Aggregated Data, in the manner and on the schedule as required by Applicable Law, and in accordance with Calm’s then-current data deletion practices. Termination or expiration will not relieve either Party of obligations incurred prior to the effective date of the termination. The following Sections survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement: 4 (with respects to amounts accrued prior to expiration or termination); 5, 6.1, 7.4, 8, 9.3, 9.4, 10, 11, 12, and any other section, which by its nature, is meant to survive termination of the Agreement.

column40: Our global capabilities allow us to provide immediate and helpful services around the world while maintaining consistent quality service delivery and program branding. Specifically, we offer the following advantages: •	Global Footprint—ComPsych service center locations include the U.S., Canada, China, Philippines, Costa Rica, and UK, in addition to numerous account management offices and global affiliate partnerships. •	Regional Account Management—ComPsych has structured our account management teams to provide timely and localized regional account support for our global customers’ locations, regardless of where they are located. Our regional account management teams are located in Canada, China, Costa Rica, India, Switzerland, Philippines, UK and the U.S. This team structure allows ComPsych to be highly responsive to and readily available for customer contacts in each region. Our regional account management teams are responsible for program deployment in their respective regions, as well as facilitating employee and manager program orientations.  •	Global Affiliate Partnerships—ComPsych also leverages strategic global affiliate partners to support local service delivery across all countries. Our global partners meet all of our rigorous quality and service standards in the countries they serve and mirror our operational processes to provide a uniform user experience for individuals across the globe.  •	Comprehensive Worldwide Partner Network—ComPsych’s proprietary network of more than 100,000 providers located across the world ensures local access to employees and their family members seeking in-person or virtual counseling. Our global network is comprised of licensed professionals that speak the local language and understand the cultural considerations required to assist individuals in varying cultures. •	Robust Online Information and Resources—employees and their family members can also access articles, assessments and on-demand training through our GuidanceResources Online (GRO) portal. Program participants can access EAP, work-life and wellness information and resources through our GuidanceResources Online websites, available in more than 80 countries and 40 languages. GuidanceResources Online also provides chat capabilities and can be accessed via our mobile app, GuidanceNow. •	Flexible, Built-to-Suit Programs—Rather than offer a standard plan design, ComPsych has the ability to customize different package options to reflect each customer’s business needs, employee population and any pre-existing or internal programs. For example, we can provide customized communication materials that target specific employee demographics. We can also customize our reporting structure based on business units, locations and other factors. During program implementation, we will work closely with the client to build a program that meets its requirements.

column67: During implementation, ComPsych will collaborate with the client on how to best execute program orientation, program communications, reporting requirements and information management. These discussions will help us better understand the client’s program needs and will contribute to a program that is proactive, efficient and responsive.  The global account manager will schedule implementation meetings to cover issues such as: •	Identifying the client’s cultural needs and priorities •	Reviewing program design and objectives •	Establishing performance measures and program objectives •	Planning vendor transition (where appropriate) and program rollout •	Discussing integration with internal teams and other benefit vendors  As we have done for thousands of other organizations, we will make the process of implementing the GuidanceResources program smooth and easy for HR staff and line managers. Our account management team shoulders the routine, time-consuming aspects of the program launch and relies on HR managers primarily for direction and approvals on communication pieces and other materials. column74: ComPsych’s goal is for complete employee awareness of the GuidanceResources program. We work toward these goals by integrating print and electronic communications, which can be fully customized for customers. During program implementation, the ComPsych global account manager will work with the client to develop a customized employee and leadership communication strategy, factoring in the client’s culture and preferences. Our tailored programs are designed to ensure a successful program launch, maintain high utilization, and provide relevant information to employees when they need it most. the client’s program can include the following communication efforts: •	Program Launch Campaigns—Launch communications are designed to introduce employees and managers to the GuidanceResources program and its many benefits. They also present important information regarding eligibility and the confidential nature of the program. Communication vehicles may include posters, brochures, wallet cards and digital outreach campaigns, and will highlight all program features from clinical counseling, to legal, financial and work-life services. It is important that participants know that GuidanceResources is more than just counselling, and that it has something for everyone.  •	Ongoing Engagement Tools—ComPsych will continually support the client’s GuidanceResources program with a steady stream of topical communications to keep the program top of mind for employees. During implementation, we will develop an annual communications calendar around specific needs, promoting engagement and driving utilization by addressing employees’ most pressing issues. For example, January’s campaign topic might be resiliency, where we would provide a series of posters, Helpsheets and employee trainings tailored to individuals dealing with stress and burnout issues, while February might focus on financial wellness or mental health awareness. Our campaigns are supported by the more than 90 informational learning sessions made available to customers. •	Themed Communication Campaigns—ComPsych’s highly responsive programs include the development of standalone campaigns tailored to the specific needs of each customer. For example, for customers going through change and/or reorganization, we have developed customer-specific resiliency and mindfulness training programs and Helpsheets. For customers seeking to improve organizational efficiency, we have delivered campaigns around thoughtful time management. ComPsych can also develop campaigns based on the top presenting issues among the client’s employee populations, top requested work-life resources or industry trends around employment, behavioral health and work-life balance.   All of our communication strategies, campaigns and resources can be easily integrated into existing internal communication schedules and calendars, or can be rolled out as standalone plans. To address the needs of our multinational customers, we provide materials in the languages needed for their employee populations. We are continuously expanding our translation capabilities to meet the needs of our customers.
column79: Our approach to DEIA includes: •	A proud Equal Opportunity Employer •	A culturally diverse workforce in more than ten countries over four continents  •	Multi-pronged recruiting approach to promote corporate diversity •	A uniquely talented workforce featuring a staff that is 46% BIPOC and 75% female •	Internal training on diversity, sensitivity, and unconscious bias •	Nationwide DBE purchasing and support efforts •	Ecovadis certified for Corporate Social Responsibility

column91: ComPsych can provide single sign-on functionality as an optional customized feature. We have developed single sign-ons for both employer’s intranet sites, as well as a client’s vendor partners’ sites. GuidanceResources Online supports this functionality via a standard, interoperable machine-to-machine interaction known as SAML 2.0. In these instances, the employer’s intranet or vendor partner’s hosted website plays the role of Identity Provider (IdP), while ComPsych’s GuidanceResources Online plays the role of Service Provider (SP).  Additional fees may be required to add single sign-on capabilities.
column92: It is important for global EAPs to report activity to each organization’s local country management as well as to regional and global leaders. ComPsych accomplishes this goal by creating easily customizable reports on a per-country basis for each employer and then aggregating reports into regional and global totals. Utilization reports contain case activity, demographic data, employee satisfaction and utilization trends. All reports ensure the confidentiality of individuals, even in areas where employee populations are small.   We also provide a complete narrative analysis covering the previous period’s EAP utilization. Based on utilization trends, the narrative analysis recommends future engagement strategies and programmatic changes.   In addition to our standard reporting, which provides EAP and work-life statistics along with graphic and narrative highlights, ComPsych can provide many different types of reports based on various needs and interests.

column103: According to the Department of Labor, an EAP that provides medical care is governed under ERISA.  If an EAP is staffed with trained counselors (either internally or through an outside service provider) who provide some form of counseling, such an EAP generally would be governed by ERISA.  Because ComPsych EAP services are handled by trained counselors who do provide some form of counseling, ComPsych considers its EAP services to be covered by ERISA.
