column101: Over the last 7 years, ThrivePass has developed a modern and holistic benefits platform that reduces costs and consolidates core TPA services with our proprietary Lifestyle Benefit, Wellbeing and Rewards, as well as our Tuition Reimbursement technology that supports the entire employee benefits journey.  Thrive Account (Lifestyle Benefits) – a truly unique, automated global solution giving employees choice with a more inclusive and holistic wellbeing approach including physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, and many other customized categories, along with access to discounted products and services through the on-line Marketplace, with Work Anniversary Service Recognition, Peer Rewards, & Company Swag options.  At its core, the Thrive Account is a digital employee spending account that can be utilized for reimbursements, spot gifting, birthday and anniversary programs, as well as rewards and recognition.  Employers have the flexibility to customize programs to fit their objectives while also empowering their employees to choose the wellness or lifestyle benefits that are most meaningful to them.  In addition to our wellness categories allocated for fitness reimbursement and physical wellbeing, mental health, financial guidance, and other lifestyle benefits, ThrivePass also has categories for work from home supplies, office equipment, headphones, internet reimbursement, grocery delivery and meal service subscriptions.

column127: At ThrivePass we leave the taxation decision/method up to each employer group and their respective organization’s tax policies.  Although, I should point out that if a group decides to make the lifestyle benefit taxable, it is only taxable upon “utilization” – not at the time of the “contribution” as it’s possible the employee may not use the funds (and the funds are not portable).   ThrivePass will provide a utilization file/report back to the employer on monthly (or weekly) basis with all of the employees who have utilized funds in the prior month (or week) along with the dollar amount utilized, and the category.  Many of our clients then include those amounts in a subsequent payroll run as Imputed Income so that all the appropriate tax withholding occurs and it is included on the employee’s W2 at the end of the year.

column40: Health Advocate believes that the complexity of the healthcare system should not be a barrier to living well. Our mission is to develop personalized, innovative programs and tools, backed by cutting-edge technology and data analytics, that simplify the healthcare experience, and motivate and enable people to become engaged in their own health and well-being – resulting in improved health outcomes, lower medical costs, reduced stress, and time savings for both our clients and their employees and family members.  Health Advocate was incorporated in 2001 as a Delaware corporation. We currently have more than 750 employees, almost 500 of whom support our health and benefits navigation, well-being, chronic care, emotional health and clinical cases.  We have a nationwide presence, working with more than 12,500 organizations of all sizes and industries, and supporting more than 12 million members across the United States. Our clients include 20% of Fortune 500 companies, schools, colleges and universities, health systems, for profit and not-for-profit organizations, governmental agencies, insurers and health plans, and both insured and self-insured employers.

column54: Health Advocate is available 24x7x365. Regular business hours are 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. weekdays. After-hours, calls are taken by our contracted on-call clinical nursing and behavioral health service. This assures that urgent clinical and behavioral health issues can be addressed immediately. Administrative matters are forwarded to our regular staff for follow up on the next business day.
column55: We measure customer satisfaction on a client-by-client basis through the personalized, ongoing account relationship our team creates with each client. Our more than 97 percent client retention rate attests to our client's satisfaction with our services.   Our account managers meet with clients quarterly and annually. During the quarterly calls, utilization from that quarter specifically is reviewed. The annual review looks back at the full year of utilization. The account managers will make suggestions on ways to further promote the program as well as provide information on other Health Advocate solutions that would benefit the client and their employees.   Our client interactions allow us to develop new programs and modify existing approaches to better serve employees and their family members.
column56: Our Personal Health Advocates are selected based on the experience, and also on their ability to communicate with members. The team includes clinical professionals, claims, appeals and benefits specialists, and triage/intake staff. Our clinical team of nurses, health coaches, behavioral health professionals, social workers and case managers is supported by a team of experienced medical directors. The backgrounds of our customer service team include:   Personal Health Advocates:  Bachelor’s Degree + 5+ years' experience, working in health benefits, physician practices, hospital settings or at health plans.   Benefits Specialists:  Bachelor’s Degree + 3+ years' experience in medical plan design, insurance, health administration.   Triage/Intake:  Bachelor’s Degree + 1-2 years' experience. New hires may have recent experience in non-healthcare industries.   Nurses:  RN + 5+ years' clinical experience, working in physician practices, in hospital settings, or at health plans, including in case management roles.   Physician Medical Directors:  MD/DO degree + 10+ years' of clinical practice experience prior to coming to Health Advocate.   The clinical team also includes Masters level social workers and, behavioral health professionals, health and wellness coaches, nutritionists, exercise physiologists, consulting pharmacists and specialists in substance abuse management, all of whom have had appropriate training and practical field experience before joining us.

column79: At Health Advocate, we are committed to embracing diversity and inclusion throughout our organization. Our corporate values of trust, collaboration, innovation, and execution are possible through the diversity of our employees, partners, and customers.  With the unique array of skills our employees possess, we can lean on each other’s expertise, innovate to meet evolving global challenges, and deliver world-class solutions to our customers.      For our Customers and Members:  Health and Well-being Help for Everyone - We are committed to our belief that our services are a universal benefit, available equally to all entitled parties irrespective of their gender/race/physical or mental ability/sexuality/age/religion or belief. There are many ways we can help. For example, we identify community resources, coordinate services like Meals on Wheels locate and coordinate funded transportation, help members apply for subsidies under the Affordable Care Act, Supplemental Social Security, and Medicare and Medicaid, find providers and care for the LGBTQAI+ community, and so much more.

column92: Our engagement solutions offer the following reporting:  • Clients standardly receive our comprehensive Group Information Utilization Report on a quarterly basis. The reporting package provides a detailed overview of all aspects of a client’s utilization of our services across all of our programs. We measure performance and report results on both a “cases” and an “interaction” basis and also report on the time our staff has expended serving members to reflect intensity of our efforts.  Clinical utilization is detailed by the category of each case’s clinical need (e.g., orthopedics, pregnancy, cancer, preventive care, etc.) and administrative assistance is broken down by the nature of the inquiry (coverage, benefits, etc.). Comparative information looking at client data compared to data from other Health Advocate clients of similar size offers useful insights. Member comments are also included in the client’s utilization report.    • Enhanced reporting including an Annual Medical Claims Analysis that outlines population health measures, management of chronic conditions, adherence with evidence-based care, recommendations for chronic illness and preventive care services, medication adherence, generic/brand drug use, emergency room utilization and the impact of tobacco use and obesity in the population. The report includes year-over-year comparisons.  • Interactive Client Reporting Dashboard that enables clients to drill-down into detailed utilization and cost data in order to track medical costs.
column101: Health Advocate is the company that pioneered the Advocacy industry in 2001.   Our wellness experience dates back to 1997, through the acquisition of another seasoned wellness firm. Between 2010 and 2012 we acquired two EAPs, whose operations date back to 1979.  Our wellbeing and engagement platform has expanded over the years; it now provides a full suite of integrated services that offer employees a “360 degree” approach to wellbeing, engagement and medical decision support.   Our diverse product portfolio extends across the spectrum of population health solutions, to include Health Advocacy, Physical and Emotional Wellbeing, Onsite Health Screenings, Benefits Navigation, Medical Decision Support and Second Opinions, Data Analytics and more.  Our identity as a compassionate yet independent company -- independent of payers, providers, and employers -- builds credibility with our members, allowing us to become a trusted resource, and creates an overall easier experience for them to seek the care and help they need.
column104: Health Advocate conducts an annual review of the services it offers and ERISA.  Health Advocate Solutions’ analysis is that the services offered are an ERISA-excepted benefit and do not trigger any ERISA compliance policies.
column107: Health Advocate Solutions services are not health plan benefits and are generally only available to active employees and are billed to the employer on a “per-employee-per-month. The employee does not “elect” coverage and there are no employee premiums or cost sharing.

column40: Compared to digital-first providers (Ethos, Bestow etc):   1. Ladder has prioritized partnerships as our primary go-to-market channel, aiming to make our product available through existing, relevant, and trusted channels such as Sequoia. As a result, Sequoia clients and employees enjoy access to a rich ecosystem of established partner infrastructure - including industry-leading API integrations of various types, tailored user experiences, custom collateral, detailed utilization, conversion, and client-level demographic reporting, etc.  2. Ladder is capable of issuing policies for customers up to Table rating 8, and with a guarantee of no medical exam for coverage up to $3m.  3. We offer coverage in all 50 states and DC (including NY which most don't), and have an industry-leading coverage max of $8M. 4. Ladder is the first full-stack digital life insurance provider. Using a proprietary underwriting engine and administration system, Ladder makes it possible to instantly issue coverage that can be easily assessed and adjusted over time. Ladder works with the world’s largest life reinsurers directly as a carrier as well as via partner carriers to make the LadderLifeTM term product available.  Compared to a traditional group life plan, Ladder's voluntary term product is: -Much better price over the life -Higher max coverage available ($8M vs. 1-5x salary) -Portable if an employee leaves the company -Easier and faster application experience than a paper Statement of Health (instant v. 30-90 days)

column40: Our support system for expecting parents includes career coaching for employees and recurring training for their managers to support critical pre-leave planning & re-onboarding activities. They receive a personalized toolkit specific to their role, function, industry & management responsibilities. The toolkit reinforces key concepts, includes a library of resources to save time in the planning process & sends reminders that integrate with employees’ workflows to keep them on track towards key milestones.   We're focused on employees' and managers' #1 concern when someone takes parental leave: work and career disruption. We do not do LOA filing, healthcare or mental health - so we can easily be implemented alongside those other vendors.   We're often compared to general career coaching providers and other new parent support vendors, but we're the only company specifically focused on career and business success across the parental leave journey.   Our largest "competitor" is the status quo (companies providing no support across parental leave OR deciding to have HR/L&D handle it in-house). The majority of companies don’t have this support so it’s a big gap and not something being addressed.
column43: We typically price on a fixed fee basis that is quoted out based on total volume of parental leaves per year. This fixed fee includes manager trainings, coaching, and unlimited usage of toolkits.   Most clients start with a pilot of $20K - $80K and we scope the pilot to their available budget. This is a great way for HR leaders to test this out without making any ongoing commitments, and then we can help them build the ROI case using their own employees' feedback.
column54: 8am - 6pm M-F
column55: Our mission is to improve the parental leave experience for all stakeholders - the expecting employee, their manager, their peers and the business overall. This is a big mandate, and it's one we take seriously.   Our programming receives rave reviews, and we have 100% retention and conversion from pilot to full benefit. Therefore, we fortunately do not do much (if any) problem-solving for our clients, as we rarely have quality of service issues.   Instead, we view customer service primarily as focusing on (1) taking as much work off of our HR partners' plates as it relates to parental leave and (2) serving as a feedback loop between their employees and the HR team so that the company can continue to improve the culture, policies and support structures for working parents.
column56: Our team of career coaches go through an extensive vetting, interviewing and certification process. They have all been career coaches for 3+ years before working with us, most are ICF certified, and all come with strong references. Our coaches have all also worked in the industries we serve, or have coaching expertise in those industries.
column67: Parentaly is a standalone solution and does not require integration with other vendors or software, so can be operationalized in as few as three weeks.  Clients do not share any employee data with us, which makes the data privacy review very easy and fast.  To launch, we collect key information about their company’s parental leave policies and existing guidance, which should take, at maximum, two hours of the HR team’s time. From there, Parentaly handles the majority of the logistics and ongoing support, including providing an internal marketing kit to help promote the new benefit and provide step-by-step guidance to employees on how to participate.   This timeline includes legal and data privacy reviews.
column74: Parentaly provides an internal marketing kit to help promote the new benefit and provide step-by-step guidance to employees on how to participate.   Typically this involves an announcement email or newsletter, putting our information on an intranet site, and a few other standard enrollment marketing channels.
column79: All of our content was specifically built to be gender-agnostic, with inclusivity of language and imagery throughout the entire experience.   No matter the path to parenthood, race, sexual identity, gender identity, socioeconomic status - everyone will receive the support they need during this vulnerable and exciting moment in their lives.
column81: (1) Agreement to circulate enrollment marketing materials (that we create for the client) (2) Ideally, information about their parental leave policy - but we can launch without this if needed
column92: We provide a pilot review (if they pilot our service) and ongoing quarterly business reviews.
column104: Career coaching programs are designed to provide professional development, guidance, and training to employees. These programs are usually considered part of an employer's training and development initiatives rather than a benefit plan providing retirement or health benefits. Therefore, they do not typically fall under the purview of ERISA.
column107: Since career coaching is not a health benefit, it is not subject to the regulations and requirements of COBRA.
column118: From a tax perspective, whether career coaching is taxable as a fringe benefit depends on the tax laws and regulations in the specific jurisdiction. In many cases, professional development and training provided for the benefit of the employer are not considered taxable income for the employee. But, we would ask all clients to please consult with a lawyer on this.
column119: The main compliance conversation is typically around confidentiality. While career coaching is not legally considered confidential (like that of a lawyer-client relationship), it's critical to the success of our service that we establish and maintain confidentiality.   To do this - we include explicit language around confidentiality in our contracts with our clients (HR buyers), as well as inform and ask all participants (expecting employees) to acknowledge that they understand our confidentiality expectations and commitments.
column124: We handle this all quite quickly during the contracting and data privacy review stage. This has never been an issue for us.
column127: There is no taxation.

column40: Founded in 2015, Espresa offers personalized employee benefits and experiences designed for life. Espresa's modularly designed platform unifies Lifestyle Spending Accounts (LSA), total well-being, recognition, and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). We currently support over 100 clients with employees in over 80 countries and work with some of the world’s most innovative Fortune 100-500 companies.   Espresa’s fully elastic solutions are connective with LSAs sitting at the heart and center. With our purpose-built SaaS engine, HR and people teams create unified and scalable global experiences while flexibly solving a range of business challenges, including:  -Improving benefits to attract and retain top talent -Enhancing employee experience and engagement -Streamlining and reducing HR administration -Supporting diversity, equity, antiracism, and inclusion -Increasing the global impact of your non-traditional benefits offering   Some of Espresa's key differentiators include:  -Purpose-built: Espresa’s solution was designed to deliver an exceptional experience for employers and employees while achieving 80%-90%+ adoption rates.  -Flexible: Espresa provides globally unmatched flexibility, so employers can offer creative and inclusive programs that employees truly value. -Global and inclusive: Espresa offers programs in 132 pre-configured languages in any currency worldwide.  -Earned incentive/allowance: Espresa’s unique earned allowance capabilities enable companies to connect culture programs, drive employee experience, and ignite engagement in new and meaningful ways. For example, employees may earn LSA funds for completing challenges or rewarding key behaviors through recognitions.  - Friction-free experience: Espresa’s mobile-first platform is designed to be easily accessible and friendly for employees 24/7.
column42: Espresa does not have a minimum client size requirement but rather a minimum revenue threshold of $10,000 per year (Espresa Preconfigured LSA offering) or $15,000 for any of our other Espresa solution modules. This minimum revenue threshold typically comes into play for clients with fewer than 350 employees.
column43: Based on an LSA's high expected participation (80%+), we typically charge a PEPM fee based on eligible participants. However, we support alternative pricing structures for more narrowly focused plans with lower expected participation (e.g., flat fee, per user, etc.)
column54: Espresa offers member support globally, 24 hours/day, Monday through Friday.
column55: Our company approaches customer service with a focus on responsiveness, reliability, and personalization. We prioritize being readily available and proactive in addressing our clients' needs, ensuring each solution is tailored to their unique challenges. Like Sequoia, our commitment is to consistently come through for our clients, building trust and value in every interaction.
column56: N/A
column65: Espresa conducts MSAT surveys rather than NPS survey. Our most recent MSAT score is 95%
column67: Getting started with Espresa is simple. Espresa will work with your client to create a customized implementation project plan outlining key objectives, milestones, success measures, and supporting actions required to meet the agreed-upon go-live date. The project plan will be organized around critical phases of implementation, including:  • Program design • Program configuration • Program communication • Pre-launch readiness • Go Live  Status meetings will be scheduled to support execution, monitor progress, and meet implementation timelines. The client's designated Customer Success team will provide access to industry trends, program best practices, guidance, and thought leadership all along the way to support effective program deployment.
column73: Our standard terms are as follows: Either Party may terminate the agreement for cause due to a material breach by the other Party if such breach goes uncured for more than 30 days after notification by the non-breaching party.
column74: Espresa recommends focusing on employee participation in the program as one of the primary measures of success and employee value. When designing your program, Espresa will work with clients to help them understand which program options best meet their needs and help guide you in creating a program that achieves 85% to 95% participation.  In our experience, key elements to driving employee value revolve around program design, communication, creating a friction-free experience, monitoring performance, and adjusting the program over time to ensure it meets the needs of employees and the company.   During implementation, we work with clients to design and configure programs that meet their objectives and create the user experience you desire for employees, which will achieve the participation goals theyset.  Espresa has a finely tuned communication plan to maximize employee awareness and participation. The key is to strike a balance between overcommunication - which will get tuned out - and under-communication, which will result in poor awareness and participation. For example, a typical plan includes a variety of launch communications. Then periodic communications targeted to specific audiences (e.g., people who have never logged into Espresa, people who have logged in but never filed a claim, etc.) and end-of-plan reminder comms. Although plans are customized for each client, common communication channels include virtual/onsite benefit fairs, employee town halls/webinars, internal newsletters, leadership announcements, blog posts, recorded videos, slack, etc.  Ongoing, Espresa leverages in-platform analytics to understand program dynamics and share insights that inform ongoing engagement needs and strategy.
column79: Espresa believes diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are at the core of who we need to be as a people globally. Espresa's growth trajectory continues to drive – in words and action – toward a diverse workforce inclusive of all people, regardless of race, gender, or sexual orientation. In addition to our LSA offering, Espresa offers a product that supports DEI initiatives via our ERG module. We participate in and host DEI educational sessions and webinars (e.g., Inclusivity for All: Delivering Values in the Heart of your Workplace and Creating Solidarity in a Pandemic with Focus on Diversity, Equity, Antiracism, and Inclusion). Our advisory board includes DEI industry luminaries like Dr. Rodriguez, David Kim, and Nancy Vitale.  Specific to LSAs, Espresa's solution enables employers to offer an inclusive benefit that empowers employees to choose from a wide range of benefits that are most important to them. Employers can leverage Espresa to provide an equitable benefit to every employee, anywhere in the world, in any language. The flexibility, choice, and global support built into the Espresa platform allow employees to experience a curated solution that appreciates their unique needs as a person. This enables DEI initiatives to be adaptable and culture first, focusing on driving a supportive and positive experience for all.
column82: Espresa's platform is built for flexibility in all aspects and connects easily with most platforms, including Oracle. Espresa is flexible regarding receiving eligibility data, and we can accommodate various cadences, such as daily, weekly, bi-monthly, or monthly updates. These files typically contain essential information like employee IDs, names, emails, and benefits eligibility dates. We can provide a detailed list of file columns and their descriptions upon request.  Our standard method for receiving eligibility data is through a CSV file, which can be delivered via HTTP POST to our API or through SFTP. The format of these files can be customized to suit your requirements. Additionally, if preferred, eligibility data can be manually uploaded through the Espresa web application. For further specifics, please refer to the "Eligibility File Process" documentation we've provided for a more comprehensive understanding of the process.
column91: We support all SAML2 SSO systems. Our platform can integrate with SSO systems out of the box and set up during implementation.
column92: Espresa offers real-time, on-demand dashboards and reporting on the platform. Clients will have direct access to various live analytics and reports highlighting key program metrics, e.g., participation and usage by expense category, employee category, campus, or region. We can customize reports per the Client's requirements and support any report frequency. Any data that flows through the platform can be provided in a report.
column101: Lifestyle Spending Accounts: - Leading-edge, flexible technology - Customizable plan design and program parameters - Mobile-first anytime, anywhere access - Optional global LSA marketplace - Flexible reimbursement and debit card options - Expert human adjudication - Dynamic LSAs with earned incentives  Well-being and Challenges: - Challenges and Achievements - Incentive Management - Reward Fulfillment - Events Management &  Tracking - OnDemand & Live Wellbeing + Fitness classes - Wellbeing + Champion Communities - Additional options: Telephonic health coaching, tobacco cessation programs, biometric screening, flu shots  Recognition and Rewards: - Peer-to-peer recognition - Automated Anniversary and Birthday awards - Spot bonuses and Equity awards - Gamification and Leaderboards with digital badges - Awards feed socialized across the company - Positive behaviors tied to company core values - Global rewards marketplace  ERGs + Communities - Create community groups - Browse and join communities - See events at-a-glance in an informative calendar view - Control ERG notifications - Allow members to become allies and participate in community success - Access budgeting and KPI workflows
column104: Espresa programs do not fall under ERISA's definition of an employee welfare benefit plan.
column107: Espresa programs are not group health plans.
column117: Lifestyle Spending Accounts (LSAs), incentives, and rewards can be considered a type of fringe benefit as defined by the Internal Revenue Code (IRC), but their specific tax treatment can vary based on how they are structured and implemented.  Regarding LSAs, Espresa can support both taxable and non-taxable expense types. All expense types are coded in our platform as taxable or non-taxable (determined during the implementation). These codes are applied to each claim/transaction that is submitted. Taxation information is then shared with the employer via an advice-to-pay file or as an imputed income file.  Espresa does not offer official legal or tax guidance; however, we will share best practices we have learned from other organizations we work with. Note: Espresa does not offer HRA, HSA, or FSA programs
column119: Espresa provides relevant regulatory and compliance updates as necessary. Unlike Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), COBRA, or Health Reimbursement Arrangements (HRAs), LSAs are less burdened by regulatory and compliance demands. While Espresa does not provide formal legal or tax advice, it shares valuable best practices gleaned from its experience with various organizations.
column124: Espresa provides relevant regulatory and compliance updates as necessary. Unlike Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), COBRA, or Health Reimbursement Arrangements (HRAs), LSAs are less burdened by regulatory and compliance demands. While Espresa does not provide formal legal or tax advice, it shares valuable best practices gleaned from its experience with various organizations.
column126: Espresa refrains from providing formal legal or tax advice. However, it shares valuable insights and best practices acquired from collaborations with other organizations. Consequently, Espresa advises its clients to consult with their respective professional advisors, such as legal counsel, benefits consultants, and tax advisors, for specific guidance as needed.
column127: The taxation aspects and relevant considerations of the program are typically addressed with clients during the sales process. This stage is crucial for educating clients and addressing their questions. Additionally, these topics are revisited during the implementation phase as programs are set up and configured, ensuring clients have a comprehensive understanding of the implications.

column18: Lyra Health, Inc. (Lyra) is the bidding entity. Please note that Lyra Clinical Associates P.C. (LCA), an independent, contracted partner of Lyra, will be providing clinical and coaching services and Lyra will request that LCA be a party to an applicable SOW and Clinical Services Addendum.
column29: Lyra has 16 mutual customers with Sequoia.
column40: Overarching Difference: We own our provider network Our exclusive provider network is owned by Lyra Clinical Associates. This allows us to scale as needed to continue offering easy access for all members. Care should always be effective and accessible. We also prioritize the diversity of our network so we can provide culturally competent care. Our provider network is 84% female, 41% non-white, and about 20% of our providers speak a language other than English. Lyra connects members to the providers who can best meet their needs. To ensure consistent, industry-leading outcomes, we also have clinical oversight of our network. Before a provider is added, they are vetted extensively. We look for cultural competencies, evidence-based treatments, and credentials. We monitor providers on an ongoing basis to verify that our standards are being met. Owning our network allows us to make sure patients are getting better. We also provide training and support to our providers.  Compared to Traditional EAPs Lyra offers a technology-based personalized member experience. This helps our members find and schedule the right kind of care. Our AI-driven algorithm recommends 7-10 curated providers. It compares every provider in our network to match them to a member's needs, preferences, availability, costs, and more. We track provider outcomes to ensure members improve or recover. Lyra uses clinically validated assessments like the GAD-7 for anxiety to measure clinical outcomes. Our methods help 9 in 10 members feel better.  Compared to Other Emerging Solutions Lyra offers the most personalized, comprehensive care on the market. We can accommodate a broad range of needs, including child and family care. We offer every type of care, from preventive self-care to suicidality and addiction treatment. We also offer our services in a variety of modalities to meet our members where they're at. This includes our website, mobile app, in-person care, virtual sessions, live messaging, and telephonic sessions. Lyra matches members to the right level of care to help them get better faster and to reduce care costs. We also offer innovative care models like Lyra Care Therapy. Our offerings provide many kinds of value beyond great care. We can help reduce overall healthcare spend, offer an economic model that works for your organization, and help your members access affordable care.
column42: Lyra has a minimum group size is 500 employees. We have no annual payment minimums.
column43: Lyra provides a mixed model for pricing. Our mixed model includes the actual care costs that members receive (which is the majority of the costs) and a per-employee per month (PEPM) support service fee. The PEPM fee covers all other program components:  Care Costs: Lyra passes on the costs of utilized care services (i.e. therapy or coaching sessions), and the customer only pays the costs of services received by the member population. Support Fees: We charge a flat support PEPM fee to cover the use of Lyra's unique digital platform. Our platform provides personalized care recommendations and online appointment scheduling, active network management to deliver evidence-based care, dedicated account management, and innovative quarterly marketing resources. Lyra's digital approach increases utilization and reduces stigma. Work-Life Services: We offer optional Work-Life services. Lyra passes through our partners' costs of providing these services without markup. Lyra is the only mental health solution that truly aligns our pricing model with patient care. This way, we deliver lasting proven results through a concierge member experience. With Lyra’s only-pay-for-results economic model, customers only pay for what members actually use. Lyra ensures that those members receive the right care, backed by proven outcomes.  Robust performance guarantees on clinical outcomes, access, and satisfaction, bolster our promise. We align performance guarantees to the business problems that you care about most. Lyra's proposal and pricing process are customer-specific. Our pricing is uniquely built for every customer based on a variety of factors including the number of sponsored sessions, the inclusion of HPI, the number of employees, and more. For pricing requests, the customer can reach out to strategicalliances@lyrahealth.com.
column54: Lyra's Care Navigator Team is always available, 24/7/365, to answer your calls no matter the time of day or the day of the week.
column55: We support our members through every step of their mental health care journey. They should never feel alone. We provide 24/7/365 in-the-moment support through our Care Navigator Team and through our digitally accessible resources. We also take care of clients by making proactive recommendations, training leaders and wellness champions, and providing an attentive customer success team. Lyra and the customer will discuss the trainings and support necessary for the customer's service team. This will include, but is not limited to:  Overview of Lyra's services, including how to access care and the programs offered. Bi-directional warm transfers between Lyra's Care Navigator Team and the customer's customer service team. We will work with the customer to ensure that your customer service representatives have access to the information necessary for them to support your employer group members.
column56: In addition to a master's degree and clinical licensure, Lyra's Care Navigator Team has significant experience managing high-risk clinical situations (e.g., suicidality, mandated reporting). Care Navigators provide clinical support for members with more complex or urgent needs, such as self-harm. They de-escalate distressed callers, engage them in safety planning, and stabilize the situation. For ongoing care, they help the member with securing an appointment with a Lyra provider.   Mental Health Care Providers Lyra's network consists of 11,600providers. Across Lyra's network, 92% of providers are therapists. About 5% are coaches, and 3% are prescribers.  Lyra coaches have the highest level of certification for mental health coaches. All coaches graduate from an International Coaching Federation (ICF) accredited school, which requires the most rigorous education and practice requirements worldwide. Each Lyra coach goes through a 4-month long proprietary training program that is designed by Lyra’s PhD-level clinical psychologists and is accredited by ICF.   Lyra therapists have a master's level education or above, are in good standing, and only practice evidence-based therapies.  Lyra physicians are board-certified, in good standing, and specifically trained in behavioral health medication prescription.   Work-Life Service Vendors Lyra's Work-Life services are offered through vendor partnerships. Our work-life service vendors are CLC Incorporated, My Secure Advantage (MSA), and EmployeeCare. The credentials include the following:  Legal Credentials CLC Incorporated employs 150+ employees. They provide a credentialed network of 20,000 attorneys and mediators. CLC is constantly expanding its network to provide for new members. Attorneys must have 5+ years of experience, and meet the following criteria:   Primary source verification of licensure. Verification of educational background. Have professional liability insurance. Be in good standing with the local licensing authorities. Once the provider passes the credentialing requirements, they are contracted into the network. During this process, the attorney completes an Area of Practices form. This details the types of legal matters they can assist members with. CLC re-credentials its network annually using the above standards. CLC completes case management after a member is matched with a legal provider. Like Lyra, they match providers with the right qualifications to help a member's specific needs.  CLC's mediators are also highly qualified. They must have:  5+ years of experience in the industry. Up-to-date malpractice insurance. 100+ hours of mediation and continued education. For ID theft support, CLC has a team of in-house, employed fraud resolution specialists. They are certified in a discipline based on their area of expertise. Specialties include Certified Credit Report Reviewer, Certified Credit Counselor, Certified Public Accountant, and more.   Financial Credentials My Secure Advantage (MSA) has provided financial support services for over 30 years. Their team of in-house specialists covers multiple financial disciplines. Members match with the right money coach for their personal situation. The minimum education requirement for a coach is a bachelor’s degree or comparable financial industry experience, and at least five years of relevant experience in the financial industry. The average experience of an MSA Money Coach is 22 years. MSA has proprietary training to ensure the quality of its financial coaching. Money Coaches are directly employed by MSA. They are not affiliated with any financial services company or bank. Specialties include Accredited Financial Counselor, Certified Credit Counselor, Certified Financial Planner, and many more.  Child/Elder/Pet Care Credentials EmployeeCare has master's-level generalists who consult on a variety of topics. All EmployeeCare call center counselors are also clinicians. They are trained to detect possible mental/emotional issues and help in a crisis. Like Lyra's Care Navigator Team, they can also respond with a client-based protocol.
column67: Lyra’s best-practice, 12-week implementation process is designed to minimize the work of your benefits team. If a customer decides to do a health plan integration, our implementation process will take longer. Our implementation philosophy is that we should do the heavy lifting and create plans and examples to which we can react and provide strategic guidance. At a high level, we look to the customer to provide:  Data sharing authorizations as Lyra require an eligibility file. Communication insights (Lyra will provide recommended communication assets based on your team's feedback). Vendor partner introductions to ensure any required handoffs are done via warm transfer and seamless. Lyra assigns an Implementation Manager to lead the implementation process (typically 12 weeks) and support a successful launch. They work alongside the Customer Success Manager we assign to the customer. You will have access to clinical, marketing, technology, security, and benefits experts from Lyra. You also have a direct line to your Lyra executive sponsor for any needed escalations.   We will assign an implementation manager to lead your implementation. Lyra's typical implementation timeline is as follows:  30 Days Implementation Kick-off with the Lyra Team and the customer's Benefits Team. Finalize the Lyra solution core configuration and add-ons. 60 Days Finalize the marketing plan (e.g. mindfulness, stress, sleep). Data file feeds setup (e.g. eligibility, claims, disability). 90 Days All legal documents signed (e.g. MSA, BAA, Security Risk Assessment). Pre-launch review (e.g. Lyra site, marketing, etc.). 120 Days (HPI Only) Launch Lyra Test health plan clearinghouse connections, data flows, and validate the accuracy of data 150-180 Days (HPI Only) Launch Health Plan Integration
column73: Lyra can agree to the client terminating the program for cause with a 30-day written notification. Regarding termination without cause, Lyra can agree to this, but we would request the opportunity to further discuss timing. Generally, Lyra requests that it only occur after the first 12 months of service.  Please see the following for Lyra's standard termination language:  "Either party may terminate this Agreement: (a) upon thirty (30) days’ written notice for a material breach of this Agreement by the other party unless such material breach is cured within such 30-day period; or (b) immediately if the other party becomes the subject of a petition in bankruptcy or any other proceeding relating to insolvency, receivership, liquidation or assignment for the benefit of creditors. In addition, following the completion of the first 12 months of Services, either party may terminate this Agreement without cause upon ninety (90) days’ written notice."
column74: Lyra's Marketing and Customer Success teams will work with customers to develop a unique strategy to engage members. This includes choosing appropriate timing and channels for messaging. We will tailor the content to reach the customer's workforce in ways that resonate with them. Our goal is to validate talking about mental health. We also want to normalize the customer's member experiences.  We will provide the customer with a library of communications content. Print materials include items such as flyers, posters, home mailers, and business cards. Digital assets include displays, emails, banner ads, and more. We also support content for educational presentations, workshops, and newsletters. We generate materials with company-specific Lyra URLs and dedicated Lyra phone numbers.  Our user research and creative expertise are the foundation for our communications campaigns. We work hard to make mental health approachable and engaging for members. In addition, what drives success among customers is the support of people managers and executives. We see high awareness and utilization at companies where people managers and executive leaders create a culture where discussions about well-being and mental health can be had and where employee resource groups are empowered to be local champions of Lyra.
column79: Internal Support: All employees are trained on implicit bias, identity, interpersonal relations, and micro-aggressions. Lyra's DEIB team also leads monthly facilitated talks called "Intentional Conversations". They focus on creating a space to openly discuss DEIB topics. To continue these conversations we have listening groups. These allow people from all walks of life to learn about different groups and experiences. Lyra has a dedicated DEIB Slack channel. Lyrians share news, offer support, and discuss related topics here. Our CEO and executive team serve as thought partners and participants in these spaces. They take ownership of their journeys and model continual learning with employees. To learn more about Lyra's commitment to culturally responsive care, please visit https://www.lyrahealth.com/resources/culturally-responsive-care/.  Lyra offers public presentations and customer-specific training around diversity and mental health. These include:  Proactively engaging with organizations for providers of color. Groups like Therapy for Black Girls, Multicultural Counselors, and more. Attending conferences/gatherings for people of color. For example LatinX Psychologist Association or Association of Black Psychologists. Adding a multicultural competency component to our provider interview process. Lyra also actively supports diverse providers of the future through 2 programs:  Enhanced Access Initiative. This program is designed to support clinicians who identify with historically marginalized communities. This is for providers who may not have the resources to open their private practice. Lyra Clinical Fellowship. This program provides associate social workers with high-quality training. We gear this toward those in underrepresented communities and emphasize culturally responsive approaches. The goal of this new program is to address key systemic barriers to licensure. Our efforts increase access to providers who reflect some client populations. We aim to improve access for marginalized communities seeking mental health care. External Support: We expect equity and respect in the care Lyra provides. By making equity a baseline, we ensure that members receive the care that best fits their needs. Lyra defines equity as distributing resources based on the needs of the recipients. We define quality as giving everyone the same resources. We do this by having a network of diverse providers educated in culturally responsive care. This helps members feel seen, understood, and valued in their sessions. To incorporate culturally responsive care, Lyra provides ongoing education for providers including:  Intersectional frameworks for understanding clients’ presenting concerns. Training on being an anti-oppressive therapist working with LGBTQIA+ individuals and people of color. Training in working with transgender clients. Culturally responsive support for Black men. Getting parents ready to talk about race. Training in the social justice implications for evidence-based treatments. Training in understanding white privilege and allyship in therapy. Culturally responsive care consultation groups. Lyra empowers providers to incorporate culturally responsive care modalities into their care strategies. We integrate them into a community of similarly-minded mental health professionals. Therapists in our Lyra Care Therapy program have access to consultation groups and other experts. Together, they can determine the best treatment options and approaches for members. Lyra also supports providers in doing the work they love with the groups they are most passionate about serving. This makes a more positive therapeutic experience for both the member and provider. Click here to read more about Lyra’s approach to culturally responsive care.  Lyra’s goal is to deliver equitable outcomes across all racial groups. We are delighted that our outcomes show we are achieving that goal. Lyra members who reliably improve or recover range from 85% to 90% across all groups.      Lyra's triage process and resources also reflect our commitment to providing equitable care. Our enhanced platform features are aimed to support BIPOC and/or LGBTQ+ members. They include the following:  Members can indicate racial stress and/or gender identity during intake. Lyra will connect members with specialists in treating their symptoms. Members can search for additional providers if they do not feel that our recommendations fit their needs. This includes specifically searching for more providers of color. Our digital content and activities include content to support the BIPOC and LGBTQ+ communities.  We provide ongoing best practices and in-the-moment resources for your benefits/HR team. This includes content to support your entire workforce. Together, we can foster a mentally healthy organization and deliver overall workforce transformation.  We offer workshops specifically designed to support DEIB in the workplace.
column82: Lyra will work with the customer for the eligibility file vendor set up an encrypted full eligibility file feed containing all eligible employees and known eligible dependents to be delivered weekly. During implementation, we will partner with the customer and test ahead of launch.
column91: Lyra customers typically elect not to use SSO due to concerns around member privacy and eligibility for dependents. That said, Google and Apple SSO are already built into the Lyra platform. If the customer would like to set up SSO, we are happy to explore that further.
column92: Standard Electronic Reporting: Lyra provides an unprecedented amount of data in our standard electronic reporting package. We keep customers informed on engagement, access, and outcomes. We provide quarterly or bi-annual reports (depending on client size) at no extra cost. This will be led by the Customer Success Manager. Reporting includes: -Registrations by age, member type, gender, geography, primary need, and severity. -The number of “high-risk” registrants (i.e., self-harm, suicidality). -Percentage of members immediately matched with verified available providers with the right expertise. -Members in care by age, member type, gender, primary need, and severity. -In care by care type: therapy, family/couples therapy, coaching, self-care, and more. -Time from searching for care to the first completed session. -Percentage of members who start care within 2 weeks of searching. -Overall patient satisfaction (1 to 5 scale). -Therapeutic alliance (connection with a therapist). -Percentage of members who made improvements on clinically validated metrics. Scales like the Patient-Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) for depression and the Perceived Stress Scale (PSS). -The number of cancellations and no-shows. Lyra can also calculate health plan offsets if provided with the customer's medical and Rx claims data. Ad hoc reporting can be provided at additional cost but is rarely requested.   On-Demand Workforce Wellness Dashboard Lyra provides a web-based, on-demand Workforce Wellness Dashboard. It shows utilization metrics and datasets for self-service reporting. This reporting dashboard includes: -Key Engagement Metrics. The number of registered clients, care searchers, clients who started care, and active clients. -Registrations and New Care Starts. The number and percentage of registrations and new care starts by month. -Clients in Care Demographics. Clients in care are broken out by member type, age group, geography, and gender. -Metrics on Clients in Care. Percentage of clients who started care in 2 weeks or less, the top locations, the top primary needs, and the top provider-identified needs. -Session Details. Session-level metrics, including sessions by program type, modality, and attendance.  Customers can gauge engagement at a glance with this feature. We also have a Word Cloud, which displays words and phrases clients select during intake. Sample phrases include burnout, lack of enjoyment, and difficulty concentrating. This displays words and phrases that clients can select during the triage process, and can capture indicators of high risk and potential crisis. We also include racial stress, since this is top of mind for many customers. We show the percentage of searchers who select each word cloud during their first search. We show the top 15 phrases that were selected across our book of business.
column96: The customer's Customer Success Manager is available to speak about compliance questions.
column97: We have an internal legal team that supports regulatory compliance and governance work for our internal operations.
column98: We have an internal legal team that supports regulatory compliance and governance work for our internal operations.
column101: Not applicable. While Lyra does not provide compliance services, our legal and compliance teams actively monitor applicable laws and regulations, and any changes or modifications that would impact our products and services.  Should Sequoia's legal and compliance team wish to connect to discuss any regulatory updates in greater detail, Lyra would be more than happy to schedule a call with the appropriate parties from both organizations.
column103: Lyra works collaboratively with our customers to provide them with adequate information so that they may evaluate customer's benefit plan compliance. Lyra provides sample summary plan descriptions to help our customers obtain a legally-sufficient SPD under ERISA. It is only a sample, and, accordingly, each of our clients maintains their own SPD.    Our internal legal and compliance teams watch laws and regulations to ensure we are in compliance. They check for any changes that could impact our services or products.
column106: Employees and their dependents are generally eligible for Lyra under COBRA. However, specific eligibility requirements vary by customer. Lyra typically defines dependents as spouses and children. The customer will determine Lyra's availability under COBRA. Some customers require employees to elect Lyra during COBRA. Other customers make Lyra available automatically. Simply electing medical or other benefits under COBRA may not guarantee access to the Lyra benefit.  We also offer Health Plan Integration. This allows members to Lyra providers with their health benefits on their COBRA plan. Free sessions would not apply until there is a specific offering of EAP COBRA as explained above.

column118: At this time, our view, as confirmed by a legal opinion from outside counsel, is that there is a reasonable argument that an employer can consider Lyra as an excepted benefit EAP provider.  In particular, it can be reasonably concluded that Lyra’s EAP does not provide significant benefits in the nature of medical care or treatment, and thus, classify us as an excepted benefit under ERISA. Moreover, Lyra’s EAP is not financially integrated with a health plan, nor is Lyra a requirement or gateway for any member using the health plan.    If selected as a provider/vendor of choice, Lyra can make available a legal memorandum from outside counsel for your review.
column119: Our legal and compliance teams actively monitor applicable laws and regulations, and any changes or modifications that would impact our products and services.  Should the customer's legal and compliance team wish to connect to discuss any regulatory updates in greater detail, Lyra would be more than happy to schedule a call with the appropriate parties from both organizations.
column124: Lyra is committed to complying with all applicable laws and regulations for our industry and meeting applicable ethical standards. Lyra has internal legal, regulatory, and information security teams to ensure compliance with all state and federal regulations. Our company also maintains extensive relationships with outside counsel at nationally recognized firms to support its compliance in pertinent areas and to be brought up to date on any changes in relevant laws. While we ensure that our product and services align with all applicable laws and regulations, we do not provide legal counsel for our clients. We consider our partnerships with our customers to be, in part, collaborative in nature, and are happy to discuss any concerns.
column126: Our legal and compliance teams actively monitor applicable laws and regulations, and any changes or modifications that would impact our products and services.
