column40: Carrot’s engagement solution is unparalleled in clinical excellence, member engagement, and providing a premier and personalized member experience leading to the utmost satisfaction. The underpinning to our solution is innovation. Carrot has been the first to market in new service offerings including gestational surrogacy, donor coverage, and menopause support - leading the marketplace through healthcare innovation, and setting the bar high for our competition to follow. Our end-to-end suite of services does not sacrifice the depth we’ve built up over the years of solidifying our stronghold as an expert in family-forming and hormonal health care. What differentiates us from other vendors in the space is:  First, our approach. We believe that fertility is inclusive of women but also broader. It is a fundamental part of human healthcare spanning every age, sex, gender, and more. To serve women best, we must enable everyone - not only females -  to engage in their fertility health. As the category enters its mainstream growth phase, we see this continued maturation happening across the U.S. and around the globe so that fertility is no longer a woman's fault, responsibility, or burden. All people can engage and take part in the benefits and burdens of how we pursue parenthood.   Second, our experience and data. Our fertility dataset is orders of magnitude larger than anyone else's. Sequoia clients everywhere will benefit from tens of millions of data points across 130 countries, generated by tens of thousands of members who have gone down similar paths before, all to ensure a premier member experience. No one else has the depth, range, and, importantly, confident command of this highly dynamic fertility landscape. Experience and data matter, especially when handling topics as sensitive as infertility, pregnancy, hormonal health, and more.   Third, our people. Data, clinical rigor, and technology are enablers of human beings who are at the heart of how we support members. We know the power of human connection and expert empathy is what truly moves the needle with members, whether it's by helping to educate them on the nuances of laws that may not be black and white or simply being a quiet listener during a time of intense grief, We are right there with you. These are the moments that members remember -- and ones that will make them think to themselves and say out loud to others, "My company supported me during one of the most important times of my life, and I'll never forget it." It’s important not only that members engage with Carrot, but that they are highly satisfied with it. With our solution, members are offered unlimited touch points with their Care Navigator, as the Care Navigator supports them through every aspect of the journey, from education to clinic matching, from benefits coverage to financial services, and more. Additionally, our members are provided with 1:1 support with our full suite of Carrot Experts for supplementary resources, education, and support throughout every step of their journey. Carrot is the leading provider of high-touch employee support for lifelong fertility and family-forming care, and our superior member satisfaction demonstrates this.
column43: Over 250 Employees: Sequoia  clients with 250+ employees have the option to purchase Carrot through a PEPM model or a utilization based model.   - PEPM Pricing Model - In this model employers pay Carrot a per employee per month fee  - Utilization Pricing Model: Carrot charges a low, up-front annual fee based on a PEPY model that covers program support through a designated Customer Success Manager (CSM), reporting throughout the year, and launch support. This fee also covers members and their partners who want to access the platform's educational content and learn more about the Carrot benefit and family forming. In many cases a Sequoia discount applies to the case rate.  When a member becomes meaningfully engaged and is ready to move forward with their family-building path, a custom Carrot Plan is created for that member to promote the healthiest possible outcome. Carrot Plans include unlimited access to Carrot Experts and support from a Care Navigator who works with employees through every step of their journey. Carrot Plans are then charged/available for a 12-month period and include access for spouses and domestic partners.  $X upfront admin fee + case rate ($X estimated) = annual total spend  **Please note that Carrot offers tiered support (Carrot Core vs Carrot Pro), allowing employers to choose whether offering a financial benefit aligns with their organizational goals and capabilities. If our employer customer chooses to offer their employees a financial benefit (Carrot Pro), we partner with them to custom-design a benefit allowance using industry benchmarking and best practices. The annual total spend will differ based on which tier of coverage the customer chooses.  Under 250 Employees: For employers in this market segment, Carrot has a flat annual administration fee (of $25,000) for either Carrot Core or Carrot Pro. Similar to as described above, if our employer customer chooses to offer their employees a financial benefit (Carrot Pro), we partner with them to custom-design a benefit allowance using industry benchmarking and best practices. The annual total spend will differ based on which tier of coverage the customer chooses.
column54: Care Navigators are available for scheduled calls or on an on-demand basis via phone, video, or secure messaging 24/7/365 in order to provide consistent support for our members as they pursue their personalized fertility and family-forming journeys. Our Carrot Experts are also available for educational Telehealth support throughout our operational regions and support all time zones in which Carrot is currently active.  Members who have Carrot Rx fertility medication coverage can access a pharmacy clinician for any questions related to medications and administration on a 24/7/365 basis. And, members always have 24/7/365 access to the Carrot member platform, which includes educational articles, guides, and videos, as well as a real-time overview of the member's specific benefit and details on their unique family-forming journey.
column55: Carrot believes that customer success is built in providing a multi-tiered approach to customer support. Once the MSA has been fully executed, Carrot will engage the Customer Success team to begin the implementation process and drive toward a successful launch of the Carrot program to employees. The Carrot Customer Success team will "quarterback" all initial setup activities (including operational readiness activities such as compliance and reporting).   Following the launch of the Carrot program, the Customer Success team will continue to oversee the account and ensure expectations are met or exceeded over the course of the relationship. The team approach ensures continuity and fluidity of service in the event of a Carrot employee's transition from the team or the organization. The Carrot Customer Success team is supported by a team of product, technical, and clinical subject matter experts who may be engaged as needed.
column56: Experts Carrot's multi-disciplinary team of Medical Experts is a team of licensed clinical and non-clinical experts that include OB/GYNs, reproductive endocrinologists, urologists, embryologists, nurses, midwives, doulas, lactation consultants, nutritionists, social workers, mental health professionals, and more. Medical experts must have an active clinical license (this requires continuous education to maintain a license), as well as all necessary credentials required for their specialty. Carrot Experts typically have a minimum of two years of experience in their role. They are provided with ongoing education by Carrot and are involved in discussions related to industry advancements, changes in legislation, and developments in practice. Our members can opt to schedule a chat with a specialized Carrot Expert, providing members with the opportunity to ask questions related to medical, emotional, and family-forming scenarios. The chats are educational in nature, and our experts may provide medical or family-forming advice and recommendations during these sessions; note that these sessions are not intended to be a substitute for medical or legal services.  Members have unlimited support from full-time registered nurses (RNs) whose main function includes member interactions and education as well as a full suite of clinical/medical contractors globally (MD, RN, PhD, MS, Midwife, etc.).  Care Navigation Care Navigators are experienced, healthcare industry veterans and are trained through a curriculum designed by Carrot's Chief Medical Officer, Chief Scientific Advisor, and member success leadership. To be eligible for hire, Care Navigators must have strong customer service experience in healthcare, a bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience, and a specific skill set (empathy, attention to detail, problem-solving skills) that is tested through a series of situational interviews and performance exercises. Once hired, Care Navigators complete initial training including two weeks of intensive learning on family-forming topics, Carrot's product and services, empathy and sensitivity, LGBTQ+ community support, and more. Care Navigators then participate in a two-week program shadowing seasoned Care Navigators before entering a hybrid period with care navigation management where all communications are reviewed prior to interacting with their first Carrot member. All members of the Care Navigation team complete ongoing training on Carrot's products and services, basic refresher training, and annual education on privacy and security compliance.
column67: Carrot strives to make the implementation process as seamless as possible for customers. Implementation is led by the Carrot Implementation Manager (IM) who facilitates regular communication while providing guidance along the way on key business decisions, employee communications, Carrot and customer deliverables, technical setup, joint testing, acceptance, and operational readiness (including compliance, reimbursement and tax handling processes, and reporting/analytics).   In our experience, we have seen the greatest success with implementation when customers assign a Project Manager or Project Lead to facilitate communication within the customer's organization and interface directly with the Carrot IM. Additionally, we recommend engaging available subject matter experts in the areas of finance and compliance.   Leading up to the implementation kickoff meeting, Carrot will provide visibility into the key decisions and discussion topics to ensure customers can responsibly engage the appropriate roles/players/resources within their organization. Carrot understands the importance of collaborating upfront regarding resources required, the time commitment needed, responsiveness norms, and availability for recurring and ad-hoc meetings.   During the kickoff meeting, the Carrot IM provides an in-depth walkthrough of the entire implementation process. Additionally, Carrot has developed an Implementation Playbook to help guide customers through the process which will be shared prior to the implementation kickoff meeting.
column69: Carrot - Sample Employee Communications and Resources.pdf
column73: Determinations regarding termination of service will be discussed and agreed upon during contracting.
column74: Carrot provides a high-touch, member-centric experience throughout our platform. We understand that each member has unique needs related to the family-forming journey and interactions with Carrot. With this in mind, we offer multiple options for members to engage with Carrot staff so that each member can choose the option(s) that is best suited to their individual needs.   These communication methods accommodate members who prefer a self-service model, and those who appreciate having more direct support from Carrot's team of experts. When a member initially goes through onboarding with Carrot, they are assigned to a Care Navigator. The Care Navigator will proactively reach out to the member via email, and will also offer to set up an audio or video chat if those communication methods are member-preferred. For subsequent support outside of the member's regular communication with their Care Navigator, members can reach Carrot via email, asynchronous chats, as well as audio and video Telehealth support.  Carrot proactively engages and re-engages members based on user actions and appropriate brand marketing. Carrot provides meaningful messaging and experiences for our members in order to drive engagement and enrollment. This includes:  - Welcome emails - New member webinar invites - Reachback emails sent to anyone who registered but did not create a Carrot Plan - Reachback emails based on user responses during registration - Infertility awareness emails for unregistered eligible employees - Carrot Plan abandonment email  Our communications are written from an employee-first perspective, leveraging user insights. We utilize user segments to target communications based on member journeys, characteristics, and circumstances (leveraging reimbursement data, user behavior, and content interests). Future state, we will be implementing a new communications process that allows members to select specific content areas of interest to further provide them with communications relevant to their needs and goals, when they need it - reducing noise so members are more likely to receive communications that earn their attention and propel action.
column79: At Carrot, DEI are foundational to our success as a company. We strive to build an inclusive workforce, bridging various backgrounds & perspectives through our programs, our processes, & how we interact with each other.   As employees, we all share a responsibility to foster an environment in which everyone feels free to contribute, share ideas, & succeed as their full selves. Employees complete Ethena compliance training during onboarding and DEI trainings throughout the year.   At Carrot, we fully embrace employees’ differences in age, national origin or ancestry, race, color, ethnic origin, sex, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, physical & mental ability, religion (or non-religion) marital or domestic partner status, & the multitude of other areas that make us all so unique. We are an Age-Friendly Employer by The Age-Friendly Institute; our ECGs offer networking forums, engagement, community outreach, education, & awareness to build stronger connections; and we are proud to be allies and sponsors for events such as Lesbians Who Tech.  Please visit https://www.get-carrot.com/deib to learn more about our DE&I approach.
column82: Carrot's standard eligibility file may include the following:  - First and Last name (required) - Preferred name (optional) - Work/company Email (required) - Employee ID (required) - Eligibility start date (required) - Date of birth (required) - Sex at birth (required) - Zip code (required) - Country code (optional)  During the implementation process, the Carrot Implementation Manager will provide a detailed specification outlining the specific fields that will be required for the implementation as well as formatting and other supplemental details.
column91: For SSO implementation, Carrot supports SAML 2.0. All identity providers (e.g. Okta, Auth0, Microsoft AD) that support SAML 2.0 are compatible with Carrot’s SAML implementation, as it is an open standard.
column92: The Carrot Customer Success team provides customers with a quarterly business report that includes key insights into how their population is utilizing the Carrot benefit. This includes details on white-glove member engagement as well as Carrot's financial benefit utilization via structured data files and/or PDFs. Details surrounding these key insights are below:  Monthly utilization reporting to support payroll and tax/withholding processes when a financial benefit is offered.  Ongoing, in-depth quarterly reporting including: - Number of registrants by quarter - Global engagement by country - Member journey tracking (number of members going through adoption, surrogacy, preservation, fertility, etc.) - Total cost savings from Carrot's discounted rates on treatment and Rx - Number of employees who used their precision ovulation tracker to avoid ART altogether - Employee loyalty (% of members who say they would stay longer with the employer because of Carrot's benefit) - Mental health cost savings from employee well-being - Cost savings from talent retention - Total employer savings and return on investment (ROI) from investing in Carrot's program - Utilization of the Carrot Card
column101: Carrot’s robust fertility and family forming engagement platform offers a modular and flexible approach to support clients by expanding coverage to more family-forming needs. Each service offering is available on a stand-alone basis. Our suite of solutions include:  Family Planning (Fertility Testing, Early interventions, Cryopreservation, etc) Fertility Adoption Gestational surrogacy Pregnancy, postpartum, & early parenting support Menopause and low testosterone support Gender-Affirming Care (GAC)  Family planning: Oftentimes, members know they want to grow their family but are unsure where to start, or they've encountered challenges and need guidance to move forward. When a member is ready to begin their family-forming journey with Carrot, they are matched with a personal Care Navigator who will then create a Carrot Plan unique to the member's needs — bringing Carrot resources together in a step-by-step guide that helps members reach their specific family-forming goals.   Carrot empowers our members to start their family-forming journey with less invasive, less expensive, first-line interventions before stepping foot in a fertility clinic. These interventions include precision ovulation tracking, nutrition counseling, and options for at-home support. A fundamental piece of Carrot’s solution is to support our members even as they begin thinking about family formation versus supporting them only when they are struggling. We do not want to fast-track people into IVF; in fact, we give our members and employer partners a wide range of options and support before costly, invasive IVF surgery. Carrot provides financial coverage and care navigation services for members who wish to preserve their fertility (egg, sperm, embryo freezing). We guide members in making a choice that works for their individual journey and will navigate them to in-clinic options as well as our clinical-grade, at-home sperm analysis and cryopreservation services (as appropriate).   Fertility: Our fertility care solution takes a clinically managed approach to fertility support, leveraging our own highly vetted network to drive members to top-quality fertility clinics. We take a proactive approach to education, ensuring members are aware of and understand best practices. Additionally, we are the only solution that provides utilization management of multiple embryo transfers (MET) — ensuring an increased number of single embryo transfer (SET) cases, which leads to proven healthier outcomes. As part of our solution, Carrot covers the following fertility-related services for all applicable members and their partners: basic fertility testing (including labs, bloodwork, and ultrasounds); intrauterine insemination (IUI); in-vitro fertilization (IVF); reciprocal IVF (for same-sex female couples); preservation services (egg, sperm, embryo freezing); and urology visits (for male infertility).   Adoption: Our guiding principle has and will continue to be to support legal, safe, and ethical adoption practices that promote safety, stability, and permanence in the best interests of children. We provide support, education, and guidance for our members, including our LGBTQ+ members for and throughout the adoption, keenly focused on the types of adoption, explanations, and costs by country and region. This entails respective Adoption agencies, agency fees, travel expenses, court and legal fees, mental health screenings, and other related eligible fees. The Carrot financial benefit can also be used to cover eligible expenses for adoption journeys, both domestic and intercountry, where legally permissible. We recognize that access to care through the lens of laws and regulations is complex and may vary based on factors such as location, marital status, and sexual orientation.  Gestational Surrogacy: A gestational surrogacy journey support is a complex and emotional journey for our global members. At the core is to ensure a premier member experience, highly educated on the process, and to provide access to quality experts supporting our members. We vet and partner with agencies that provide the guidance, support, and tools for intended parents to use a gestational carrier/surrogate to have a child. We understand there are complexities worldwide and by region we will support cultural and regulatory appropriateness. Where appropriate Carrot will support reimbursement for agency fees, egg/sperm retrieval or freezing, medications, donor reimbursement, egg/sperm bank fees, and much more.   Pregnancy, Postpartum, & Parenting: Carrot is designed to support members from exploration through postpartum and transitioning back to work.   Maternal healthcare is at a critical juncture and Carrot is focused on ensuring engagement and trust are factored into every interaction with our members. We know that family forming and maternity can be challenging for many with 1 in 6 people globally affected by infertility and 1 in 10 babies born prematurely in the U.S. Lack of access to quality care is resulting in increasing costs and poor health outcomes, which impacts member engagement, customer retention, and growth, as well as your bottom line. We know this data is skewed on a global basis which is why the Carrot program for maternity focuses on a multi-pronged approach.  Create a concierge-level member experience through education, guidance, and care management. Address equity by matching our members to clinical experts who share the same race and cultural background as they are to ensure we are building trust throughout their journey and adherence to recommendations.  Members in the postpartum period transitioning back to work benefit from existing Carrot offerings. In fact, 9 out of 10 members who have Carrot Plans for a pregnancy journey return to work after they give birth. Through our high-touch care navigation, access to our full suite of postpartum Carrot Experts, and our extensive library of digital resources, we help to ensure members achieve safer, healthier outcomes and receive support to promote their physical and emotional well-being at every stage. Following a birth, members remain engaged with their Care Team (if they choose), including care navigation and extensive Telehealth support which includes unlimited access to OB/GYNs, mental health professionals who specialize in postpartum depression and anxiety, lactation consultants, doulas, midwives, and nutritionists when needed.    As part of Carrot's pregnancy support, members can access: - Expert-led, intimate group sessions with a specific focus on postpartum topics - Unlimited chats with Carrot experts including doulas, midwives, OB/GYNs, and lactation consultants. Members can also speak to emotional support experts about managing stress and anxiety. - Financial coverage for in-person doulas who can provide postpartum support  - Financial support for milk shipping - Self-guided educational resources on postpartum topics, such as lactation and postpartum depression  Our solution is built to provide our members with the education, resources, and support necessary to confidently transition back to their careers when the time comes. Additionally, Carrot's interactive benefits ecosystem allows us to partner with an employer's parental support vendors and provide warm transfers for our members if they are in need of these services.  Menopause and low testosterone: Fertility hormones are at the center of fertility care. Carrot understands that the same key hormones that govern whether IVF, egg freezing, or pregnancy will be successful also govern another important part of fertility care, which is hormonal aging. That's why fertility support isn’t just pertinent in someone’s reproductive years — it is important throughout life. Carrot uniquely provides clinically-validated, complete support for people in managing symptoms associated with menopause and low testosterone (low T), including access to resources such as expert-guided group sessions to build a community with Carrot members who are on a similar journey timeline as well as self-serve content such as articles and dynamic guides, allowing members to learn at their own pace when that’s the right approach. Members can find specialized providers that support menopause and low T through Carrot's vetted provider list or work with their Care Navigator for support on finding the best provider that works for their situation. In addition, members can use employer-sponsored funds for covered expenses, including hormone replacement therapy and visits with specialists.   Many of these employees in their 40s and 50s are incredibly valuable leaders, managers, and executives on your team. The result is lost productivity at work, bouncing around the healthcare system, or suffering in silence. Equitable fertility care for all is including all sexes, sexual orientations, genders – and ages.   Gender-Affirming Care (GAC): Carrot provides holistic support, personalized navigation, and gender-affirming hormone therapy coverage for individuals seeking gender-affirming care (GAC). While GAC is currently offering in the US only, as the landscape and market shift to accomodate globally, so will Carrot in our global offering where appropriate for GAC coverage. Whether we are augmenting the current healthcare systems, private insurance or routing our members to the resources and guidance they may require, we will always do so with a lens of cultural allowance and legal parameters.
column103: Carrot administers an infertility HRA to reimburse certain qualifying medical expenses in the U.S.. Carrot provides an ERISA compliant plan document and SPD intended to comply with ERISA and acts as the named fiduciary for adjudicating claims and appeals under ERISA Section 503. Coverage under the infertility HRA is only available to participants who are enrolled in an employer-sponsored medical plan.
column106: Carrot’s approach to compliance is intended to reduce risk for our customers. Carrot has implemented policies and procedures designed to comply with Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act ("COBRA"): An amendment to ERISA that ensures continuation of healthcare coverage for individuals who experience a qualifying event (e.g., termination, divorce).

Carrot provides an ERISA compliant plan document and SPD intended to comply with ERISA and acts as the named fiduciary for adjudicating claims and appeals under ERISA Section 503. Coverage under the infertility HRA is only available to participants who are enrolled in an employer-sponsored medical plan.
column124: Carrot’s approach to compliance is intended to reduce risk for our customers. Carrot has implemented policies and procedures designed to comply with:  - Internal Revenue Code: Federal tax law in the U.S. - Employee Retirement Income Security Act ("ERISA"): A U.S. law regulating employer-sponsored health and retirement plans for the protection of individuals in these plans - Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act ("COBRA"): An amendment to ERISA that ensures continuation of healthcare coverage for individuals who experience a qualifying event (e.g., termination, divorce) - Affordable Care Act: A U.S. law with far-reaching implications for healthcare coverage, including how Health Reimbursement Arrangements ("HRAs") are offered - Various data security laws and standards (e.g., HIPAA, SOC2 Type II + HITRUST)  Carrot also provides support to our customers to apply taxes equitably based on general IRS guidance in the U.S.  We provide customers with easy-to-use reporting so that employers can apply any necessary taxes to Carrot benefits based on their preference as well as detailed information on managing a carve-out fertility benefit for members enrolled in a high-deductible health plan (HDHP). We work with our employer customers to determine their preferred tax posture and to support compliance with all legal requirements applicable to their health plan offerings. For individuals enrolled in employer-sponsored HDHPs, we follow the current IRS guidelines regarding minimum deductible amounts for self-only and family coverage when referencing the dollar amount that individuals must meet to satisfy their Carrot-specific deductible. We determine whether a deductible applies based on the member’s attestation when they create a Carrot account.  Carrot has years of experience processing payments for fertility coverage. For example, in the U.S., Carrot is structured as a post-deductible HRA to maintain HSA eligibility and we ask members to confirm medical plan enrollment prior to covering qualified medical expenses through the HRA.  Our platform helps navigate the complexities surrounding taxation as they relate to current ERISA interpretation. We send monthly reports that are reflective of the customer's tax posture and can be easily automated into the payroll system.
column127: We provide tax reporting on a monthly basis to our employer partners that flags expenses as taxable vs. non-taxable, based on their preferred tax posture. During our compliance discussion at implementation, our experts will explain the most recent IRS guidance related to the taxation of fertility/family-forming benefits, and how clients may choose to address it (i.e., gross up to cover taxes on taxable expenses [like elective cryopreservation] or pass taxes on to the employee member). Our Care Navigation team is educated on each employer partner's unique taxation stance and will educate members accordingly.

column20: One Embarcadero Center Suite 1900 San Francisco CA 94111
column40: One Medical has over 185 brick and mortar clinics in 22 markets and counting and delivers 24/7 virtual care nationwide. One Medical's multimodality arrangement ensures that members are able to get care, when they need it most. Our Net Promoter Score is 90. 97% of our employers renew their account with us. 45% of our members use One Medical's digital services every month. We rank at 90th percentile of HEDIS scores. We have yielded an average of 8% Cost savings on total cost of care. Our primary care model lends itself to reducing ER visits by 41%, hospital days by 46% and 23% of office visits are replaced by virtual visits. Our on-demand virtual care is free of charge to members and our clients (no copays or claims). We offer a comprehensive suite of primary care services that focus on whole person care (both physical and mental health), whole family care (pediatric and adult care), and whole community care (with a focus on diversity and inclusion).
column42: For a company to add One Medical to their benefits package as a direct partner, they need to have a minimum of 10 employees; any population smaller than that will be subject to the One Medical commercial consumer model unless they are affiliated with a Channel Partner, such as Sequoia, and can enroll at any size through our partnership. We do not currently have a maximum employee limit.
column43: PEPM
column54: Our Member Service Specialist (MSS) team has standard business hours and we have several hubs throughout the country, the largest being in Phoenix, to ensure we are best supporting our patients on the schedule that fits their needs.
column55: One Medical’s client success team ensures all support and services are aligned and meet/exceed customer expectations. Our account managers work with targeted books of business that match the complexity and required time spent for each client. Each account manager works to develop an in-depth partnership with clients, establishing joint strategic goals at the start of each relationship focused on a differentiated experience anchored in superior primary care. The account manager can also help with communication, implementation, issue escalations, reporting and addressing any technical questions that are received from employees.    Additionally, One Medical’s Member Service Specialist (MSS) ensures we are best supporting our patients on the schedule that fits their needs. Our support center is run by a customer service veteran of over 22+ years in the field and is led by a team of seasoned leaders who come from a multitude of customer service organizations. We have a 250 person centralized support center with several hubs throughout the country, the largest being in Phoenix, and the team is divided by specialties. For any medical inquiries submitted via the app, One Medical’s in house virtual medical team (VMT) will respond.   Key areas that contribute to a successful relationship are: willingness to partner on innovation, eagerness to promote the benefit in creative ways, ability to directly email program communications to the unenrolled population on an ongoing basis, and inclusion of One Medical within any incentive programs offered.

column67: One Medical’s implementation process is structured to include regular and collaborative meetings, both internally and with the representatives of the client and requires a relatively low lift for HR leaders. Depending on the complexity of the implementation, the timeline can take anywhere from 2 weeks to 8 weeks.   The overarching sequence of our launch typically includes an extensive marketing and communications campaign to introduce One Medical and the near site clinic(s), followed by a push to encourage employees to initiate membership and enroll in the program. We typically expect utilization, both virtually and in-person, to follow shortly after.   Through e-listing, instead of sending manual eligibility files, we can automate manual census pulls, drive engagement with a better member experience and provide enhanced reporting with actionable insights. Once e-listing has been set up, we will work with your HRIS vendor to automatically receive updated eligibility files.
column73: One Medical’s standard enterprise contracts allows for annual opt out, provided we receive at least 30 days notice of termination prior to the start of the new term.
column74: We start engaging our members as soon as we go live with our offering by first communicating the scope of our services and guiding members on ways to utilize One Medical services. Once members download the app and start utilizing it, we send follow-up notes, and outreaches via app. Once members have started using the virtual care platform, they find it to be an easy and cost-effective way to seek care, so they return.
column76: One Medical for Business - Brand Guideline & Toolkit.pdf
column79: One Medical has always focused on equitable care, and in early 2021 we deepened our commitment by establishing two new clinical Domain Working Groups (DWGs)-- one focused on Health Equity and another focused on Public Health -- each consisting of six experts from our diverse provider team. These teams debate questions posed by our providers and patients and develop guidelines and educational content, which is then reviewed and approved by our Medical Advisory Council. Approved content is pushed out through our Clinical Learning systems and TOPS communication tools, and incorporated into our regular clinical and operational practices. Since its inception, our Health Equity DWG has driven dozens of initiatives ranging from addressing Covid vaccine hesitancy to managing hypertension, renal disease and cancer screening in Black patients to best practices for using interpreters/translators in our patient encounters.  We’re committed to making One Medical a place where everyone feels welcome and comfortable truly being themselves. Here are some of the ways we’re making One Medical a place for all. We value Culturally Competent Care; we are dedicated to promoting evidence, policies, and best practices on providing care that respects the diversity of our patients and the cultural factors that can affect their health. We also mandate Implicit Bias Training; every employee receives implicit bias training to help people better recognize their own unconscious biases so they can work toward eliminating them. We’ve also incorporated DEI commitment in our Hiring Processes; We’ve implemented systems to limit bias in the interview and hiring process.    There is a rich level of additional detail available on our website - we share with members the commitments we have made to provide equitable and sensitive care, and also share member and provider stories. Examples can be found here https://www.onemedical.com/services/lgbtq/ and also on our blog https://onemedical.com/blog/healthy-living/shift-stress-management-experience-dc, which outlines some of the BIPOC-focused stress management programs we offer at no cost to our members.
column82: One Medical has established a requirement for clients to enable an automated eligibility file feed via SFTP. This file feed is typically set up within an HRIS and operates on a weekly cadence. For authentication, the client will generate an SSH key pair and use the private key to access their designated SFTP directory. The file itself will adhere to a specific template with required data fields for both eligible employees and dependents, including but not limited to: first name, last name, DOB, work email, zip code, unique id, etc.
column92: We offer quarterly reporting on enrollment, utilization and experience by key services (onsite/nearsite vs. virtual) but there is no admin website that the data can be pulled from. Based on the key metrics for in-office engagement, virtual service utilization, and average time saved, we can estimate potential cost savings for clients. Other sample metrics available in reporting include utilization by visit type (e.g., in-office vs. virtual vs. phlebotomy visits), virtual utilization by type (e.g., Rx renewal vs. video), top categories of health concerns (pre-wellness visit or virtual treatment topic), patient booking behavior, virtual after hours use, patient satisfaction score, verbatim member feedback. Please note that regular reporting is available for clients with 500 EEs+ only; others available ad hoc. For clients with 1,000 EEs+, we leverage our reporting to identify strategic priorities/initiatives that One Medical and client can drive jointly to achieve better employee engagement, experience, and health outcomes.
column101: One Medical engages our members to be happier, healthy, and more engaged. By establishing ourselves as a healthcare home base and driving higher engagement with primary care, One Medical clients see lower downstream healthcare costs, reductions in ER and Urgent Care utilization, and reduction of hospital stays.    Key areas of support through in-office and virtual care include:  Colds, flu, COVID-19, and other illnesses Skin issues  Minor injuries Allergies Headaches Urinary tract infections Annual physical (Live Well Visit) Mental health, depression, and anxiety Chronic conditions Sexual health (Testing, IUDs, etc.) Onsite labs Wellness and prevention   24/7 Virtual and Scheduled Remote Care: App-based, on-demand Video Chat and messaging, along with prescription renewal requests or scheduled primary care visits, with an employees’ chosen doctor, over video.   Deferred Care and Population Health: Members are putting much more importance on their health and the health of their families, and they expect their companies to support them on their journey.   Compassionate, Non-judgmental Care: We believe healthcare should be inclusive, comprehensive, and available to all.  That’s why we’ve created a new kind of primary practice.   Integrated Behavioral Health: Mindset by One Medical is a longitudinal care model that integrates evidence-based behavioral health solutions within primary care to address whole-person health. One Medical’s behavioral health services include virtual therapy and coaching, virtual group wellness series, and lifestyle and prescription management.    Chronic Disease Management: Impact by One Medical’s dynamic care model helps improve health outcomes for patients with, or at risk of developing, chronic conditions. Our providers act as the care quarterback for our patients, diagnosing and treating chronic conditions. Patients enrolled in the Impact program have an extended care team dedicated to personalizing their care journey through preventive, high-touch engagement.   Cancer Screening and Prevention: Focused on personalized, integrated care and preventive screening for earlier detection of cancer and better patient outcomes.   Women’s Health and Family Planning: One Medical’s Providers deliver longitudinal, relationship-based care for those who identify as women, taking a personalized approach to help inform testing decisions and specialty referrals.    Additional information can be found at www.onemedical.com/services.
column104: One Medical is not a health plan and therefore is not subject to ERISA.
column107: One Medical is a network of providers, not a health plan that might be subject to COBRA. That said, some of our customers who incorporate OM in their benefits have extended OM to their employees as part of COBRA. One Medical has no issue with this practice and will support.
column118: One Medical does not give tax advice to our clients, but the vast majority of our clients have not found that the One Medical offering is a taxable fringe benefit.  While One Medical is not a health plan, it is perhaps analogized to a health plan for the purpose of this analysis, resulting in the conclusion that membership should not be a taxable fringe benefit.
column119: If there are questions or concerns raised by a benefit team, One Medical can always bring our legal or compliance team in as resources to address.

column40: What sets Progyny apart:   Proven outcomes for seven years (since founding). With Progyny, members are more likely to achieve their dream: a healthy baby. Progyny's comprehensive, equitable benefit allows members to pursue the most effective treatment and achieve optimal outcomes in a cost-efficient manner. This results in faster time to pregnancy, fewer miscarriages, and healthier singleton births, thereby reducing high-risk maternity and NICU expenses.   Network of directly contracted top providers. Progyny has curated the nation's largest network of top reproductive endocrinologists and reproductive urologists, including 950+ providers in 650+ locations and providing an unparalleled level of quality, access, and convenience for members. Progyny contracts and manages all of its providers, and has a continuous patient data exchange, enabling a transparent view into all outcomes so employers can see a true ROI, and member support can be clinically integrated with outbound support at key times of the family building journey.   Member-centric approach. Progyny provides personalized, dedicated support and top-quality care that helps members achieve better outcomes and reduce the stress that’s inherent in the fertility journey. Throughout their journey, members are supported by a dedicated PCA, who reaches out at key times to offer support, guidance, and resources via both phone, message and through digital companion tools. Members save time and stress – they never need to spend time in a doctor’s billing office or spending time seeing how much they can afford, as Progyny covers care in the same manner as employers cover other complex medical conditions. This also reduces the stigma around fertility, which can arise when it is provided with a dollar cap benefit.
column42: The Progyny solution is available to self-insured employers with a minimum requirement of 1,000 benefit enrolled employees and fully insured employers with a minimum of 500 benefit eligible employees.
column43: Our fee structure is utilization-based to align price and value.    A nominal administrative population based PEPM fee is paid by the client to Progyny. This fee allows all members to use the services of Progyny’s Patient Care Advocates (PCAs), digital tools, and preconception support, regardless of whether they continue on to fertility treatment. Progyny’s services support all paths to family building, including support for the navigation of adoption and surrogacy. This also includes support for patients who do not progress to fertility treatments. Progyny’s experience is that 50% of members who engage with a PCA don’t move on to treatment.   The client pays for the actual utilization of fertility treatment services by its members. Progyny bills the employer for such services in accordance with Progyny’s unique bundled case rates, which vary by the service rendered and the clinic location. Progyny’s bundled case rates include all physician and laboratory fees and all of Progyny’s Care Management services (concierge PCA services, optimized plan design, network access and management, outcomes reporting, full-service account management, integrated fertility medication program, digital tools, etc.).   Progyny also offers the following add-on programs:  - Progyny menopause and midlife care is available as an add-on for a nominal $0.10 PEPM and $75-$250 per visit (member average ~3 visits).   - Progyny pregnancy and postpartum can be elected as an add on for a $500 case rate per engaged member annually, which includes support through pregnancy and 6 months postpartum.  -Progyny+ is available as an add-on for $110 per engaged participant per month, plus claims.
column54: Members have 24/7 access to our member app, which includes features such as scheduling an appointment with their PCA or clinical educator and real-time tracking of Rx deliveries which will allow a member to track the delivery to their door. The member can contact their dedicated PCA via phone or secure messaging Monday through Friday, 9:00 am to 9:00 pm ET. Based on our experience and book of business (which includes large populations of members in all US time zones), we have not seen the need for expanded hours.   Outside of business hours, members can leave a voicemail or send their PCA an email or secure message which will be returned promptly the next business day. Due to the non-emergent nature of fertility treatments, we have not seen a need for 24/7 access to our Patient Care Advocates.     For members who have Progyny Rx fertility medication coverage, they can access a pharmacy clinician for any questions related to medications and administration 24/7. Members also always have 24/7 access to the Member Portal, which includes educational articles and videos, as well as a real-time overview of their benefit and details on the member's fertility journey.
column55: Progyny prides itself on a supportive, comprehensive member experience. A member’s journey with Progyny begins with an initial call with a PCA onboarding specialist. Through our unique MemberMatch program, members are paired with their perfect PCA based on their individual needs, preferences, and situation. Progyny’s PCAs are nurses, doulas, embryologists, andrologists, clinical psychologists and other experts that are trained to provide members on their family building journey with education, clinical guidance and emotional support.    A member’s dedicated PCA verifies eligibility (in real-time) and activates the member on the Progyny Member Portal. After an initial onboarding conversation personalized to the member’s needs (typically 20+ minutes), they receive a comprehensive Progyny Member Guide for reference. Members who are trying to conceive are enrolled in our preconception program; for members that require treatment, the PCA will help the member navigate the fertility journey by first finding the right provider fit within our network of premier clinics. Members can also contact the provider directly or search on www.progyny.com/findaprovider.    Progyny members have access to our app and can reach their PCAs via phone and secure messaging. The member app includes educational articles and videos, as well as a real-time overview of the Progyny benefit and details on the member's fertility journey, Smart Cycle allowance, and out of pocket responsibility in one centralized location. Members can also schedule calls with their PCAs at a time that works well for them, and they can track their Rx deliveries in real time right to their doorstep.    A member's dedicated PCA leads their care team and can bring in additional PCAs to be part of a member's care team, including PCA doulas, surrogacy and adoption coaches, and clinical educators, depending on the member's fertility and family building journey and needs.  Members have over 15 interactions with their PCA during their treatment on average. PCAs help to educate members about the Progyny benefit as well as existing employer benefits; they assist with the coordination of appointments and records; they educate members throughout preconception, prenatal, pregnancy, and postpartum.    Progyny’s model is inbound and outbound, enhancing the member experience and ensuring continuity. The PCA proactively makes outbound outreach to check in with the member at critical points throughout the duration of treatment (e.g., when she begins her injections, after embryo transfer, or a pregnancy test result).
column56: PCAs   Progyny’s PCAs are nurses, doulas, embryologists, andrologists, clinical psychologists and ​other experts who are trained to provide members on their family building journey with education, clinical guidance, and emotional support. They have at least the following minimum credentials: a bachelor’s degree or requisite occupational experience either in a fertility clinic or working with insurance companies in a care management role. Clinical Care Coordinators must have at least five years of clinical nursing experience in the fertility industry and a current nursing (RN) license in good standing. The PCA team has a monthly requirement for continuing education on innovations in the fertility industry and on service delivery.     Network Providers   Progyny has rigorous network inclusion standards. In addition to review of outcomes data as reported to the CDC, providers must meet our network standards in order to be included as a network provider:  Board certified in Obstetrics and Gynecology and subspecialty training through accredited fellowship in reproductive endocrinology and infertility (REI)*   - Medical Director: subspecialty board certified in reproductive endocrinology and infertility (REI)*, be an active candidate for REI board certification or grandfathered   - Physicians must complete Progyny’s credentialing process and be approved by the credentialing committee to ensure providers meet NCQA Standards   - Reports to Society for Assisted Reproductive Technology (SART) &/or the CDC   - Follows American Society for Reproductive Medicine (ASRM) Guidelines   - Embryology lab is accredited by CAP, Joint Commission, or similar   - Offers pre-implantation genetic testing (PGT) across the patient population   - Uses vitrification as the cryopreservation method   - Performs a minimum of 100 assisted reproductive technology (ART) cycles annually   - Contractually agrees to provide clinical outcomes to Progyny monthly     *with limited exception for grandfathered (in accordance with SART) or for foreign training equivalent    Our menopause provider network includes MDs, DOs, RDNs, PAs and NPs with the following minimum credentialing requirements:  - Active state license (in each state of practice)   - Active Board Certification in specialty applicable to Progyny (in each state of practice)  - DEA or CDS (in each state of practice) OR DEA/CDS waiver form signed
column67: Progyny has developed a streamlined and simplified implementation process as we understand that our clients have many other priorities. We find that, on average, implementation can be accomplished over the course of five weeks, requiring only one implementation status call per week.   Each client has a designated Implementation Manager who will be their point-of-contact throughout the implementation process. This implementation manager will guide, consult, and provide benchmark information on decision points throughout the implementation process. The client's team will be asked to join a kickoff call and four status calls, finalize plan designs, and share carrier and other benefit partner contacts. Our team manages the rest, including carrier integration and transition of care, coordination with other benefit partners, suggested SBC and SPD language, and member communication materials. Clients are not required to be on vendor or carrier integration calls.
column73: Progyny's standard initial contract term is 3 years. Our template agreement contains an evergreen provision to automatically renew for additional twelve month renewal terms. A client may elect to not renew the contract upon 90 days written notice effective at the end of the current term.
column74: Over the past seven years, Progyny has created a best-in-class communications strategy that is customized for each client to optimize outreach and engagement. As part of our standard materials, Progyny provides a benefit overview flyer, cobranded benefit overview video, and the Progyny Member Guide. We also provide a digital postcard, which is an easy way to share customized materials with a client's employees. All of this is provided at no cost to the client.   Members receive the Progyny Member Guide when they activate their benefit with their dedicated PCA. This guide is customized to the client and provides all the information a member needs to utilize their benefit: specific coverage information, financial responsibilities, explanation of covered treatments and services, adoption and surrogacy reimbursement processes, Progyny Rx details, and frequently asked questions.    We recommend posting these materials on the company intranet if possible and sending them via email during open enrollment season. Both the flyer and video provide an introduction to the Progyny benefit and direct members to call their PCA.   We also recommend the following activities to increase awareness of a client's new comprehensive fertility and family building coverage:   - Send Progyny-provided email announcement introducing the benefits. We recommend sending to all eligible employees at go live and including the link to the digital postcard or benefit overview video.   - Send printed benefit announcement poster to all physical locations. These are displayed in breakrooms and spread general awareness about the Progyny benefit.   - Send cobranded postcard to 28–44-year-old employees on an eligible plan notifying them of their new benefits.   - Offer at least one benefit overview webinar. The 45-minute webinar goes over the Progyny benefit and client-specific coverage. It includes a Q+A section with a Progyny PCA so members can ask anonymous questions. Progyny provides a PDF poster with a registration link. We recommend including it in an email promoting the event ~3 weeks before. A recording will be available after the event.   - Offer a fertility 101 educational webinar featuring a network provider. Although we offer events on several different topics, we recommend starting with a fertility 101 event to educate members on the basics of fertility and family building, including an explanation of their Progyny coverage. The webinar includes a Q+A section with a local fertility specialist so members can ask anonymous questions. Progyny provides a PDF poster with a registration link. We recommend including it in an email promoting the event ~3 weeks before. A recording will be available after the event.   This communication strategy is reviewed during implementation and customized as needed.
column79: The Progyny solution was designed to provide inclusive, comprehensive, and equitable care to support a diverse population. Our mission is to make everyone’s dream of parenthood come true through a healthy, timely, and supported fertility and family building journey.   Benefit design: The Progyny benefit helps reduce care inequities; for example, we do not require a medical diagnosis of infertility in order to access care. Contrary to our approach, traditional health plans typically require a medical diagnosis of infertility before allowing members access to treatment coverage. A medical diagnosis typically means six to twelve months of unsuccessful, unprotected, heterosexual intercourse. This requirement means LGBTQ+ individuals, LGBTQ+ couples, and single parents by choice are prohibited from accessing benefit coverage. We also cover tissue freezing that is beneficial for trans members who want to preserve fertility prior to beginning hormone therapy.   Race-related disparities in fertility and maternal health, especially among Black women, are also prevalent. Compared to white women, Black women are twice as likely to suffer from infertility but half as likely to access care, regardless of their socioeconomic status (CDC, 2014). While there are many reasons Black women may not be getting the care they need, Progyny understands that providing comprehensive coverage and access to high-quality care is a key step in reducing health disparities and helping members get the treatment they deserve. Progyny addresses racial and ethnic disparities by covering screening for monogenic disorders like Sickle Cell Disease (1 in 13 Black Americans of African descent carry the Sickle Cell trait), Tay Sachs, or Cystic Fibrosis.   Progyny’s benefit design utilizes the Smart Cycle instead of dollar-based plans, as dollar-based plans have been shown to drive inequities in care and fail to positively impact outcomes. Dollar-cap plans are not best practice for complex medical care. They can be discriminatory, burdensome for members, and ultimately cause an increase in total cost for the employer. For example, dollar-cap plans cause more stress and anxiety because they drive a scarcity mindset as members are required to fill out a financial attestation, spend time with billing coordinators, figure out how much services will cost, and keep track of care and cost all on their own. Additionally, dollar-based benefits are inequitable, as different people need different treatments, levels of medication, and based on their home geography, some people may be able to afford more treatment than others. Lastly, by covering fertility with a dollar-based benefit as opposed to covering it similarly to how employers cover other complex medical care, it furthers the stigma around fertility that it is “different.”     Member care and support: Our PCAs are trained to support cultural and racial diversity in their roles and are required to complete trainings from in-network Progyny providers on fertility and maternity within BIPOC and LGBTQ+ communities. Progyny's PCAs also provide resources to members, including referrals to community organizations who specialize in support for LGBTQ+, single parents by choice, and BIPOC individuals, such as The Broken Brown Egg (https://thebrokenbrownegg.org/). Members have the option to request a BIPOC PCA as well, and Progyny offers webinars and podcast episodes providing education, support, and guidance for diverse members, which can be found at: https://progyny.com/education/podcast     Similarly, Progyny’s network of fertility specialists – reproductive endocrinologists and reproductive urologists – are vetted to ensure they are providing culturally responsive care and LGBTQ+ inclusive services. Every quarter, we review outcomes for both a rolling 12-month and 24-month period and host a discussion with our providers on how they are trending as well as how they have performed compared to peers. Progyny’s Medical Advisory Board, comprised of leading reproductive endocrinologists across the US, ensures that our plan design recognizes the unique needs and cultural differences in approach to treatment that members might require.    A member’s dedicated PCA can assist them with finding an in-network provider who will meet their desired characteristics (including preferred gender, race, and language) and unique needs. To complement this personalized PCA support, we also have a robust provider search tool members can use. Members can access detailed information about providers and clinics, including demographic data, practice characteristics, specialties and areas of interest, languages spoken, and services available at the clinic. We are dedicated to empowering members to make the best choices for themselves – and this is much easier when you connect to and feel comfortable with your provider.   All support, guidance, and care is based on and tailored to the member's unique journey, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, racial identity, or personal care preferences.   Member communications and education: During implementation, Progyny will ensure that our communication strategies support a client’s diverse population. We regularly partner with our clients’ various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to reach targeted populations likely to benefit from learning about their fertility and family building coverage. For example, we can bring a Progyny network provider in to discuss family building options specific to LGBTQ+ individuals, including reciprocal IVF and surrogacy. Progyny also provides ongoing curated member education (webinar, articles, blogs, podcasts, videos) throughout the year focused on various topics such as infertility in the BIPOC community or family building for LGBTQ+ and single parents by choice.   Corporate efforts: Progyny acknowledges that we cannot just focus on helping members build their families for today. Our work must also create a fair and just future. Health disparities in fertility and maternal health continue and we are dedicated to providing support to our staff, members, and employer clients to close the gaps. We are doing this through the establishment of Progyny's Social Justice Committee and Allies groups that inform not just our corporate strategy but our solution, dedicated training and education for our Member Services team, and targeted member education to enhance benefit awareness and access. Progyny publishes its CSR report (which can be found at https://investors.progyny.com/static-files/5654fe7d-3287-47d8-96ae-bfb0223fbb70). The report outlines the work Progyny is doing and its commitment to people, diversity, and inclusion.
column81: During the implementation process, Progyny will request a sample dataset from each health plan to test our eligibility connectivity through Availity. This testing is best practice, and the goal is to confirm that Progyny PCAs can submit a request for eligibility and receive a real-time response that includes eligibility and accumulators.
column91: Although the Member Portal has the capability to support SSO to allow Member access via an Employee Portal or another vendor, the portal’s infrastructure supports only one method of authentication. Activating SSO prevents members from accessing the Member Portal via login page(member.progyny.com).   For employers who require SSO on the Portal, the following should also be considered:   - If SSO access for a Member to the Member Portal is terminated, the Member will no longer be able to access claims history using the Portal. The Member would be required to contact Progyny directly via email/phone.   - SSO may prevent members from using their preferred email address (e.g. personal email instead of work email).   - Members frequently prefer not to send their personal health information to their work email address.   - This creates a security vulnerability if employee email addresses are recycled.   - SSO through an employer intranet may prevent Dependent from accessing the Member Portal   - This creates privacy concerns as the users will lose control over who can access their personal health records.
column92: Progyny’s quarterly and annual client reporting is designed to give our clients a full view of how their fertility dollars are being utilized, clinical results, and member satisfaction. Beyond typical performance metrics, we provide details on a quarterly and annual basis that include:   - The overall utilization rate of the benefit and utilization rates by specific treatment type, including member average age   - Aggregate dollars spent on each treatment type and the average cost of each specific treatment   - Member satisfaction scores on Patient Care Advocate quality, the overall Progyny benefit, provider satisfaction, and Net Promoter Score (NPS)   - Detailed clinical outcomes by treatment type collected from actual medical records (rather than inferred from claims data)   - Utilization of key technologies, such as PGT-A (formerly called PGS) and single embryo transfer (SET)   - Patient volume by network clinic   Progyny is the only solution to receive actual outcomes from providers across our entire network. This detailed level of reporting allows clients to fully assess the value they are receiving from the Progyny program. Most importantly, they will understand the specific services they are paying for and what value they produce (in terms of clinical outcomes and member satisfaction). We believe we're the only fertility vendor offering performance guarantees based on outcomes (while many vendors offer none or only focus on customer service). We're able to do this because of our individualized treatment cycle reporting with providers.   On a yearly basis, Progyny will also convene an annual review that analyzes benefit utilization, treatment mix, spend, and outcomes. Member experience with both Progyny and providers will be shared and recommendations for future member communications will be discussed. The annual review culminates with a Summary of Value document that will enable the client's team to articulate how the Progyny benefit helped members meet their dreams of having a family, how it reduced spend, and how the benefit mitigated high-risk maternity and NICU claims. Progyny can also create ad hoc reports at no additional cost.    These reports are shared with clients by their Account Manager and cannot be pulled from an admin website.
column101: Our core care management services include:           A full suite of fertility treatment options   With Progyny's benefit, members have access to a full suite of fertility treatment options which include (but may not be limited to):   - Intrauterine Insemination / Artificial Insemination (IUI)  - Elective and medically necessary cryopreservation of oocytes and sperm (egg and sperm freezing)  - FDA Bloodwork and Testing  - Pre-conception carrier screening  - Fresh IVF Cycle  - IVF Freeze-All  - Frozen Embryo Transfer (FET)  - Frozen Oocyte Transfer (FOT) fertilization of previously frozen oocytes and transfer  - Pre-Transfer Embryology Services (embryo creation to support surrogacy journey)  - PGT-A (PGS, or Pre-implantation Genetic Screening) to assess embryo viability  - PGT-M (PGD, or Pre-implantation Genetic Diagnosis) to screen for monogenic disorders  - Assisted Hatching (AH)  - Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection (ICSI)  - Purchase of donor tissue (eggs and sperm)  - Testicular Sperm Extraction (TESE), Testicular Sperm Aspiration (TESA), Microscopic Epididymal Sperm Extraction (MESA)  - Annual Tissue Storage (egg/sperm/embryo)  - Pre-authorized fertility medications (via Progyny Rx)        Access to the highest quality network of providers with rigorous oversight   Progyny has curated the nation’s largest network of fertility specialists – reproductive endocrinologists and reproductive urologists – including key opinion leaders and world-renowned fertility experts. We adhere to rigorous credentialing thresholds for inclusion in our network, and our network providers utilize the latest technologies and best practices. Our network includes 950+ providers in 650+ locations, providing an unparalleled level of quality, access, and convenience for members. Progyny also requires its network providers to directly submit treatment outcomes in real-time as actionable fertility treatment outcomes data cannot be accurately obtained from medical claims.    Concierge Patient Care Advocate (PCA) services starting with preconception support and coaching   Members are assigned a dedicated PCA who provides preconception and fertility guidance and emotional support throughout their entire journey to parenthood, including adoption and surrogacy. Progyny PCAs are reproductive health experts, registered nurses, and other fertility specialists trained to provide highly personalized service across each member’s unique fertility and family-building journey (including surrogacy and adoption). Coaching and guidance starts with a robust preconception program, enabling members to achieve healthy pregnancies. On average, PCAs engage with a member over 15 times during treatment. Progyny PCAs achieve a world-class Net Promoter Score (NPS) of +82. If a member does require fertility care, their PCA continues supporting them throughout their entire journey.    Comprehensive and equitable plan design    Our innovative fertility benefit design simplifies the member experience and provides access to state-of-the-art treatment options without any barriers to accessing care. The Smart Cycle is Progyny’s easy-to-understand benefit currency, supporting all paths to parenthood (including adoption, surrogacy, donor tissue, single parents by choice, etc.) Unlike traditional fee-for-service carrier models, everything needed for a comprehensive fertility treatment is bundled within the Smart Cycle, including all necessary diagnostic testing and the latest technology (such as PGT-A, ICSI, etc.), and there are no mandatory requirements that discriminate against LGBTQ+ individuals. Our Smart Cycle design also eliminates the discriminatory impact of dollar-cap designs.    Male factor fertility support     One-third of the time infertility is male factor, and Progyny’s comprehensive benefit supports every individual, no matter their gender. Progyny has curated a network of top reproductive urologists to support members who produce sperm. Progyny’s PCAs are trained to support those with male factor infertility, providing support and guidance on their fertility journey. Progyny also has a partnership with Legacy for at-home testing services, and our Smart Cycle comprehensively covers services for those with male factor infertility, such as prenatal labs, infectious disease testing, and preconception carrier screening.    Adoption and surrogacy support    Surrogacy and adoption support are an integrated part of Progyny’s offering. Members have unlimited access to dedicated PCA adoption and surrogacy coaches for comprehensive support, guidance, and education. The Smart Cycle benefit design also allows members pursuing surrogacy to use their benefit for pre-transfer embryology services, including egg retrieval (from a covered member), diagnostic testing, fertilization, embryo monitoring, and preimplantation genetic testing.     Integrated fertility medication program    Progyny provides integrated fertility medication coverage, Progyny Rx, for clients that utilize our fertility benefits solution. This solution provides our members with access to the medications needed during their treatment. Progyny Rx reduces dispensing and delivery time to two days to eliminate the risk of missed treatment cycles. We provide phone-based, clinical education and support seven days a week to ensure our members understand any necessary medication storage requirements and administration techniques, including injection training. Progyny Rx provides unit cost savings for our employer clients and an additional 10% savings from our waste management protocols.       Pregnancy, postpartum, menopause and primary care support (optional add-on programs)   Progyny offers extended support and care for members as they continue their journey through pregnancy, postpartum through midlife and menopause. Rather than members needing to start a new relationship with a different benefit provider, employers that opt-in to extended programs can enable members to continue their deep Progyny relationship for comprehensive navigation and access to expert care for their individualized health needs.   Progyny's pregnancy and postpartum care engages members across the pregnancy and postpartum journey, with coaching from pregnancy and postpartum experts, timely education and tracking, wraparound digital tools, and more – all with the goal of targeting high risk pregnancies, c-sections, and NICU admissions. Members receive unlimited access to maternity and postpartum experts and coaches who also support return to work, lactation, etc. Given the average age that members go through infertility treatment, many fertility members are considered high-risk pregnancies, so our pregnancy program enables clients to reach the most high-risk pregnancies on day one to reduce the likelihood of high-cost maternity claims, long patient recovery times, NICU visits, etc.    Progyny also offers Progyny+, a holistic primary care program where members with underlying health conditions that can make it hard to conceive or navigate a healthy pregnancy receive personalized primary care physician support, both virtually and in person. This program focuses on the member’s health from the PCP perspective, enabling them to manage and mitigate any underlying health conditions, be more likely to achieve a healthy pregnancy, and be supported through postpartum to enable a successful return to work.   Our menopause and midlife care connects members to leading network partners for virtual integrative care and hormonal and non-hormonal treatment. Members will have access to clinicians (OB/GYNs, MDs, and NPs) who are specialized in perimenopause, menopause, and midlife care for personalized treatment plans that help them manage their symptoms and take preventative steps.    Surrogacy and adoption reimbursement administration (optional add-on service)  Progyny can help clients configure a surrogacy and/or adoption reimbursement program or take over the administration of an existing program if desired.   Fertility preservation (optional add-on service)  Individuals may need to preserve their fertility for many reasons, including advanced age, injury, cancer treatment, transgender care, or other underlying diagnoses affecting fertility. Our clients can include elective and medically necessary fertility preservation coverage on a pre-tax or post-tax basis within their Smart Cycle plan design. Progyny standardly includes one year of tissue storage within each applicable Smart Cycle. Clients can choose to add additional years of tissue storage.   Donor tissue services (optional add-on service)  For members needing to purchase donor tissue (eggs or sperm), these services can be coordinated and covered under the Progyny benefit.     Doula reimbursement (optional add-on service)    Progyny offers a doula financial assistance program for which a member can be reimbursed for eligible expenses up to the established reimbursement limit. PCAs also provide support for members who are looking to find a doula for their pregnancy as well as postpartum doulas (from a vetted doula network/collaboratives). Studies have shown that families who have the continuous support of a doula have fewer medical interventions, shorter labors, lower caesarean rates, and overall, a more enjoyable birth experience.
column103: Progyny has an in-house legal staff with healthcare and regulatory expertise. We track federal and state regulations and guidance using a number of compliance platforms and we regularly engage specialty counsel to advise on compliance. Progyny's legal team has compliance expertise to assist clients with their benefit design, including any questions around taxation, ACA amendments, ERISA requirements, or COBRA regulations, or any other compliance questions that may arise. As an example, the most recent federal transparency requirements set forth in the Consolidated Appropriations Act and the No Surprises Act contain numerous provisions that affect group health plans. As a TPA, Progyny already has compliant resources that are included in its standard offering. As part of our on-going compliance and regulatory model, we will continue to stay ahead of changes on behalf of our clients to ensure ease of compliance with these surprise billing and transparency standards as these rules phase in over the next four years.
column106: If a member leaves their employer or loses coverage, the member will need to elect COBRA to continue the Progyny benefit.  Progyny's legal team has compliance expertise to assist clients with their benefit design, including any questions around taxation, ACA amendments, ERISA requirements, or COBRA regulations, or any other compliance questions that may arise.
