column73: Following the initial term, the contract automatically renews for a 12-month term unless either party provides written confirmation of their intent to terminate with at least 90 days' notice. We would be happy to discuss termination language and develop mutually agreeable timelines.
column74: We work with each customer to create a tailored launch and year-round marketing plan, equipping them with member materials and messaging to integrate into internal communications. In addition, Spring Health communicates directly to employees through email, home mailers, and more at launch and throughout the year. We also provide HR and manager training to equip managers with the knowledge and information to recognize mental health needs and refer employees to the right resources.  We have deployed strategies that engage a diverse workforce, from front-line workers to knowledge workers, including:  Executive leadership email — Communications from leaders promoting and emphasizing the Spring Health benefit. We have found that executive endorsement helps motivate employees and can be served in many meaningful mediums (e.g., town halls, video messages, memos, print materials, etc.). Leveraging managers/HR managers — For many employees, their main source of information is their manager, so arming managers with information and talking points is key to a successful rollout. Our team will lead training sessions focused on getting managers familiar with the Spring Health benefit and how to refer employees. We also provide managers with talking points, handouts, and exercises to use at group meetings. Leveraging wellness champions or resource groups — Promoting the benefit through these channels helps others tell the story of Spring Health. We provide employee resource groups with materials relevant to their community and/or purpose to help ensure these employees are aware of key attributes of Spring Health — such as our diverse provider network — that will encourage engagement among their population. Home mailers and electronic/print materials — Home mailers help engage not only the employee but family members as well and are especially relevant for people who do not access a computer during work. Flyers, posters, electronic signage, and wallet cards that have a QR code directing members to the Spring Health portal make it easy for members to enroll quickly and seamlessly. Additional partnership and communication around open enrollment have proven to be impactful. Spring Health Benefit Overview — These employee webinar sessions provide a detailed overview of Spring Health benefits, from either an employee or manager perspective, and can be recorded and shared internally for future use. Email campaigns — Activation emails directing employees to the Spring Health portal are an effective way to help people take action when they are ready. Year-round webinars and small group therapy sessions — Employees have year-round access to support employees throughout the year with Community WellSprings, our optional small group sessions, and monthly events and resources on topics such as grief, friendship, substance use, and more. On-site visits — Booths at key locations for hard-to-reach employee populations and/or attendance at in-person benefit fairs and Open Enrollment are also helpful.  Furthermore, we consistently experiment with innovative communication strategies to optimize our engagement and impact.
column79: One of our core values is “Embrace Diverse Teams and Perspectives: We find strength in diversity of cultural backgrounds, ideas, and experiences.” This value is embedded into our culture and something we celebrate.  We promote DE&I in the following ways:  - Experienced Staff: Our counselors are adept at supporting each caller as a unique individual with unique care/communication needs. They run specialized searches for members looking for providers of specific ethnicities, backgrounds, or specialties.   - Curated, Diverse Network: 80% of our Care Navigation team is BIPOC (5x the national average), 47% of our provider network is BIPOC (3x the national average), 23% of providers identify as Black (6x the national average), and 8% of providers identify as Asian (2x the national average). We use real-time data to ensure our provider network continually represents member populations.  - Enhanced Searchability: Our platform has 25 provider filters based on various conditions, ethnicities/backgrounds, and specialties  - Equipped Providers: We partner with Violet to improve access to inclusive care. Violet benchmarks providers' cultural competency and provides upskilling pathways to increase their ability to deliver culturally competent care.  As part of our strategy to enhance engagement and overall well-being, we also focus on leveraging wellness champions or resource groups. We promote the benefit through these channels to help others tell the story of Spring Health. We provide employee resource groups with materials relevant to their community and/or purpose to help ensure these employees are aware of key attributes of Spring Health — such as our diverse provider network — that will encourage engagement among the population. For example, we can work directly with client ERGs to provide content, trainings, and community sessions around cultural and ethnic diversity, such as Black Mental Health, and Healing Sessions for Asian Hate.
column82: The eligibility file must include the following minimum data elements:  - employee first and last name - date of birth - corporate email address (if available) - home city - home state
column91: We offer SSO in 2 ways: - Through our channel partners (e.g., Virgin Pulse) - Through a client's current identity provider  There is a one-time fee for SSO integration. We are happy to work with Sequoia and each client to discuss the feasibility of SSO and integrating with your ecosystem as we continue our partnership.
column92: Spring Health provides bi-weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports. Our bi-weekly reporting allows you to keep a pulse on how your population is using the benefit and improving clinically. In addition, Spring Health will also dedicate Data Science and Account Management resources that will work with you to create quarterly reports that fit your company's customized needs, including, but not limited to, utilization by sessions, dependents, external resources/referrals, and primary issues/reasons.   Our Customer Success team will deliver quarterly business reviews and bi-weekly engagement and performance reports. We report on a variety of engagement metrics, including completion of intake assessments, receipt of individualized treatment plans, and time for therapy appointments. We provide reporting on member utilization of Care Navigators, diagnosis breakdown, therapy sessions, medication management visits, recovery rates, treatment outcomes, and time to recovery. In addition to our reporting frequency, our Customer Success/Strategic Account Management team will review performance guarantees on a quarterly and annual basis.  We also provide Atlas, a self-service data administration dashboard, that surfaces relevant insights from your data in real-time and pairs those insights with clear guidance on actions to be taken for maximum impact. Atlas will be coupled with subject matter expert support to help clients act on insights based on data-driven recommendations.
column101: Spring Health offers the following:  - Digital Mental Health Platform: proprietary assessment, personalized care plan, scheduling tools, learning center, moments (CBT library), mobile app, Care Support, and 24/7 Crisis Support.  - Care Network: Care Navigation, referral concierge, care quality management toolkit, network referrals, plan design, Client Specific Network, therapy, coaching, medication management, tobacco cessation, and SUD program. - Organizational Support: Unlimited management consultations, formal referrals, informal referrals, rapid response content delivery, CIR, FFD, SAP referral, and in-house clinicians. - Member Activation & Engagement: launch toolkit, virtual training and programming, virtual benefits overview, community WellSprings, on-site events, engagement toolkits, and communication packages. - Work-Life Services: elder care, prenatal and postnatal care, summer care, travel and relocation resources, childcare, education, pet care, wellness, special needs, household services, adoption, and parenting resources.  - Legal Assistance: divorce/custody, criminal, estate planning/wills/trusts, real estate, landlord/tenant, bankruptcy, personal injury/malpractice, debtor/creditor, adoption, probate. - Financial Assistance: bankruptcy counseling, budgeting, buying a home for the first time, major life event planning, college fund planning, credit card debt, retirement planning, foreclosure prevention, and identity theft prevention.
column104: Spring Health has structured its EAP services to comply with the 4 criteria of an excepted benefit under the ACA and ERISA in the following ways:  - The services Spring Health provides do not require employees to pay premiums or contributions to participate in Spring Health's EAP.  - We do not require any cost-sharing. We do not coordinate these benefits with any other health plan.  - Spring Health's EAP services do not constitute "significant medical benefits."  As such, Spring Health asserts its EAP is an excepted benefit.
column106: Employers can elect to make Spring Health services COBRA-eligible. If elected, Spring Health administers COBRA benefits in line with each employer's internal policies, and we can support and extend coverage for employees no longer with the company, based on a census file of COBRA-eligible employees. For example, if the employer determines that the COBRA population is eligible for the EAP for 36 months, it would be up to the employer to collect payment for utilized sessions. There would be no additional fees associated with extending coverage to COBRA participants for 36 months.  If the employer does not elect to make Spring Health services COBRA eligible, the member's Care Navigator will work with them to coordinate care for continuing treatment.
column118: Spring Health has structured its EAP services to remain an “excepted benefit.” Excepted benefits are exempt from the market reform and certain other requirements added to ERISA and the Internal Revenue Code by the Affordable Care Act.  Spring Health must meet several elements to satisfy the requirements of an “excepted benefit” for an EAP. For our services, the analysis turns on whether Spring Health provides “significant benefits like medical care.” The government considers the “amount, scope, and duration of covered services.” Services that are limited and short-term are typically not significant.  Spring Health offers up to 2 Medication Management sessions that are employer-sponsored as part of its package. Our position is that 2 sessions with a prescriber are not enough to establish a provider-patient relationship that would trigger what might otherwise be considered “significant benefits,” consistent with applicable guidance.We rely primarily on the preamble language in the 2014 Final Rule that amended the regulations regarding excepted benefits, 79 Fed. Reg. 190, 59130 (Oct. 1, 2014).
column119: During implementation, our dedicated Implementation and Legal teams will ensure that each client's eligibility feed meets all applicable requirements under HIPAA, as well as any applicable security measures to ensure the information is transferred, maintained, and stored in a safe and fully compliant environment. Spring Health also ensures it has an ongoing relationship with all of its customers and is available to answer questions relating to compliance requirements under ERISA. Spring Health will work with each client to ensure both the client and Spring Health are comfortable with the services Spring Health provides and the ways in which the benefits are administered — ensuring they are in line with and compliant with all laws, regulations, and policies.
column124: Each client's Customer Success Manager will proactively reach out to your internal teams regularly to provide program updates and answer any compliance questions surrounding the delivery of Spring Health services. The Customer Success Manager will work cross-functionally with our in-house legal and compliance teams to provide timely, thorough responses.  Our in-house legal team is diligent in ensuring that the services delivered comply with local laws and regulations. Spring Health's in-house legal counsel and compliance department provides oversight to ensure operations are under relevant regulations. Our People team also monitors any changes to employment legislation and our legal team works to ensure compliance.

column40: Holistic Approach - one stop shop for all things well being, focusing on variety, flexibility, and inclusivity. Our in person gyms network is the largest in the world and we work with 35+ best in class premium app partners like Calm, Headspace, Strava, Lifesum, and more  Unrestricted & UNLIMITED Access - no black outs or credits. Gympassers are treated exactly the same as a normal member of any facility or app  Engagement is our North Star - together with Client Success, we create an action plan to increase participation month over month coupled with our proven communication methodology  Product - We have the largest global network of 50,000 gyms, studios, classes, apps, and trainers in the world. We offer an alternative to 100% of employees at no cost (Digital Plan).  Administration - We offer our clients a management platform to enable usage and monitor results. With best in class launch and messaging to guide HR (we get more people active than other options), we promote wellbeing and drive adoption with marketing and communications plans. 7/10 Gympassers had not had a gym membership in the past, so we are helping those who are inactive find an activity to love.  Experience - we have 10+ years of enterprise experience and have activated over 10,000 entities globally.

column56: Specific to our Client Success team, here are some qualifications of our team. Bachelor's Degree Client facing experience managing client relationships  A dynamic leader with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams Thrives working in a team environment Ability to lead team independently and with limited supervision Strong ability to coach, mentor and advise internal and external partner An excellent communicator -- interpersonal, written, and public speaking -- with superior customer service to internal and external clients. column67: We try to make implementation as easy for you and your clients as possible. For SMB clients under 500 lives, the entire contracting process can be done via our broker portal. Here, the client will find contracting documents and instructions on how to upload eligibility onto their HR portal. They will also find marketing material such as their welcome email to get the launch process in motion. Once the client signs the contract, and uploads the eligibility file feed- their plan is live. SMB clients are typically launched within 7 days of signing the contract.   For clients over 500 lives, implementation begins towards the end of the sales process. If the broker is leading the charge, we send the draft of our contract and terms and conditions to the broker to pass on to the client. We then work with the broker/client’s legal team to address any redlines with our legal team. Simultaneously, we will send any infosec documents to our tech team, and schedule any calls that are needed regarding security reviews. If the client is able to send eligibility files through our HR portal, we are able to jump right into our implementation calls (if not, we will add in a call with our tech team to discuss any integrations needed). For the implementation calls, at a minimum, we schedule 3 calls, but will schedule more if needed. The 3 calls consist of: 1) Alignment call - this call is between Gympass, Sequoia and the client to align on timing, and finalize any open items and questions 2) Intro to Client Success Call - this call is between Gympass, Sequoia (optional) and the client to discuss the launch plan and timeline. Communication needs and initial plans will be discussed on this call 3) Launch Communications Call - this call is between Gympass, Sequoia (optional) and the client to discuss the final launch timeline, approve communications and timing of the welcome email. Any last questions will be discussed here.
column74: Communication strategy is a key part of our product, and it’s extremely important to our success with any client. Simply offering the benefit is very passive and will not change behavior.  We need to be proactive on engaging their employees.  Gympass has the expertise in using marketing intelligence to tailor each communication based on user behavior with each user, we engage in a way that is personalized and highly relevant in helping them get active and find an activity to love. We avoid mass outreach and spam.
column79: Gympass believes in the power of diversity and is committed to a culture of inclusion. In the 5-Year Diversity Commitment Plan, Gympass pledged to build a more diverse company. To help Gympass achieve these goals, Gympass recently completed a voluntary Gympass Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) Survey. This survey is part of the Gympass diversity program focused on better understanding our employees’ experiences and evolving the employment process to improve equitable outcomes.
column82: As a business-to-business company, Gympass only provides its services to employees (and by extension their family members) of subscribing companies, and because of this, all processes begin by establishing and maintaining eligibility of end-users. Typically we only require Full Name, Email Address, and Employee ID. Additional optional fields available for clients for reporting. Template attached.
column91: In addition to Eligibility File exchange, Gympass supports SAML, OAuth, and JWT single sign-on (SSO) standards and a Gympass designed API as alternative ways to establish eligibility.
column92: The HR platform is a source of truth for the adoption and engagement of employees. Employers can pull data in real-time to monitor activity. Data includes enrollment rate, sign-up rate, top gym visits, visits per month, and app usage.
column101: Gympass is a SaaS platform that enables companies to extend the fitness and wellbeing programs provided to their employees. Employees and subscribing companies can use Gympass to access over 50,000 fitness facilities worldwide, an innumerable list of live stream and on-demand classes, dozens of Personal Trainers, and an ever-growing number of wellness applications. After an account is established, an employee can select from a number of plans that give them access to these services, all for a single monthly payment. This encourages employees to stay active, promotes physical fitness and well-being, and allows employees to find and stick with activities and wellness programs they love.
column104: Gympass does not qualify as an "employee welfare benefit plan" under ERISA because we do not provide the types of services that are within the scope of the statutory definition under ERISA. Specifically, we don't provide medical, surgical, or hospital care or benefits, or benefits in the event of sickness, accident, disability, death or unemployment, which is the proper scope of a plan covered by ERISA.
column107: Gympass is an intermediary service that provides our subscribers with access to affiliated partners, which included physical gyms, wellness applications, and other partners.  We are not a health plan and thus, not subject to COBRA.
column118: Gympass does not consider itself a fringe benefit. Gympass and its affiliates do not provide tax or legal advice; this answer is provided for informational purposes only.
column119: Inapplicable, as ERISA, COBRA, et al. do not apply.

column40: LearnLux’s philosophy is to offer world-class financial wellbeing programs that are independent, configurable, and holistic, paired with industry-leading white-glove Customer Success support. A few of our key strengths and differentiators include:  Supporting Diverse, Global Workforces: LearnLux provides holistic financial planning, guidance, and action to meet the needs of a diverse workforce in all phases of life. For employees of all incomes and asset levels, LearnLux is the most relatable program on the market today. By meeting each employee where they are, LearnLux members achieve impactful, measurable, financial health outcomes for the entire employee population - whether a person is just learning the basics of saving, budgeting, and credit, or is already comfortable and prosperous and looking to be better prepared for retirement or leave a legacy.  Outcomes-Driven: LearnLux is the leading outcomes-driven financial wellbeing solution. For employer partners and employees alike, LearnLux supports ROI and VOI-driven results such as reduced financial stress, improved financial behaviors, increased participation in employer-sponsored retirement plans, reduced presenteeism/absenteeism, improved employee retention and satisfaction, employee health outcomes, and more.   Advanced Reporting: LearnLux delivers robust reporting to each employer partner we serve, including custom data and insights. On a quarterly basis, your dedicated Customer Success Manager will meet to review goals, update the success plan, share engagement data, provide insights, and make recommendations. Your Customer Success Manager will review all reports and data with you and use them as the basis to gain insight into the unique needs of your employee population and design engagement and educational programs that address those individual needs.  Benefits Decision Assistance: LearnLux builds each employee a financial plan that takes their unique benefits into consideration. Custom lessons spotlight specific information about your Total Rewards offerings. With LearnLux, employers can easily link all key benefits in one place, which creates a valuable tool for employee education during onboarding, open enrollment, and qualifying life events.

A typical communication plan includes the following: Build Awareness: Digital communications via Slack/Teams/Workplace, Email, Intranet, and digital displays, signage, flyers, table tents, banners and print communications to display in common areas, press, and social media Educate: Financial tips and reminders, infographics, webinars, money minute videos, and more Motivate: Financial wellbeing programs, challenges, and rewards tied to incentive programs Engage: Designated financial wellbeing champions, highlight and share peer-to-peer employee successes Integrate: Open enrollment, benefits communication, new hire onboarding Members also receive regular ongoing communications from LearnLux about upcoming open events, including open webinars, Planner FAQ sessions, and financial wellbeing challenges.

column40: 1. Clinical-grade care is always provided by a Doctor of Physical Therapy As a fundamental business imperative, Sword matches every member with one of our Doctors of Physical Therapy (DPTs) to guide them through every step of their therapeutic journey. This is the safest and best option because only a DPT has the knowledge and experience needed to diagnose members at enrollment, monitor their performance ongoing, and resolve their sources of pain in the long-term.   2. Real-time feedback for all joints and conditions Sword’s FDA-listed device (our Digital Therapist) is required to meet a level of clinical and technological reliability, precision, and efficiency that non FDA-listed tech are not. Sword uses both sensors and computer vision to capture movement with high precision, taking 25 measurements per second, and providing up to 5,000 different types of feedback, teaching the member precisely how to perform their exercises while sending a wealth of clinical data to the member's Sword DPT.  3. Every member receives a tailored therapeutic program Each care program is designed around the unique member’s specific MSK condition, their movement requirements both at work and in their personal lives, and their individual goals. No two members, regardless of their affected area or therapeutic history, receive the same treatment program. We understand that each individual’s goals and challenges are unique, so their care program should be as well.  4. More clinical research than the entire industry combined Sword is widely regarded as the most clinically rigorous digital physical therapy program on the market, and we commit to continue pushing the industry in this direction. Sword has published more peer-reviewed research in scientific journals than any other digital MSK vendor in the industry, and as a company, we hold more than 30 patents, which is 3x more than the nearest competitor in the industry.  5. Validated savings and clinical outcomes Sword is the only digital MSK solution that has achieved independent certification by the Validation Institute for both Level 1, clinical third-party validation of our data and clinical outcomes as well as Level 2, cost savings. Through a two-year claims-based study, they found that Sword reduces average MSK costs by $2,472 per enrolled participant compared to a matched control group.
column43: Sword’s Fee Structure Sword believes in a pay-per-performance or utilization-based pricing model. The maximum total cost a client would spend for any given member is capped at $1,000 per participant per year. To protect our clients from financial risk, Sword's pricing model is dependent on member utilization. Unlike some digital physical therapy solutions that invoice 100% or the majority of their fees when a member enrolls in their program, Sword does not bill the full annual per participant fee upfront. Instead, we will bill the customer in three separate stages that are tied participant utilization as outlined below:  Total Proposed Cost: $1,000 per participant per year  •  Milestone 1 - Enrolled: 50% of fees are due when the member completes their onboarding assessment, completes an eligibility questionnaire, or has completed their first Exercise Visit on the Platform (whichever comes first).  •  Milestone 2 - Engaged: 25% of fees are due when the member successfully completes the first 3 sessions of their program.  •  Milestone 3 - Committed: 25% of fees are due when the member successfully completes 9 sessions of their program.  Please note that members can use Sword’s program as often as they like for the entire year at no additional cost.
column54: We offer customer service support 24 hours per day on weekdays and 8:00a.m. to 8:00p.m. ET on the weekends.  Our DPTs are often the first level of support since they have an existing relationship with the participant and can often troubleshoot or pull in the right Sword resource to resolve issues quickly. Of note, our DPTs are available from 8:00a.m. to 10:00p.m. ET for onboarding calls. For follow-up appointments, DPTs work to accommodate members’ desired hours.
column55: Sword has developed a customer support model in which each member is assigned a Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT) as their single point of contact throughout their journey to ensure each member’s progress and performance is monitored and supported. Sword has intentionally chosen not to use health coaches for this important role as our experience has shown that using a DPT is the most effective and popular model from the member's perspective.  Our DPTs provide their cell phone numbers to members so the member can call, text, or access them through chat at any time using the Sword Mobile App. If the DPT is unable to resolve an issue, it is escalated to an appropriate Sword team member to reach a satisfactory conclusion and ensure the member is appropriately cared for. If a member has a question about the program itself before they are enrolled and assigned a DPT, they also have the option to reach out to the concierge Sword asset who is assigned to the client. In all cases, we are committed to supporting our clients and their members at all times and in all stages during the process.
column56: Sword exclusively hires Doctors of Physical Therapy (DPT) to provide individual care for our members. We require each of our DPTs to be graduates of a CAPTE-accredited program, pass a national licensure exam (NPTE), and obtain state licensure(s) where they will be practicing. We also seek out DPTs with a minimum of three years of work experience (though most have far more) to ensure our members are receiving the most knowledgeable and appropriate direction for their condition.  At Sword, each member’s treatment is provided by their Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT) who is individually selected by the unique member at intake, ensuring they work with a person who resonates with them. From the moment the DPT creates the member’s first exercise session through the completion of the program, the member is fully supported by this same individual. Sword exclusively hires licensed physical therapists, all of whom have a Doctorate of Physical Therapy (DPT) degree and at least three years of post-graduate clinical experience (though most have far more), to provide individualized care for our members. We hire all of our clinical staff based on these stringent requirements because the advanced skill set and education associated with the credentials makes physical therapists the expert of choice for providing MSK and pelvic health care. We also hire with a preference for demonstrated experience in using behavioral change skills such as motivational interviewing and cognitive behavioral therapy tools, all with the goal of reflecting the diversity of our members.
column67: We can launch our solution in as little as 6-8 weeks. Successful implementations is another Sword asset and our clients in a post implementation survey, have graded us with an average implementation score of 9.7 out of 10. Once the process begins, Sword will assign an Implementation Manager and dedicated Customer Success Manager to oversee the implementation as well as the ongoing partnership. Client resources will need to be available for a one-time 60-minute implementation kickoff meeting followed by bi-weekly 30-minute working sessions until the launch date is reached (typically 4-8 meetings). Sword's team will track and drive all work streams in an implementation project plan, all of which will be shared with the Client to ensure visibility of project milestones. These workstreams include any activities and tasks related to integrating with other suppliers in the ecosystem (i.e., TPA, eligibility vendor, health plan, etc), which may require an email or phone introduction to suppliers in other ecosystems to help establish and facilitate a working relationship. Please note that we work closely with each of our new clients to get a fair gauge for the required hours needed from their side so they can best prepare the appropriate personnel and workload.  Once the Client has decided to implement Sword, they will be assigned a dedicated Customer Success Manager (CSM) who is available to provide support from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. by phone and email. The CSM will work with the Client to understand your objectives and the needs of your population, as well as oversee the launch of the Sword solution. Our CSMs build and iterate the marketing strategy to engage the population, develop and support the content strategy, and train teams and third parties within the Client’s ecosystem. Additionally, the CSM will also share ongoing performance reports and lead regular business review meetings to assess Sword’s impact on the Client population.  Additionally, the member experience with Sword and Bloom (pelvic floor therapy) are at the top of our priority list. Our Doctors of Physical Therapy (DPTs) have multiple touch points with each member each week (2-4x/week). Each member is able to choose the DPT they want to work with and that person will stay with them throughout their plan of care. This allows members to develop trusting relationships with members, which creates a better user experience and better outcomes. The typical member journey is as follows:  •  Potential members are identified and reached through marketing campaigns (emails, home mailers, social, SMS, digital ads, webinars, advertisements, print, etc.). •  Members can access Sword through Sydney/Live Health Online as a front door. •  Members complete an enrollment form, are checked for eligibility, and each member is able to read a short bio on our DPTs to select who they would like to work with throughout their plan of care. Once the member makes a selection, they will remain with the same DPT. This drives better relationships, engagement, and ultimately better outcomes. •  Members will receive their Digital Therapist kit (motion sensors and tablet) via mail and are asked to schedule a 1:1 video consultation with their Sword DPT. •  Members complete the video consultation where they meet their DPT, discuss their goals, cover their medical history, familiarize themselves with the program, and are screened for red flags. •  Upon receiving their Digital Therapist kit, members are guided step-by-step through the process of general maintenance (wearing their sensors, charging the kit) and encouraged to begin. We make the Digital Therapist® kit easy to use, ensuring members are able to begin their exercises daily with minimal navigation. •  Members progress through an 8-12 week program (on average) with exercises 3-5x/weekly (as customized by the DPT). Throughout the plan of care, the DPT will review and adjust the program as necessary, share educational tools, and correspond with the member. •  Our DPTs reach out to members between 3-4x per week through the ideal communication channels established during onboarding (e.g. chat, email, or phone). Every 4 weeks the member meets with their DPT via video call to reassess progress and goals. This process continues until the member is pain free or goals have been attained.   •  At the end of each member’s program, members are free to transition to a maintenance phase, which is an additional exercise program with the Digital Therapist or return the kit using the prepaid shipping label and materials.  The Bloom process has a similar journey.  The main difference is that each member will work 1:1 with a Doctor of Physical Therapy who specializes in women’s health, specifically pelvic floor therapy.
column73: Termination for Cause. The notice of breach under this Section shall specify with reasonable particularity the nature and extent of the breach for which complaint has been made.

column79: Sword’s Commitment to DE&I Sword Health believes deeply in a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive future—one where access to high quality care is not determined or hindered by race, gender, sexual orientation, or socio-economic background. From the top down, we have built a world-class physical care company based on these principles. We believe a more diverse and inclusive workforce is essential to delivering the best care, service, and outcomes for our members. We also recognize that many members face deep-rooted disparities that prevent them from receiving equal care, and we have an important responsibility to break down these systemic barriers as much as possible.  Sword’s commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) is visible throughout our organization. It can be seen in our leadership, in the people we hire, in the way we treat members, and in the way we see strength in our differences. For us, DE&I isn’t just a corporate buzzword. It’s the key to our productivity, innovation, and industry-leading success. Here’s how we drive DE&I at all levels of our company:  Who Leads at the Top Our senior leadership team consists of executives from diverse ethnic backgrounds, and a third of our leaders are women. Our Portuguese-born founder and CEO, Virgílio Bento, has long been a champion of diversity and inclusion. His genuine commitment ensures that these initiatives get the support that they need and deserve, from the CEO’s office on down.  How We Train All of our physical therapists are required to undergo training on gender-affirmative and LGBTQ+ cultural competency and education. We follow curricula developed by the creators of the PT Proud movement, whose objective is to address health disparities and improve the healthcare experience of LGBTQ+ patients and clinicians. We also provide other training to build equitable values and create a sensitive environment for all members.  How We Maximize Outcomes At Sword, one of our core tenets is that everyone’s pain is different. We recognize that each member comes to us with a unique set of goals, challenges, and circumstances. Their recovery should be as personal as their story. That’s why the Sword program is designed to deliver tailored care at every step, combining industry-leading motion-capture technology with 100% of care from Doctors of Physical Therapy. Truly personalized treatment is the key to maximizing adherence and improving outcomes for our members. It is also important to note that the Sword solution is available in English, Spanish, French, and Portuguese, with staffed DPTs who can speak these languages.  Who We Hire Sword’s mission is to free 2 billion people from pain—regardless of their race or background, and we believe it is critically important that our workforce reflect the diversity of the members we serve. We want our members to see themselves in Sword, and we want our employees to deeply understand the challenges that our members face. In this spirit, we have one of the highest percentages of female employees among companies in the digital healthcare space. Additionally, nearly a quarter of our licensed physical therapists, who personalize the treatment for each and every member, come from underrepresented minority groups. About 11% of our physical therapists are bilingual or multilingual. While we aim to hire the best talent, we also hire with the goal of creating a diverse workforce so everyone feels represented.  Sword Equity Council We have also created an internal equity council, which is open to all Sword employees and led by them. The council not only serves as an internal guiding light on all DE&I issues within the company, but also allows each collaborator to make meaningful contributions to DE&I initiatives. The council has a direct line to our leadership team to make recommendations to further our commitment to diversity and inclusion.  Our APTA Partnership In its first ever collaboration with a digital musculoskeletal company, the American Physical Therapy Association partnered with Sword Health to support DE&I efforts within the profession. Powered by an annual funding commitment of $100,000 from Sword, this initiative aims to drive new models of care and increase health access for underserved communities. This effort will also fund scholarships for underrepresented minorities seeking to pursue.
column82: Sword will request demographic data for the sake of confirming eligible members as they apply for the Sword treatment, to identify members living with an MSK condition for the purposes of targeted outreach, and to ensure Sword is able to communicate the impact of the program to your population. We typically share data in CSV (most common), ANSI 834 EDI, ASCII format, or pipe ( | ) delimited files. We prefer to use Sword's SFTP to transfer data between our partner's organizations and Sword. If another transfer method is preferred, we are happy to make accommodations. We typically request a monthly eligibility file in order to effectively make Sword Health available to your members. We are able to (and often do) receive more frequent files (i.e. weekly), but this frequency is typically determined during implementation.

column92: Upon award, Sword assigns a Customer Success Team to work closely with each client throughout the implementation process and ongoing for the life of the partnership. This team will engage the client using regular project management calls, provide a variety of reporting metrics (financial and clinical), and oversee the engagement broadly to ensure satisfaction. Data is made available through aggregate reports and/or member level data extracts.  Reports are provided monthly as well as on an as-needed basis, as requested and agreed upon by Sword and the client. That reporting covers enrollments, total engaged members versus enrollments, reported pain reduction, sessions completed, and a variety of other insights designed to provide a complete picture of the impact that Sword is having in the population as well as opportunities to increase efficacy. Sword has a dedicated Customer Insights Team that can partner with your Customer Success Manager to ensure the client is happy with the cadence and data elements that will provide the most insight possible.   Standard Reporting Summary Aggregate Reports •  Onboarding metrics - total enrollments, consultations completed, baseline clinical assessments for surgery intent, pain level, medication usage, depression & anxiety, and work impairment •  Member demographics - average age & age distribution of enrolled members, gender, and enrollment location •  Program engagement - distribution of enrolled members by therapy program and total sessions completed •  Member experience - time of day when sessions are completed (normal-hours vs. after-hours) and type of day when sessions are completed (weekend vs. weekday). Overall program satisfaction and member quotes   Member Level Data Extracts •  Identifiers - eligibility IDs, first/last name, DOB, Sword program •  Program engagement - enrollment date, active date, inactive date, first session date, last session date, third session date, date services completed, sessions per week, total sessions •  App utilization - app user (yes/no), total message count •  Member satisfaction - satisfaction score and satisfaction date •  Clinical measures (baseline and treatment scores provided as well as assessment dates) - surgery intent, pain level, depression, anxiety, work impairment  Custom Reporting Aggregate Reports •  Standard reporting metrics mentioned above broken out by customer's business unit or other dimension on the eligibility file •  Clinical outcomes presented outside of standard Executive/Annual Business Reviews •  Exercise session detail (training time, wrong movements, self-reported fatigue) Member Level Data Extracts •  Exercise session level detail provided as a separate extract
column101: Product Overview Sword Health has digital solutions to address physical therapy for MSK, women’s pelvic pain, and mental health. All the components of our program are delivered through the Sword Member App, or, if preferred by the member, they can be delivered via email (web-based). Also accessible via the Sword Member App, Sword provides a variety of educational tools and resources.    Digital Physical Therapy Every Sword member is paired with a dedicated Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT) and our Digital Therapist, which leverages our FDA-listed tablet, computer vision, and inertial motions sensors to offer real-time biofeedback to both the member and their DPT. We have programs addressing acute, chronic, and post-surgical MSK pain, and are the only digital physical therapy solution with peer-reviewed outcomes on all three scenarios.    Women’s Health Program, Pelvic Floor Therapy Bloom is Sword’s women’s health program that consists of a sensor-based and data-driven, tailored solution designed to address the whole spectrum of pelvic and reproductive issues including childbirth (prepartum, pregnancy, postpartum), pelvic health, urinary/bowel health, and menopause. Bloom is the only women’s product in the industry that offers an intravaginal device that measures contraction, force, and elongation of the pelvic floor, and provides real-time feedback, monitors progress, and shares outcomes so their plan can be tailored.   Move Move, Sword’s newest innovation, is a digital health solution that connects members with a personal trainer who uses real-time insights from an integrated wearable device to deliver personalized movement programs. Move is an alternate pathway of care for members who are looking for a whole body focus to their physical health and also provides a care continuum for members that complete Digital physical Therapy.   The Academy The Academy was designed as a prevention program to provide premium original content to members for educational awareness. Sword has developed a variety of videos and content through clinical research and guidance from Doctors of Physical Therapy to directly address a full suite of MSK issues. The videos demonstrate proper movements, stretches, posture, or habits that will empower users to avoid injuries through everyday best practices in physical health.    Sword On-Call From the Sword Member App, members will be able to securely message (meaning it is HIPAA-compliant) a clinical pain specialist and receive help with any physical health issue that they may have. Members will receive answers to their questions and receive support navigating to the best next step in the care continuum for pain and physical health conditions.  Predict Predict is the first AI engine built to detect and engage the 1% of members who are at the highest risk for MSK-related surgeries to be treated in the most clinically-validated virtual physical therapy program. Predict’s advanced machine learning detects members 6-8 months before a decision is made to operate.
column103: Under ERISA, Sword is offered as a wellness program and can be offered to individuals enrolled in a Health Savings Account or high-deductible health plan. Because our wellness program is not considered a health plan, it does not make an individual ineligible to contribute to an HSA or enroll in an HSA-eligible HDHP. According to the IRS, a wellness program is not a “health plan” under section 223(c) (defining eligibility to contribute to an HSA) if the program does not provide “significant benefits in the nature of medical care or treatment”. Every one of our client’s and prospective clients' ERISA attorneys have come to the same conclusion.
column109: Not applicable. Sword is considered a "voluntary wellness" solution when billed via claims.
column118: We consider our program a "voluntary wellness" solution, and as so, we do not consider the program to be a significant medical benefit. We recommend you confirm with your counsel.

column40: Tilt is a leave-of-absence management technology company. Tilt provides a Saas platform alongside a team of leave experts to solve all of the common leave of absence pain points so that important necessities like communication, administration, coordination, compliance, and leave tracking happen in the platform. Tilt manages all types of leave and offers a robust end-to-end solution for HR, payroll, employees, and managers. Our platform is integrated with most HRIS systems via a file feed, and custom API integrations with select HRIS and payroll partners.   Some key differentiators:  - Tilt manages all types of leaves, in all 50 states and birthing/ parental in Canada. - Tilt can support different employee populations (exempt and non-exempt) and both continuous and intermittent leaves. - Tilt has both a leave of absence self-serve platform and dedicated 1:1 support for employees, managers, and People Teams. - Tilt uses proprietary automation technology and AI to determine what benefits apply (ie: state, disability, company) to an individual employee, which ensures scalability, accuracy, and compliance for both Tilt and our customers. - Tilt has an in-house compliance team who keeps not only our technology up to date but is also there for our customers. A few examples are: reviewing policies or an escalated leave scenario. - Payroll team members have access to Tilt’s payroll calculation reports, which take into account all variables, such as waiting periods, pro-rating, STD, State Benefits, PTO and any other factors that can go into an employees pay. Our pay calculations also include over/under adjustments.  - Managers have their own dashboard with high-level visibility into an employee's leave and also provides education on things like company policies, essential leave law information, and the do’s and don’ts of supervising someone taking a leave.

Pricing is based on the headcount at the time of implementation and cost will remain fixed in year 1 regardless of employee growth or number of leaves. Cost is only adjusted in year 2 if we need to accommodate for growth in employee population.   Implementation fee: $2500  Takeover leave fee: $150/takeover  Pricing includes management of all leave types in all 50 states. No additional fees for ADA support.   See our pricing page here: https://hellotilt.com/pricing/

column55: We love that and feel the same way! The Tilt team takes pride in owning that we are an empathy first SaaS company that handles complex and difficult leave of absence situations on a daily basis.  Our vision here at Tilt is to create a simple, secure, and scalable platform that helps companies balance empathy with economics and empowers people to take time away from work when life happens.   Tilt was founded in 2017. Our founder, Jen Henderson, was inspired to build Tilt after her own parental leave experiences - which happened twice.   From Jen’s words, “I spent 15 years as a leader in corporate America. I saw talented, driven employees hit serious slowdowns in their careers when they started a family. Again and again, we lost some of our best employees around the time of their parental leave.   Those employees would not have walked away if we had created a smooth leave process and supportive environment.  As a professional mom with 2 small children, I experienced career stagnation myself. My employers assumed I didn’t want to put in 110% anymore. I was left out of critical conversations and skipped over for ambitious projects.  As we’ve worked with employers, we find that miscommunication, reactive behavior, biases, and assumptions are at the root of 99% of the issues. All of which can be prevented. That’s why we built Tilt. Parents deserve to feel comfortable and confident returning to work after leave. And companies shouldn’t lose top talent because their employees decide to start a family."  One of our company virtues is “Love our Customers.” Not only do we have a dedicated Customer Success Manager assigned to each of our customers HR teams, we also understand taking a leave of absence is a very personal and emotional life event. Which is why Tilt has dedicated 1:1 support for employees along the whole journey. We not only love our customers, but we serve all people with a humble head and human heart.
column56: Implementation Guide: Tilt assigns this role based on the time of contract completed and specific needs to a company. The implementation team has an average of 3-5 years of experience. Typically the implementation guide is onboarding around 4 companies at any given time.   Customer Success Manager: The Customer Success Manager is the dedicated 1:1 contact for the HR team. Our Customer Success Managers average around 5-7 years of experience. The Customer Success Manager typically supports around 20-30 companies total.  Leave Success Manager: The Leave Success Manager is the dedicated 1:1 contact for the employee and manager. Our Leave Success Managers average of 5 years of experience in leave of absence or a related industry. Our Leave Success Managers are assigned accounts based on the number of leaves rather than the number of accounts, so it can range from 1 dedicated account to 12, depending on leave volume.   In-house Compliance Team: This team is comprised of a Labor & Employment attorneys, FMLA experts, ADA specialists and payroll specialists. Collectively they average 30+ years of experience. This team ensures the way to manage leave of absence on our customers behalf is always compliant with Federal and State regulations.

column67: A dedicated implementation guide who meets with the HR team on a weekly basis to keep the team on track and provides a project plan with the estimated go-live date.   Our implementation process is 5-7 weeks or 7-10 weeks depending on size of company and consists of the following steps:  Complete an onboarding form that will outline information about the company benefits. This is also when we explain the steps of setting up the SFTP file feeds.  First call (Discovery call) to review company information as well as outline the process for the coming weeks.  Tilt will begin to create the custom Tilt platform. This will include company benefit information (e.g. leave policies) so HR is able to see exactly how a leave plan will look in our platform.  Platform training session - on this call, we will show HR how to navigate Tilt as an HR user. We will go over details such as initiating leaves, reviewing leave requests, and reviewing leave plans.  Payroll education session - on this call, we will review the payroll reports that Tilt will be providing the team. Tilt asks for edits to the platform (or plans). We provide 7 calendar days for these edits to be turned back into us.  Edits are made by Tilt.  If necessary, we will meet again to review the edits made and/or revisit the Tilt platform, HR functionality, and how to find and view leave plans.  Final call (the launch call). The Success team (Customer Success Manager + Leave Success Managers) join on this call and make themselves available for any questions.  The customer will enter the onboarding phase, which begins after go-live. Their Tilt Success Team (CSM, LSM, and IG) will be available to answer questions as they start using the platform and initiating leaves and will be a resource as the team uses Tilt payroll report for the first time.

column79: Tilt is a female-founded company. Our current senior leadership is 33% women. Tilt conducts a quarterly eNPS survey and a monthly pulse survey that both include questions related to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging. This information gives us valuable insight as to how we can continue to steward an environment where every person can show up to work as their authentic self. Tilt then shares this information on an internal communications platform and at relevant company-wide all-hands meetings.   At Tilt we are always thinking of ways to improve diversity, equity, inclusivity, and belonging because these things have a direct impact on employee’s experience.  - Continue to build programming for specific holidays, months, etc. to drive employee engagement and prompt healthy discussions.  - Continue opportunities for cross-functional learning and education  - Continue to enhance the recruiting process to continue to offer Tilt roles accessible to all humans.

column40: UrbanSitter's corporate care difference:  - Care Credits: Employers have the option to provide employees care credits (stipend) for any amount and any frequency (ie. $500 a year, $100 per month, $250 per quarter, etc.).  Employers are only charged monthly in arrears for what their employees actually use. Employees have access to the care credits immediately on their account and can use it to pay for any services booked on UrbanSitter. - 2x more utilization than the competition: Clients that switch to UrbanSitter from another caregiving benefits vendor report an increase in employee utilization of nearly 2x. - Backup care that's actually available: No other vendor can match UrbanSitter for same-day needs. Employees can reliably find backup care—no need to book weeks in advance. - Every type of care, all in one place: In-home care providers, daycares, preschools, concierge services, tutoring, pet & home care, senior companions—UrbanSitter covers every employee's care needs. - Establishing trust through data: Caregiver profiles show statistics such as quantity of """"Repeat families"""" and bookings, response times, and ratings to inform and build trust before hiring. - Trusted Connections: UrbanSitter leverages a careseeker’s personal network to connect them with caregivers used by their friends, neighbors, co-workers, and parents from their kid’s school—to find someone they can trust.  - Trust & Safety: Every caregiver on UrbanSitter has been background checked at the county and national level, and reviewed by our Trust and Safety team.   - Modern Conveniences: Caregiver video profiles help employees screen candidates quickly for a fit. Receipts for FSA claims are easily downloaded from UrbanSitter's site. Paying caregivers is quickly done with a tap of the app.  - Company Groups: Only visible to employees from the same company, the company logo will display on a caregiver profile if they have been booked and highly recommended (4 or 5 stars) by someone else within their same company.  For example, a Client employee would see a Client logo on the profile of a caregiver who has provided quality care for another Client employee. - Supports diversity, equity and inclusion: UrbanSitter's caregivers speak more than 25 different languages, span all 50 states, and have the flexibility to work off-peak hours to service hourly and nightshift workers.

column79: We envision a world where everyone fully understands their leave options and can easily access the time and pay available to time. Cocoon pioneered a different leave experience from day one, starting with software that enables employees to plan a compliant leave privately, in their own time, and share with their employer when ready to request a leave. In the coming years, we plan to expand this level of awareness and access by making Cocoon available to anyone globally — whether they work full-time at a venture-backed startup, or part-time at a local hardware store. More immediately, we’re also building product support for any type of leave, from military to bereavement and beyond, plus expanded support for requesting leave as an ADA accommodation.   Our work to enable caregivers is key in supporting DEI and empowering clients to attract & retain a diverse workforce.

column40: Voluntary Legal Plans go unused by ~90% of employees because employees can't predict whether or not they'll need legal assistance in an upcoming year. By contrast, Rocket Lawyer is free and available to employees year-round and as a result, we see an average of 30% employee engagement.   In addition to legal support, Rocket Lawyer also offers tax preparation and tax filing each year. Rather than doing your own taxes, Rocket Lawyer pairs you up with a tax professional. Rocket Lawyer's network of tax professionals will collect your tax paperwork and file your taxes for you and maximize your deductions, at a fraction of the cost.   There is zero administration with Rocket Lawyer. Because there's no payroll deductions involved, we also don't require any census files or file feed exchanges.   Rocket Lawyer's philosophy isn't just to pair up the employee with an attorney. Some legal needs are quite simple and only require a document. Rocket Lawyer offers thousands of do-it-yourself, customizable legal documents for employees to create on their own. Instead of spending hours with an attorney, Rocket Lawyer allows you to generate a lease or a living will in minutes.
column42: No employer headcount minimums. Our lowest annual payment is $6,000.
column43: Our pricing is based off a PEPM model, however we bill once annually and upfront. Our standard list price is $5 PEPM or $60 PEPY and our minimum platform and service fee is $6,000.   Through our partnership we can offer Sequoia clients a significant discount from our list price and a free trial to evaluate our offering with no strings attached.
column54: 6am - 6pm MST
column55: Customer service is #1. Every one of Rocket Lawyer's HR partners gets a dedicated Customer Success Manager to handle anything from simple questions to onboarding, employee support, employee engagement, data reporting and a whole lot more. We try to respond to our clients as quickly as possible and we don't send anyone to 1-800 numbers or automated answering machines.   For employees that use Rocket Lawyer, we offer an on-demand platform that can be accessed at any time of the day. Employees can build as many legal documents as they want at any time. For any legal assistance or support, our Service Level Agreement is 1 business day - although we typically reach out right away.  For quick legal questions through our chat box, our average response time from our network of attorneys is 2 hours.
column56: The attorneys in Rocket Lawyer's network must qualify by the following:  1) They must have 5 years of experience practicing the law.  2) They must be in good standing with the state bar they're license to practice.  3) They cannot have any malpractice incidences and must carry sufficient malpractice insurance.  4) They must maintain a strong 1-5 star rating.
column67: As soon as a prospective client complete an Order Form, Rocket Lawyer will generate a customized claim link for the HR team to share with their employee population (i.e go.rocketlawyer.com/sequoia).   After the customized claim link is shared, employees can visit the claim link and sign up with their company (or personal) email address to create their individual account.   There is no implementation, no need for census files and no file feed exchanges. Rocket Lawyer is introduced by simply sharing a sign up link with employees.
column74: We offer HR partners "attorney workshops" for their employees. This is a great opportunity for employees to learn about how their Rocket Lawyer benefit can support them through life and also increase engagement awareness.   We also offer up webinars through the year and attend benefit fairs and annual enrollments, upon request.   Finally, our team will ask once or twice a year to remind employees about Rocket Lawyer.

column40: Rightway has designed a new navigation model that combines the best technology with expert, empathetic human guidance. The model offers clinical support at a lower price point than legacy navigation vendors, powered by our 'smarter clinical' model that intelligently routes cases to nurses while our modern tech infrastructure guides decision-making. A mobile-first platform drives higher utilization through a better member experience. All of this maximizes appropriate utilization of the benefit design and drives cost-effective healthcare.
column43: Rightway’s standard navigation pricing model is based on a PEPM (per employee per month) model.  Custom proposal to be provided on opportunity. Typical direct navigation price point starts at $5 PEPM, with a one-time implementation fee based on size and complexity.
column54: Monday - Friday 8 am - 11 pm ET Saturday and Sunday 9 am - 5 pm ET Holidays 9 am - 3 pm ET
column55: Rightway’s delivery org blends a deeply empathetic service orientation with an innovative, tech-company culture obsessed with member experience and partner feedback. Our team is driven by the central mission to improve healthcare access, affordability, and advocacy. As we like to say, “we will go to the end of the earth” to help our members with their healthcare.
column56: Rightway, in conjunction with our partner ecosystem, has a robust recruitment process where we screen for background experience, applicable credentials/licenses, and demonstration of core skills.  Non-clinical navigator ideal profiles are individuals with a minimum bachelor's degree and backgrounds in social services/social work background and experience; Medical Assistant or medical office training and experience; Healthcare Administration or like field; Wellness & Lifestyle training and experience; and educators all tend to be a strong fit for the navigator role.  For clinical team members, we require licensure for RNs, NPs, and LCSWs, with a minimum of five years of clinical experience. We recruit and hire for clinical expertise and diversity. Credentialed providers include Certified Diabetes Care and Education Specialists (CDCES), Registered Dietitians, NB-HWC Certified Health Coaches, MA Health Education/MPHs, PhDs, Pharmacists, Endocrinologists, Licensed Therapists, Physicians, Nurse Practitioners, and Doctors of Physical Therapy. Providers are carefully selected for specific programs based on their expertise, credentials, and experience.  Our mental/behavioral health guides are licensed social workers or therapists from different disciplines, with 6+ years of experience in their field.  Our clinical guides are licensed RNs (registered nurses) and NPs (nurse practitioners) with a minimum of 6+ years of patient care experience. Our clinical guides have diverse backgrounds in emergency medicine, primary care, women’s health, and a range of specialties.   Our billing and claims guides have 5+ years of medical billing experience in a provider or clinic setting or relevant claims processing experience with a carrier.
column67: All Rightway clients are supported throughout the implementation process with clear and effective communication from their implementation manager.  Implementing Rightway is a frictionless process to collect the materials needed to activate members on our platform. The process is designed to minimize the lift from clients and maximize member engagement.   Implementation Process Overview:  Plan Documentation. Population Data.  Engagement Strategy.   As the first step in our implementation process, we will need to gather all the appropriate plan documentation (medical, dental, vision, point solutions), which can be shared over email. This allows our team to have all client benefits information in one centralized location to be able to support members.  The second step in our implementation process is to share the appropriate population data. This allows Rightway to provide a personalized experience when members are communicating with our health guides. We’ll know exactly what each members’ specific elections are, so we can support them in their health care journey. To ingest this data, we’ll set up an eligibility file to be shared over SFTP.  Rightway also has the ability to ingest claims data, which can allow clients to support high-risk member populations.   The third and final step is to review a go-forward engagement strategy. We’ll understand your goals for launching Rightway, share best practices for activation and engagement, and design an internal launch timeline.
column74: Rightway’s communication strategy is to spread awareness of Rightway to member populations, communicate the benefits of our service offering, and drive members to the application.  Our standard engagement process with members is through email. We understand that client communication preferences vary, so we work together to have a clear understanding of the best ways to engage with the population.  Typically, to engage and notify members of Rightway, we first begin with a 5-part activation series that kicks off on launch day. Emails are direct and informative. The content of the email is to notify the member of Rightway, how to sign up and what the benefits are. Following the activation campaign, clients will receive invitations to quarterly webinars and seasonal campaigns featuring clinical expertise (e.g., on mental health, flu season). We also communicate around our open enrollment support and can participate in benefit fairs and OE presentations.
column79: Rightway is committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. Internally, Rightway hires with diversity in mind so that our health guides best mirror the populations we serve.   Externally, each team member is trained on our delivery model with attention to personalized member support based on their needs and preferences. Our clinical team is also well versed on disease states/conditions that may impact individuals differently based on gender and race.
column82: First name, Last name, Relation, Member SSN, Individual SSN, DOB, Gender, Medical.
column91: Rightway is able to establish inbound SSOs from third-party platforms such as company intranets, Okta, etc. We can set up deep links from the Rightway app to third party apps – full outbound SSOs require additional vetting and internal sign-off.
column92: Rightway offers robust utilization and engagement reporting for clients, which can be shared via their Client Success Manager (CSM). During the first 30 days after launch, Rightway will share activation and utilization metrics on a weekly basis.    After the first 30 days, Rightway will share quarterly reporting via QBRs, which will be presented and reviewed with CSMs. QBR reporting includes key metrics like activation rate and engagement rate, as well as a thorough breakdown of the types of interactions members are having with Rightway health guides, how frequent they are and what the preferred method of communication is. If claims data is shared, Rightway will also report on the financial trends and cost of health care.
column101: Rightway has two services that it provides to Sequoia clients today:  Rightway's care navigation solution optimizes enterprise healthcare spending by guiding associates toward high-quality and cost-effective care. Each employee interacts with a member of their dedicated care team, who serves as their care concierge throughout their healthcare journey. Rightway empowers consumers to navigate the entire care continuum through a modern app and clinician-led support. Rightway's core navigation services can be categorized into four areas: 1) Benefits Navigation, 2) Provider Search, 3) Clinical Guidance, and 4) Billing advocacy, all with the mission to make our members better consumers of healthcare.  Rightway’s PBM solution seeks to redesign the member pharmacy experience by guiding members to optimal medication regimens and proactively engaging high-risk and specialty members and subsequently reducing total pharmacy spend. Rightway leverages our care navigation DNA with clinical proficiency and rich data science to identify optimal medication therapies and savings opportunities available through members’ healthcare programs. Rightway’s clinical pharmacists proactively engage employees regardless of health status, reducing non-adherence and suboptimal spend across all therapeutic classes. We provide a more personalized engagement for members through best-in-class mobile technology and direct access to pharmacists. Rightway is committed to aligning with our clients' benefits goals and objectives, including lowering overall spend, as well as improving the employee experience.
column103: Rightway currently monitors Federal and State legislative actions related to PBM administration such as employee benefits (e.g., ERISA and Retiree Drug Coverage), prescription drug programs (CAA, ACA, state-based women's health regulations), transparency drug reporting, etc. We support any legislation that may have an impact to how the pharmacy benefit is administered.

column40: Arta is different from other startups and firms in the financial services space in a few ways:  ● A tech-forward approach to financial services and personal wealth management; this is a digital-native experience built by folks coming from Google, Microsoft, Grab, Stashaway, and many other successful consumer tech companies.  ● Comprehensive wealth management. Many other fintech companies focus on a specific, narrow slice of financial services. Arta is building a digital family office that covers growing, protecting and enjoying your wealth.  ● A high degree of personalization by combining AI and human service delivery. AI is remarkable for its ability to take an enormous amount of data and variability into account; we use it to develop personalized, AI-Managed Portfolios (AMPs). At the same time, we know that wealth management is a complicated space, so we have experts in a range of fields (insurance, tax and estate planning, financial planning) who consult with members and develop bespoke plans.
column42: No employee headcount or annual payment minimums. However, Arta is currently only available for Accredited Investors in the US. These are investors who have either $1M in net worth or $200k in annual income. More info on how the SEC defines "Accredited Investors" can be found here: https://www.sec.gov/education/capitalraising/building-blocks/accredited-investor
column43: Because of our focus on technology and creating scalable solutions, we’re able to price our services much more competitively than traditional financial services. There is no fee to access the Arta platform. Investments that charge Assets Under Management (“AUM”) fees tend to be in the 10-40 basis point of AUM range.  Our private market funds are accessible for 60 to 80 basis points of the invested amount (plus any fees charged by the underlying fund manager). These fees are significantly lower than what an individual would typically have to pay to access a private market fund. In addition, the minimum investment amounts are much lower on Arta than investors would normally find; minimums on funds are anywhere from $2,500 to $100,000, depending on the fund.
column54: The team is available for live support via a range of channels during normal US business hours. One of the benefits of having a team in Singapore is that our team members there are usually able to respond to any questions “overnight” in the US as well.
column55: Arta’s Member Success team offers welcome/onboarding calls for every member and are on hand and easily reachable through multiple channels to answer any questions after onboarding. We also have experts in the major disciplines of personal wealth management -- including insurance, tax and estate planning, overall investment planning, risk management -- who consult directly with our members.
column56: Arta is an SEC-registered Investment Advisor. Our Member Success team does not provide financial advice; rather, recommendations are made through the app or web. We have Series-65 licensed investment advisors on staff should a member wish to develop a financial plan, or just speak with someone for one-off questions.
column67: The Arta app and web platform require no integrations as is; it’s consumer-ready and available on the App and Play Stores. We are also happy to discuss white-labeling and customizations based on employer interest. Members are encouraged to schedule a welcome/onboarding call with one of our Member Success representatives so they can have a personalized overview of our platform and services.
column73: Members are free to uninstall the app whenever they choose.
column74: Information about Arta can be found at artafinance.com. The app is available on Google Play and iOS App Store.
column79: Arta is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Arta will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.  In addition to our hiring practices, the democratization of financial well-being is core to our mission; Arta was created to bring the "financial superpowers" of the ultrawealthy to many more people, globally. We are available in the US now but have just received our license to operate in Singapore. We will be able to serve clients in Asia by Q1 2024.
column82: Arta performs "know your customer" checks as required by the SEC. Arta is currently only available for Accredited Investors in the US. column118: Individuals would sign up for Arta as individuals; there is no relationship between the employer and Arta, and there are no fees or other aspects of Arta that would be paid for by an employer, and therefore it is not a fringe benefit.
column119: Individuals opening up accounts at Arta go through an automated onboarding process that covers "know your customer" (KYC) and other regulatory requirements. There are no "benefits compliance considerations" as such when opening an account.

We are finding this number to be more than adequate for our current member base; given the thought and care we have put into the app and web UX, most member questions are resolved without Member Success team involvement.

column40: Villyge is using technology to scale empathic leadership and bring a more human-centric approach to the workplace. An AI-driven platform, Villyge is the ONLY tool delivering the precise just in time guidance managers need to navigate issues and lead effectively through each of their employees’ Life Events, based upon a specific employee's unique set of circumstances. In turn, employees feel seen, heard and valued, managers are able to upskill in empathic leadership at scale, HR can get back to what's important, and organizational culture is truly transformed.
column43: Pricing is PEPM and is volume-based, with the average PEPM fee sitting at $5.00. Companies are billed a monthly fee based upon the number of employees at the start of each month.
