column55: At Villyge, customer service is fundamentally at the core of what we do. Our approach to customer service is defined by a deep commitment to understanding and meeting the unique needs of each organization, and we believe in maintaining open, clear, and consistent communication with our clients. This includes being readily available to address any queries or concerns they may have and keeping them informed throughout their journey with us. Our team is trained to be empathetic and solution-oriented, ensuring that every interaction with our customers is positive and productive.  Moreover, we continuously seek feedback from our customers to improve our services, through ongoing QBRs and check-ins. By embracing both positive and constructive feedback, we constantly evolve and enhance our customer service strategies. This customer-centric approach not only helps in building strong relationships but also fosters a sense of trust and loyalty among our clients.  To detail our customer service approach, Villyge is available 24/7 through the chat feature and emailing success@villyge.com. The Client Success team is dedicated to handling customer service issues during non-business hours and ensures the most immediate response to all customer issues and inquiries.
column56: Villyge offers Expert coaching via Zoom with a wide range of subject-matter experts. Qualifications vary by Expert, but our cadre of employees and coaches include, but are not limited to, CLC's, CLEC's, IBCLC's, Ed.D's, JD's, RD's, CDN's, MD, RN's, Ph.D's and ICF Certified Coaches.
column67: Standard implementation takes 30 days or less and can be completed within 2 weeks if necessary. Villyge hosts an onboarding kick-off meeting to walk employers through every step of the process. The few responsibilities of the employer include providing an eligibility file and minimal assets (logo, etc.), and coordinating the Welcome Webinar and other meetings with internal employees. Villyge takes the lead on all other tasks and ensures that the employer experiences a smooth and simple onboarding process.
column73: 60 days notice from annual contract date
column74: Villyge hosts two webinars before officially onboarding eligible members. First, Villyge hosts an Empathic Leadership Workshop to educate and inform managers of the power of empathic leadership, and how the Villyge platform makes it easy for managers to upskill in empathy. Next, Villyge hosts a company-wide Welcome Webinar for all eligible employees to educate them on the purpose of the tool and how to utilize the tool.  Upon initial login, employees are introduced to a personal Success Guide, who is there to answer questions and support the employee in utilizing the platform. Along with the extensive support provided by the Villyge platform, each employee's Success Guide, as well as the Client Success Team, will reach out to them on an ongoing basis to ensure they're receiving the support they're looking for. It's Villyge's hope that employees engage with the platform and their Success Guide on a weekly basis, as life doesn't stop!  Last, but not least, Villyge sends ongoing emails to educate members of new features, ways to find support within th eplatform, etc.
column79: At its core, Villyge is a people-first platform that is revolutionizing culture in today's workplace, and it all begins and ends with supporting a diverse workforce. Villyge offers employees an easy way to communicate what's going on in their lives (burnout, pregnancy, elder care, loss, coming out and much more) with their leaders, which kickstarts a cadence of just-in-time nudges to educate, guide and empower leaders to support their employees, all while driving team goals forward. By holistically supporting employees AND leaders through life's ups and downs, Villyge fosters a connected company culture inside and outside of the office. The Villyge approach is innovative in that it's the only tool out there that is upskilling leaders in the "personal stuff," while offering personalized resources to employees, truly supporting a culture of diversity and meeting everyone where they are in their journey.

column40: Some of the unique differentiators that set Level apart from our competitors in the market:  1. The Level Card, a first-of-its-kind payment card, offers employees true agency and choice: they can spend their benefits where they choose, without concern for out-of-pocket payments, or delayed reimbursements. Between our streamlined platform, curated plans, and effortless user experience, Level is the only benefits solution capable of supercharging your culture.  2. Merchant-agnostic: We at Level do not have a marketplace. We believe in giving employees control over where they spend their funds in places that matter most to them. This approach reduces confusion and provides genuine flexibility, empowering employees to make choices aligned with their individual needs and preferences.  3. Member experience: At Level, we prioritize member experience and simplicity. Our app is extremely user-friendly, and spending funds is as easy as swiping or tapping your credit card.  4.Best in class technology stack: At Level we have built our own technology stack built for platform, engine, and interface, where we can provide a top-quality experience without reliance on tired platforms and disconnected systems.
column42: Level is best suited for 100+ employee companies. For smaller clients, we set a minimum annual revenue admin fee during the quotation process.
column43: Level charges a simple PEPM for the administration of the plan.  This covers the cost of implementation, card production and mailing (if applicable), and other items which may show as separate charges from other vendors.    Benefit costs for the client are 'pay as you go'.  We set a minimum balance that funds all benefit payments for a given month, and at the beginning of subsequent months will have the client 'top up' to the established minimum balance established.    Please reach out to a member of the Level team for a direct quote.
column54: Our friendly, expert support team is available via in-app message, email at support@level.com, or phone at (855) 400-5705, Monday-Friday 9:00am-9:00pm Eastern Time.
column55: We see our customer success model through a similar lens.  Our Account Management team takes this approach with every client, and our Support team provides 'white glove' service.  Our quality assurance program ensures that each member of our support team is upholding our high standards of customer service. The senior members and manager of our customer experience team monitor new members' cases for two weeks following the completion of their training to provide detailed feedback and evaluation. And this continue on a quarterly basis after training throughout the year.  Additionally, Level closely monitors feedback received from members through automated CSAT surveys following every support interaction with Level. Our team thoroughly investigates all negative responses and follows up with each member to ensure we've resolved any issues or concerns.

column67: The typical time frame for an enterprise customer is 45-90 days, depending on the degree of customization being requested for the plans.   To begin the implementation process, we'll host plan design consultations with our clients until they've landed on the best plan for their team. From there, the process involves integrating with their HRIS vendor, connecting their bank account for billing, building a customized employee communications strategy, and administering training sessions for employees and administrators. We'll work with them to create an implementation timeline that works best for their business, and we'll keep them updated throughout the process by hosting regular meetings with their HR and broker teams. In these meetings, we’ll answer questions, review plan documents, and jointly prepare for open enrollment and employee engagement sessions.
column73: Either party may terminate Level's services without cause with sixty (60) days’ prior written notice to the other party. For more details, see our terms and conditions.
column74: Level will work with the employer team to craft a multi-faceted communication strategy that's most effective for your population. We typically recommend a combination of remote employee engagement sessions, email campaigns, Slack messages, and push notifications from the Level App.   When the plan goes live, we coordinate with the client the release of welcome emails which are used for employees to register for Level and start using the benefits being offered to them.  We will continue to engage employees after the plan is live, with education sessions and push communication through the Level App. We can provide metrics to measure engagement after these targeted communications, including opened emails, employee account creation, and utilization increases. We'll use those metrics to help the client build a communication strategy that maximizes the team's participation and engagement.
column79: Though Level is a young company, we're committed to creating an inclusive environment from the ground up. Kathleen Harris, our interim Chief People Officer with recognized leadership experience at Time Warner, dedicates her skills to supporting diversity, equity, and inclusion at Level. We make sure our investors, like Operator Collective and Renegade Partners — both founded and owned by women and people of color — represent a diversity of identities, too.  Level is built to help companies create a culture of belonging. We believe intentional benefits go further than salary: they transform values into meaningful action, and they can rise to address unexpected circumstances.   Level’s Education benefit, for example, worked to take Visa’s commitment to learning and development from a promise to a reality. While their previous system required employees to pay hefty out-of-pocket costs and await often-delayed reimbursement, our program came with the Level Card, allowing employees to pay up front with their benefit dollars. Level’s approach instantly increased access to educational opportunities, creating a more equitable workplace.   Our Medical Travel benefit was built to help employees access health care that’s  not available to them locally. With covered expenses like gas, transportation services, hotel rooms, and air travel, members can use the Level Card to pay instantly with their benefit dollars. Level fully processes transactions, creating a hassle-free experience for finance teams while ensuring ERISA and ACA compliance.   Level’s commitment to helping companies deliver on their DEIB goals is at the heart of everything we do. Our range of benefits, including Gender Affirmation, Mental Health, and Education, prioritize inclusion and access to care. Our simple dental and vision plans are easy to understand, with no confusing limitations, and members’ full transaction history at their fingertips in the Level App. We empower companies to put their people first, and to show up for all of their employees equally.
column82: During implementation, we'll partner with your team to set up an automated API or SFTP (either via 834 EDI or a CSV file) connection to send enrollment data, in our specified format. We'll process that data within one business day of receipt. If something went wrong, we'll present an error report back to your team with guidance on how to resolve the issue. This will file can be scheduled at the client's preference and no additional charge.   If your system can't support an API or SFTP connection, you can manage enrollments through Level’s Employer Dashboard. You can use our bulk upload feature for initial enrollment, add new individual members, enroll employees in new plans, and keep demographic data up-to-date. Required information varies, depending on your plan, but we generally require enrollment and demographic data to process new enrollments.   Level currently requires employees' SSNs to provide our benefits. We take special security precautions to protect SSNs and are in the process of updating our systems to operate with only the last 4 digits of SSNs.
column91: For Member App and Employer Dashboard, Level supports Google OAuth without any additional setup. Level also supports SSO for the most popular identity providers, as well as all SAML 2.0 and OIDC compliant identity providers. You can set up and manage your SSO integration in the Employer Dashboard during implementation.
column92: The Insights section of Level's Employer Dashboard provides meaningful and actionable data into employee enrollment and how employees are using their benefits. Administrators can track cumulative plan spend versus budget, member savings through the Level network, plan versus member costs, and member utilization insights by plan and plan year.  Transactions data within Insights is updated on a daily basis as transactions are processed. Budget data is updated once a month (for example, at the start of February, the budget will be updated to include the sum of January + February budgets).
column101: Some of our most popular benefits include:  • Wellness. Encourage your team to invest in self-care with flexible funds that inspire each person to define what wellness — physical, mental, or emotional — means to them.  • Mental Health. Increase your team’s access to quality care, empowering them to get the services and support they need in the way that’s most effective for them • Convenience. Shorten your team’s personal to-do list by covering the everyday tasks and inconveniences that prevent people from showing up as their best selves. • Office. Set your team up for success with funds to boost their productivity, connectivity, and comfort, anywhere.  • Education. Unlock your team’s potential by providing easily accessible funds for learning and development — no up-front costs or waiting for reimbursement.  • Medical Travel. Provide critical support for your employees by providing funds to access the medical care they need that isn’t available to them locally.  We are also launching pre-tax benefits in 2024, including HSAs, FSAs, HRAs, Commuter accounts, and COBRA Services.

column29: Headspace currently serves approximately 500 clients through our relationship with Sequoia. More than 160 clients have access to Headspace Care (legacy Ginger content and synchronous, live mental health care), and approximately 360 have access to Headspace’s standalone and series-based meditations, sleepcasts and sleep music, guided workouts, and focus music. Many Sequoia clients use both Headspace Care and Headspace.
column37: Headspace Care Case Study - California Health Plan.pdf
column40: We clearly and consistently distinguish ourselves through the following key criteria:  -Immediacy - Timely response and navigation into care is a critical component of how Headspace breaks down access to care barriers. To that end, mental health coaching is available live, on-demand, in less than two minutes (with an average wait time of 1.5 minutes). The average time to the first offered therapy appointment is two business days. Our average wait time for the first psychiatry appointment is 8 business days. Our average wait time is significantly lower than traditional care models, as our W-2 staffing model allows us full oversight and access to calendars that are not shared with any other systems.   -Accessibility - We harness the power of our global Headspace brand to promote widespread awareness while destigmatizing our approach to mental health care. Headspace has been downloaded over 100 million times worldwide, with 73% of organizations touting that our brand is a key driver of adoption. We provide members with a complete spectrum of mental health offerings coupled with the flexibility to engage in self-directed care, human-to-human care, or both.  -Team-Based Care - Our coaches provide continuous, simultaneous support as members embark upon their mental health journey, providing advice and encouragement, recommending care activities, and helping them stay on track with what they learned during therapy sessions. Our virtual care team is composed of W-2 professionals, who have access to a unified electronic medical record (EMR) to ensure consistent, multilayered support. Plus, our model reduces costs for members and clients by offsetting claim costs for clinical care, while keeping members longer via prevention.   -Augmented Intelligence (AI) and Technology - We leverage augmented intelligence (AI) to surround and support our care team via AI chat transcripts, clinical assessments, member satisfaction data, app engagement data, session length, and collaboration notes to improve safety risk detection, clinical triage, quality assurance, and resource demand prediction.  -Results - With over 50 published papers, 11 patents, 65+ research collaborations with external research institutions like Oxford and Harvard, and a dedicated science and research team, we are one of the most comprehensive, evidence-based, digital health and wellness companies. Published studies show statistically significant results, including: >75% of members engaged in 1:1 care have their needs met via behavioral health coaching; >85% of all members experienced an improvement in depression symptoms*; >83% of all members experienced an improvement in anxiety symptoms*; >81% of international members experienced improvement in depression symptoms*; >30 days of Headspace self-care content produces a 32% reduction in stress; and >Four weeks of Headspace self-care content improves focus by 14%. ** Measurement/results determined after 6-16 weeks  Please refer to the attached case studies for more details about results achieved with other clients.
column42: Headspace does not impose an annual payment minimum with the Sequoia bundle; any size organization can enroll, and the base PEPM fee would be the same regardless of employee count (e.g., Headspace is $1.10 PEPM; Headspace Care is $2.30 PEPM; and Headspace Care Plus is $4.25 PEPM (SF up to 8 sessions).   Please note that the fees noted above are specific to the Sequoia bundle. We also offer clients an opportunity to purchase Headspace services directly through Sequoia, the Sequoia Marketplace option. Sequoia bundle clients who buy up to the Sequoia Marketplace offering receive the following enhancements:  >Direct account management support from Headspace Client Success Representatives >Enhanced, employer-specific communications strategy and approach: >>Email campaigns that drive ~3x additional signups (welcome emails, priority campaigns, etc.).  >>Headspace Client Success Representatives help employers determine which internal channels to leverage to increase adoption throughout client lifecycle. >Robust employer-specific reporting on utilization, impact, and population health insights.  Sequoia Marketplace clients who buy directly from Headspace have access to additional product configuration and product options available to them at an additional fee (e.g., a unified single-app user experience across products; Headspace EAP, a full EAP replacement solution featuring Headspace Care Plus services with the addition of telephonic support from master’s level therapists, in-person therapy sessions, work-life resources, critical incident support, manager consultations, training webinars, etc.). Sequoia bundle clients have fewer options for customization and limited opportunities to expand Headspace capabilities and services.
column43: Headspace pricing (specific to the Sequoia bundle) is built around a PEPM fee (see above) that includes access to coaching (unlimited 24/7 access via text-based chat), self-care content and mindfulness resources, the Headspace collaborative care health system (therapy/psychiatry), and technology.  Technical, implementation, and account management scale allows us to offer significantly discounted pricing.   Options within the Sequoia bundle:  Headspace -Meditations, sleepcasts and music, focus music and breathwork, at-home workouts, daily curated recommendations, family support, stress and anxiety tracking, goal setting. -$1.10 PEPM.  Headspace Care (formerly Ginger) -Unlimited behavioral health coaching, therapy and psychiatry*, family and teen support, clinically-validated assessments, member support, self-guided content. *Therapy and psychiatry coverage based on employee health plan. -$2.30 PEPM.  Headspace Care Plus (formerly Ginger Plus)	 -Unlimited behavioral health coaching; therapy and psychiatry (up to 8 sessions); family and teen support; clinically-validated assessments; member support; Headspace meditations, sleepcasts and music, etc. -$4.25 PEPM.     *Please note that dependent support is included at all levels (new for 2024!)  Options for Sequoia Marketplace (direct sale):  Headspace -Meditations, sleepcasts and music, focus music and breathwork, at-home workouts, daily curated recommendations, family support, stress and anxiety tracking, goal setting.  Headspace Care -Headspace (everything above) and unlimited behavioral health coaching, therapy, psychiatry, family and adolescent support, international support, clinically-validated assessments, member support.  Headspace EAP -Headspace and Headspace Care (everything above) and 24/7 phone line intensive care management, in-person care, work-life services, critical incident support, included and custom live trainings, optional onsite counseling.   Other products included in Sequoia Marketplace (direct sale): -Dependent support -Dedicated account management  -Organization-specific communications and engagement strategy -Organization-specific reporting on utilization, impact and population health impacts  -Option for employers to purchase additional products (like EAP, onsite counseling, etc)
column54: Member support is available 365 days a year. Weekly hours of operation are as follows:  Monday - Friday 5 am to 5 pm (PST) Saturday - Sunday 8 am to 5 pm (PST) Holidays - 8 am to 5 pm (PST)  Additionally, behavioral health coaches are available on-demand, 24 hours a day, 7 days per week, 365 days a year to assist members with navigation and access to our services.
column55: Everything we do, from personal interactions to data exchanges, revolves around our members and clients—your success is our success.  As part of our client-centric delivery model available for an additional fee to the Sequoia bundle pricing, we assign a client executive to partner with Sequoia clients and serve as a master of resources. This includes day-to-day support as well as facilitating and aligning subject matter experts (SMEs) across  organizations. Supported by a client success team with extensive experience managing behavioral health programs, client executives is accountable for the following key areas: -Client and program oversight -Client relationships and ongoing operations -Problem-solving and issue resolution -Engagement and communication -Reporting and insights -Strategy and tactics
column56: Our approach to staffing and recruitment ensures that each member of our team has extensive experience in benefits, health and wellness, project management, and building relationships. Everything we do, from personal interactions to data exchanges, revolves around our members and clients–your success is our success.  For members accessing our virtual solution, different levels of support are available using the strengths of three unique disciplines within a highly collaborative environment—coaching, therapy, and psychiatry. Credentials and qualifications are outlined below.   Behavioral health coaches have: -a minimum of a master's degree in a psychology-related field or coaching certification from an accredited training program (approved by the National Board for Health and Wellness Coaching (NBHWC); -experience as a coach or counselor (a minimum of two years of relevant experience of which six months occurred with supervision under a qualified, credentialed, or licensed supervisor); -extensive training on effective methodologies, such as motivational interviewing, specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goal-setting, and assessing stages of change/readiness; and -over 100 hours of annual training and oversight by the clinical leadership team at Headspace.  Licensed therapists have: -a minimum of a doctoral (PhD) degree or a master's degree in psychology, social work, counseling, marriage and family therapy, or other relevant field; -a license to practice (e.g., a licensed psychologist) and be in good standing; and -over three years of experience providing clinical psychotherapy to individuals, couples or families preferred (one year must be post-licensure)   Psychiatrists have: -a minimum of a doctor of medicine degree (MD) with completion of an accredited psychiatry residency (board-eligible/board-certified); and -a license to practice psychiatry.  In-app support team members are: -professionals with a wide range of educational backgrounds; -a mix of high school diplomas and healthcare customer service experience; and -various types of bachelor's and master's degrees.  Headspace Training Institute: We launched the Headspace Training Institute, our program to train the next generation of coaches and clinicians on our model, as demand for virtual mental health services increases. This works to advance the field of virtual mental health as well as increase the pool of providers. Our program also has important diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging (DEIB) benefits, such as building a more diverse mental health workforce and increasing access for marginalized, rural, and other underserved communities.  The coaching arm of the Headspace Training Institute—behavioral health coach training program–is an approved health and wellness coach training and education program by the National Board for Health and Wellness Coaching (NBHWC). This program provides a comprehensive curriculum and training activities designed to prepare students to become certified Behavioral Health and Wellness Coach (NBC-HWC). This course of study provides learning and application of evidence-based best practices in health and wellness coaching as well as in behavioral health coaching.  On the clinical side, we offer a psychology postdoctoral fellowship. One area of study focuses on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging (DEIB) or research and evidence. Fellows must have graduated from an American Psychological Association (APA), or an APA-accredited doctoral program, in clinical or counseling psychology and have completed an APA-accredited internship before petitioning. While in their year-long appointment, fellows provide care to members, support research and DEIB efforts across the organization, and receive extensive training on how to deliver care in our collaborative, measurement-based telehealth model. We also offer another avenue of study, a practicum program for students enrolled in doctoral programs in clinical or counseling psychology, who similarly provide comprehensive care to our members. All trainees are supervised by licensed psychologists (in their respective states).
column65: We measure NPS for our self-guided member experience with recent results of 60+.
column67: We have refined our implementation process into a scalable and flexible model that addresses the needs of small to large employers. Implementation generally takes approximately 60 days, depending on scope and complexity.   Before starting implementation, we collect the following essential assets: -Clean eligibility data -Summary of benefits and coverage (SBCs) -Email safelist requirements -Each implementation begins with a kick-off meeting to learn, share, and address specific needs.   Our implementation opens with a kick-off meeting among key stakeholders (e.g., the account management team, implementation managers, internal subject matter experts, etc.) to learn, share, and address the client’s needs. The information discussed and noted during this forum becomes the basis for the client-specific launch and engagement plans.   The list of implementation achievements collectively accomplished throughout this process includes: -contract execution (completed before implementation) -technical integration and/or integration with client's health partners -eligibility data alignment and exchange -safe listing of internet protocols (IPs) and domains (email delivery testing) -operational readiness and testing -staff briefing on eligible population -referral process to applicable benefits/resources -overview of reporting standards (setup and configuration) -review of communication strategy and promotional tactics
column73: Headspace does not require a notice of termination for Sequoia bundle clients. We maintain and verify eligibility via a standardized eligibility process using a composite eligibility file of participating Sequoia clients submitted monthly.
column74: We have found that every employee demographic and every organization's processes are unique, and Headspace is adept at identifying and understanding these differences. Using this insight, we create effective engagement communication plans that drive awareness using a variety of multi-channel tactics, including digital, traditional, and interactive media, to execute the campaigns.  For Sequoia clients who choose the Marketplace Bundle, Headspace's Communication Playbook offers clients a set of launch essentials and campaigns that help streamline and optimize communications. Following are a few examples from the Communication Playbook, which includes digital, traditional, and interactive tactics and templates: -Email campaign templates -Flyer and handout templates -Newsletter/intranet content -Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) -Topical videos/workshops presented by our care team -Champion toolkit (communication templates for wellness champions, HR leads, and managers)
column79: Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) are central to our organization’s mission and values. Improving the health and happiness of the world means ensuring that our staff, leadership, and board of directors reflect the diversity present in the world. Our values reflect a core commitment to ensuring that we work to democratize mental health so that everyone has access to high-quality and affordable care. The centrality of DEIB in our organization’s values is also reflected in our approach to inclusive product and content design. We are dedicated to doing equitable and inclusive impact work that celebrates human diversity and fosters a culture of deep belonging in our organization and society.   -Diverse global workforce - We’re building a company that reflects the diversity of the people we serve and the world in which we live. -Culturally responsive care - We invest in cultural responsiveness and training for care providers to support any member of any community. -A place where everyone belongs - We engage in company-wide conversations, learn from others, and celebrate our diverse backgrounds and perspectives.  In addition to our previous initiatives, in 2023, we brought together our DEIB and Impact resources into a single team that focuses on people, society, and policy. These people, society and policy initiatives are grounded by an Inclusive Impact Model & Theory of Change, to systematize DEIB work done across teams and align them with our Environmental, Social, Governance (ESG) and the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Key areas of focus include: -Fostering a culture of DEIB among leaders and within cross-functional teams to enhance the employee experience, strengthen governance and a values-based culture. -Conducting place-based outreach, engagement, activation to drive member growth in areas of heightened social vulnerability where historically underserved individuals live, work, play, pray, and get educated. -Growing policy and mental health sector thought leadership across three policy priorities: mental health prevention for all, advancing mental health equity, expanding and protecting telehealth  We recognize that creating a world where everyone is kind to their mind requires addressing inequitable conditions in the places where individuals live, work, play, pray, and get educated. Our goals are to foster a climate and culture of mindfulness and mental health  that promotes transformative action inside our organization, for our members, and in the world.  Refer to the following for a few examples of our recent initiatives: -We have hired a c-suite leader for DEIB that reports directly to the CEO (Our diversity and social impact initiatives and teams are led by Dr. Wizdom Powell, Chief Social Impact and Diversity Officer: https://www.linkedin.com/in/wizdomp) -We have invested in our ERGs by providing them programming budgets and a stipend for our ERG leaders.  -We have hosted fish bowls with youth in the UK to better understand the unique experience of youth from historically excluded communities. -We expanded the DEIB team to hire a dedicated individual who supports our ERGs and cultural heritage month programming. -We have invested in external partnerships with organizations that help us connect with talent from historically excluded groups. -We expanded our DEIB data collection to better understand the diversity that exists across the company.    -We created DEIB data dashboards to help use data to guide the company’s workforce diversity efforts. -We created organization-wide principles for inclusive product and content design to ensure that we layer in a DEIB lens at the inception of, as well as, throughout the development process.  Within our virtual, on-demand mental health system, making mental healthcare accessible to all has been and will continue to be a key priority - both for our internal organization and for the clients and members we serve. Here are a few examples of ways we approach it:  Representative Care:  -Given underrepresentation in providers is a barrier to equitable mental healthcare, we actively address this inequity through the representation in our internal care team of coaches, therapists, and psychiatrists.   Representative Content:  -Our onboarding experience includes demographic data collection to enable a more personalized care experience. -We recently acquired Shine, a mental health and wellness app dedicated to providing an inclusive mental health experience for the BIPOC community.  -In addition to our acquisition of Shine, we added new teachers and special content collections to support a diverse workforce.  -Our self-care collections are led by certified meditation teachers and experts in nutrition, resilience, youth empowerment, neuroscience, emotion science, and stress management. Headspace’s diverse range of teachers, voices, and partnerships are designed to provide an inclusive experience for members and facilitate conversations around important topics like Black joy, racial injustice, and Asian mental health. Additionally, by partnering with Dive in Well, Headspace offers a collection of resources and meditations that cover topics like social justice, grief, anger, love, and community.   The discovery of need around SDoH is also a focal point in our approach to working with members. Discovery of SDoH needs does not often follow a clear path as many members will feel embarrassed or even ashamed that they are struggling with housing, access to food or dependable transportation. Our clinicians who support members via telephone, and our coaches, who are texting with members, are trained to explore these sensitive issues and initiate meaningful connections to community based organizations, or other resources within your benefit offering, that address these most important needs.   We also maintain a diverse board of directors, executive team, and broader employee population. For example, approximately 52% of our employees are from "Historically Excluded Groups" (non-white, not hetero, or disabled) and 44% of our employees affirmatively identify as non-white.
column82: Our standard data transmission process centers on a secure file transfer protocol (SFTP) site for pulling and applying data from eligibility files provided by Sequoia’s employer clients.  Required data fields include the employee's first name, last name, zip code, work email, and employee ID. There are also a range of optional fields, including gender, medical plan, location, department, address, and language (among others).
column91: We have experience establishing SSOs with organizations like Okta, Microsoft Azure, and other partners; however, each request requires custom review by our technology team to determine potential alignment and application.
column92: Headspace provides clients with quarterly and annual reporting. In addition to the following reports, we provide evidence-based insights and strategies to help enhance our solution across your employee population: -Signup reports show how many members download the app and register; -Onboarding insights illustrate key focus areas/themes of service of members based on responses to initial onboarding questions; -Engagement reports provide visibility into how frequently members interact with coaches, clinicians, and content topics/types; -Satisfaction ratings reflect the user experience and feedback; -Response time reports measure the time it takes for a coach to respond to a member’s message; -Appointment availability measures access timing and frequency of clinical sessions; -Outcome reports detail results based on member completion of PHQ, GAD, and adaptability surveys.
column101: Headspace Care’s full offering includes a comprehensive suite of programs that offers personalized support across the continuum of care – from prevention to complex clinical support based on each member's preferred approach to communication. Our services include:  Prevention and Guided Self-Care -Coaching via text-based chat – unlimited, 24/7 access in under two minutes – Taking a preventative approach to emotional health, we address issues before they evolve into greater challenges and provide support anywhere at anytime. Coaches assist members in taking slow, steady steps that lead to meaningful change in their lives, helping them overcome challenges in any number of domains, from sleep to mood to relationships. Coaches have advanced degrees in psychology related fields and/or coaching certifications and engage in ongoing training. -OPTIONAL: Unlimited access to Headspace audio and video self-care content –   We help members develop mental health and wellness routines that last a lifetime:  --Members can access Headspace’s beloved, standalone and series-based meditations, sleepcasts and sleep music, guided workouts, and focus music, anytime, anywhere.  --By combining the flexibility to explore the full Headspace library at the member’s own pace with the structure of a personalized content feed, our award-winning mindfulness program helps members take steady, measurable steps toward better wellbeing.  Counseling Resources for Elevated Care -Counseling session models that ensure employees and family members receive substantial care with no out-of-pocket costs. -Specialized collaborative care built around a W-2 staffing model that brings together a team of coaches, therapists, and psychiatrists who provide evidence-based support to members when they need it via our mobile app. -Support finding counselors and scheduling appointments, including follow up and continued care. -Referrals, including coordination with healthcare benefits; long-term counseling; specialized care; and community resources -Psychiatry services are available through our virtual psychiatry team, supporting members with more complex needs.  -Specialized support for adolescents (13-17 years old) and their parents. In-person counseling is also available for dependents ages 6-12. This expands care to children under 13 by helping parents find in-person care options.
column103: As with most benefits, the answer to this question varies by client and depends on the specifics of the client's employee benefits plan design. Headspace, along with its affiliated medical providers, operates as a provider system and is a licensed medical professional corporation (PC). Depending on the client’s current benefit programs and plan design, ERISA and related laws may impact client’s decision as to how to best incorporate  Headspace  services into its benefit program. As these regulatory requirements are complex and include consideration of other design-impacting issues, the client  should work with its benefits counsel to determine the best options for integrating Headspace services into its benefit offerings.   Headspace does not provide advice or legal guidance related to an employer's benefit plan design. However, Headspace, as a service provider, can support and provide information to clients to comply with any necessary filings.
column106: Whether Headspace Services are subject to COBRA depends. As COBRA requires that group health plans offer employees and their families the opportunity to receive continuation coverage in certain circumstances where coverage under the plan would otherwise end, the key question is whether the Headspace services a client  provides its employees constitute medical care. If the Headspace services provide medical care, it is likely that the services are COBRA eligible. Because certain deployments of Headspace services may not provide medical care, we recommend that a client check with its benefits counsel.
column118: Fringe benefits are perks or extra compensation over and above regular salary such as company car usage, tuition reimbursement, etc., often offered only to certain categories of employees. Whereas an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) is a voluntary, work-based program that offers free and confidential assessments, short-term counseling, referrals, and follow-up services to all employees who have personal and/or work-related problems.

column43: Legal Plan: PPLSI's legal plans are priced based on plan design and case size. We do typically not rate plans based on tiers related to age bands, attained age. column55: Our call center structure provides assistance to participants from representatives who can best address their question as quickly as possible.    National Plan: Our National Plan is supported by a dedicated Member Services team solely responsible for the service of our National Plan Sponsors and participants. The team is staffed by knowledgeable LegalShield employees who take all calls and are skilled to assist our participants and provide service on all things associated with our LegalShield and or IDShield plans including covered service questions, billing inquiries, issue resolution, pre-enrollment decision support, web navigation assistance, resolution for Provider Firm questions/ issues, identity theft questions/ resolution, and more.    We offer multi-language support for Member Services. We currently have English, Spanish, and French speaking representatives.  For participants with various disabilities we provide accommodations via email, chat, and the use of relay services.   Additional for IDT: Only if necessary, the call may be warm transferred to another representative who is able to address and resolve question/ issue more thoroughly or quickly. When a Licensed Private Investigator (LPI) is engaged, the LPI will establish a direct, 1:1 relationship with the participant and provide next steps in the consultation/ restoration process. The LPI is assigned for the duration of the restoration process for the participant.   Staffing: National Plan: The national plan member services team is staffed with 7 full-time representatives.
column56: We combine comprehensive quality control, adherence to service level agreements, and a diligent performance management process to support our plan sponsors and their participants. Our National Plans are supported by a dedicated team solely responsible for the service of National Plan sponsors and members. The team is comprised of veteran employee benefits professionals with over 30 years' experience in employee benefits, time-tested processes, and large plan sponsor capabilities.   Moreover, our quality management system includes monthly data-driven metric assessments and performance scorecards to ensure the best delivery of services for the Members. We use point-of-service surveys to ensure member satisfaction and incorporate results into our training programs.    Legal Plan: We offer the market’s only proactively managed legal network point-of-service experience. We measure member satisfaction through satisfaction surveys sent to every member engaging our Legal Plan Network. We roll-up results based on law firm performance, and track such metrics as Net Promoter Score.   Member Services: We take a proactive approach to management of our Member Services department. Not only do we require 100% of calls to be documented, we also proactively review calls throughout each month by management. Our Representatives are graded on their call performance. A formal bi-annual quality assurance evaluation is conducted with each Representative. Additional training and coaching is provided as necessary to help improve the representatives and the teams performance.

column67: Customer onboarding and account management is critical to ensuring the satisfaction of our customers and members. That is why we provide a dedicated implementation and account management team focused on executing the project plans and ongoing service at the highest levels and with the level of effort each customer is willing to provide. Our team consists of veteran employee benefits professionals as well as an experienced, knowledgeable Implementation Manager, who are charged with ensuring your overall satisfaction throughout our relationship. This consultative approach ensures that our plan sponsors can engage with us and manage our product in a manner that works best for all stakeholders.   Our process begins with the Implementation Manager leading an efficient and streamlined onboarding process working through the administrative and enrollment processes and communications plan. We will work with the plan sponsor to develop and execute on a comprehensive implementation plan, with periodic check-ins to ensure all tasks are completed to your satisfaction. Our Broker Relationship Director will serve as the primary service contact and account management owner on-going.  Singular accountability throughout the process with oversight from our National Sales Manager/Director helps us ensure we are hyper-focused on the development and care of our relationship with you.  The typical implementation timeline is 4-6 weeks in advance of enrollment. However, we will work with our customers to determine the appropriate timeline for their needs.   Reasons why implementation may be longer than standard 4–6-week timeline:   - If the plan design/ offer requires new plan codes (e.g. changes to supplements or new pricing). Plan codes are deployed every two weeks.  - Custom materials (last minute requests not known prior to implementation). Custom pieces require two week turn-a-round.  - Incorrect / incomplete information provided upfront - SSN/ DOB not provided during enrollment (Email missing for our website enrollments).
column73: Terminations and when to cancel coverage are determined by the employer. We are able to terminate immediately or, depending how the client collects premium from the employee, terminate at a later date (e.g. end of the month).
column74: We can provide the following marketing support:  - Digital Marketing: We provide group benefit websites and educational videos. In addition, we are able to host webinars and provide articles for E-Newsletters or other mediums used by the employer to promote and educate employees on the benefits throughout the year.   - Traditional Marketing - Enrollment fliers, breakroom fliers, benefit booklet inserts.   - Home Mail: Upon effective date of the plan, participants enrolled in the benefit will receive a mailed Welcome letter with their member number and steps to create their account.  - Email: We provide email memo templates for employers to use when communicating/ promoting the benefit.
column79: PPLSI has selected the Disabled American Veterans, Lambda Legal, and the Oklahoma Innocence Project for our annual social responsibility / awareness contributions. Each of these organizations battle for the rights of their clients and/or members just as PPLSI does for our members, associates, and employees. Working to improve the systems, policies, programs, and laws, just to name a few, to ensure our veterans, the LGBTQ community, and the Oklahoman's wrongfully convicted have a fighting chance for equal justice for all.     DAV  The disabled American Veterans organization aligns with PPLSI's mission and values by ensuring all veterans and their families have access to the full range of benefits they are entitled to, provide care and support during tough times, transitioning to civilian life, advocate for the veteran community on Capitol Hill, connect veterans with meaningful employment and so much more. The DAV has been fighting for our veterans and their families for over 100 years.     LAMBDA LEGAL  The Lambda Legal team has been fighting to defend and expand protections for the LGBTQ community for over 50 years.  Helping to improve equality, employment, health care, fighting for new policies on Capitol Hill and so much more.  Fighting to ensure equal justice for all.    OKLAHOMA INNOCENCE PROJECT  The Oklahoma Innocence Project has been dedicated to identifying and remedying cases of wrongful convictions in Oklahoma since 2011. As with PPLSI, working towards righting the wrongs that have been done and fighting for what is right and just.

LegalShield: LegalShield's reports show benefits administrators how the LegalShield Plan provides value to employees within their specific group, and also how utilization compares to groups similar in size. column40: Omada for MSK members are provided with: --Fully dedicated licensed physical therapist --Intuitive app and computer vision (CV) technology --3D animation library with 500+ exercises added continually --Individualized care plan (personalized by the members’ job, lifestyle factors, SDOH, etc.) + adjustments --MSK kit which includes exercise bands, a phone stand, a door anchor, and a lacrosse ball.  The Omada for MSK program consists of four main components:  --Unlimited engagement with a physical therapist  --Individualized exercises and care plans for each participant --Behavioral health support --Monitoring of patient progress via assessments  As the first fully virtual company to earn URAC accreditation, Omada for MSK meets the high clinical standards set by URAC for our high-quality, tele-physical-therapy services for joint and muscle health from licensed physical therapists.   Finally, all Omada PTs are continually trained on how to address SDOH topics.
column42: Yes.   We generally support clients with 50 or more employees / members. For direct contracts with Omada, we generally prefer 1,000 covered lives between the products the client is looking to purchase. For example, a client looking at only one product would need to have 1,000 benefits eligible employees. However, a client considering all four Omada programs would need to have 250 benefits eligible employees (250 x 4). We do consider client groups with fewer than 50 employees or members on a case-by-case basis.
column43: For your bundled clients, Omada for MSK's pricing is on a case rate basis. There are three scenarios which illustrate how the pricing works:  MSK Prevention Program: $0 No cost.  A member enrolls in the program and upon intake indicates that they have no current injury and are interested in injury prevention.  First time/One time PT Consult + Care Plan (consult fee of $250)  Within 48 hours of signing up, the patient will have a video consultation with a licensed PT. From this evaluation, the PT will use their clinical judgment to guide the patient into the program most appropriate for their condition. The First time/One time PT Consult + Care Plan provides access to prescribed exercise animation videos, computer vision video, educational articles and unlimited chats with their PT. The member can follow the self-guided care plan without further involvement from the PT. If the member determines within 12 months after enrollment that they do require additional PT involvement, they can contact their PT at any time and opt-in to the next level Full PT-Guided care below.  Full PT-Guided Care Program (Consult fee ($250) + Program fee ($625)  If the PT feels the patient would benefit most from receiving 1:1 attention with an individualized care plan, frequent communication and support, the patient will be directed into this care path. The PT-Guided fee is capped for 12 months with unlimited video visits and asynchronous in-app messaging for the same episode, and a participant will not incur any other fees throughout duration of treatment.    For Omada products outside your current bundle, our cardiometabolic programs (Prevention, Hypertension, and Diabetes) use the activity-based billing (ABB) model, working to ensure that they are actively using their program and managing their health. Under the ABB billing model, each program has a monthly condition fee. There are no set-up fees, implementation fees or travel fees and standard reporting is included.   Please contact Lauren Barbaro for a quote at lauren.dallo@omadahealth.com or 631-848-2760.
column54: Omada's Member Support team is available to applicants and members 24/7 by email or through an on-demand Help Center. That team can also be contacted via phone on Monday through Friday from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Pacific Time.

Deliver results 5. Succeed together 6. Remember why we're here   This approach helps ensure our Member Support agents are:  --Clear, empathetic communicators --Problem solvers that use creative and critical thinking strategies to provide a great member experience --Discrete and handle sensitive, confidential information appropriately --Personable and enjoy engaging with members
column56: '--Dedicated Health Coach: DPP Certified Health Coach; Bachelor’s degree or higher & experience in a health-related field  --Cardiometabolic Specialist: All Clinical Specialists possess a Certified Diabetes Care and Education Specialist credential + either a Registered Dietitian or Registered Nurse credential  --Behavioral Health Specialist: All Behavioral Health Specialists are Licensed Clinical Social Workers (LCSW)  --Physical Therapist: All Physical Therapists are licensed to practice in the state of the member they are treating and our staff has specialist certifications in areas such as Orthopaedics and Sports at a significantly higher rate than the national average.
column67: Our implementation is intended to be simple, seamless and straightforward, typically allowing us to launch to your eligible population within 30-60 days of kick-off. A brief overview of the key activities leading up to launch is provided below:   Kick-off/Discovery (Day 1-15) --Introduction to Omada Client Success - meet your Omada Customer Success Manager (Implementation lead and on-going support) and Senior Member Growth Manager, builds enrollment and engagement marketing programs. Senior Member Growth Manager sample high level campaign listed in attachments. Senior Member Growth Manager leverages past program success, SDOH data and customer input variables to design each campaign. This Senior Member Growth Manager program design, implementation and support is included at no additional cost to our customers.  --Omada Demo and deep dive - detailed walkthrough of the Omada program, roles and responsibilities --Review implementation and launch plan - detailed walkthrough of project plan - responsibilities, implementation activities and key milestones leading up to targeted launch date.  --Employee census - get to know where your eligible populations are based to ensure appropriate PT staffing once we are live. --Vendor/partner discussion - understand your vendors/partners who we might collaborate with to support functions such as communications, eligibility management or referrals (to and from Omada).   Operations and Setup (Day 1-45) --Eligibility file setup (required) - for ongoing identification of eligible participants --Claims file setup (optional, can be decoupled from initial implementation) - for use in targeted outreach --Partner integrations (where applicable) --Establish billing protocol - setup billing process for monthly invoicing or ongoing claims processing. --Client Success planning --Ongoing meeting cadence --Key contacts --Reporting/key metrics   Marketing and Communications Planning (Day 15-60) --Channel review - understanding your most effective communications channels for spreading the word on Omada. --Finalize materials and copy - select and customize materials from Omada’s playbook for distribution in communications campaign(s). Digital and print available. --Finalize communications plan - establish timing and related materials for pre-launch, launch and post-launch marketing of Omada to your eligible population.   Please see the attached “Omada Health onboarding implementation - Sequoia Consulting - Glide Pathway”.

column73: Our standard terms require advance written notice of at least 120 days' prior to the effective date of the termination so that Omada is able to safely wind down the care being provided to participants.
column74: The Omada enrollment outreach plan combines insights from the client with Omada's strategy to create the most impact. Generally, we recommend:    1) An email introduction from the client's leadership team. A familiar voice establishes trust and credibility for the Omada Program in advance of the deployment and should be the first communication sent in a campaign series. We will provide a template that a client management team member can cut and paste into their email program  2) Multi-touch email series sent by Omada spanning six emails per campaign, with an annual calendar launching between 4-5 campaigns (or to the clients' discretion). When it comes to enrolling members into Omada, we’ve learned that email is 3x-10x more effective than direct mail or onsite events. To further increase the effectiveness of email, Omada has invested in consumer research to develop a proven email narrative that speaks to the benefits, features, and motivations that resonate with potential Omada members. This roughly one-month cadence–with each email featuring a distinct theme informed by consumer insights–gives the audience multiple chances to take action within a set period of time.   3) Establish local "Omada Champions" if appropriate, and motivate them to educate client members about the program. We have found that Omada Champions, such as a human resources representative or executive, can drive utilization for their employees through their own experience and testimony.  4) Client-led toolkits focused on providing our clients content for their existing channels. We can provide blurbs for their Intranet, open enrollment materials, digital signs, on-site signage, flyers and content for monthly health awareness (like American Heart Health, Diabetes Awareness, Mental Health, etc).   5) We can provide content for health plans and pharmacy benefit managers who are partnered with our clients, if applicable. We can provide portal content, messaging for Explanation of Benefits, pharmacy bag tags, blurbs for their microsite and more.

column79: Omada has several on-going diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives built into our company, product, and care delivery, including:  --Finding and addressing bias in our product experience (led by: Product) In how we learn/test; program content; illustrations; features; coach tool/logic; and more. --Care team inclusivity training (Led by: Medical Affairs Team) Learn how member identity and social drivers inform health and healthcare. Trainings are required as part of onboarding, and on-going through monthly clinical trainings. Social Drivers of Health has been identified as the Medical Affairs Team number one priority. --Coaches/care team hiring (Led by: Operations, and People & Culture) Full review/update of hiring profiles and practices to ensure inclusivity and reduce/remove bias. --Building diversity & inclusion into the research process (Led by: Data Science, Participant Insights). Audit and address biases in data collection and analysis (quantity and quality).  We also address DEI and SDOH for customers and participants in the following areas: --Omada outreach materials --Application & account setup --Member/care team connection --Care onboarding --Food insecurity and nutrition --Social support --Medication support --Musculoskeletal care --Benefit referrals --Promoting coping
column82: We require the following fields from a client:  --unique_id: This should be the health plan member ID if we are submitting claims or employee ID otherwise. The applicant should know the ID so we can match it to their coverage to confirm eligibility. --group_number: Required if multiple groups needing segmentation for reporting, etc. --dependent: Required if the deployment includes dependents.  --first_name: Member’s first name. --last_name: Member’s last name --dob: Member’s date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format --gender: Member’s gender as either M or F --city: Member’s home city --state: Member’s home state (two digit abbreviation) --zip: Member’s home zip code (9 digit preferred)  Please see the attached “Omada Health Eligibility File IT Specification”.
column84: Omada Health Eligibility File IT Specification.pdf
column91: Omada supports SSO for all authentications. Currently we only support password logins and SAML federation, with 2FA with either of those.   While we can support SSO, our standard is to provide a dedicated landing page for each customer's employees to learn about the Omada program and take our short risk screener to determine eligibility. This client-specific URL is referenced in all employee communications about Omada and can be promoted on all client internal communications, benefits portal, and company Intranet. Because the entire participant journey - including application, account setup, and the program itself, resides on the Omada platform, we find SSO to be a less ideal user experience. Our managed file transfer (MFT) service currently supports multi-factor authentication via Google Authenticator or Okta. For end-user logins, we support 2FA and we can support SAML, but Omada's iPhone/Android apps aren't bound to an authentication server.   We are happy to discuss a client's requirements around SSO as we do address this request on a case-by-case basis to ensure our customers' requirements are met.
column92: Yes. Types of utilization reporting we provide clients through our secure customer reporting portal include:  --# of weigh-ins (for eligible Prevention, Diabetes and Hypertension participants who have an elevated BMI >=25 (>=23 if Asian descent)) --# of log-ins to our platform --# of interactions with connected devices (Omada for Prevention, Diabetes, Hypertension) --# of lessons completed (Omada for Prevention, Diabetes, Hypertension) --# of activities tracked (Omada for Prevention, Diabetes, Hypertension) --# of meals tracked (Omada for Prevention, Diabetes, Hypertension) --# of interactions with dedicated, professionally trained health coaches (Omada for Prevention, Diabetes, Hypertension) --# of group interactions (Omada for Prevention, Diabetes, Hypertension) --# of in-app workouts completed (Omada for MSK) --# of video visits with dedicated, licensed PT (Omada for MSK)   Additionally, we measure and report on enrollment, validated clinical outcomes, and qualitative member feedback. The reports that we provide at the aggregate level are de-identified and HIPAA-compliant.
column101: Launched in 2011, Omada for Prevention focuses on pre-diabetes and weight management--two critical elements of preventing diabetes or heart disease. Following guidelines and recommendations set by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force and the CDC, the goal of the program is to help members lose weight, maintain a healthy weight, and increase physical activity. Our program is fully recognized by the CDC as a DPP provider.  Omada for Diabetes supports and enables eligible members to achieve stable blood glucose levels and meet and maintain their A1C reduction goals based on treatment guidelines from the American Diabetes Association. Members are paired with a dedicated, professionally trained health coach and Certified Diabetes Care and Education Specialist (CDCES). On-call CDCES' are also available 24/7 in the event of a dangerous glucose or blood pressure reading to provide in-depth consultation to the health coach. As of April 2023, Omada has achieved 3-year NCQA Population Health Program accreditation for our T2D program--the first fully virtual healthcare provider to earn this distinction. (https://resourcecenter.omadahealth.com/latest-content/omada-health-earns-3-year-ncqa-population-health-program-accreditation)  Omada for Hypertension focuses on reducing members' blood pressure. Applying clinical protocols recommended by the American Medical Association (AMA), the American College of Cardiology (ACC), and the American Heart Association (AHA), our dedicated, professionally trained health coaches provide support and resources to improve blood pressure control for members with hypertension through connected blood pressure monitors, real-time secure messaging, group board discussions, as well as frequent and proactive check-ins. The coach may also consult with a hypertension specialist if needed. Omada holds the NCQA Population Health Program (PHP) Accreditation for our combined Diabetes+Hypertension programs--the first fully virtual healthcare provider to earn this accreditation. (https://resourcecenter.omadahealth.com/press-releases/omada-health-becomes-first-fully-virtual-healthcare-provider-to-earn-ncqa-population-health-program-accreditation)  Omada for MSK members are provided with:  --Fully dedicated licensed physical therapist --Intuitive app and computer vision (CV) technology --3D animation library with 500+ exercises added continually --Individualized care plan (personalized by the members’ job, lifestyle factors, SDOH, etc.) + adjustments --MSK kit which includes an exercise bands, a phone stand, a door anchor, and a lacrosse ball.  As the first fully virtual company to earn URAC accreditation, Omada for MSK meets the high clinical standards set by URAC for our high-quality, tele-physical-therapy services for joint and muscle health from licensed physical therapists.    All of our programs include behavioral health support, with specialists (LCSWs) available 24/7 to provide expert insights to the rest of the care team for a behavioral health emergency. When a member's care needs reach beyond the scope of their condition management plan, our care teams are trained to assist with navigating members to covered mental health services, such as therapy or prescribed medication, that they can access through their EAP, health plan network, or an employer system.
column104: Omada Health is a health care provider; it is not a health plan or other entity subject to ERISA. However, when an employer customer enters into a contract with Omada, the law may consider the employer a sponsoring group health plan and as such, is subject to ERISA. This would apply whether the employer establishes its arrangements with Omada as a stand-alone plan, as part of the employer self-funded plan, or as part of the employer insured plan. It is the responsibility of the employer, not Omada, to comply with ERISA, such as summary plan document, COBRA, and 5500.   Omada does not provide legal advice or recommendations for provisions that relate to the State Departments of Insurance or U.S. Department of Labor to third parties. This response is for informational purposes only.
column107: Omada Health is a health care provider. While requirements related to COBRA do not apply to providers like Omada in the same way they do ERISA plans, Omada programs can be made available to COBRA beneficiaries at the election of the sponsoring ERISA plan.
column118: Omada is not a fringe benefit, but is a health care provider under Section 213 of the Internal Revenue Code.

column40: SNOO is the first (and only!) baby bed to receive FDA De Novo Approval for its ability to keep sleeping babies on the back (happiestbaby.com/pages/fda). Back-sleeping is the #1 safe sleeping recommendation by all US public health authorities, including the AAP, CDC, and WHO. SNOO is parent’s all-night car seat for their little ones. It reduces the temptation to bed-share, alleviates parental exhaustion,  and prevents risky rollovers with its secure swaddle. Awarded Best Bassinet by New York Times Wirecutter, SNOO is a new-parent sanity-saver and gives parents peace of mind.   The SNOO Employee Benefit Program has no upfront costs or minimum spend, easy and quick launch, dedicated assets and promotional materials, and 7 day/week customer care.

column40: Our scalable technology was built to administer a wide-ranging set of spending accounts with many opportunities for custom configuration. Our LSA offering is just one of the many programs we can administer (Wellness, Food & Grocery, Healthcare Travel, Pre-Tax Accounts, Education and Tuition Support, and more).    Our Differentiators:  1) A financial technology foundation that empowers employees with access to pre-funded accounts. These accounts represent the employer's benefit programs and can be accessed simply by charging their Benepass Visa Card at a merchant (physically or virtually) or submitting an expense for reimbursement, which we adjudicate and pay out (via ACH in the US) for our clients. Access to a funded account removes the need for employees to front the cost for their benefits programs, which has enabled our clients to see over 85% employee engagement. Our card-based approach enables employers to deploy global benefits that are equitable across domestic and international employees.  2) An administration and policy layer gives account administrators control over how they customize, adapt, and monitor these programs. This enables employers to customize their benefits to match the company's vision and values while providing the agility and flexibility to adapt to employee needs. During a client's relationship with Benepass, they will partner with our Implementation Experts / a Dedicated Customer Success Manager to design their programs. Our CSMs will be available on an ongoing basis to help strategize on topics like new program iterations and tactics to increase engagement and to provide benchmarks and learnings from other companies in the Benepass ecosystem.  3) Enterprise-level capabilities with automation, reporting, controls, integrations & employee well-being data make administering modern benefits, like an LSA, painless for clients. We integrate directly with HRIS and Payroll systems to make it seamless to sync rosters, enroll or term employees, and manage tax compliance at scale. And we provide out-of-the-box reporting like transaction history, reconciliation reporting, and imputed income to ensure any business stakeholder can quickly get the data they need. Employee wellbeing data is live and used to consistently see how your employees are engaging with their benefits programs, to make programs better, and more meaningful to employees over time. We have bi-directional syncs with payroll systems like Workday.  4) Equitable Global benefits experience & parity: Localize Benepass app for each country with translated currency to ensure every global employee has a seamless experience in their local region/country. Benepass' global reach means employees can spend wherever Visa is accepted! Benebot, our generative AI tool, can also handle receipts in different languages and answer employee questions in any language.   5) A consumer-grade experience for employees: Member Experience is at the forefront of how Benepass was built. We pride ourselves on a modern user experience for employees. A member's first experience with Benepass is the mobile app and web portal to set up their account, view stipend balances, explore the marketplace, and instantly access their virtual VISA card, all via a self-service model. Our platform and program work the way an individual lives and works. We believe ""one size fits all"" benefit models do not provide an equitable experience for employees globally, so we are enabling our clients to give their most prized asset, their people, the power to choose how their benefits need to work for them. "
