column43: We charge PEPM depending on a company's number of employees and the number of Lifestyle and pre-tax accounts they have. Prices typically range from $1.75-5 PEPM. We are happy to explore and discuss preferred pricing for Sequoia clients.
column54: Employee Support: - One tap away: Employees can submit requests 24/7/365 directly through the Benepass app. Our team's live hours are Monday through Friday, 9am EST to 8pm EST, except on federal US holidays. Our Employee Experience team consistently scores over 97% on Customer Satisfaction Scores (CSAT); your team will be in good hands! - Comprehensive help center for real-time resources: Employees and admins can also visit our comprehensive Help Center if they prefer to self-serve their needs. - Benebot, our generative AI tool, can also answer common employee questions with data specific to that user. It can also handle simple administrative tasks and give program overviews to employees.  Admin support:  - For HR/People admins, we are responsive around the clock. Requests submitted outside of business hours will be addressed the following business day. - Open enrollment and go-live webinars: During open enrollment or prior to go live, we will host employee and admin webinars to train your team on the platform and how to get help. We are alos happy to attend a benefits fair in person as well.
column55: We believe setting up programs exactly to the client's specifications on day 1 and automating as much as we can, mean that both employees and admins will be successful with our technology very quickly.  On day 1, Benepass clients will be assigned a team of experienced Benepass customer service representatives. This will ensure a smooth and flawless implementation, and best-in-class experience after going live. We also have systems in place to ensure a client's unique requirements and programs are known across all relevant organizations within Benepass.                                                       Dedicated Customer Onboarding Manager: During Implementation, you will have a Customer Onboarding Manager who will project manage the process and help you design and configure your benefits. We find it a best practice to have weekly meetings to track progress during this period.  Dedicated Customer Engineer:  This individual will ensure any file setup or integration works as intended.  Dedicated Customer Success Manager: After implementation, you will begin your partnership with a dedicated Customer Success Manager. Our Customer Success Managers will partner with you to monitor employee success, and also proactively design campaigns and engagement strategies that will continue to drive program participation. They will also be available for consultation and the design of new programs, and can project manage any iterations to existing ones.  Best-in-class Customer Support Team - Employees can submit requests 24/7/365 directly through the Benepass app. Our team's live hours are Monday through Friday, 9am EST to 8pm EST, except on federal US holidays. Our Employee Experience team consistently scores over 97% on Customer Satisfaction Scores (CSAT); your team will be in good hands! - Employees and admins can also visit our comprehensive Help Center or Benebot, our generative AI tool, if they prefer to self-serve their needs. - For HR/People admins, we are responsive around the clock. Requests submitted outside of business hours will be addressed the following business day.
column56: The same team that implements your client's LSA and pre-tax accounts is the same team that will be supporting them and will therefore know their unique LSA inside and out. Most of our clients bundle in their pre-tax accounts as well and so our team also know IRS regulations around pre-tax accounts like FSA, HSA, and HRA.
column67: Our typical Implementation timeline is 6-8 weeks, though we can move as quickly or as slowly as a client prefers.    1. Account Funding - Working with the client's internal Finance Team to ensure account is setup and funded.  2. Tech/IT Configuration - Working with the client's team to sync the employee directory to automate new hire enrollment and termination processes.  3. Benefits Policies Finalized - Working with the client's Benefits Admins to finalize the details of the programs (contributions, eligibility, expirations, rollovers, merchant eligibility).  4. Communications and Training for Go Live - Prior to launch, we will provide your admin team with full training on both our employee and admin portals. We will provide your team with sample employee communications which we can customize (depending on your communication preference). We host employee webinars/Q&A sessions so employees can feel confident and comfortable in accessing their benefits programs.  5. Go Live  Registration: Employee registration will be automatically streamlined based on your configuration. These enrollments will happen based on your program design and HRIS/Payroll data provided. We will go live on the date you agreed on during your onboarding process.   Engagement: To drive employee engagement we've built programmatic 'nudges' (In-App, Email, and SMS Notifications) that inspire and remind your employees to leverage their programs.
column73: Our typical agreement is for one (1) year and automatically renews for successive one (1)-year periods, unless either party requests termination at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the then-current term.
column74: Before go-live, your Dedicated Customer Onboarding Manager will be available for Open Enrollment or for company-wide training sessions (+ Q&A) for your employees!  Registration: Employee registration will be automatically streamlined based on your configuration. These enrollments will happen based on your program design and HRIS/Payroll data provided. We will go live on the date you agreed on during your onboarding process and employees will get an email inviting them to log in. After logging in they will be guided through a log in flow and informed about their benefits and given a virtual card immediately.  Engagement: To drive employee engagement we've built programmatic 'nudges' (In-App, Email, and SMS Notifications) that inspire and remind your employees to leverage their programs. Admins also have live analytics of employee engagement and can work with their CSM to drive further participation.
column79: Our card-first LSA solution is a great way to support DEI initiatives because not every employee has the ability to spend their own money first and wait for reimbursement for a wellness related expense. This is exclusionary to low earners, to young employees with high student debt, and those employees who live paycheck to paycheck. With our solution, every employee can start taking advantage of their wellness/LSA dollars immediately with the card and not have to worry about this.

column91: We can support OAuth and SAML protocols - SSO is provided at no additional cost.
column92: All of our reporting capabilities are available in real-time and directly in the Benepass Admin Dashboard. Here are some example reports you will have available:  Recon Report:  This report is the source of truth for all money movement on the Benepass platform. This report can be filtered and sorted to support a number of end of month or close of book functions for accounting and finance teams. All other Benepass reports are built off of this data. Admin teams can use this report for line-by-line auditing, as well as the building blocks of any custom reporting required.  Benepass Platform Statement: This report summarizes the Itemized Reconciliation (IR) report. The totals listed here are equal to the sum of each type of spending listed on the IR for the same time period. Admin teams can use this report to see an at-a-glance summary of the IR report.  Imputed Income Report:          If your company has a taxable benefit, you will need to regularly report taxable spending on employee paychecks as "Imputed Income." This report will show all taxable spending by employee for a time period, either in aggregate and breakdown views. HR and Payroll teams use this report to calculate YTD taxable spending, and push imputed income on employee paychecks at a regular, pre-determined cadence.  International Reimbursements: A summary of all reimbursements approved by international employees for a select time period. This report will show a sum of all reimbursements approved for payout, and can also be toggled to show the breakdown of included transactions. HR and Payroll teams use this report to provide international employees their reimbursements via payroll at a regular, pre-determined cadence.  Transaction Table and Spending Reports: Dynamic searching, filtering and sorting functions on this report will allow you to customize spending summaries. Admin teams can use this report to track individual or company-wide spending patterns. You can breakdown transactions by employee, location, benefit type, and more.  We also provide Employees access to a complete history of spending within all their enrolled accounts by logging in to the mobile app or employee web portal.
column101: Benepass currently supports many innovative and progressive companies across the globe, administering Lifestyle Spending Accounts and tax-advantaged programs for over 100,000 employees.   The majority of our clients have access to one or more of the following:  Lifestyle Spending Accounts: are employer-funded accounts that provide after-tax funds to support employees wellness needs and happiness  Wellness Accounts: (Type of LSA) gives employees money to spend on mental health (eg Headspace, Calm), or physical wellbeing (gyms, classes).  Remote Work Accounts: (Type of LSA) provide employees funds to create a home office or to pay for co-working spaces  Family Care and Formation Accounts: (Type of LSA) provide employees funds to start/expand their family or to care for their existing children or elders  Professional Development Accounts: (Type of LSA) provides employees funds for training, courses, or conferences in service of their own professional development  Rewards and Recognition: gives employees bonuses to recognize achievements  Flexible Spending Accounts: lets employees set aside pre-tax money for healthcare costs  Commuter Accounts: provides employees tax-free money for work-related transportation costs  Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts: provides employees pre-tax money to cover child or elder care services  Health Reimbursement Arrangements: provides employees tax-free funds from employers to cover healthcare expenses  Health Savings Accounts: lets employees set aside tax-advantaged funds for medical expenses (and invest those funds)
column103: Benepass LSA programs exclude medical services.  Our pretax accounts (FSA, HSA, and HRA) are subject to ERISA guidelines and we have outside counsel, that specializes in ERISA requirements, review our pre-tax programs and processes.   Our internal team is also trained on pretax account rules and regulations. We also audit and review our internal workflows on a regular basis to ensure compliance.  Benepass supports employers with the creation of Plan Documents and administering of Non-Discrimination Testing to ensure compliance.
column106: Benepass's FSA, HSA, and HRA accounts are subject to COBRA. We partner closely with COBRA administrators to ensure we continue service as elected.   If the client is looking to bundle pre-tax, LSA and COBRA, we also have a COBRA partner that we work with closely during implementation to ensure a seamless experience.

column117: "Common use cases for the Benepass LSA include wellness, fitness, nutrition, work-from-home enablement, rewards and recognition, food and grocery, and more.   Taxability of programs is maintained at a program-level, so that a client can properly reflect any fringe benefit spending as imputed income (employees will be taxed only when they spend their funds, not at the point of contribution). Benepass supports out-of-the-box, real-time Imputed Income reporting that Admins can access at any time. These reports can be exported and uploaded into the client's payroll system."

column40: Physician led model based on early engagement: By directly connecting patients with a physician we reduce time to treatment, eliminate wasteful spending, reduce risk, and ultimately improve clinical outcomes. By offering the full spectrum of reproductive health, wellness, and fertility care under one solution, Kindbody ends the fragmentation of care which directly improves outcomes and reduces the number of point solutions involved in a patient's journey.  Innovation, technology, multi-modal approach to care: Kindbody uniquely combines virtual telemedicine care, in-person care, digital -patient portal, experienced navigation, and ability to integrate within an employer’s ecosystem to provide a seamless member experience that ends fragmentation of care and supports members throughout their reproductive health continuum.  As clinical experts we guarantee that our end-to-end multi-modal approach to care translates to a better member experience, improved outcomes, and cost savings.   Guaranteed Savings: Kindbody replaces legacy fee-for-service solutions with value-based case rates and transparent pricing, in turn avoiding excessive provider reimbursements and vendor margins. Our value-based bundled case rates include all services required to complete a fertility cycle.  This includes PGT-A (preimplantation genetic testing for aneuploidy), which is critical for enhancing outcomes. Unlike other benefits managers, Kindbody only charges for this testing when it’s used, avoiding unnecessary costs for employers and members.  For fertility medications, KindbodyRx enhances the family-building benefit and increases value. KindbodyRx’s virtual pharmacy combines significant fertility medication savings with 24/7 personalized support. It is the only solution able to provide pharmacy cost guarantees on a bundled, per-treatment-cycle basis, rather than a cost-per-script pharmacy benefits manager (PBM) model. These financial models align incentives to treat the patient holistically in their fertility journey, providing the best care while managing waste and overspending. Kindbody estimates that, on average, employers will save 25% annually in direct medical and pharmacy costs by partnering with Kindbody, compared to other solutions.
column42: Kindbody targets all domestic markets with a minimum of 1,000 eligible employees and multinational employers with global members. We will evaluate global minimums on a case by case basis, given an employer meets our U.S. minimum; No annual minimums  In addition, employers of any size can take advantage of the Small Business Model Kindbody deployed in 2023 through established partnerships with: Justworks, Namely, Bennie, BenefitBump, New Benefits, Rightway and more. In these relationships, Kindbody’s partner owns the contract and their own pricing arrangements.  Consultants or employers can reach out directly to each entity for costing and contract options.
column43: Kindbody’s solution centers on transparency. Our pricing model is different than any other in this space with a one time implementation fee and utilization based pricing. We provide value-based bundled case rates with care navigation fee per utilizing member included in the case rate with no mark ups or hidden fees. These case rates are consistent across all U.S. markets, allowing employers to provide a rich, equitable benefit regardless of member location.   To determine utilization, Kindbody will leverage our book of business or can evaluate employer's historical data to determine utilization and cost projections. Below is Kindbody's book of business utilization (of total employer population) across all industries, employer size, and benefit plan design.   Consultations and diagnostics - 1.00% Fertility treatment (IUI, IVF) - 0.35% Egg freezing (preventive and medically necessary) - 0.12% Adoption, donor, surrogacy - 0.05% Kindbody 360 sessions - 1.20% KindDoula - 0.50% Kindbody Menopause - 0.40% KindBaby - 0.70%     Kindbody welcomes analysis of employer claims data to provide direct Kindbody pricing projections/savings and can provide data from book of business that demonstrates annual savings of 35% on fertility services compared to the same employer's prior cost of care with former coverage.
column54: Kindbody’s Care Navigators are available from 8am - 9pm ET, Monday - Friday and 9am - 5pm ET, Saturday. During non-business hours and for non-urgent matters, members can reach out for support via secure message in the Patient Portal/app or by leaving a voicemail. For members who are pursuing a treatment cycle they will also have access to emergency, 24/7 clinical support with an on-call nurse and physician
column55: Similar to Sequoia, our clients and their members are our north star. We partner with our clients to ensure that we continue to grow and innovate together. Kindbody will support Sequoia’s clients throughout open enrollment and beyond, providing communications to raise awareness about the benefit, not only engaging the member, but guaranteeing an understanding of their offering and utilizing this life changing benefit. Kindbody will perform surveys to collect both ongoing qualitative and quantitative feedback from our clients regarding any learning opportunities to better serve our clients' needs. Metrics include (but not limited to): responsiveness, availability, professionalism, knowledge of client's business, frequency, and proactiveness of new solutions. Additionally, Kindbody will assign a program Executive Sponsor who will help manage urgent requests and needs in addition to supporting high priority escalations.
column56: As the only family-building benefit administrator that is also in the provision of care, we offer a unique opportunity for members to engage with board certified fertility and reproductive health specialists at the onset of engagement for diagnosis and treatment.  Clinical Team Kindbody clinicians provide comprehensive care that includes consultation, education, diagnosis, and treatment (including ordering diagnostic tests and prescribing medications when appropriate). The clinical team is accessible in-person, at our clinics, via phone, as well as via the Kindbody portal/app through secure messaging. Kindbody also offers telemedicine services, so that the member can engage quickly and easily with Kindbody at their preference. Kindbody’s clinical team consists of: – Reproductive Endocrinologists – Embryologists – Obstetricians – Gynecologists – Physician Assistants – Urologists – Nurse Practitioners – Registered Nurses – Medical Assistants – Sonographers  Additional Supportive Professionals  Kindbody is committed to supporting the whole human by addressing each patient's physical need and emotional wellbeing. Kindbody offers an array of coaching, mental health, physical health, and other supplemental nuanced fertility and family building services. These care team members are accessible virtual, via phone, video, and email, depending on the member’s preference. They offer one-on-one telehealth services to support the member throughout their unique family-building journey. The non-clinical care team includes: – Certified Doulas/Midwives – Licensed Clinical Therapists – Physical Therapists – Nutritional Health Coaches – Mind & Body Coaches – Adoption/Foster Care Coaches – Sleep Coaches  Care Navigation The Kindbody Care Navigator will be assigned at the start of the member journey and consistent throughout. In addition to having a complete understanding of each member’s employer sponsored coverage, they can provide guidance for actionable next steps based on their member interactionsThey will also direct members to a robust team of Kindbody experts to assist in more detailed scenarios, including, but not limited to: Kindbody Financial Coordinator, Pharmacy Specialist, Coaches and Counselors, 24/7 Nurse Navigator.  The Care Navigation team guides the member through their Kindbody benefit journey to ensure a seamless experience for the member and coordinates the full-spectrum of benefits available to the patient and their covered family members. The team provides guidance through the care pathway and identifies resources available within the full spectrum of Kindbody services, as well as available providers and clinics.   This team has a wide range of experience in healthcare, hospitality and customer experience. Most importantly they are all deeply passionate about Kindbody's mission.
column67: Implementation duration can be 60 to 90+ days based on the complexity of the plan design. Kindbody will provide the full implementation and project management timeline after scoping is complete. Upon kick-off for implementation, Kindbody will assign an implementation manager who will oversee the overall project plan, ensure deliverables are timely and accurate, and mitigate any potential risks. The implementation manager will host a key stakeholders kick-off meeting with every department represented and project status calls (weekly or biweekly cadence as mutually agreed to with the client).   Internal/external stakeholders who will be part of the overall project includes, but not limited to, Operations, Account Management, Customer Success/CX, Sales/Partnerships, Finance, Marketing, Product, IT along with any other Vendor Partners.   The implementation manager will serve as the key point of contact throughout the project and ensure all stakeholders are aware of upcoming deliverables and will ensure the project remains on track for launch. The implementation manager will track all tasks, including key milestones under the four key phases: initiation, requirements, testing/training, and go live readiness.   Our implementation process starts with an implementation kick-off meeting where the implementation manager review the overall timeline and key milestones for project deliverables.  Following the initial kick off meeting, the implementation manager will schedule a weekly or bi weekly status meeting which will be used as a working session and a status update meeting to provide stakeholders with and overall update on the project.  The implementation manager will also lead separate work stream meetings to cover different areas as needed.  Key deliverables required from an employer may include: Eligibility File - Minimal data is needed to establish eligibility. During implementation we will review the minimum PII eligibility file spec and the file transfer options. Employers and/or Sequoia will be asked to create an introduction to all parties involved in the implementation. This may include account managers, data warehouse constituents, PBM, and consultants. Employers will need to sign off on final deliverables, i.e., contract, scope documents, communication materials, etc.
column73: All contracts are 3 year terms with a mutual termination without cause clause.
column74: All communications will be highly customized to meet the client’s specific needs. Our playbook contains materials and communication recommendations based on what has worked well for client launches and how we know our members engage and interact with us depending on their unique fertility and family planning journey.  During the implementation and at launch, Kindbody will conduct a communication discovery where we will provide a marketing playbook that outlines Kindbody’s multi-pronged approach to kicking off the partnership, while increasing appropriate engagement. Our playbook includes: Kick-off announcement Targeted marketing outreach, based on claims data/demographics/personas Emails Social Ads Digital signage Text campaigns Brochures Postcards One-pagers Member guides, explanation of benefits Customized web portal and mobile app Virtual events - ie. Fertility 101, Family Planning Care Team, etc. Webinars  During the communication discovery, we will discuss a communication campaign strategy by channels (such as emails, mailers, etc.) and verify any limitations to outreach. Any custom email campaign will be approved by the client before sending. Email campaigns are tracked for open and click rates, to evaluate effectiveness. Marketing and communications assets are sent by the Kindbody team on a strategic calendar cadence based upon collaboration with our clients creating a partnership of care with the client.  Kindbody's dedicated account manager will host a kick-off of the benefit with the employer. As a part of communicating the launch of the Kindbody benefit, we offer our clients an exclusive "Fertility 101" event for employees. Our signature event is hosted by Kindbody's founding physician and includes the need-to-knows about fertility and family-building options and an overview of the specific benefits offered through the employer.  With all of our events, we will evaluate the effectiveness by measuring how many employees participate and how many are engaging with us (i.e. signing up for Kindbody or booking an appointment).  Kindbody will also provide a member benefit guide, describing all the details of the benefit as well as how to sign up and utilize your benefit. For launch and beyond, we provide additional communications, educational information, webinars and other initiatives to drive member engagement.   Kindbody's branding and social media campaigns are widely popular and can further drive patient/member engagement and interest.
column79: We work with our consulting partners and employer clients to design inclusive benefits so that all employees have access to fertility, family building and reproductive health services. Our goal is to offer the most inclusive and equitable benefit for all. Kindbody creates or enhances plan designs to remove unintentional discrimination by lifting infertility requirements to access medical benefits. This allows same sex couples, single parents by choice and anyone encountering resistance under traditional coverage to be able to have equitable benefits for all. In addition, Kindbody recommends offering adoption/donor/surrogacy benefits at equal dollar value for cost parity to fertility/medical coverage. This truly supports inclusive benefits and all paths to parenthood.  When employees start working with Kindbody and our clinical staff, we must appropriately mimic the demographic we are serving. It is important that patients feel comfortable with their care team and that they feel seen, heard and understood. It is critical that our network welcomes LGBTQ+ patients, as well as minorities and single parents by choice. Thus, we use diversity as a very important part of our hiring process and ensure we hire for a diverse staff. Likewise, we look for partner clinics with a similar priority for diversity.   We welcome, empower and support heterosexual and LGBTQ+ couples as well as single parents, across all backgrounds, creating access to services through our integrative and holistic spectrum of care. Approximately 15% of Kindbody's patients identify as part of the LGBTQ+ community and 45% identify as BIPOC. With intention, our team has the ability to identify with the members they are serving.  We effortlessly nurture all paths to parenthood from natural conception support, to donor and surrogacy, adoption, and assisted reproductive technology. Additionally, we want to educate on reproductive health and assist members who are looking to preserve their fertility in hopes of starting a family in the future or need clinical and holistic support in their reproductive years i.e. menopause. .   From the beginning, we want to understand our members and gather information such as one's biological sex and preferred gender/pronouns so Kindbody can acknowledge all nuances that may exist in their identity. Our Care Navigators are equipped with empathy and broad knowledge to drive education and insight.  We also host regular community-focused events covering a range of family-building topics including LGBTQ+ family building and race and fertility, that promote understanding, solidarity and hope across all family-building pathways. At the employer level, we welcome collaboration with an organization’s internal BRG's to ensure cohesive and relevant engagement opportunities are understood and communicated thoughtfully.   Kindbody is committed to closing the gap on healthcare disparities. We achieve this by eliminating medical necessity in benefit design, improving access by lowering costs, providing education, targeting awareness about reproductive health and fertility issues to men and women of color and the LGBTQ+community, and giving a voice to these underrepresented populations.
column82: Eligibility files are required for Kindbody to administer the benefits in accordance with the client's eligibility rules. Clients are responsible for obtaining and relaying all eligible member data to Kindbody (or through a client assigned third party i.e. HRIS vendor). Eligibility files must be provided in the Kindbody prescribed specifications. The following are the high-level file requirements:   File must be comma-separated values (.csv) format and must be UTF-8 encoded Field headers must be as prescribed in the data specifications Each record must be assigned a unique identifier Ongoing files must be passed as a full file.  The data needed are basic census information along with the effective date of coverage, the assigned unique identifier and employer access code (provided by Kindbody). Once implementation kicks off, Kindbody will hold a thorough session to discuss the data specifications in detail.      The preferred frequency is to receive eligibility data on a weekly basis via Kindbody's secure file transfer protocol (SFTP).
column91: Kindbody is able to provide SSO on a client-by-client basis, to be determined during implementation upon review of employer’s IDP infrastructure. During implementation, Kindbody may also recommend against SSO integration out of consideration for the member experience and based on previous member and client feedback.  We recommend all patients use standard methods of authentication on our portal, currently email and password, Google SSO or Apple SSO.
column92: Participation, satisfaction, and utilization reports are typically delivered on a quarterly and annual basis. All data tracking and utilization are available in real-time within Kindbody’s reporting application and delivered by our account management team. Kindbody's proprietary and integrated EMR enables us to obtain real-time information with respect to utilization, cost tracking, and outcomes.   Kindbody's reporting transparency not only provides direct fertility cost savings, we also have the ability to leverage our electronic medical record (EMR) for detailed employer reporting relative to outcomes, spend, engagement, utilization, and more. We are confident in our ability to support employer needs and requests in a timely and accurate manner following benefit implementation.  All of which will be delivered by the employer's dedicated client management team. Just as the members are reliant on us to provide transparent forms of care, our employers deserve the same level of transparency with their investment and trust in Kindbody.
column101: Kindbody offers the full spectrum of reproductive health services, including fertility services. Kindbody's mission is to treat each member individually and comprehensively, beginning with preconception, through the family building process, postpartum/post birth, return to work through menopause/andropause (men's health). Kindbody is the only vendor in the space offering one fully integrated program, executing as the benefits administrator, technology platform, and direct provider of high-quality care. We deliver a seamless, integrated member experience that results in proven superior health outcomes at a lower cost, making fertility care and all paths to parenthood more affordable and accessible for all. We provide transparent rates that are aligned to assure equity in cost for all patients.  The most unique aspect of Kindbody is that we are in the provision of care with a best-in-class team of full-time, licensed physicians. No matter where the member is located, our model supports everyone with the same access to expert clinical guidance and robust technology and support. We encourage proactive clinical engagement at a lower level of care for better alignment of care and avoidance of unnecessary testing and treatment. The member's trusted care team remains engaged with them throughout their end-to-end journey with a focus on reducing fragmentation in healthcare while assuring the most well connected longitudinal care experience.  The breadth of our services include: – Fertility Assessments (male and female) – Fertility treatment including intrauterine insemination (IUI), in vitro fertilization (IVF), egg, embryo, and sperm freezing, frozen embryo transfer (FET), genetic testing – Surrogacy – Donor services (donor egg, sperm, embryos) – Adoption – Fertility Rx  Holistic services through Kindbody360, including: – Prenatal Services: birth planning, nutrition, postpartum preparation – Postpartum Assistance: Lactation consulting, mental health services, life coaching/planning and return-to-work coaching – We support the whole human by addressing each patient's physical need and emotional wellbeing via mental health coaching and psychiatrists that specialize in nuanced fertility and family building challenges, such as recurrent pregnancy loss and marital stress – We are committed to holistic care through acupuncture, guided meditation, life coaching and more  KindMan program - Powered by Male Fertility Urologists with a focus on male reproductive health, fertility assessments, male specific fertility treatments, and male paths to parenthood We meet the member where the care is needed, both in-person at clinics and virtually through telemedicine and telehealth.   KindDoula program - An integrated care solution rooted in evidence-based birthing support to guide birthing parents through their pregnancy, increase compliance with routine OB appointments, and strengthen their ability to effectively communicate birth plans and postpartum care.   KindBaby program - Provides supplemental and inclusive support and guidance and preparation for birthing parents. Our services bridge the gap between routine clinical appointments and take a clinical focus on risk reduction and improved outcomes.   Menopause program - Combines clinical and holistic care through integrated physician-led care combined with a comprehensive and holistic suite of specialists.
column103: Our solution can be offered as an integrated carveout for an employer's group health plan participants or on a stand-alone basis/HRA. Kindbody typically recommends that self-funded employers adopt an integrated solution for ease of administration and to keep all medical dollars in one place, as well as for ERISA and ACA compliance purposes.  - Under an integrated benefit model, Kindbody integrates with the group health plan and ERISA rules are met by the major medical plan with Kindbody providing the required reporting information needed.  - Under a standalone or HRA model, Kindbody is responsible for meeting ERISA rules.  If an employer chooses not to integrate with the employer’s group health plan, we typically recommend an “integrated” HRA per applicable law (i.e., not literally/practically integrated but considered in conjunction with a group major medical plan for ERISA and ACA compliance purposes). Kindbody can provide a sample attestation for certification of other group medical coverage and a sample HRA plan document.  Alternatively, if the employer wants to implement a standalone benefit or HRA, we typically suggest that the standalone benefit/HRA only be offered to employees enrolled in the group health plan for ERISA and ACA compliance purposes.  More specific information is provided below:  Integrated Carve Out Eligible: medical plan members only ERISA/ACA compliance: Extension of group health plan coverage Kindbody fertility benefit program is offered as an integrated benefit with the member’s group health plan. Cost share is applied to claims submitted to the carrier and is counted towards the member’s accumulators under the member’s health plan. During implementation, our carrier integrations team works with the medical carrier(s) to suppress all fertility codes from coverage within the health plan and we establish an integrated claims submission workflow with the carrier/TPA. As an integrated carve out, Kindbody integrates with the TPA/major medical who maintains the ultimate ERISA responsibilities. We will provide a description of our fertility services that can be used within plan documents/summary plan descriptions. To support our employer groups with their DOL filing, we provide a description of our fertility services that can be used within plan documents/summary plan descriptions.  Standalone Benefit or Integrated HRA Eligible: medical plan members, medical waivers, and/or other employee populations (e.g., Kaiser) ERISA/ACA compliance: Requires an employee to verify that the employee is enrolled in a group health plan in order to provide them with the Kindbody fertility benefit. Kindbody fertility benefit program is offered as a full carve out, separate from the member’s health plan. Because there is no integration, accumulators will not be applied and therefore, any cost share/deductibles will be in addition to their already existing health plan cost share/deductibles. Incurred fertility services fees would be a direct bill back to the employer, less any member responsibility. In order to assist customers with verifying that the employee is enrolled in another group health plan, we have an attestation box in the registration flow in our portal where the employee will attest to meeting the requirements of being enrolled in a group health plan (whether their employers or their spouse’s or partner’s group health plan).
column106: Fertility medical benefits are subject to COBRA. It is at the discretion of the employer if they elect to offer non-medical benefits i.e. adoption, surrogacy reimbursement as a covered COBRA benefit.  During implementation we will determine the best approach to verify eligibility.  Some of our clients are able to pass the eligibility of COBRA enrollees on their eligibility file for active employees, while others opt for Kindbody to directly verify with the COBRA administrator. We are flexible with the process to verify COBRA enrollees.   While we do not establish COBRA rates, we understand that these rate estimates are based on the actuarial projected cost of the fertility benefit. The premium may be calculated based on a reasonable estimate of the cost of providing coverage. We are happy to assist an employer with projected cost of the program based on plan design, eligibility, and utilization in order for them to determine their rates.
column109: As a benefit manager and providers of care, Kindbody has a team of experts that understand the various compliance laws at both state and federal level. We ensure compliance by making sure our team undergoes routine training and that each employee has an executive team member where they can seek guidance and clarity to ensure compliance.  Kindbody works with ERISA counsel to ensure compliance with the ACA and all applicable rules and regulations. As an integrated carve out solution with a client's self-funded medical plan, Kindbody complies with ACA requirements so long as the underlying plan meets the applicable requirements (eligibility, affordability, reporting. etc.). This includes ensuring members on HDHPs are meeting their deductible to maintain HSA contribution eligibility. Furthermore, we provide recommended language for the employer and carrier to update plan documents/SPDs.  Employers do have the option to expand coverage to non-medical plan members. Members who are not enrolled in medical coverage do have to show enrollment in another group health plan to be eligible for medical benefits in order to satisfy ACA compliance. As the provider, Kindbody verifies insurance coverage before services are rendered.    Kindbody's Chief Legal and Business officer closely monitors legal considerations as they emerge. Kindbody will alert our clients as needed if and when any legislative changes may require consideration or action, including updates to the ACA.
column111: Kindbody will draft SPD verbiage specific to the Kindbody fertility and family building offering.  Most of our clients will have their carriers review and insert in the broader SPD / SPD wrap document.
column118: A fringe benefit is defined as a form of pay for the performance of services, none of our clients have set up their fertility and family building benefit that way.  Kindbody provides general guidance on compliance requirements; however, Kindbody does not provide legal advice or tax counsel.  Kindbody recommends that each client consult with their legal and/or tax counsel for final determination on the structure of a fertility benefit program.
column119: Our goal is to mitigate any concerns with compliance related questions as early as possible, often beginning during the sales process. At this time, we have general guidance we can provide to potential clients, including how our book of business has generally structured their fertility and family building benefits. This allows employers to be the most informed and share their concerns and capture direction from their legal and/or compliance professionals.  At the onset of implementation, our goal is to first finalize the scope of work, as the benefit structure/administration impacts the final compliance approach i.e. integrated carve out vs full carve out, elective services vs medical necessity only, etc will play an impact on compliance. We will identify each core area as we work through the final scoping document and program plan design.
column124: Kindbody provides general guidance on compliance requirements; however, Kindbody does not provide legal advice or tax counsel. Kindbody recommends that each client consult with their legal and/or tax counsel for final determination on the structure of a fertility and family building benefit program. We ensure compliance by making sure our team undergoes routine training and that each employee has an executive team member where they can seek clarity for appropriate guidance.    Kindbody's Chief Legal and Business officer closely monitors legal considerations as they emerge. Kindbody will alert our clients as needed if and when any legislative changes may require consideration or action.
column126: Kindbody provides general guidance on compliance requirements; however, Kindbody does not provide legal advice or tax counsel. Kindbody recommends that each client consult with their legal and/or tax counsel for final determination on the structure of a fertility benefit program.   We look forward to working with Sequoia on each respective client as risk tolerance varies at the organizational level. While we have knowledge and experience for each level of our services, we would look to partner with Sequoia to ensure our mutual clients expectations are met.
column127: For any medical benefit, Kindbody does encourage employers to seek internal guidance on taxation as it sits within their broader benefit offerings. This is an area that is up for interpretation and we support employers who choose to consider non-medically necessary benefit as taxable income and those who interpret taxation to exclude all fertility services. We provide reporting back to the employer on all identified taxable services. Kindbody also offers plan designs that only cover medically necessary or medically appropriate preservation. The majority of employers offer all fertility services as a pre-tax benefit.

column40: Maven is the leading global women’s and family healthcare company designed to deliver compassionate, equitable, and high quality care to members around the world. Maven covers the largest population globally of any fertility solution, enabled by the largest engineering and clinical team in the fertility industry - with ~150 engineers (1 in 4 employees) and ~150+ on-staff clinical/administrative team members (vs. others who are staffed mostly in operational and clinic administration departments). Our innovative, 24/7 platform offers members access to the clinical, emotional, and financial support they need to build their families and thrive. We take a member-centric approach to fill gaps in care and are the only platform with depth in care management and improved clinical outcomes from family building through menopause and beyond.   With Maven, employers delivery a single, holistic solution that integrates all reproductive health and family forming benefits.   Our approach to fertility & family building is unique in the following three ways:   1.) End-to-end care from family building through menopause: Maven delivers compassionate, equitable, and high quality care from preconception and family-building to pregnancy, postpartum, return-to-work, parenting, menopause and beyond. Maven is the only platform that delivers both breadth across the health and family journey, while also delivering depth in terms of clinical rigor. No other vendor has designed and built all programs from the ground-up, in-house with the same relentless focus on member experience (i.e. others have grown via partnerships with other vendors leading to a disjointed member and client experience).   2.) Member-first approach to family building: Maven is not incentivized to recommend costly and invasive treatment that drives profit, instead we ensure members get the right care at the right time, which may look like preventative preconception care, continuous and unlimited mental health support through the family building journey, or treatment if/when it’s necessary at the highest quality clinics within the Maven Performance Network. Our care model is inclusive of all paths to parenthood, and ensures all Comcast employees have access to the highest quality care.          -Up to 25% of fertility members achieve pregnancy without assisted reproductive technology         -40% of Maven’s 850+ providers identify as Latine, Black/African American, Asian, Middle Eastern or Multi-Racial; 11% of specialists identify as LGBTQIA+         -0% Maven markups on treatment costs  3.) Proven outcomes at scale: Maven supports members across their clinical, emotional and financial needs in a single platform - driving high member engagement. High engagement translates to better clinical outcomes for members and cost savings for Comcast. Since day one, we've relentlessly prioritized member experience, understanding that high engagement translates to better outcomes vs. other vendors where member experience is an afterthought. Backed by the largest engineering and clinical team in the fertility industry, today Maven serves 700+ employers, including half of the Fortune 15.    -15+ member touch points per month    -Up to 28% lower NICU admission rate    -Up to 20% lower C-Section rate    -40%+ reported finding emotional support with Maven
column42: Maven works with clients of all sizes. Our smallest client is currently ~ 5 employees. Maven does have a minimum annual fee of $20,000.
column43: Maven's pricing model reflects a PEPM model for groups under 1,000 lives and a case rate model for group 1,000+ lives. This pricing model allows Maven to provide comprehensive 24/7/365 support to all members.  Please refer to the pricing sheet provided for additional details.
column54: Maven's Care Advocacy team is staffed 24/7/365. Each Maven member is assigned a dedicated Care Advocate to accompany them through their journey on Maven. When a member’s dedicated Care Advocate is not working and logged in, messages from the member are triaged by the Maven Care Team. Collectively, our Care Team is staffed 24/7/365 and the availability of Maven’s Care Team in the late evenings, early mornings, holidays and weekends has repeatedly been something that members note as a significant value-added part of their experience with Maven. Care advocates typically response to members within an hour.
column55: With Maven, Sequoia gains an experienced partner that delivers value for your clients, has flexible design capabilities and provides members with access to a comprehensive platform built to provide continuous, affordable, and proactive care that improves whole health. We have partnerships with leading health plans with clinical and product integrations to deliver best-in-class experiences.   For your clients, our team consists of experts across eligibility, communications, benefit design, and care operations, all led by one dedicated Client Success leader. Insightful benchmarking & thought leadership:     -Client insights: Your Client Success Leader delivers thoughtful insights and learnings gathered from other Maven clients.    -New surveys & research: Maven will leverage ongoing market research, industry benchmarking, and surveys and insights to support our ongoing partnership.     -Continued product innovation: We will consistently showcase the latest innovations with clients to foster our partnership.
column56: Each client's Account Management team would include experts across eligibility, communications, benefit design, and care operations, all led by one dedicated Client Success Manager. With a client NPS of 89, we are deeply committed to ensuring we go above and beyond to meet and exceed all client needs and expectations. Your Client Success Manager is responsible for working directly with your team to ensure not just a successful partnership, but also to help maximize engagement, build communication strategies, and be your point person to ensure satisfaction is exceeded among both your team and your employees.  Here's an overview of roles and responsibilities of your core team through evaluation and launch:     -Client Success Manager: Responsible for working directly with clients to ensure a successful partnership. Meeting cadence and communications preferences will be established early in the implementation process to make sure expectations are set throughout the relationship.    -Implementation Manager: Responsible for support from implementation through post-launch, and will include support from a core cross-functional team trained on your organization's goals and nuanced needs. column67: Maven's dedicated Implementation and Client Success teams are responsible for designing high-quality, impactful implementation processes and also ensuring successful ongoing partnerships. These teams have a strong track record as evidenced by our 96% client retention rate and 92 implementation NPS score.   Below are the key components of Maven's implementation process:     -Eligibility and Reporting: In order to verify access to the platform, Maven ingests eligibility files. During implementation, Maven will partner with the client or vendor to establish and safely transfer eligibility files to Maven via a secure SFTP connection.    -Benefits Integration: The aim of this stage is to integrate with the client's existing benefits. The information collected is used to train the Maven Care team and customize the product for a client's employees. Maven Care Advocates are trained on our client’s existing benefits so they are able to direct members to the most appropriate resources such as in-network, in-person providers.    -Member Communications: During this last stage, Maven and the client will work together on developing a communications strategy for launch and ongoing communications. Maven will create all the creative materials for the client and will work with their team to establish a communications timeline as well as a deployment strategy for all communications. Maven works directly with clients to make sure launch communications are tailored to their employee audience to ensure a successful launch.    -Legal, privacy, and security reviews: Maven will work the client on the required legal, privacy and security reviews. As part of this process, we will identify any possible impact the reviews will have on meeting implementation deadlines and ensuring an on-time launch.  Maven will manage the majority of the implementation process, ensuring deliverables and milestones are achieved on time. Based on our experience, our recommended implementation lead time is ~8-12 weeks. The implementation process can vary depending on the unique needs, specific benefit design and complexity of the organization.

column73: Maven generally requires that its customer agreements may only be terminated at the end of a term upon the issuance of a termination notice within 90 days prior to the end of the then-current term.
column74: Communication is critical to driving impact and Maven has best-in-class communication tactics to drive both initial enrollment in the programs and engagement once a member is enrolled.   Enrollment communications:  Communications materials are custom-created per client. Maven's team will work closely with the client's communication team during implementation to ensure that we cover all areas of reach.  Examples of enrollment communication materials provided by Maven include:  -One-pager with detailed program information -Launch email, including an additional email for employees on leave -Intranet page and newsletters copy -Maven program description for use on other client collateral (benefits and new hire guides) -Posters, digital signage -Social media toolkit -Direct mailer options -Maven-hosted webinars and member-exclusive classes -Trifold to print out and use at in-person events -Integration with benefits vendors All assets listed above are available in Spanish language  Engagement communications:  Maven is consistently engaging members with regular communications including emails, automated messaging (personalized based on a member's preferences and journey), as well as direct and personalized outreach from Maven Care Advocates at key time points to drive improved outcomes.
column79: At Maven, our goal is to redefine the care model for women and families, building a more equitable healthcare system. Maven gives employers the opportunity to provide their employees with increased access to care that meets their needs and fills gaps left by traditional health systems.   The Maven solution:     -Increases access to hard to reach specialists: The needs of expecting parents and their families extend beyond what can be covered in a standard 15-minute OB-GYN or pediatrician appointment. Members benefit from the ability to connect with a range of specialty care providers throughout their family journey, including doulas, midwives, birth planning specialists, mental health therapists, lactation consultants, and more.                >Access to providers trained in delivering culturally competent care. Trainings done both internally and through Maven's partnership with Violet. Violet trains care teams on health literacy, cultural humility, and the unique needs, challenges, and healthcare disparities that exist within and across diverse populations    -Offers designated tracks for all paths to parenthood: Maven's end-to-end programs are inclusive of all paths to parenthood, including adoption and surrogacy, which is especially important for same-sex couples.     -Provides care-matching based on identity and background: Maven's virtual network includes over 850+ providers across 30 specialties. They speak 35+ languages, 40% of practitioners identify as Latine, Black/African American, Asian, Middle Eastern or Multi-Racial and 11% identify as LGBTQIA+. To ensure our network remains diverse and meets the needs of the populations that we serve. Members can choose to be matched with providers based on background, race, and ethnicity    -Recognizes and addresses barriers to care: During onboarding, members are screened for unmet social needs in order to help our Care Advocates better understand a member's situation with respect to unmet needs and connect them to community based resources as needed and customize a member's Care Team with providers such as doulas, diabetic coaches, and MFM's, who are known to improve outcomes but are inaccessible in many areas             >Maven's SDoH Screener: Maven-developed SDoH screening - 3 question screening allows care teams to understand a member's social needs without being burdensome. Results of effectiveness are close to par with the industry gold standard, Protocol for Responding to and Assessing Patients’ Assets, Risks, and Experiences (PRAPARE).    -Community resources: Access to local community based organizations, resources, and online communities within the Maven platform, which helps increase health literacy, ease feelings of isolation, and empower members.     -Educational resources: Offering access to clinically-backed resources can help to improve health literacy and empower members in healthcare situations.    -Personalized referrals: When needed, Maven can provide trusted, vetted referrals to top-rated in-person care based on background, preferences, and location. For example, LGBTQIA+-friendly adoption agencies, fertility clinics, in-person providers.    Within Maven, we promote the following DE&I initiatives among our own team.     -Allies in Equity: Maven's Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Neel Shah, moderates a bimonthly Q&A for Maven employees and providers focused on health equity, featuring healthcare leaders, advocates and community members who discuss their work progressing health equity and the importance of access to quality care.    -Anti-Racism Challenge: Maven hosts an annual month-long Anti-Racism Challenge for employees to broaden their perspectives and better equip Mavens to be anti-racists, through self-reflection, learning and connection. This annual event results in over 500 cumulative hours of anti-racism education at Maven.  Additionally, Maven's believes that community-based organizations (CBOs) are essential to addressing the many disparities we see in maternal health across the United States. In partnership with March for Moms, we launched MPact for Families, a new program to invest in community-based organizations (CBOs) advancing maternal health. The program provides financial, mentoring, and skill support to community-based organizations that are filling gaps in the traditional health care system, and building the trust within their communities that is core to delivering better health outcomes.  Through MPact for Families, Maven and March for Moms currently support two organizations:     -Village of Healing offers a new approach to community wellness through Cuyahoga County’s first and only medical center focused on the health of Black women. The Village of Healing Center delivers quality health care services that meet the social and cultural needs of patients in the greater Cleveland community by offering gynecology, obstetrics, mental health services, telehealth, and community programs.      -Breath of My Heart Birthplace is a midwifery care clinic and birth center in the Española Valley of New Mexico. Through its free walk-in clinic, birth services, and holistic fertility and preconception care, Breath of My Heart meets the needs of birthing people and families before, during, and after birth.  Other activities include building statewide campaigns, for example, with one of our heath plan partners we built a campaign that aligned with the state's maternal health equity strategy, and are holding educational events within communities to help pregnant people understand the resources that are available to them.

column111: Here are examples of documentation provided. Specific documents may vary based on benefit design.      -Group Health Plan Document: Legal language governing a client’s Maven Wallet plan for Fertility medical expenses    -Summary Plan Description (SPD): Employee-facing version of the group health Plan Document; once completed, this should be posted on the client’s employee benefits intranet or similar location    -Adoption Assistance Program: This document is required by the IRS to offer qualified adoption reimbursements that are excludable from income taxes up the IRS maximum    -Maven Wallet Program Overview: Employee facing program details outlining eligibility, coverage details, and program guidelines.
column119: Given our experience in developing innovative and inclusive fertility and family building benefits, we take a consultative approach to benefits design. Employers are able to customize fertility benefit plan designs according to their needs and preferences.   At a high level, our approach to designing a fertility & family building benefit alongside our client includes the following:     -Benefit design: Carve out with the Maven-Managed Fertility & Family Building program and health plan wrap around.     -Eligible population: Determining who will be eligible for the fertility benefit (e.g., all employees, or just those enrolled in the employer's medical plan(s)) as well as any criteria that will be required to access the benefit (e.g., a medical diagnosis of infertility). Note that Maven's clients typically do not require members to have an infertility diagnosis to access coverage through Maven Wallet.    -Eligible services: Defining what services will be covered. Maven provides a starting point for recommended covered services (e.g., fertility treatment consultations and diagnostics, treatments like IUI and IVF, as well as egg/sperm/embryo preservation, if desired).    -Benefit level: Maven is uniquely flexible in that we offer both Dollar Lifetime Max and Cycle-based benefits (Maven Cycles are only available in a carve-out scenario).   Additionally, Maven supports the client during plan design and program administration to enable compliance. ACA compliance begins with plan decisions aligning the employee eligibility waiting period to access the fertility program at a maximum of 90 days. Maven provides insights into the best practices we see across our book of business for tax treatment including grossing up where applicable. Maven provides SPD and Plan Document templates to employers to document the program. Additionally, Maven provides a Program Overview, which is an employee facing document outlining the summary benefits of coverage in employee friendly language.   Lastly, Maven manages navigating the complexities of ACA and ERISA compliance for both our clients and our members including ensuring employees utilizing the fertility program are enrolled in a health plan that meets minimum coverage requirements either through their employer or a spouse's employer. Maven protects our members contributing to HSAs by seamlessly checking if they have met the minimum required deducitble for their plan year before Wallet begins to pay.
column124: Maven supports the client during plan design and program administration to enable compliance. For example, ACA compliance begins with alignment on key plan decisions, including parameters of employee eligibility, waiting periods, and confirming a member's participation in the employer’s group health plan (or other group health plan that meets minimum value coverage). For clients that offer reimbursement for medical expenses through an HRA supported by Maven Wallet, Maven provides a customizable plan document and SPD in addition to a program overview that may be used to communicate the benefit to employees.   The Compliance function at Maven is led by our Sr. Director of Compliance with support from a Sr. Manager, Compliance & Credentialing and Compliance Associate. In collaboration with legal counsel, the Compliance Team is responsible for administering Maven's Corporate Compliance Program and ensuring Maven complies with all legal, regulatory, and contractual commitments including state, federal, and international obligations applicable to our services.
column126: In our experience, brokers and consultants are happy to assist their clients navigate benefits compliance concerns with point solutions to ensure that plan sponsors make informed design and compliance decisions.  While Maven does not provide legal or tax advice it does share industry best practices and approaches and collaborates with brokers/consultants to address any concerns that arise.
column127: With Maven Wallet, there may be different tax treatment of eligible expenses depending on the specific member’s journey and the expenses that they incur during that journey. Some of the services offered through Wallet are subject to taxation (such as surrogacy related expenses), while others may be considered tax qualified, based on the IRS guidelines for qualified medical expenses and the client's own plan elections.  Clients are encouraged to consult their own tax advisors for any employee tax implications of services received, however Maven is able to provide best practices and approaches for different segments across our book of business and industry standards. Maven provides regular utilization report to clients on the amount of funds approved per employee and the corresponding taxability of those funds based on the client's plan design for payroll adjustment.

column40: Cleo is the first and leading benefit to provide services to every member and their family through all stages of life–-from family building and parenting children and teens to caring for an elderly loved one. With approximately 70% of the workforce managing parenting and/or caregiving responsibilities, the end-to-end support allows Cleo to see and support the whole picture of family health, even when focused more on one specific life stage like caregiving. With Cleo's global care team and digital platform, our support stands out with the following:  A population health approach to support family caregivers across all 5 stages of caregiving: awareness stage (for those early in the caregiving journey who may not even self-identify as a caregiver); responsibility stage (for those supporting family members with day-to-day functional activities); growing demand stage (for family caregivers who are at high risk for burn out); end of life stage (for those who need support with advance care planning, palliative and hospice care and making final arrangements; bereavement stage (supporting families during their grief and planning for what's next).  A proactive engagement model that leverages advanced data analytics such as the Family Health Index to identify the higher-risk members and provide targeted interventions to improve health outcomes and workforce engagement to support lower healthcare and employer costs. The Family Health Index has provided significant insights on the caregiving and health challenges family caregivers are experiencing as well as identifying those at the highest risk of burnout: 44% of members screen positive for early signs of depression and anxiety; 90% of members report an impact to their general health or self-care; 85% are feeling burdened from their caregiving and parenting responsibilities.  Extensive library of LifePaths that cover the full spectrum of parenting and caregiving, from normative and milestone-based needs (e.g., age-specific milestones, planning for long-term care, healthy aging) to specialized areas of support (e.g., Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, falls in the elderly, depression, chronic kidney disease, heart failure, stroke) to help families with all of their parenting and/or caregiving responsibilities, which is essential with the growing "sandwich generation."   24/7 access to our comprehensive family digital platform with curated LifePaths, support plans, real-time personalized Family Health Index report, benefit navigation and unlimited on-demand access to our team of Guide experts and specialists across different engagement modalities: 1:1, group coaching, Cleo Connect and workshop/webinar sessions to meet the needs of every family unit.  Rather than delivering reactive and episodic support like other solutions in the market, Cleo's population health approach provides proactive and continuous support using advanced data analytics and targeted digital support plans coupled with expert support from a dedicated Guide. In comparison to solutions focused on logistics and individual task completion, where a member needs to know what they need help with, Cleo's Guide team of health, parenting, and/or caregiving experts are matched to each member upon enrollment based on their life stage and needs and stay with the family throughout their journey, building deep trust and lasting relationships. This model allows Cleo to engage with a broader population proactively, helping them address not only their current needs but also plan for near-future needs with the goal of preventing avoidable urgent events or issues (e.g., falls in the home, determining advance directives, finding home care providers), which ultimately results in better health outcomes for the caregiver(s) and care recipient(s).
column42: No minimum for partnership through Sequoia. No minimum membership headcount for direct sales, but Cleo does offer flat minimum fee pricing for employers with less than 1,000 EEs.
column43: PEPM   Cleo's direct to employer pricing is based on a variety of factors including products selected and size of employee organization.
column54: Sequoia members have access to Cleo's app content and Guide messaging capabilities 24/7. Every member can request/access service in one of three ways:  By directly messaging their Guide, with direct oversight of all messaging provided by managers.  By requesting specialist support via the app such as with feeding, sleep, and/or career.  By attending Live events moderated by specialists and posing questions/requesting support there.   Families can expect to receive a response to any in-app messages from their dedicated Guide within one business day and in some cases within a few hours. The type of response is based on the needs of the member every time (e.g., message back, direct to app content, offer time 1:1 with a specialist, refer to a group class or cohort). If after hours, we have the ability to cross-cover and triage messages to ensure urgent needs are handled.    When emergencies arise, all Guides utilize our internal emergency protocol that: Defines the scope of Cleo's role in the emergency and what Cleo can/cannot do to help.  Offers support with next steps when applicable and safe to do so and may also involve clinical support.  Directs the member to local and national emergency resources.  If any request is beyond the scope of Cleo support, our team will:  Make recommendations for virtual and/or local resources that can help solve the problem/meet the need.  Offers white-glove service in getting the member and/or their partner connected to such services/resources.
column55: Cleo is proud to maintain a 90 client satisfaction NPS score and a 95% customer retention rate. Our team is dedicated to ensuring the highest quality of service for our clients. In partnership with Sequoia, Cleo provides clients with dedicated customer service and success support, reporting, and consultative feedback to ensure satisfaction and success with the Cleo offering. Just as Cleo Guides support families through questions big and small, Cleo's Customer Success team is here to do the same for Sequoia and Sequoia's client base.  Regarding tracking customer service satisfaction, Cleo deploys the following strategies throughout our overall book of business:  Consistent monthly, client-by-client engagement and utilization data shown via Sequoia's Insights Dashboard.   Client satisfaction NPS surveys and tracking Member satisfaction NPS tracking Post-implementation NPS survey (direct clients only) Quarterly business reviews with each client to discuss satisfaction and ensure quality (direct clients only).
column56: Cleo Guides are subject matter experts in their respective fields and have several certifications, including but not limited to registered nurse, certified midwife, speech pathologist, certified sleep coach, certified child life specialist, career coach, licensed clinical social worker, parent coach, international board-certified lactation consultant (IBCLC), child development specialist, NICU nurse, and more. Each Guide must uphold their licensure and certifications and is evaluated annually via ongoing professional practice evaluations, family feedback, audits, and case reviews. Before joining Cleo, our Guides undergo a rigorous qualification process and are trained in Cleo's proprietary protocols upon hiring.  To ensure the highest quality experience for each member, we diligently manage our Cleo Guide team capacity at the Guide and member level. Guide capacity is tracked weekly, and we maintain a strong and active pipeline of candidates for timely hiring. Cleo has a dedicated Quality and Training Manager who actively manages the training and onboarding process and has designed a program that utilizes video, live instruction, and knowledge tests and matches each new hire with a mentor.  Our Guide team has a 6-week onboarding process, including a mentorship program. Their year-round training includes regular sessions on workflows, content knowledge, and customer service. Training topics are categorized as proactive reinforcement, new information, or reactive need based on regular quality audits.  All members have access to Cleo's robust network of Guides and specialists in 15 countries and speak 15+ languages. Cleo Guides provides 1:1 support via private and group virtual sessions on lactation, sleep, planning support, parenting support, caregiving support, and career coaching.     Our Guides are experts in their respective fields and build long-lasting relationships with families via our direct care model.  They must maintain credentialing or certification in their respective fields throughout their work with Cleo. These requirements vary by field but typically require ongoing training and education.     Below, please find a list of experts for our guide team to highlight the breadth of support offered and the inherent variation of credentialing requirements.    Adolescent Development Certificate Behavioral Specialists Board Certified Behavior Analyst Career Strategist & Coach Certified Birth & Postpartum Doula Certified Birth Doula Certified Child Life Specialist Certified Dementia Specialist Certified Infant/Pediatric CPR Instructor Certified Midwife Certified Nurse Midwife Certified Postpartum Doula Certified Sleep Consultant Child Development Specialist/Educator Childbirth Educator Divorce Specialist Early Intervention Education Specialist Eldercare Specialist Fertility Specialist Health Coach High School Educator International Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC) Licensed Clinical Social Worker LMFT/MFT Masters of Social Work Medicare/Medicaid Specialist Mental Health Counselors/Specialists NICU Nurse Nutrition Counselor Parent Coach Parent of Teens Coach PhD, Education Registered Dietician Registered Nurse School Counselor Sexuality and Gender Educator Speech Pathologist Teacher Other competencies include ADHD; Adoption; Autism Spectrum Disorder; BIPOC; Cerebral Palsy; Culturally Concordant Care; Foster Care; Gestational Carrier; LGBTQ; Adolescent development; Neurodivergence; Surrogacy.
column67: 1. Sequoia submits new client launches to their form monthly. 2. Upon receiving the form submission, Indirect clients are processed by the last week of the month before launching. 3. Clients are configured to go live on their launch date.  Please note that the Cleo implementation and sales process varies for direct sales. Cleo's standard implementation timeline is 90 days.   RESOURCES For indirect Sequoia clients:   Your dedicated Sequoia CSM will provide you with a variety of overview documents, marketing materials and email communication copy to provide to your employees to socialize the Cleo benefit. Should you need any additional resources, please reach out to Cleo through your Sequoia CSM for assistance.    For Cleo direct clients:  The implementation process for clients with 1,000 eligible employees or fewer includes a welcome email from Cleo's designated account management team, a request for clients to submit benefits information to our account management team, and a tailored folder of resources that clients can use as they communicate the Cleo launch. The folder includes email, benefits handbook, and internal messaging copy, one-pagers and other promotional materials from which clients can choose. Clients will be able to reach out to Cleo's designated account management inbox for additional implementation support, as well as additional support post-launch.   For clients with more than 1,000 eligible employees, the implementation process includes additional hands-on support from Cleo's Customer Success team. Cleo is happy to provide additional detail on the implementation process for groups that exceed 1,000 eligible employees upon request.
