column74: Our effective enrollment marketing strategy and best practices framework include: Working collaboratively and creatively with Sequoia  to leverage available channels to educate and drive awareness  Developing diverse messaging to resonate with Sequoia​ clients' employee populations Creating a cadence of outreach to be visible to members through their planning, parenting and/or caregiving journey  Identifying points for communication and outreach based on trends from Sequoia's Insights platform.  Upon launch, we encourage education on Cleo and parenting and/or caregiving support services through digital outreach (e.g., email, newsletter, intranet). Sequoia is equipped with marketing assets to be utilized across internal channels to announce Cleo's launch and product offering.  Cleo will provide initial launch communications to newly eligible employees and organizations on a monthly basis, as well as quarterly outreach to employees who are eligible for Cleo but have not yet enrolled.
column79: Cleo is committed to diversity in our employee population, vendor relationships, and providing culturally concordant care for our diverse member population. Cleo is a female-founded and female-led Series C venture-backed company. Cleo's internal dedication to racial and ethnic diversity is second to none. We actively practice and foster an inclusive culture where employees feel welcomed, heard, and respected, and their authentic self is celebrated. Cleo sponsors employee-led "Cleo Inclusion Communities" that aims to foster a diverse, inclusive community aligned with Cleo’s mission, vision, values, and priorities. We also have an internal "Culture Calendar" and host various opportunities throughout the month to celebrate the diversity of our workforce.  Cleo's products and content are designed and implemented under our set inclusivity framework. Every aspect of our service, from family forming support to pregnancy and parenting coaching to adult caregiving, is created to fit all family structures. We offer every member access to our inclusive support program, which allows families to work directly with Guides who live and look like our diverse member base. Our Guides are trained in offering culturally competent care, and members are given options of culturally congruent guides whenever possible. We deeply believe in offering support and creating content that encompasses the experiences of all our members, and our training reflects this belief.   We have several strategies to recruit, promote, and retain staff, including sourcing candidates from a diverse pipeline, including conferences devoted to family health equity, recruiting from remote locations that are likely to have a more diverse set of healthcare professionals, as well as promoting referrals of individuals that bring diverse backgrounds and perspectives. One of our core competencies is to scale our member-facing staff to the regions and locales where our members reside, which enables highly contextualized support. As a byproduct, Cleo's member-facing staff, Cleo Guides, are located in 15 countries and provide support in 15+ languages (and counting).

column101: Core support topics and programs:    Support for parents & caregivers that are included in all of these stages includes:  • Parent & caregiver confidence & self-care  • Support through loss and grief  • Inclusive & culturally-concordant support  • Career Coaching  • Benefits Navigation  • Emotional wellness support  • Perimenopause & menopause support   Family Planning, Expecting, Return to Work, and Infant Parenting:   • Family planning - options, timing, etc.  • Guidance on IVF, IUI, egg freezing  • Surrogacy, adoption & fostering  • Miscarriage & loss  • Pregnancy & prenatal health  • Lactation & feeding support  • Emotional support & mental health screening  • Maximizing quality of sleep  • Guidance on child care - options, locations, child care benefits, etc. (more on this below)   • Leave planning & return to work    For parents of children aged 1-8 years old:   • Positive parenting & co-parenting  • Childcare & school transitions  • Developmental milestones  • Navigating neurodivergence  • Feeding and pediatric nutrition  • Understanding children’s and adolescent’s development  • Nutrition and eating disorders  • Support exploring gender identity  • Parental guidance for children’s academics  • Planning for future and college  • Discipline & addressing challenging behavior  • Addressing children’s emotional well-being, self-esteem, and mental health    For caregivers of an adult loved one:  • Caregiver confidence & self-care  • Caregiving at a distance  • Condition-specific education & planning  • Home care  • Transitions to senior housing  • Healthy aging and long-term planning (health, financial, and legal)  • Condition-specific education & planning  • Navigating insurance benefits & community resources  • End-of-life care
column104: Cleo's services are not subject to ERISA as Cleo is a wellness benefit and not a medical benefit.
column107: Cleo is not subject to COBRA because Cleo is a wellness benefit. COBRA is only applicable to medical care, which includes: Inpatient and outpatient hospital care; Physician care;  Surgery and other major medical benefits;  Prescription drugs;  Dental and vision care. Cleo services do not include these medical benefits to clients. Therefore, we are not subject to COBRA.
column118: N/A, Cleo's position on this matter, which was formulated with the help of our outside counsel, is that we believe there is sufficient evidence under the "primarily for medical care" test under code §213 that the majority (if not all) of the benefit provided would be considered tax-free to employees. The IRS guidance is not definitive based on Cleo's services, even though we take the above stance. Certain Cleo clients treat our services tax-free, while others believe the benefit is taxable.  We suggest you consult your tax accounting professionals or counsel to make your company's determination as you read the tax guidance.
column119: Cleo is a wellness benefit and is not subject to ERISA or COBRA. Cleo is not a level/self-funded plan or classified as a fringe benefit supported by the responses above. Regarding client-facing materials, Cleo's external-facing security documentation site is accessible at https://trust.hicleo.com/. Here, clients can request access to Cleo's SOC 2 Type II and HITRUST reports, as well as our Information Security Policy, Business Continuity Policy, Acceptable Use Policy, Privacy Terms, etc.
column124: Cleo's Head of Security and Compliance as well as our legal team are responsible for the company's compliance with state, local, federal, and international laws and regulations. Cleo leverages outside counsel and consultants for specific updates and guidance relating to the interpretation of regulations to Cleo's unique service model.   Your designated Cleo Partnership representative will be the primary client point of contact for such notices; this depends on the regulation in question and what the update entails.  All Cleo employees must take and pass HIPAA training within the first two weeks of employment and retake the training annually. Additional training required of Cleo employees includes phishing awareness, GDPR compliance, how to work securely while remote, and role-specific training.

column40: StashWorks is the first automated savings solution that rewards employees for achieving their financial goals. Leveraging 8 years of helping customers build over $3B in savings, Stash is now also partnering with employers to make it easy and fun for their employees to save money. For most people saving money is hard and feels out of reach. Lack of meaningful savings creates stress and impacts employees’ physical, mental, and professional well-being. StashWorks solves this problem - giving employees the ability to automatically deduct money from their paychecks, effortlessly save for life goals, and earn cash rewards for making consistent contributions and hitting “savings streaks.” With no minimum balance or contribution requirements, no fee banking services, and no AUM fees, StashWorks makes it easy to get started and stick with it for the long run. We’re fully integrated with all major payroll systems, ensuring a set up that takes just minutes for employers and employees. Nearly 90% of working Americans saying they would participate in a workplace savings tool and 60% saying they’d be more likely to stay at a job that offered financial wellness benefits - StashWorks is on a mission to become the most utilized benefit and effective employee engagement solution. What makes us different? Combination of education and action: Unlike most providers in the financial benefits space, StashWorks offers both financial education and actionable accounts, tools and solutions. We call it “earn as you learn” and the experience is designed to help users utilize our financial content to take empowered, informed actions based on learnings. Focus on savings and investing, accessible funds and portable accounts: Across every segment of the population, people are most concerned about the amount of money they have saved for emergencies. To this end, unlike many other providers in the space employees can choose from a variety of products and solutions including, savings and investing as well as retirement planning. In addition, we have integrations with all major payroll providers and can power automatic deductions from employees’ paychecks for deposit into a Stash account. Stash accounts move with employees so there is no work for employers to facilitate transitions. Whether employees are just surviving or thriving, Stash puts employees in the driver’s seat and gives them choice, access to their funds, and ease of portability. Innovative, attractive rewards: StashWorks is a first of its kind benefit that offers innovative rewards through sign up incentives, milestone rewards (i.e “savings streaks”) and spend based perks all with the goal of providing near term and long term value, encouraging enrollment and optimizing for long term engagement. The rewards are branded, positioned and messaged as a ‘perk’ and convey a sense of optimism, levity and ‘value’ (i.e. a smart way to get ahead in life). The goal is to leverage a rewards driven experience to help turn money into a source of hope and opportunity. Proven track record: Stash is not new - we bring 8 years of experience to StashWorks and a tried, true “formula” from helping millions of users build wealth.

column56: Stash is a web and mobile app based tool - our leadership team does not personally provide financial advice or communicate directly with the end user. That being said please see below for our CEO and Co-Founders' bios: Liza Landsman: Liza Landsman joined Stash as CEO in February 2023, bringing extensive expertise scaling world-class organizations in consumer finance, e-commerce, and retail. She’s passionate about products that help people save and spend, and is deeply committed to the financial wellbeing of everyday Americans. Prior to Stash, Liza was general partner at NEA, and also served in key operations and leadership roles at Jet.com, Citigroup, BlackRock, E*TRADE, and IBM. She sits on several boards of directors and has been listed amongst Fortune’s Most Powerful Women. Brandon Krieg: After nearly eight years as CEO whereby Stash surpassed $100 million in revenue, Brandon is now focused on helping companies large and small jumpstart their employees’ journey to financial wellness with Stash. He also serves as CEO of Stash Capital, our broker-dealer. Prior to Stash he co-founded Edge Trade, one of the first and largest agency trade execution and software firms (later acquired by Knight Capital Group), and served as Head of Electronic Execution at Macquarie Securities Group. Ed Robinson: Since founding Stash, Ed has led the Product, Marketing, Operations and Engineering teams to serve millions of active subscribers across the U.S. His passion is democratizing financial services through innovative products that are simple, affordable, and accessible. Early in his career, Ed provided financial advice to high-net-worth families focusing on asset allocation. Following that, he spent nearly a decade on equity trading desks across London and New York with Macquarie, where he met his eventual Co-Founder,
column67: We leverage Atomic to connect with our employer partners' HRIS. Employers receive an authorization link from StashWorks and click on this link to give us permission and grant us access. From there, there is nothing left for the employers to do in terms of technical integration. Stash is able to leverage access to the HRIS to communicate with employees and enroll them. The end to end process for employers can be completed in minutes. In addition to granting us access, employers are asked to review and sign a brief partnership agreement. Lastly, we offer live training sessions and provide employers with training materials, recorded training videos/demos and content to leverage on their intranet and during open enrollment season to help educate employees about StashWorks.
column74: Our communication strategy is informed in large part by 8.5 years of experience working directly with millions of consumers to drive awareness, enrollment and engagement. We have mapped out a comprehensive pre-launch, activation, welcome and ongoing engagement communication strategy and messaging plan. In addition, we offer employers onsite and/or virtual training sessions, a launch kit, creative resources and messaging for their internal channels and ongoing support to manage FAQs and employee customer service requests. The tactics listed above are designed to help drive awareness of what StashWorks is, explain why employees will benefit from utilization and also provide an easy to understand overview of the product to ensure employees can take full advantage of the offering.
column79: At Stash, our mission is to help everyday Americans invest and build wealth. We believe everyone has the right to be treated with fairness, dignity and respect. We recognize that building a diverse and inclusive culture is therefore central to our mission. Our goal is for every employee to feel welcomed from day one, able to make an impact and thrive with the full support and advocacy of their colleagues and leaders. This is a crucial part of The Stash Way and achieving these goals is critical to our success as a business - and as human beings. We take a diverse slate approach when it comes to hiring which ensures diverse pipelines and an inclusive process. We don’t just measure representation but we also measure inclusion through a bi-annual inclusivity index, which is a 7 question survey that measures things like psychological safety and belonging to name a few. Our CEO Liza Landsman this year signed the CEO Action pledge for diversity, publicly acknowledging our commitment to DEI. We also have an internal pledge that all employees have a chance to sign We have an annual Unconscious Bias training that ensures we recognize and combat the many biases that we encounter on a daily basis. We dedicate April specifically to Allyship (Allyship Awareness Month) a month where we learn what it takes to be an Ally and its importance. We have five Employee Resource Groups (ERGS) each with an executive sponsor and have been instrumental in building our culture. We have someone in a full-time role dedicated to DEI.
column81: We partner with Atomic who has integrations with most major payroll providers. The employer simply has to click an authorization link to give us/Atomic access to their HRIS and from there we have everything we need to verify and enroll employees.
column92: We will provide employers with monthly and quarterly utilization data in terms of number of employees enrolled, months enrolled and anonymized information regarding utilization behavior (products employees are using, balance growth, etc).
column101: StashWorks is a workplace benefits program powered by Stash. We securely connect with employers' HRIS system, so that employees can allocate money from their paycheck into a StashWorks account. They’ll earn automatic stock rewards in a Stash Investment Portfolio as they continue to save money for the future. We offer a suite of financial tools and education to support their financial growth. Employees don’t pay any subscription fees and there are no account minimums. They can adjust their paycheck contribution amount in their StashWorks Dashboard, where they’ll also have access to their full Stash banking and investing account. StashWorks users gain access to Stash's solutions, advice and rewards: Solutions: employees grow their money and build financial stability by contributing to Stash’s assisted saving, retirement, and investment tools via automated payroll deductions. Advice: Ongoing guidance, tutorials, and content support employees in gaining confidence and building positive financial habits. Rewards: Stash continuously deposits rewards into an automated personalized investment account when employees allocate a portion of their paycheck into a Stash account and achieving savings streaks and goals.
column104: StashWorks is a benefits program allowing employees to access the Stash financial platform, and ERISA does not generally apply to Financial planning programs. Additionally, employees may only transfer their contribution amount (post-tax) from their paycheck into their Stash Banking account which is a demand deposit account.
column107: We are not a health plan.
column118: StashWorks is not a form of pay for the performance of services. Employees simply get free access to StashWorks as a "perk" which unlocks features such as financial education and content, easy to use savings solutions, a banking product, and smart portfolio investing accounts.

Lastly, our contract with the employer makes reference to our respective compliance obligations.

column40: i) Impartiality: With no products or services to sell, our financial education is one of very few impartial financial wellbeing platforms available. In addition, we provide Pearson with peace of mind in regards to their governance and fiduciary duties. Furthermore we can highlight Pearson's workplace benefits (such as 401k, workplace discounts, voluntary benefits) through nudge.   ii) Unmatched Localized/Global offering: We know that poor financial wellbeing isn't just a US problem so are proud to be able to support people across 80+ countries. Should Pearson offer nudge to your entire workforce, we are able to support your entire team in your 65 different countries. 96% of your workforce will have localized content in their native language. By 2024, 97% of your workforce will have nudge in their local language and 99% will have localized content.    iii)  Something for everyone: Our offering is unbiased, inclusive, and global. column92: Nudgenomics supports our clients in understanding the financial needs and interests of their workforce.   Nudgenomics will be reported quarterly. Nudgenomics is an easy to understand analysis of participants' usage of nudge on a quarterly basis. In the report total reward professionals are provided with the following: i) Engagement: Interactions (reading/clicking/logging in) by report period, alternative access (percentage of users who receive nudges through an alternative method), percentage of nudges read each month.  ii) Demographics: The percentage of participants who interacted in each reporting period broken down by salary, region, age, and additional demographics. This information is benchmarked against all nudge users and industry.  iii) Timings: The breakdown of times of day that participants read 'nudges' broken down into different demographic sectors; The median time that it takes for participants to open a 'nudge' broken down into different demographic sectors in hours and minutes.  iv) Selected Interests: The most added interests by your workforce.(i.e. Budgeting, Savings, Mortgages, In the home, Holidays & Travel, Everyday finances); The interests with the most positive and negative differences compared to all clients and your industry; The spread of interests as selected by your participants compared to all nudge clients and your industry.  v) What participants are reading: Top 10 articles accessed; topic reads compared to all; Most read topics (i.e. inheritance, debt, investing, retirement accounts, borrowing, government programs, tax).   nudgenomics is provided to our clients quarterly, and we will have self-service available in 2024.
column101: nudge builds the financial knowledge, skills, and confidence of the workforce, while driving understanding, awareness, and positive engagement in total rewards.    The nudge platform is a SAAS platform that educates the workforce through 3 primary methods...   1. nudges: When something important happens in the world of money, like a change in legislation or new government giveaway, associates get a personalized and timely nudge. They choose how they receive this nudge eg. WhatsApp, Email, Slack, Teams or SMS.   2. Education: A social media style feed of personal finance content – tips, tricks and detailed guides – keeps associates up to date and boosts their financial literacy. It’s also really easy to share this with the people they love - their friends and family.  3. Tools: Personalized tools help employees better manage their money including budget, saving and borrowing. For example, the budget planner helps them compare their weekly, monthly or annual budget to people like them across their respective country.    Furthermore the platform provides integrations with existing benefits such as EAP platforms and retirement offerings.

column40: What truly differentiates apree from the marketplace is our comprehensive integrated approach to healthcare which blends advanced primary care, sophisticated health navigation, and a deeply personalized member experience resulting in an unmatched ability to solve for the customer across all dimensions of their population health and wellbeing needs -- all from a single solution. No other vendor in the market has a comprehensive integrated technology platform, transparency solution, wellbeing solution, personalization engine, concierge/advocacy services, and care delivery through advanced primary care. We can deliver one or all of these for the customer with the ability to add solutions and grow with them over time, future-proofing your solution all while lowering costs and reducing administrator complexities.   Integrated Healthcare Approach: apree combines the strengths of Vera Whole Health's advanced primary care model with Castlight Health's sophisticated health navigation capabilities. This integration allows for a seamless healthcare experience that addresses both immediate health needs and long-term wellness goals.  Personalization at Scale: Leveraging a data-rich platform, apree offers predictive personalization, tailoring health journeys to individual member's needs. This approach extends beyond generic health solutions, providing targeted care and resources based on a member's specific health profile, preferences, and history.  Robust Digital and Clinical Ecosystem: apree's ecosystem comprises a vast range of health solutions and partnerships, all accessible within a single platform. This ecosystem is not only extensive but also rigorously vetted for clinical validation, security, and legal compliance, ensuring the highest quality of care and resources.  Data-Driven Engagement and Outcomes: Utilizing advanced analytics and a comprehensive data foundation, apree's solutions are outcome-focused, aiming to improve overall health while managing costs. This data-driven approach facilitates proactive identification of high/rising risk groups and engages them in preventive care and chronic condition management.

column54: Live support is available via phone and chat, Monday through Friday 8AM – 9PM Eastern Time. Members can also submit inquiries via email and asynchronous chat 24/7.   Members have unlimited access to Care Guide Advocates through multiple channels including chat (web/in-app), email, and phone, with all inquiries being routed directly to a team of apree Care Guides.
column55: One of the core offerings of the apree health service is access to Care Guides. Care Guides is a service that combines the best of apree’s personalized health navigation technology with a team of highly trained healthcare consumerism experts providing one-to-one support to ensure members have the support they need when a digital app isn't enough.   Care Guides go the extra mile to address member concerns and are integral to the apree team and culture. Members have unlimited access to Care Guides through multiple channels including chat (web/in-app), email, and phone, with all inquiries being routed directly to a team of apree Care Guides.   Care Guides develop trusted relationships with members to serve as their single point of contact who can uncover barriers to care, establish priorities and next steps, warm transfer to partners when applicable, and follow up with the member.   Our Care Guides provide support to members in the following areas: - Technical Support (navigating the app/portal, password & account issues, etc.) - Explanation/navigation of available health benefits and how to use the apree service - Instruct members on how to conduct searches within the apree app - Explanation of claims information displayed in apree - Assisting with questions regarding incentives - Answer benefits inquiries - Finding a provider & assist in establishing PCP relationship - Educate on cost and provider quality - Schedule appointments - Promote programs and assist with enrollment - Claims advocacy and billing  - Reduce financial barriers to care, such as facilitating an understanding of member Explanation of Benefits (EOBs), assisting in resolving claims/billing issues and identifying options for out-of-pocket payment arrangements - Increase the value of the benefits ecosystem by promoting and enrolling members in clinically relevant programs; such as telemedicine, EAPs, and other programs offered by the member’s health plan and/or point solutions  For all members, they leverage the same Care Guide through an interaction - for example through our secure, asynchronous chat functionality that allows the member and Guide to communicate uninterrupted until the episode is closed. For non-English speaking members, we provide live and email support in Spanish via our bilingual Care Guides as well as translation services in 170 languages via interpreter services.  We leverage ongoing satisfaction reporting to continually improve our customer service. Our team regularly achieves an NPS of 80 for our Live Care Guides solution and a CSAT score of 9.2. for our Care Guides.
column56: Clinical Care Guides have an average of 15+ years healthcare experience and an average of 12 years nursing experience, support center, medical office, pharmacy, and hospital experience. - 5 years minimum experience in a clinical setting required. - Nurses and pharmacists have nursing or pharmacist degrees and active licenses. Advocate Care Guides have backgrounds in medical billing, clinical call centers, wellness, and/or healthcare administrative settings. - Clinical and customer service backgrounds including nursing, pharmacy, medical billing, and clinical customer support. - Full ADA support and HIPAA Certified - Bilingual is a plus  Guides receive an 8-week training-program involving self-study, facilitated classroom discussion, and hands-on activity learning, around healthcare concepts, product functionality, the Guide Desktop environment, and apree's customer service standards with two weeks spent working live issues with a trainer and other SMEs. Upon completion of the training program, and successful completion of post training assessment, each Guide goes through a provisional period where they must successfully meet the standards of apree's quality program. Guides are trained on each client to understand goals, culture, and benefits landscape. 20hrs continuing education annually + HIPAA, Compliance, Diversity, Awareness, Non-Harassment, and Culture and Sensitivity.
column67: apree does the heavy lifting during implementation. Our goal is to make this solution very easy to implement. apree has developed a proven implementation methodology and tools that continuously improves with every implementation.   Our preferred approach/methodology consists of 5 phases: - Project kickoff - Design - Build - Test - Launch  Implementation typically takes 3-6 months depending on the solution and scope of the clients requirements.  The Implementation Manager is responsible for project management, tracking decisions & deliverables, and configuration of the apree health experience for our customers. The Implementation Manager works closely with the Customer Success Manager (CSM) and the customer to ensure on-time, high quality product launches.   Implementation support from kickoff through launch, delivered by your designated Implementation team: ● Implementation management from kickoff through package launch ● Delivery project management ● Eligibility data management: scoping, data inclusion & business rules definition, testing, file approval ● Application configuration & testing ● Program vendor management: data transfer scoping & configuration ● Customer testing scripting & management   Additionally, customers will have support from multiple teams at apree, including Engagement Services, Design, Data Management, and Analytics. Each of these teams interface with the CSM and Implementation Manager, where needed, to execute critical work for our clients. All resources are organized through the Customer Success Manager who acts as the single point of contact for the client.  apree will provide the client with an experienced team that includes cross-functional resources from IT, Engineering, Product, and Member Engagement to support launch communications for the client.

column74: At apree, we understand that there's no one-size-fits-all approach to health, and so there can't be a one-size-fits-all-approach to health communication. That's why our communication strategy is powered by one of the most sophisticated algorithms in the market, ingesting more than 30 different data points (e.g. claims, sociodemographic variables, census data, etc.) to generate a personalized approach that meets people at the right time, via the right channels (SMS vs. email vs in-app / push notifications), with the right message. That means that depending on a member's health status, needs, goals, how they're interacting with the platform, etc. they'll receive their own unique mix and cadence of communications.   Communications are highly customizable. Communications can display the customer logo, program names, and calls to action. We also tailor personalized communications and custom messages based on employee needs which are more standardized messaging that has been clinically evaluated for messaging and recommendations.  Registration communications: communications sent to encourage members to register for the application  Triggered communications: communications that automatically get sent based on a member's actions in the platform (e.g. rewards redemption, receipt of a new claim, password reset, etc.)  Genius communications: personalized communications based on our sophisticated algorithm that help members achieve health outcomes and reduce total cost of care (e.g. breast cancer screening communications, chronic condition management communications, etc.).   Advocacy communications: communications linked to high-value events (e.g. a visit by a member to the claims page) or high-risk profiles aimed at supporting members through a particular moment in their healthcare journey and helping achieve more positive health outcomes. These are sent directly from our Care Guides and are   We kick-off a new launch with an interactive workshop to learn more about your employee communication philosophy and channels. From there, we build out an engagement launch plan and begin developing co-branded materials and content specifically meeting your needs.  Collateral materials library: We have a robust collection of both digital and print content available for co-branding and getting the word out about apree. From videos, senior leadership sponsorship content, incentive ideas, flyers, digital signage, social media support – we’re ready to match collateral to meet your needs.
column79: apree is attempting to solve the health care affordability crisis in the United States. In so doing, we seek to understand the entirety of the challenges our members face in accessing affordable primary care, including social vulnerabilities that can create challenges to health equity--income disparities, education status, unconscious racial bias, and challenges with access to quality primary care.    Our deep data knowledge and digitally-enabled care model seeks to find these disparities in order to look for gaps in our practice that may even be blind to us.  In so doing, we believe we offer a model of care that supports the goals and strategies for diverse clients with equally diverse populations.

column92: apree provides reporting in a variety of ways:   • Mission Control – On-demand 24/7 customer-level web-based access to apree's analytics and reporting dashboards. This information refreshes daily and includes overall platform engagement, program engagement, challenges reporting, and Communications Suite information.   • Annual and Quarterly Business Reviews – provided annually/quarterly. Relevant metrics are provided year-over-year   • Ad hoc reporting – as requested   • Raw data on additional client specific metrics - as requested   Our analytics and reporting dashboard, Mission Control, provides real-time insights, in-depth metrics, and reports across the entire platform. It gives employers total visibility into engagement levels, behaviors, what communications work, what needs to be changed, and more.   Mission Control allows customers to: understand current apree engagement and performance across key metrics, analyze employee utilization and search behavior, and spot opportunities to optimize both apree and general benefits strategy. Platform engagement data can be further analyzed across your rewards center, events, challenges, incentives, and more. This allows clients to constantly evolve their program, driving outcomes that save money, improve health and increase employee satisfaction.     Data can be exported from self-service reports in Mission Control (reporting webpage) via CSV, XML or txt. Structured, regular exports of specific data can be arranged by request and delivered via file share. In addition, reports are provided as part of our standard annual business reviews such as ROI reporting. This flexible tool provides client administrators a wide variety of views into their population. They can tailor the reporting using a wide variety of attribute based filters. Attributes include gender, age, state, insurance plan, insurance company, relationship. They can also look at data across a wide range of time periods including: since launch, last week, last month, last 3 months, last 6 months, last 12 months, last year, this year, this month, this quarter.
column101: We provide a Transparency and Navigation self-service platform with a team of clinician-led (Care Guides) experts. We guide your employees and their families to better health outcomes in the way that works best for them. We care for your whole population by giving them personalized, proactive recommendations powered by medical, pharmacy, behavioral health, and dental claims, coupled with clinical outcomes, user behavior, and socioeconomic data. And with the industry’s leading intelligence in cost, quality, and outcomes, we help your people connect with the highest quality providers and best-in-class programs, whether virtual or brick-and-mortar, to meet their individual clinical needs.   Primary Care Our APC model shifts the focus away from quantity of services provided and towards quality of care via a true value-based approach. We differentiate ourselves by offering “whole health” that treats the “whole person.” Our bio-psycho-social approach, which ensures members’ physical needs are addressed in addition to the evaluation of their behavioral health and social factors that influence health such as work, environment, finances and family.   Offering longer appointments, we are taking the time to restore the patient-provider relationship. Our providers can address any preventive, acute care or chronic condition concerns in both the adult and pediatric populations that are within the scope of their licensure, training and experience.   By utilizing technology to determine risk and stratifying the population, we ensure our providers have the data they need to determine the appropriate amount and type of care needed for each patient, identify and close gaps in care, and perform focused outreach.  Our APC model is designed to manage the majority of a member’s care within the primary care setting and provide effective care coordination when additional care is needed. At our core, apree is a one-stop shop for care and health and benefits information with targeted, personalized messaging. Our health navigation platform connects with hundreds of health vendors, benefits resources, and plan designs, giving rise to the world’s first comprehensive app for all health needs. We guide individuals—based on their unique profile—to the best resources available to them, whether they are healthy, chronically ill, or actively seeking medical care.  We offer a configurable and flexible platform and service, as well as scalable vendor management; meaning that with apree, the customer's health and wellbeing initiatives come to life in a tailor made solution. Our experts will work closely with customers and help guide and develop their digital platform strategy.  Wellbeing Included in all our solutions is Holistic Wellbeing, where we provide a digital-front door connecting your members to all their programs and benefits across physical, mental, social, and financial health. Mobile and web-based application that assesses a user’s specific wellbeing needs through claims, a health assessment, health goals, biometrics, and wearables which facilitates targeted interventions customized to the user and drives engagement. Employees engage with features like team-based challenges, activity tracking and encouraging healthy habits, flexible incentives to help drive engagement across programs and benefits, a social community to connect virtually, and an ecosystem of best-in-class partners to serve your population's complex needs.

column118: The primary function of apree's services is to improve health outcomes and manage healthcare efficiently for members, which is a core aspect of healthcare delivery rather than an ancillary benefit.  Unlike typical fringe benefits that add value to an employee's compensation package, apree's services have a direct impact on the health and well-being of individuals, aligning more closely with medical care than with employee benefits.  While apree's services contribute significantly to the overall welfare and satisfaction of employees, they are distinct from fringe benefits in their purpose, structure, and regulatory treatment under the IRC.

column127: apree discusses the taxation of its program and benefits with clients as part of its back office processes for administering incentives. This includes coordination with other vendors and considering payroll tax implications. Specifically: - At the end of each calendar year, apree health provides a taxable income file to all employers.  - This file summarizes all taxable earnings received by employees and their spouses through the apree platform.  - The sources of taxable value included in this file are the value of all device credits spent, the value of all items redeemed in the Rewards Center, and the value of all sweepstakes won by members.  This process ensures that employers are aware of the tax implications associated with the incentives and rewards provided through the apree health platform, allowing them to properly account for these earnings in their payroll and tax reporting

column40: Every organization is unique. Employers deserve to work with a reliable carrier that understands their business and their employees and provides meaningful, custom-designed solutions.  Employee needs are changing at a rapid pace, with different challenges and expectations across the diverse groups we serve. With rising healthcare costs, different work environments and evolving expectations around support for social, financial, mental and physical well-being, employers must find new ways to attract, retain, and engage employees.  We are here to help them navigate this changing world and ensure every benefits program is a strategic investment that offers a competitive edge. With a robust suite of customizable products and services, industry-leading expertise, and community efforts, we empower employees to thrive, with a commitment to supporting those in underserved and underrepresented communities.  We’ve been in the business of keeping promises and supporting people for more than 150 years. As the #1 Group Insurance Carrier, we provide insurance and benefits to more than 40 million people across 50,000 businesses. The depth and breadth of our experience means we can work together to offer the solution that is right for each employer.  Our forward-looking insights and expertise on the changing workforce can support confident decisions that unlock greater value from an employer’s benefits plan. With proactive consultative guidance, customer-focused solutions, and exceptional service, we ensure employees have the financial security and the support they need to reach their goals.  Our offer includes these flexible, competitive solutions to help employers meet the diverse needs of their employees, and attract and retain top talent: •	Dental; •	MetLife Vision (Davis, Superior and VSP Choice); •	Disability & Absence Services (STD, LTD, Absence Management); •	Employee Assistance Program (EAP); •	Life Insurance and AD&D; •	Accident & Health (Accident, Cancer, Critical Illness, & Hospital Indemnity); •	Auto and Home insurance offered by Farmers GroupSelectSM; •	Pet Insurance; •	MetLife Legal Plans; •	Health Savings & Spending Accounts (HSA, FSA, HRA, Limited Purpose FSA, Dependent Care FSA, Commuter Benefits, and COBRA); •	Identity & Fraud Protection; •	Retirement & Income Solutions (Fixed Income Annuities, Structured Settlements and Stable Value); •	Worksite Short-Term Disability; •	Worksite Whole Life; •	MetLife Worldwide Benefits; •	Financial Wellness (including Upwise, a financial wellness app); •	Executive Benefits (GVUL, DIGI).  We are committed to building long-term relationships. We achieve long customer tenures by delivering products and services with best-in-class account management models. Our financial strength ratings are some of the highest in the industry which provides added confidence that we can meet our obligations to both employers and employees – today and in the future.  We continue to invest in providing a seamless experience to all we serve – from AI that streamlines our processes, to integrated tools that create more compassionate call center experiences, to digital upgrades that address evolving employee expectations, we never settle.  When employers choose MetLife, they are partnering with a company that is dedicated to doing things right and making their job easier. We are a team that is always with you, creating a more confident future.
column42: Minimum participation requirements vary by line of coverage.  Life We require 25% participation for all voluntary coverages with a minimum of 10 enrolled employees with the exception of Voluntary AD&D. If participation falls between 20% and 25%, we reserve the right to adjust our rates. If participation falls below 20%, we reserve the right to decline coverage.  For our Voluntary AD&D product, we require a minimum of 20 participating employees if combined with other Life coverages, or at least 75 participating employees or $2,000 of annual premium if not combined with other Life coverages.  Dental We require that a minimum of 25% of the eligible population participate in an employer’s Dental plan as a guideline.  Disability and Absence Management Solutions For non-contributory plans, the minimum participation requirement is 100%.  For contributory plans, minimum participation requirements are as follows: •	When the employee pays less than 50% of the premium, the requirement is 50%. •	When the employee pays 50% to 74% of the premium, the requirement is 40%. •	When the employee pays 75% to 100% of the premium, the requirement is 25%.  Vision The minimum participation requirement is 10 employees or 10%, whichever is greater.  Voluntary Benefits (Accident & Health) Minimum participation requirements to accept and set up the group, are waived if Preferred Enrollment Conditions apply. Preferred Enrollment Conditions exist when voluntary products are placed for employees’ selection at the same time and on the same platform as major medical coverage (on ballot). This also includes instances when the customer is using an enrollment firm to offer the products.  If Non-Preferred Enrollment Conditions apply, there is a 5% minimum participation requirement.  Health Savings & Spending Accounts There are no minimum participation requirements for any of our Health Savings & Spending Accounts products.  MetLife and Aura Identity & Fraud Protection There are no minimum participation requirements for our MetLife and Aura Identity & Fraud Protection product.  MetLife Legal Plans MetLife Legal Plans is standardly available to groups with 100 lives. We can quote below this market upon request. We require a minimum of two enrollees to implement a case.  MetLife Pet Insurance There are no minimum participation requirements for our Pet Insurance product.  Whole Life Participation requirements vary by group size: •	Less than 500 Eligible Lives: 15%; •	500-5,000 Eligible Lives: 10%; •	5,000+ Eligible Lives: 5%.  We can waive minimum participation requirements when both conditions below are met: •	An enrollment firm is involved and the Worksite Whole Life coverage is enrolled on the same platform and at the same time as major medical; •	More than one MetLife product is quoted and sold.  If minimum participation is required but not met, we reserve the right to not issue coverage.  Worksite STD Our minimum participation requirement is 20% for groups with 200 to 999 lives and 15% for groups with more than 1,000 lives.

column54: In addition to the telephonic customer support noted below, our employee self-service website provides employees with a personalized, integrated and easy way to understand and manage their MetLife benefits. Employees have one place to view all available MetLife benefits, get answers to questions and perform other common benefit-related tasks. The employee website is available 24/7/365. Please note that certain features and functions may vary by coverage.  Life We provide customer service Monday through Thursday, 5:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., PT, and Friday, 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m., PT.   We also have a self-service IVR feature that is available 24/7/365. The IVR enables beneficiaries who are calling for claim status to enter key information and retrieve a status of a claim they have submitted or retrieve Group Life Claims contact information such as the fax number and mailing address.  Dental Employees have toll-free access to Dental Customer Service Representatives Monday through Friday, 5:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., PT.  PPO Dental participants can use our IVR for inquiries related to eligibility, plan benefits, claim status, requests for mailed network directories and claim forms. Claims can be reported Monday through Friday, 5:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., PT by speaking with one of our Customer Service Representatives.
column55: High quality customer service is a key element in our partnership with our customers, their employees and their dependents. Our Voice of the Customer Satisfaction Survey program ensures that we solicit input from our customers, their employees and Life Insurance claimants. We use the feedback to implement changes and improve our processes. We engage professional research firms to conduct telephonic satisfaction surveys on behalf of MetLife.  We are committed to the ongoing assessment of satisfaction among our clients and their employees through surveys. We review each concern to promote an environment of continuous improvement. We use survey results to identify coaching opportunities, training needs and possible process improvements for a specific customer, team, office or our product organizations as a whole. These surveys allow us to see when changes or process improvements are necessary.  Life Medallia, a professional research firm, conducts our quarterly telephonic satisfaction surveys of Life claimants. In 2022, 96.8% of claimants were satisfied or very satisfied with their Group Life claim experience.  This survey gauges perceptions of the following: •	Level of service that we provided on a recent claim; •	Ease of filing the claim; •	Claims turnaround time; •	Accuracy of payment; •	Toll-free service; •	Written communications; •	Satisfaction with our Total Control Account settlement option as a mode of payment (if applicable); •	Perceptions of claim transaction channels: mail, phone, IVR or online.  Dental The Dental Caller Satisfaction Survey polls a random sample of participants who recently called our toll-free customer service line. Participants are asked to provide their opinions on the outcome of the call, how satisfied they were with the level of customer service and how their experiences compared to calls with other customer service lines. The survey lasts six to seven minutes and results are reported monthly. In 2022, 90% of participants were very satisfied or satisfied with the overall call center service.  Our Plan Participant Satisfaction Survey has two components. The first component surveys a random sample of plan participants who filed a dental claim in the last two months. The second component surveys a random sample of patients who visited a network dentist during selected months.  In 2022, our overall PPO participant satisfaction rate was 95%, and 95% of participants were very satisfied or satisfied with their overall claims service.  Our Managed Dental Plan survey monitors satisfaction among participants in areas of perceived value, service quality and network, particularly in regard to choice of dentists, quality of care and access. Surveys are conducted monthly by telephone and reported out on a quarterly basis. In 2022, 91% of Managed Dental Plan participants were satisfied or satisfied with their dental plan overall.  Disability and Absence Management Solutions We conduct Disability Claim surveys and Caller Satisfaction surveys monthly over the telephone and report the results quarterly.  In 2022, satisfaction with our claims service was 90% for STD, 96% for LTD and 95% for FMLA. Satisfaction with service from Disability-related calls to our call centers was 94%.  Vision Our Plan Participant Satisfaction Survey has two main components. The first part of the survey is conducted among a random sample of participants who filed a vision claim in the prior two months. The second part of the survey is conducted among a random sample of patients who visited a preferred provider during selected months. Both parts of the survey are conducted monthly by telephone and results are reported quarterly.  The survey provides participants with an opportunity to voice their opinions regarding the Vision program, and both participating and non-participating providers. It also allows us to identify opportunities for improvement in our services and overall satisfaction of participating providers.  Following are our overall satisfaction results for respondents surveyed in 2022: •	MetLife Vision VSP Network: 98% were either satisfied or very satisfied with their overall vision program; •	MetLife Vision Davis Network: 100% were either satisfied or very satisfied with their overall vision program; •	MetLife Vision Superior Network: 94% were either satisfied or very satisfied with their overall vision program.  Voluntary Benefits (Accident & Health) We mail a satisfaction survey to all approved claimants. We ask: “How likely are you to recommend MetLife to a colleague or a friend?” In approximately 7,000 surveys in 2022, 81% of participants surveyed would recommend MetLife to a colleague or a friend, answering that they were “very satisfied” or “satisfied” with the overall claim and customer service they received.  Health Savings & Spending Accounts Caller satisfaction surveys are completed across the MetLife customer base after customer service interactions. Each time a participant called in 2022, they were invited to participate in a short three-question survey that we used to monitor overall performance. We have modified this survey beginning in 2023 to further enhance customer satisfaction.   Based on results in 2022, we have received positive feedback for each of these three questions below: •	On a scale of 1-5, 5 being the best, how would you rate the courteousness and professionalism of the representative that you just spoke with? (average  3.6); •	On a scale of 1-5, 5 being the best, how would you rate the ability of the representative to explain the information in a manner that is easy to understand? (average 3.5); •	You just called our Customer Service Center to address a specific question or concern. Was your question or concern resolved the first time you called?  Please use the keypad on your phone using 1 for Yes or 2 for No. (average 1.3).  MetLife and Aura Identity & Fraud Protection Delivering superior customer service is a core part of Aura's mission and service. Aura's agents are empathetic advisors providing expert-level knowledge in the member's time of need. We believe a strong customer service training program is the foundation for providing exceptional service.  We continuously monitor and track member satisfaction to ensure we are delivering superior service; based on member satisfaction surveys conducted by Aura via SMS texts after interactions with customer support, Aura’s average satisfaction score is 4.3 out of 5. All customer service agents receive weekly coaching, quarterly performance assessments and ongoing training. When a member is a victim of ID Theft, our experienced White Glove fraud resolution team will help navigate credit bureaus, help initiate credit freezes, make 3-way calls to creditors where permissible, set a fraud alert, and more.  MetLife Legal Plans We measure participant satisfaction by surveying members using the Net Promoter Score (NPS) process. NPS surveys are sent once a member has had an opportunity to utilize their legal plan and complete their legal service needs with an attorney. We also send surveys to members once they have used our Digital Estate Planning, and Video Notary online services.  The question asked in the NPS survey is “How likely are you to recommend MetLife Legal Plans to a colleague?”  Our Client Service Center in Cleveland, Ohio serves as an immediate “feedback loop” for participants who call with questions and concerns. We aggregate telephonic feedback and review monthly to identify any re-occurring issues or trends.  MetLife Pet Insurance Our Pet customers are given a Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey. NPS is an industry- Net Promoter Score (NPS) is an industry wide calculation and has been proven to be an effective way to gauge customer loyalty. MetLife asks a single question to gather the data required to calculate NPS. “How likely are you to recommend MetLife to a friend or colleague?”  Those who respond to the question with a 9 or 10 are classified as promoters. Those who respond with a 0 to 6 are detractors. The percentage of detractors is subtracted from the percentage of promoters to get the NPS. For example, if 70% of responders are promoters, 10% are passives and 20% are detractors, then the company’s NPS would be 50 (70 - 20 = 50).  The Regional Market Net Promoter Score is 38.  Whole Life Surveys are not conducted for our Whole Life product.  Worksite STD We conduct a telephonic satisfaction survey with a random sampling of Worksite STD approved claimants. We ask the respondents: “How likely are you to recommend MetLife to a colleague or a friend?”  In 2022, satisfaction with our claims service was 90%, and satisfaction with service from Worksite STD-related calls to our call centers was 94%.
column56: While we do not directly provide physical or mental health care to members, our Disability and Leave programs include the use of clinical resources throughout the claim process. We also offer EAP services through LifeWorks as an optional feature alongside Life or LTD programs, which utilize a network of affiliate counselors to provide counseling services. These resources’ qualifications are described below.  Nurse Consultant Position Description Nurse Consultants support the claim and appeal departments by providing clinical expertise in the analysis of medical information. The consultant triages claims, evaluates new and ongoing claims for appropriate case management activity recommendations, talks to medical providers and interacts with the claim team and internal specialty resources. Nurse Consultants serve as the primary clinical resources for their team members in the process of returning employees to work.  Education A nursing degree with current state RN license is required.  Training/Background •	Minimum of five years of experience in clinical nursing as well as experience in any of the following areas: 	Disability insurance; 	Workers’ compensation case management; 	Utilization review or management; 	Risk management; 	Occupational health; 	Rehabilitation; 	Experience in nursing homes or intermediate care facilities. •	Current certification or willingness to pursue certification in the following fields: 	Certified Claim Specialist (CCM); 	Certified Disability Management Specialist (CDMS); 	Certification by the American Board of Disability Analysts (ABDA).  Many of our nurses have specialized clinical backgrounds in the areas of orthopedics, neurology, cardiology, oncology and/or occupational health.  Key Skills We require the following key skills: •	Excellent verbal and written communication skills; •	Excellent analytical, decision-making and problem-solving skills; •	Ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines; •	Ability to work independently and in a team environment; •	Ability to engage in effective conflict resolution; •	Ability to work effectively with others; •	Proficient in use of multiple systems and technology resources; •	Yearly completion of continuing education credits/contact hours as determined by the clinical program/clinical claims unit protocols.  Psychiatric Clinical Specialist Position Description Psychiatric Clinical Specialists conduct the initial interview on claims with a primary mental health diagnosis, communicating directly with the treating provider's office. For ongoing claims that require extensive clinical involvement and/or specialty services, the Psychiatric Clinical Specialist may act as a consultant to the STD or LTD Claim Specialist or co-manage the cases. The Psychiatric Clinical Specialist is able to provide a skilled-level review of clinical information, focusing on objective findings of psychological impairment, and discerning the relationship between an employee's levels of psychological impairment and essential job functions.   Education A master’s degree in mental health-related fields is required for Psychiatric Clinical Specialists including psychology or social work and a professional designation such as Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Licensed Marital and Family Therapist or Clinical Psychologist is also required.  Training/Background Extensive clinical or managed care experience is preferred.  Certified Employee Assistance Professionals Through a network of more than 24,500 affiliate counselors, LifeWorks offers face-to-face counseling services nationwide. Professional designations held by counselors include: •	Marriage and Family Therapist/Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist; •	Master of Social Work/Licensed Clinical Social Worker; •	Professional Clinical Counselor (LPCC); •	Psychologist (PhD); •	Substance Abuse Professional.  Each counselor has been rigorously screened and credentialed to meet our standards of professional excellence. LifeWorks recruits Certified Employee Assistance Professionals to maintain the highest professional Employee Assistance Program focus within the network. Each clinician must have: •	A minimum of a master's degree in counseling, social work, psychology or a related field; •	A minimum of five years of post-graduate clinical experience; •	Membership in good standing with a recognized governing body; •	Proven experience in his/her specialty.
column65: Our most recent Regional Market Customer Net Promoter Score (NPS) is 38.
column67: Our implementation process follows a consistent and structured approach that promotes positive outcomes.  All Implementation Leaders use a Web-based project plan to monitor all implementation deliverables. The detailed project plan tracks due dates and accountability of the owners of each item. Each member of the implementation team is required to update the project plan as tasks are completed. The Implementation Leader is responsible for ensuring that implementation team members complete their assigned tasks by the due date. Key tasks are linked to an aggregate reporting system that allows the management team to react promptly if a target milestone is in jeopardy.  A comprehensive Implementation Guide is created for each customer to provide an overview of the end-to-end process. The guide is presented at the initial implementation meeting and outlines the implementation schedule, key tasks, responsible parties and target dates. The presentation of the guide and discussion of key tasks is crucial in setting expectations. Subsequent follow-up meetings are scheduled to ensure that all parties are remaining on target with their key deliverables.  During the process, several quality assurance checks are conducted to ensure we have accurately finalized the plan design. These checks are done during the system set-up, contract production and system finalization. This ensures the accuracy of the information being loaded against the final system production information and contractual documents.  Lastly, customers are surveyed about their case installation experience. The results of these surveys are used to evaluate the implementation process and recognize opportunities for improvement. Implementation team members’ performance evaluations and compensation are directly impacted by these survey results.  We have enclosed sample implementation schedules with our response. A more completed and customized implementation schedule, including detailed tasks and responsibilities for the customer’s selected coverage(s), will be developed for each customer’s initial implementation meeting.
column73: Insured Arrangements Under our contract:  The Policyholder can end the policy by giving or 31-90 days’* advance written notice to MetLife. The policy will end on the later of the date stated in the notice or on the date the notice is received by MetLife.  •	MetLife can end the policy as follows: •	For non-payment of Premium, as set forth in the Grace period provisions; •	On any premium due date, by giving the policyholder 31-180 days’* advance written notice, if participation requirements are not met; •	On any premium due date by giving the policyholder 60 to 120 days’* advance written notice, if the policyholder fails to provide information on a timely basis or perform any obligations required by the policy or any applicable law; •	On any policy anniversary by giving the policyholder 31-180 days’* advance written notice.  *The exact number of days is determined by the coverage(s) and situs. We will relay this upon case implementation. Barring any state or administrative issues, MetLife will match current notice requirements of the existing plan if possible.  Self-Funded Arrangements Our standard Administrative Services Agreement contains the following termination language:   MetLife’s Administrative Services Agreement will terminate on the earliest of: •	The thirtieth day following receipt of written notice by Customer or MetLife from the other of the other’s intention to terminate the Agreement; or •	Five business days after Customer has received written notice of MetLife’s intention to terminate the Agreement because the bank account is not sufficiently funded or the Monthly Service Fee or other service fee or charge due from Customer to MetLife under the Agreement has not been paid when due (unless Customer has remitted all outstanding unpaid amounts before that date). MetLife’s failure to treat the Agreement as terminated in accordance with this Paragraph shall not be deemed to be a waiver of MetLife’s right to terminate the Agreement in accordance with this Paragraph at a subsequent time; or •	Immediately, in the event of unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Business Information, as provided for in the Agreement; or •	Any other date determined by written agreement among the Parties.
column74: We have significant educational resources and collateral available to increase awareness across our entire product suite. In addition to the availability of these vast resources, we deliver these resources in a way that we believe is unique in the marketplace. MetLife’s Client Services teams include a Voluntary Communication Specialist, who acts as an extension of the employer’s benefits team to ensure that employee engagement, educational resources and collateral are being delivered for the employer in a custom fashion, designed to meet each employer’s needs.   The Communications and Engagement Lead will partner with the customer throughout the enrollment process to get a better understanding of their employees’ demographics, company/organization size, site locations, organizational structure and any specific requirements. With this information, we will recommend the most appropriate enrollment methodology and communication material to maximize employee education and participation. We can provide a variety of communication materials including posters, table tents, payroll stuffers and email blasts. Moreover, we have an entire library of materials including videos that have been translated into other languages, such as Spanish. In addition, standard enrollment kits customized with the employer’s name and plan design can be created for distribution to communicate new plans.   At renewal, we will work with the customer to review the plan and recommend modifications, if appropriate. If there are any major plan design modifications or significant rate increases, we recommend that new enrollment kits be distributed for re-enrollment. To optimize re-enrollment efforts, the employer’s support to communicate benefits and any modifications to the plan is strongly recommended.
column79: Being an inclusive, global company with a diverse workforce inspires fresh perspectives and thinking enabling us to compete more effectively for talent. Diversity also helps us better understand our markets across the world and build stronger relationships with our customers and the communities where we live and work.  The key drivers of our Global Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DE&I) strategy are talent and commercial opportunities. The strategy is focused on three key strategic pillars:  •	Attraction – Identifying top diverse talent;  •	Development and Advancement – Developing our diverse workforce; and  •	Retention – Retaining our best talent to ensure high business performance and high workforce engagement.  To ensure that our DE&I efforts are sustained for the long term, we have established a Global Diversity and Inclusion Council chaired by our CEO. The primary focus of the council is to oversee the development and implementation of our DE&I strategy around the world. We launched four regional DE&I Task Forces – in Asia, EMEA, Latin America and the U.S. – sponsored by the regional presidents and chaired by regional representatives from the Global DE&I Council. The Task Forces focus on the implementation of the strategy at the regional and country levels and their members represent a cross-section of the businesses and functions in each region.  Our Diversity Business Resource Networks (DBRNs) are groups of employee volunteers who promote awareness, respect and inclusion of our key populations. These networks provide personal and professional development opportunities to our employees. In addition, they create and support business-driven initiatives aligned to the company’s business and DE&I strategies.  The seven DBRNs include: •	Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender Associates and Allies at MetLife (GLAM); •	Rising Professionals at MetLife (iRISE); •	MetLife Diverse Abilities (MDA); •	MetLife Veterans Network (MVET); •	Multicultural Professionals Network (MPN); •	Women’s Business Network (WBN); •	Families at MetLife (FAM).  Our Global Women’s Initiative (GWI) is focused on increasing the representation of women in leadership roles and strengthening the leadership capability of women in our talent pipeline. To attract, engage and develop female leaders, we have implemented the following programs: •	Women’s Business Networks: a global community of voluntary employee-led groups in more than 30 countries, focused on career development and engagement activities for women; •	The International Women’s Day Forum; an annual webcast celebrating the contributions of women globally enabling employees around the world to connect with influential thought leaders; •	Developing Women’s Careers Experience: a nomination-based program that emboldens women’s leadership aspirations, preparing them to move into leadership roles; •	Peer Mentoring Circles; employee-facilitated career discussion groups (Lean In) and peer groups for MetLife employees with children under the age of one to help them navigate their return-to-work following parental leave (Mom Circles).  Additionally, we have Local Inclusion Action Teams (LIATs) that exist in over 20 locations in the U.S. and one in India. LIATs support business initiatives that encourage an inclusive environment at the local level.  These groups have held events such as “lunch-n-learns” to discuss topics related to people with disabilities, the multi-generational workforce and cross-cultural communication. Gatherings are also held to honor events like Black History Month, Women’s History Month, Pride Month, Diversity Awareness Month and Autism Awareness.  The more diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring in serving our customers, the more successful we will be in developing the products and services that meets their needs. Customers who see themselves and their communities reflected at MetLife are more likely to buy from us, stay with us and recommend us.
column82: We require the following fields: •	SSN; •	Name; •	SOB; •	SOH; •	Relationship (e.g., employee, spouse, child); •	Full address; •	Coverage start and stop dates; •	Plan values and tier (EE Only, EE + 1, etc.).  We have a standard file layout which we prefer to use for the transmission of eligibility data.   We have attached a sample eligibility file with our response.   A designated Client Services Consultant will work with each client to customize this layout based on the products they purchase.
column91: Employee Website For the employee website, we offer an inbound single sign-on solutions using Security Assertion Mark-Up Language (SAML 2.0). The single sign-on implementation process will take approximately six to 12 weeks to establish a live connection. Specific implementation timelines are determined on a case-by-case basis. Timelines are based on the preparation needed between MetLife and the benefit administration platform.   Employer Website Customers can elect to give their third party administrator, broker or consultant access to their administrative information via our employer website. To provide access, the customer must complete and submit a user authorization form. This will enable them to access enrollment services, claims status, billing and leave information.   There is no additional charge for single sign-on.
