column101: Services vary by line of coverage. Due to response limitations in this form, please see our full response in the file labeled "7. MetLife Company Information and Full Respionse to Sequoia Vendor RFI 2023."
column103: We do not opine on ERISA status. It is the employer’s responsibility to determine and inform us whether a particular benefit is subject to ERISA. If a plan is subject to ERISA, per the employer, we administer benefits accordingly.  Generally, our MetLife Pet Insurance and MetLife and Aura Identity Theft & Fraud Protection products are not subject to ERISA.  For insured customers, we are willing to review their summary plan description upon request and will provide them with the following: •	A marked-up copy of their summary plan description indicating where we believe the information provided in the summary plan description may be inconsistent with the certificate; •	A marked-up copy of the certificate indicating those sections of the certificate that we believe have not been correctly or adequately described in the summary plan description.  Our review will be limited to those areas of the summary plan description related to the insurance benefits provided under the policy.  We are not the ERISA plan sponsor or plan administrator and do not assume any of the responsibilities or obligations of the plan sponsor or plan administrator for the contents of the summary plan description. Further, should there be any discrepancy between the summary plan description and the policy, the terms and conditions of the policy control all aspects of insurance.  For self-funded customers, we do not provide or maintain summary plan descriptions. While the employer would retain responsibility for meeting ERISA summary plan description requirements, we can prepare a coverage-specific sample summary plan description for groups with more than 1,000 lives as a guide to help the customer prepare their summary plan description for no additional cost.
column106: Our Dental and Vision programs are subject to COBRA. Our Health Savings & Spending Accounts may be subject to COBRA, depending on product specifics of the plan.  Our Life, Disability, Absence, Voluntary Benefits, MetLife and Aura Identity Theft & Fraud Protection, MetLife Legal Plans, MetLife Pet Insurance, Whole Life and Worksite STD programs, as well as certain Health Savings & Spending Accounts products, are not considered covered health plans as defined by HIPAA and COBRA. They do not provide medical care, nor do they pay costs for the provision of medical care.  Dental PPO We do not directly administer COBRA benefits and billing. We will work with the customer to facilitate COBRA administration. Claims for COBRA participants who appear on a customer’s eligibility file are paid in the same arrangement as non-COBRA participants.  Active and COBRA populations are typically separated by specific codes on our eligibility system. Our system performs an audit of employee and dependent records each time a file is applied on our production eligibility system. If an employee or dependent is not on the file, but has an active record on our system, we automatically terminate the participant with a specified date. Our auto-cancel process helps ensure we have accurate eligibility on our system.  Managed Dental Plan We have the ability to perform COBRA administration, including adding or terminating individuals, apply funds to the individual’s COBRA policy, and billing.  Vision MetLife Vision – VSP While we do not directly administer COBRA benefits and billing, we understand the need and will work with the customer to facilitate COBRA administration. Claims for COBRA participants who appear on a customer’s eligibility file are paid in the same fashion as non-COBRA participants.  Active and COBRA populations should be separated by specific codes in our eligibility system. Our system performs an audit on employee and dependent records each time a file is applied. If an employee or dependent is not on the file, but has an active record on our system, we'll automatically terminate the participant with a specified date. Our auto cancel process helps ensure that we have accurate eligibility in our system.  MetLife Vision – Davis and Superior Networks We do not directly administer COBRA benefits and billing. Therefore, it is the responsibility of clients to administer COBRA. However, we will work with clients to complete the enrollment of members that they have determined are COBRA eligible.  Claims for COBRA participants who appear on a customer’s eligibility file are paid in the same fashion as non-COBRA participants.  Active and COBRA populations should be separated by specific codes in our eligibility system. Our system performs an audit on employee and dependent records each time a file is applied. If an employee or dependent is not on the file, but has an active record on our system, we'll automatically terminate the participant with a specified date. Our auto cancel process helps ensure that we have accurate eligibility in our system.
column109: Plan Documents Insured For insured coverages, our rates include the preparation and digital delivery of booklet/certificates (in lieu of summary plan descriptions) for insured coverages. For plans subject to ERISA, the booklet/certificate will contain an ERISA information section. As the policyholder, the employer retains the responsibility for meeting any ERISA summary plan description requirements.  Any requested changes to the supplemental ERISA section are subject to the approval of our Law Department. Both the policyholder and MetLife reserve the right to omit the supplemental ERISA section.  Self-Funded At this time, we only produce sample summary plan descriptions for self-funded customers. Providing a summary plan description is an ERISA requirement. The employer is wholly responsible for the summary plan description’s compliance and adherence to ERISA laws.  Financial Accounting Insured ERISA Customers We will provide customers with a completed Schedule A (Form 5500) along with necessary information and instruction within the required 120-day time period. Provided all premiums are correct, complete and at our disposal by the end of the policy period, we will make every reasonable effort to supply this information within the earlier part of this time period.  Non-ERISA Customers Within 120 days from year-end, we will provide the customer with a completed Compensation Disclosure Statement. Provided all applicable information is correct, complete and at our disposal by the end of the policy period, we will make every reasonable effort to supply this information within the earlier part of this time period.  Self-Funded ERISA Customers We will provide the customer with a completed Schedule C (Form 5500) along with necessary information and appropriate instruction within the required 120-day time period. Provided all fees are correct, complete and at our disposal by the end of the services period, we will make every reasonable effort to supply this information within the earlier part of this time period.  Non-ERISA Customers Not applicable.
column111: For insured coverages, our rates include the preparation and digital delivery of booklet/certificates (in lieu of summary plan descriptions) for insured coverages. For plans subject to ERISA, the booklet/certificate will contain an ERISA information section. As the policyholder, the customer retains the responsibility for meeting any ERISA summary plan description requirements.  Any requested changes to the supplemental ERISA section are subject to the approval of our Law Department. Both the policyholder and MetLife reserve the right to omit the supplemental ERISA section.  At this time, we only produce sample summary plan descriptions for self-funded customers. Providing a summary plan description is an ERISA requirement. The employer is wholly responsible for the summary plan description’s compliance and adherence to ERISA laws.  If requested, we can provide a sample summary plan description based on the certificate of insurance. However, it will be the employer’s responsibility to make modifications ensuring compliance with ERISA. We assume the employer will include an ERISA wrapper with the self-produced summary plan description. Any compliance determination and final approval of the summary plan description would be the employer’s responsibility.  Per the terms of the service agreement, we require that the customer provides us with a final copy of the summary plan description. We can print the summary plan description on the customer’s behalf. However, we will not take responsibility for any ongoing maintenance or provide advisory services regarding ERISA compliance.
column117: As the carrier, we do not make this determination. It is up to the employer to determine whether a particular benefit results in income to the employee based on plan design, funding arrangement and payroll practices. It is up to the employer to determine the income tax implications of offering a given benefit to its employees.  We information report on IRS Form W-2 and withhold taxes with respect to disability benefit payments based on how the disability was funded and whether the employer has entered into an agency agreement with us with respect to the employer’s share of FICA. For section 79 life insurance plans, we can assist with imputed income calculations that the employer can use in preparing W-2s. All other products are handled similarly and generally we use the IRS 1099 Form family, as applicable.
column119: Each customer’s assigned Client Services Consultant is their single point of contact for any compliance-related questions, beginning at implementation and throughout the length of the customer’s relationship with MetLife. An assigned Account Manager will also work closely with the Client Services Consultant and the broker to navigate compliance questions and concerns, as well as a robust legal department that keeps MetLife up to date on all legalities as they change by state. These individuals will engage other internal MetLife resources as appropriate to ensure questions and concerns are promptly and thoroughly addressed.
column124: Each customer’s assigned Client Services Consultant is their single point of contact for any compliance-related questions. An assigned Account Manager will also work closely with the Client Services Consultant and the broker to navigate compliance questions and concerns, as well as a robust legal department that keeps MetLife up to date on all legalities as they change by state. These individuals will engage other internal MetLife resources as appropriate to ensure questions and concerns are promptly and thoroughly addressed.
column126: We work with the employer at the time of plan/benefit implementation with respect to tax-related setup. For example, MetLife provides tax-related information with respect to disability claims. We would need to know whether to send those reports directly to an employer or to Sequoia. Similarly, we will need to know whether a disability plan is funded pre- or post-tax on a contributory or 100% employer or 100% employee basis. To the extent we are not communicating directly with the employee, we will need Sequoia to help furnish this plan information to underlying employers. To the extent that we are not in direct contact with an employer, we will need Sequoia to help facilitate the exchange of information and execution of certain documents (e.g., tax agency agreements).
column127: Taxation is discussed prior to sale and during the implementation process (e.g., whether premiums are being paid pre or post tax, if MetLife or the employer is responsible for FICA match, etc.).

column37: Adams Resources & Energy Galileo Case Study 2023.pdf
column40: At Galileo, we believe high-quality care should be affordable and accessible for all and we've built a new care delivery model to achieve it. We combine the best of Advanced Primary Care principles (and all of the necessary skills to deliver it) with data and technology to improve the scope and effectiveness of what can be done virtually. When procedures are needed, we coordinate care and clinically navigate to the right brick-and-mortar providers or point solutions.  Galileo leverages best-in-class clinical expertise and integrates data into the primary care and specialty providers’ workflow reducing variability, improving outcomes and enhancing clinical efficiency.  Our population-based delivery model allows PCPs and specialists to collaborate in real time on a single patient case, which means members get the highest quality medical opinion and fully coordinated care without the time and expense of multiple appointments. Galileo’s model improves member experience, lower cost of care and achieve better health outcomes.  Galileo is a physician-led company with an executive team that has built and scaled industry-defining care delivery organizations. Our care model enables the highest quality clinical decision-making.
column43: There are dual models. A network fee plus custom fee schedule or an all-inclusive price (PEPM) for comprehensive digital-first care including unlimited consults across 20+ specialties (Acute, Chronic, Complex, Pediatrics, Behavioral Health, Gender Care etc.), Care Navigation & Advocacy & Therapy & Coaching. In the PEPM model there are no monetary claims and no copays for the employee.
column55: "Service" is one of Galileo's core values, defined as "Embracing a hospitality mindset to thoughtfully meet the needs of others." Our founder, Dr. Tom Lee established this value at One Medical and it remains fundamental to our mission at Galileo. In a predominantly virtual care delivery environment it can be even more difficult to build trust and engagement with patients, but this mindset allows our patient-facing providers and support team to achieve it. We frequently receive patient feedback that cites our team "going above and beyond."   This mindset also translates to our employer relationships and partner-facing teams and the client service we deliver.   Importantly, we also believe a hospitality mindset includes affordability to families and purchasers as a critical element.
column56: 10 years clinical experience 5 years virtual care delivery experience Full-time, dedicated to Galileo (no 1099 contractors, which is typical for virtual care delivery)
column67: Step 1: Partnership Kick-Off & Discovery Identify stakeholders, get to know client's unique needs, align on key dates and deliverables to ensure a successful and timely launch.   Step 2: Eligibility & Enrollment Set up eligibility file transfer, test files and coordinate with other vendors as needed.  Step 3: Benefits Integration Review summary of benefits and plan coverage, hand-offs with other benefit partners and trainings needed to ensure our Advocacy team's complete understanding and ability to support patients holistically with the benefits available to them.  Step 4: Communications Planning Streamlined discovery process to understand preferred communication channels, employee motivators, existing health and well-being initiatives, performance, and targets. It is our goal to seamlessly integrate a customized communication plan with existing benefits in mind.   Galileo takes a hands-on, “white glove” approach to account management. Galileo's lead Success Manager serves as the single point of contact across all Galileo partnership touch points to ensure continuity across teams and consistent execution. They will hold regular meetings, including quarterly business reviews, to review and discuss enrollment, engagement, and satisfaction.
column74: Our comprehensive communication strategy includes an initial discovery process to identify best-performing channels and align our toolkit with the client's needs and augment with custom solutions when needed. We focus on three phases: 1) Foundation Update core, evergreen benefits materials (wikis, booklets, app, etc.) 2) Launch  Identify a cross-channel strategy of 12-14 touch points in the first 30 days across client and Galileo-led communications. This has proven to generate best-in-class adoption and long-term program performance. 3) Ongoing Engagement Leveraging our robust monthly touch points for simple distribution by print, social or email, clients can keep their Galileo benefit top-of-mind for their employees and new hires.  Once an eligible member creates their Galileo account, they will receive a welcome email series and monthly engagement emails.   Galileo also welcomes the opportunity to come onsite for health fairs, open enrollment events or send periodic home mailer reminders.
column79: Galileo is deeply committed to delivering inclusive and culturally competent care and deliberately invests in the diversity of our team and ongoing education.   1. Galileo's fully employed medical group is one of the most diverse in the nation: 50% identify as non-white (vs. 28% national average for primary care physicians) and 40% are bilingual in English and Spanish. 2. Galileo provides an end-to-end Spanish experience, including Galileo’s app and 24/7 bilingual and bicultural provider and patient support teams. 3. Providers receive advanced training on cultural competence including health equity, anti-racism, trauma-informed care and social determinants of health.

column101: Galileo includes the following services:  24/7 virtual primary and specialty care  Whether you need treatment after hours, can’t get in to see your doctor, or prefer to skip the waiting room altogether, Galileo can help. You can message their doctors about sudden health issues (the flu, stomach pain) or everyday concerns (like back pain or stress). Through the app, you can access highly qualified doctors wherever you are, whenever you need it. You’ll always get a fast, same-day response—at no cost to you (no copays, no deductibles).   Pediatric urgent care  Galileo provides 24/7 pediatric urgent care for your little ones, including guidance on whether in-person care is needed.  Receive treatment for your child based on their age, symptoms, and health history.   Find out if you need to keep your child home from school or go to the emergency room Text or video chat with a pediatric specialist day or night Skip urgent care and talk to a Galileo pediatric specialist anytime for $0.  Please note: Physicals/well-child visits, chronic condition support, and behavioral health care will be coordinated with or referred to in-person pediatricians or specialists.  Care Navigation / Advocacy Galileo’s Patient Support team specializes in administrative tasks that are often confusing, frustrating and time-consuming, such as:  Referrals to in-network specialists Insurance authorizations Care coordination with multiple providers Submitting doctor’s lab orders and prescriptions Requesting medical records from other doctors you see Galileo’s Advocates would be happy to help you with these tasks anytime and they’re available 24/7.   Mental Health Therapy & Coaching In addition to unlimited mental health screening, guidance and treatment, members can access up to 7 video sessions with a therapist or mental health coach at no cost via the Galileo app.   Music-Based Therapy for Emotional Support Unlimited therapeutic music sessions on the Spiritune app, designed by leading music therapists and neuroscientists to reduce stress, regulate emotions and improve focus and sleep.
column103: If the employer pays for any portion of the benefit, the Galileo program will be considered an ERISA plan, if you are subject to ERISA. The material herein may not be construed as legal advice. We encourage employers to consult their legal counsel regarding compliance of any benefit program they offer to employees.

column37: Peloton Corporate Wellness - Healthcare Case Study.pdf
column40: Peloton is an inclusive, fun, and motivating employee benefit that meaningfully improves physical, mental and social well-being.   Inclusive: No equipment required, activities for every level of fitness.  Fun: Fitness entertainment curated by a diverse group of world-class instructors.  Motivating: Designed to meet Members wherever they are and encourage them to grow.   Peloton’s Corporate Wellness solution unlocks award-winning classes for mind and body, unique corporate engagement experiences, robust reporting capabilities, and high-touch client success services.   With over 50 instructors, 10 modalities, 80 class types, and thousands of new classes each month, Peloton offers something for everyone.   Key differentiators include:			 Breadth of classes: Peloton offers classes across numerous disciplines (strength, yoga, meditation, walking, etc) , allowing employers to consolidate fitness and meditation point solutions.  Motivation that drives engagement: Peloton’s instructors, music partnerships, and themed classes support positive behavior change: 78% of Corporate Wellness Members report working out more than they did before their employer offered the Peloton benefit Team-building features to promote community in the workplace and a culture of well-being. Employees can leverage company challenges, team workouts, Tags, and more to engage with their colleagues outside of their day-to-day interactions in the workplace.
column42: Yes. Employer headcount minimum is currently set at 500 employees. Annual payment minimum applies for any client between 500-1000 employees.
column43: Utilization based + administrative fee. Pricing is client-specific and available upon request.
column54: Peloton’s App and platform is available 24/7. Members can take a class or utilize features anytime they’d like.  Member support is available between 6am-12am EST, 7 days a week.  Peloton Corporate Wellness Client Success Managers are available Monday through Friday, 9am-6pm EST (major holidays excluded).
column55: “Put Members First” is a core value at Peloton, and we obsess over every touchpoint of our Member experience. The company is constantly innovating and producing new features, updates, content, and more to serve our Members, largely based on feedback we receive from our community. Our Member-first ethos extends to the Corporate Wellness space, where we take our client feedback into account when prioritizing new product features and updates.
column56: Peloton requires each of its instructors to be a certified personal trainer, and the majority of Peloton instructors are certified through the National Academy of Sports Medicine, or NASM. Our instructors complete a rigorous audition and interview process before they are hired.	   Peloton adheres to a strict hiring process as it pertains to our client service team.
column65: Peloton measures NPS scores for each product across our entire Membership base, including Members who have joined through direct to consumer channels.   Bike: 66 Bike+: 66 Tread: 72 App: 74 Row: 64
column67: Peloton’s Account Management Team ensures a “light lift” for employers with the latest enrollment & eligibility technology, actionable data insights and communication toolkits.  Peloton typically recommends a weekly 30-60 minute meeting from contracting through benefit announcement/launch. Implementation can occur at almost any time of year, and typically takes no longer than 4 weeks.  During implementation, the client and account manager will accomplish the following:  - Benefit Portal Setup  - Eligibility file upload/testing enrollment flow (must be done 2 weeks prior to launch) - Communication timeline and channels (timeline will be based on client's needs) - Review marketing assets, welcome video, photography/logos, etc
column73: Peloton’s agreements with clients typically continue for a period of one year from the program launch date as agreed upon. Thereafter, the agreement renews automatically for successive 12-month periods unless either party elects not to renew by notifying the other party at least 90 days prior to the end of the then-current Term. Peloton does not offer termination for convenience.
column74: Peloton delivers industry-high engagement by focusing on various communication touchpoints throughout an employees’ journey. Communication strategy is different for every client, however we leverage a proven toolkit and playbook to address each of our client's communication needs. We focus on continuous communication through 2 key phases:  Enrollment: Peloton is committed to providing an inclusive benefit that offers something for everyone at every level. We provide a comprehensive communications toolkit, coupled with a launch & engagement plan that sustains excitement among employees. As employees are deemed as eligible by their ‘start date’ in the eligibility file provided by their employers, Peloton sends a one-time welcome email that describes the benefit and provides directions on how to enroll. Peloton can send follow-up emails to employees who have yet to activate their benefit, and will work with a client on the appropriate cadence for these communications. Peloton also leverages other company communication methods to increase awareness and adoption (i.e. messaging channels, executive sponsorship, company meetings, etc.). Here are some examples of how Peloton helps clients drive benefit enrollment and first-touch engagement: - Peloton provides the first class in the employee onboarding process - a 5 minute yoga or meditation class - to educate employees on how accessible Peloton classes are, and encourage them to continue to engage.  - Peloton can provide consultation support for company-wide launch event programming to generate awareness (i.e. all-hands meeting announcement, webinars, etc.)   Engagement: Peloton offers multiple engagement touchpoints at the company, team, and individual levels – and partners with clients to ensure that our engagement strategy is aligned with your company culture:  Company-level: - Company-wide activity challenges (available for employers with >1k employees): All employees enrolled in the benefit can participate in activity-based challenges with Peloton. Challenges are typically based on the number of classes/active days or minutes that an employee engages with Peloton, to ensure flexibility and accessibility. Challenge finishers are rewarded with custom company badges, and we can work with clients to offer additional incentives.  - Cultural moments & DEI support: Peloton produces content in support of cultural celebrations throughout the year. Our client success team can help tie Peloton into cultural celebrations such as Black History Month, Mental Health Awareness Month, Pride Month, and more.  - Tags: Peloton can help set up a company Tag so members of a workforce can interact with one another.  - High-Fives: Coworkers can offer encouragement when taking a class together.   Team-level: - Team Classes: Peloton provides assets that enable ambassadors or team leaders to facilitate team-specific classes. Peloton’s scheduling feature allows Members to schedule a class and send an invite to coworkers or friends to join them on the Leaderboard.  - Wellness Breaks: Peloton can support teams in blocking time for employees to engage in recommended activities such as meditation classes for a mental health break, stretches for a mobility break, outdoor team walks/runs, etc.  - Tags: Tags can also be created for specific teams within an organization so that Members can stay connected with one another in a more intimate setting.   Individual-level: - Peloton offers targeted outreach to enrolled Members (via email, push notifications) to recommend new content, encourage them to take their first class, keep their daily/weekly streak going, hit their next milestone, join a company/community challenge, and more.  - Streaks: Peloton helps Members stay motivated by awarding them for daily and weekly streaks of activity.  - Achievements: Members are rewarded with special badges for completing milestone classes (i.e. 10th class, 50th class, 100th class, etc.), programs, or special activities/themed classes.  - Programs: Programs can be recommended to help Members achieve a personal goal within a certain time frame. Members can track their progress and stay on track based on an instructor’s guidance.  - Personalization features: Peloton’s User Interface leverages machine learning to recommend classes and content based on a Member’s engagement and preferences.
column79: Peloton is positioned as a benefit that is for anyone, anywhere, at every stage of their fitness journey. We strive to democratize physical and mental wellness through our products, content, community initiatives, and client relationships. To ensure our product resonates with a broad and diverse audience, Peloton offers support for cultural celebrations in the workplace.  Through on-platform content and employee-facing events/communication materials, Peloton celebrates the following cultural moments: - Black History Month (February) - Women’s History Month (March) - Mental Health Awareness Month (May) - Asian & Pacific Islander Heritage Month (May) - Pride Month (June) - Hispanic Heritage Month (Sept/Oct) - World Mental Health Day (October) - Gratitude Week (November)  Peloton can provide support to Employee Resource/Affinity Group leaders to create special cultural moment celebrations.   Peloton also produces exclusive virtual events for corporate wellness members that are often focused on celebrating these cultural moments to support benefit and community engagement. Here are some examples:  - Self Love Club Event - Mental Health Awareness Month: Lifting Each Other Up

column92: Yes, reporting metrics are visible to client stakeholders via our client portal. The following reporting metrics are included in Peloton’s employer portal. Some metrics update in realtime. Minutes per Active Member: broken down by week/month

column40: The traditional vision benefit landscape has been status quo for years and typically offers very low value to its clients and their employees.   The XP Health program focuses on  Technology and Innovation: XP Health has built the world’s first smart vision care platform.  We use artificial intelligence and augmented reality to create a curated, personalized experience for selecting eyewear and have innovated to provide virtual access to care.   Lower costs eyewear for members:  Unlike traditional vision options, our business model is not structured to profit from eyewear sales.   XP Health provides access to high-quality frames and best-in-class lenses at vertically integrated wholesale costs.   By removing the physical retail overhead, staff, and idle inventory, our average member out-of-pocket is just $42, compared to $230 with traditional plans.  We source directly from OEM manufacturers for major eyewear players, and pass on the savings directly to members.   Intelligent Vision Care Journey: XP Health includes a robust national vision network that covers in-person eye exams ($0 copay) at 99,000+ providers (retail and private practice), in-person discounts, online prescription renewal, and revolutionary pricing through XP online marketplace.
column42: We support groups with 25+ lives unless they are part of a larger bulk opportunity - eg, S-Tech or S1
column43: Employers can customize plans depending on their employee needs.   On average, XP Health plans are often less expensive than competitors' while providing significantly more value.   XP Health is offered through a PEPM subscription basis, ranging from $6-$12 depending on the eyewear benefit coverage.    All plans include a $0 cost for access to doctor-recommended lenses and enhancements, included with every eyewear purchase (advanced blue-light protection, advanced anti-glare protection, UV protection and scratch-resistant coating). All plans include access to account management, marketing communication support and a dedicated Concierge Team.  We have two primary products (each offer a configurable eyewear benefit:  1.) Virtual Vision Care:  This includes access to the XP Marketplace for Eyewear.  This is typically deployed as a value added plan that would be in addition to a traditional vision plan.   2.). Total Vision Care: Includes access to the XP Marketplace and the Vision Care Platform, which includes an eye exam benefit and an online prescription renewal service.
column54: Monday - Friday 6am-7pm Pacific
column55: One of our core brand differentiators is that we strive to earn member trust and satisfaction with our exceptional customer service, high-quality frames and lenses without unnecessary mark-ups, expert-reviewed eye health content, and clinically-guided plans to care for members’ vision needs. Earning members’ trust and delivering exceptional customer service means that in situations that are unclear, that lead to confusion or questions, we consistently err on the side of our members.   In addition to policy drivel elements (like a 30-day no-questions-asked return policy for our eyewear), we have reimbursed members for scheduling an exam outside of our eye exam network (for Total Vision Care Clients), sent them free eyewear if they identified a confusing or erroneous element related to our member experience, or allowed members to add a dependent in excess of our contracted amount when we felt that action would reflect our values and commitment to member experience.   For client organizations, we pride ourselves on maintaining a level of personal care, partnership, and flexibility that redefines traditional standards of the industry.   In addition to building custom vision plans to accommodate budgets and well-being goals, offering dedicated account management resources, and as frequent as weekly reporting, we have helped our clients transition vision plans mid-year, adjust benefit levels, added coverage for new populations, recruited additional providers to our network, added eyewear inventory to our store, and even offered free XP Health eyewear as an incentive for employees to learn about other benefit changes that our clients were implementing.   Coming through for our clients is at the core of what we do and will continue doing.
column56: All of our customer service team members have prior member services experience and are regularly trained and re-trained on our standards.   Additionally, we have three certified opticians on staff, and all XP Health optical lab staff is certified in using specialty equipment that we use to deliver eyewear orders.
column67: XP Health has focused on making implementation as easy as possible. We actively partner with health plans to provide you with flexibility and leverage APIs like Noyo, Stripe, Twilio, and others to seamlessly integrate with existing systems used for eligibility information, invoicing, and marketing.   Additionally, XP Health provides implementation, analytics, marketing, and account management resources to ensure employees understand how to register and use their new benefits. We recognize that member enrollment and utilization are essential, so provide real-time performance and real-time usage information to allow employers and brokers to assess the impact.    Depending on the integration complexity (SSO, e-file exchange, etc.), implementing XP Health can take 30-60 days. Please note that for Sequoia customers, XP Health data exchanges are already implemented with Sequoia, leading to a significantly simplified implementation process:  1.) Discuss and review plan designs with the Sequoia consultant 2.) Inform XP Health about plan selections and launch date 3.) XP Health works with Sequoia to test eligibility data exchange via existing channel 4.) Site is configured and presented to customer for testing 5.) Site is live for members  The estimated process will take 30 days.
column74: XP Health would work with Sequoia to leverage existing internal channels to reach employees, including internal newsletters, messaging channels (Slack or Microsoft Teams as an example), benefits portals, webinars, etc. XP Health would provide design and copy to incorporate into these existing channels.   XP Health also provides a suite of materials to reach members, including flyers, emails, and direct mail/postcards. Typically, the flyers are digital, but printed versions can be made available as needed. The costs for the enrollment comms coming from XP Health are all absorbed by us (webinar hosting, email sends, postcards, etc). We partner with the client to outline the appropriate channel and timing to best reach their employees.
column79: Our company is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy (including breastfeeding and related medical conditions), national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, age, genetic information, disability, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, marital status, protected medical condition, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws,   Our HR partner endorses these principles in its provision of services to our Company.   This Policy extends to all aspects of our employment practices, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, discipline, firing, promoting, transferring, compensation, benefits, training, leaves of absence, and other terms and conditions of employment.   Our Company is committed to complying with the laws protecting qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as employees' religious beliefs and observances.  Our Company will provide reasonable accommodation for any known physical or mental disability and/or employee's religious beliefs and observances to the extent required by law, provided the requested accommodation does not create an undue hardship for our Company and/or does not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of others in the workplace and/or to the individual.  If you require an accommodation to perform the essential functions of your job and/or for your religious beliefs or observances, you must notify our internal HR contact.  If our Company does not completely and timely address your request for accommodation, you should contact our external employee advocate.  Once our Company and /or our external employee advocate are aware of the need for accommodation, we will follow an interactive process to identify possible accommodations that will enable you to perform the essential functions of the job.

column101: XP offers a combination of services that can serve as a value added or standalone service.  The program is delivered through two primary components:  a.) The XP Marketplace and b.) the Vision Care Platform.    We have two primary product offerings:  Virtual Vision Care:  This notes our value-added programs, which include access to the XP Marketplace.  Total Vision Care: This notes our standalone solution which includes access to both the XP Marketplace and The Vision Care Platform.   Marketplace: provides online access to discounts on eyewear including eyeglasses and lenses, sunglasses, and contacts.  - Each program includes a set benefit credit that can be applied towards eyewear purchases.  The credits can be used towards both prescription and non-prescription eyewear (e.g. - blue light computer glasses and sunglasses)  - Part of the profile creation includes a proprietary face measurement tool and recommendation system to help users select the perfect fitting frames.  - Part of the purchasing process includes home and virtual try-on  Vision Care Platform:  - Includes navigation and access to an eye exam.    Note that XP also offers access to an online visual acuity test that can be used to renew an existing vision prescription. This service can be included with both Virtual Vision Care and Total Vision Care Programs.
column104: For Virtual Vision Care, No.  However, XP Health can comply if a client prefers to treat the Marketplace as an ERISA benefit. When XP Total Vision Care is offered, it would be subject to ERISA.

column40: Helpr differentiates itself from competitors through several key features:   1. Global reach: Helpr operates globally, providing care benefits to employees around the world. 2. Direct screening: Unlike competitors, Helpr does not rely on third-party agencies for subcontracting care providers. All care providers are directly screened by Helpr. 3. Patented platform: Helpr has a patent on its platform for supporting employee personal care providers, allowing employers to offer a subsidy-based program instead of a reimbursement for in-home care. 4. Dynamic platform: Helpr's platform is dynamic and supports employee choice for using their care hours. It also allows for customization and agility as a service provider. 5. Hour-based utilization: Helpr operates on an hour-based utilization program for cost of care, as opposed to a day-based program. This allows employees to save more workdays as they can use increments of time needed instead of spending a full day of their care package on just a few hours of support.  In addition to these, Helpr offers a range of services including child and adult Back Up Care, unlimited care concierge and navigation, virtual academic support, an FSA Tool, and a Content Library. The platform also provides a simple, easy user experience with a compassionate, supportive, and reliable service.
column42: No minimum headcount, but a $6k minimum Management Fee
column43: Implementation fees are based on number of countries and languages serviced + eligibility process.  We charge a Management Fee that is based on a PEPY fee. Each Backup Care service line is an individual PEPY.   Service lines for Backup Care:  Out of Network Backup Care + Center Based Care  In Network Care Helpr Online  Service line for care coordination and concierge: Core Care   Cost of Care is based on utilization of package hours with a 10% merchant fee on the total provider payout. Each employer chooses a subsidy rate for the Out of Network + Center Based care hours. Employers also choose the number of hours each employee receives. The company's retainer is charged for what is utilized. In-Network Care and Helpr Online are a flat rate.  Copay for In-Network and Helpr Online is flat. Copay for Out of Network and Center Based Care is the differential between the company subsidy and the provider rate

column55: Helpr's customer service operations are designed to provide comprehensive support to both clients and employees. They have a dedicated client success representative for each account that handles implementation, reporting, and all employer concerns. An engagement representative supports employee communications, webinars, 1:1 benefits chat management, and all events requested to support utilization. They offer 24/7 phone support, if desired, with agents working across time zones.   Helpr's process for resolving customer problems involves reaching out to remedy the situation as soon as possible. They continuously monitor and measure customer satisfaction and quality assurance through surveys and reports. They handle repeated feedback about their systems and processes by working with their Client Success team, Customer Support team, and development department to streamline user experience. They build and rework systems in response to feedback and user/client needs.   In case of billing issues, they ensure to provide clear and transparent billing information and are ready to address any discrepancies or issues that may arise. They also have a process for handling negative experiences, where they reach out to the client to remedy the situation and use the feedback to improve their services.
column56: Helpr's team members who provide services to clients have diverse backgrounds and qualifications based on their project assignments. All have experience as professional care providers. Their credentials include early childhood education certificates, Masters in social work, Adult Home Health Aide, HR recruiting specialist, and beyond. For Core Care services, Helpr reviews the following qualifications: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNAs), Home Health Aides (HHAs), Home Care Aides (HCAs), Caregiver Certification For Hospice, Palliative, And End-Of-Life Care, and Caregiver Certification For Specific Needs And Conditions. All candidates must have a minimum of 2 years of professional childcare experience, specifically related to the position, and two professional references. Helpr uses an 8 point screening process to vet candidates, which includes professional reference checks, employment verification, ID verification, criminal search, sex offender check, social media review, CPR verification, and professional certificate & license verification.
column67: The implementation process involves the Helpr Client Success team onboarding HR teams and preparing all communication materials. This includes setting up employee dashboards for US/international users, setting dates for post-launch live webinars, and creating guides and flyers that introduce users to the benefit package features and the structure of the app. The launch webinar is recorded and hosted on the microsite for users who are unable to join live. Portals are set to country-specific subsidies, scaled for currency, and built with language options. Throughout the year, Helpr runs internal, segmented marketing touches for registered employees and shares assets monthly for HR teams to post on boards and distribute to the employee community. Helpr also offers 1:1 complimentary chats for employees with an account manager for more support, available any time by appointment. After signature, launch is available within 6 months for all SSO, security, compliance, language, and currency requirements. The client team co-promotes the events and resources. Implementation timelines are based on company specs, with international launches taking closer to a 6 weeks from contract signature and domestic accounts taking around 3 weeks. Users can register for services by downloading the app from the Google Play or Apple store internationally. They sign up/register as an employee and can opt for SSO, if applicable.
column73: Annual - 3 year fees are charged upfront so 30 days, but no fees are waived.
column74: Helpr partners closely with People teams to distribute information and marketing materials relevant to their Helpr benefits. These communications include a Benefit Guide, Benefit Flyer, Monthly Utilization Report, Employee Dashboard, Benefit Map (Full Suite), and Benefit Teaser. If email is not a preferred mode of communication, Helpr can outreach and promote the program through a Microsite, Slack integration, webinars, and ERG partnership. Each account has a dedicated Client Success account lead and Engagement Rep for support. Helpr also offers co-branded communication with client partners and is willing to participate in on-site visits.
column79: We are a certified diverse supplier through WBENC.    We have a content library with caregiving resources that companies can use to support their Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and DEI initiatives. We can also help build out programming to push through DEI initiatives in the family space. We run an ERG support program for our clients, participate in WBENC programming, and participate in HR diversity workshops. Our benefit offerings serve not just thought-workers, but also hourly wage workers in manufacturing, retail and distribution services. We are majority woman owned and operated, culturally diverse, and aim to bring affordable benefits to all employee classes and compensation levels.

column92: Helpr provides clients with access to a utilization report generated with data pertaining to that month/quarter and overall contract term to date. The reports are distributed on a monthly/quarterly basis within 10 business days of the end of the month. The reporting metrics reflect ongoing employee engagement and can include various utilization and user trends. All data reporting is standard, and Helpr can accommodate ad hoc reporting in addition to monthly detailed and annual tax reports. Clients also have access to a benefit dashboard that hosts all communications, event calendar, and the 1:1 benefit consultation link. Custom implementation for an admin portal to manage/access data is available.
column101: Helpr offers a range of services globally:  1. Out-of-Network Backup Care: Employees can use their own care providers, who are paid directly by Helpr. This service is available for infants, children, adults, and individuals with special needs.  2. In-Network Backup Childcare: Available in select US cities, employees can book screened sitters for children of all ages.  3. Center-Based Care Reimbursement: Employees can choose their own care centers or Helpr Partner centers for reimbursement of their costs. This service is available for infants, children, adults, and individuals with special needs.  4. Core Care: Employees work with a Care Consultant to source either primary or backup care providers as well as doulas and enrichment courses and camps. This service is available for infants, children, adults, and individuals with special needs.  5. Helpr Online: Dependents of employees can use 1:1 virtual academic and enrichment courses (tutoring). This service is available for individuals through high school graduation including College Prep.  6. DCFSA Tool: Employees can run childcare hours through our dependent care platform to utilize their DCFSA funds. This service is available for both children and adults.  7. Pet Care: This is an add-on to Out-of-Network Care PEPY and utilization projections, but does not include extra fees in our Core Care program. Pet Care is included for Core Care at standard fees.  8. FSA Tool: Families can extend the spend of their DCFSA by utilizing and paying out of network providers through the app.  9. Content Library: Helpr has a content library with caregiving resources companies can lean on to support their ERGs and DEI initiatives. Helpr can also help build out programming to help push through DEI initiatives in the family space.

column107: "COBRA" typically refers to the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act in the United States, which provides certain employees and their families the right to continue their health insurance coverage for a limited period after certain events, such as the termination of employment.

column40: Flexibility and responsibility.  Flexibility for employers: Every business is different, so our solution was designed to be highly configurable, allowing us to match each customer's unique workflow, regardless of size or complexity.  Flexibility for employees: Immediate maximizes the options employees have for when and where they want to receive a funds transfer.  Responsibility: Immediate uses guardrails to give employees access to the money they have earned without exposing them to the risk of receiving a zero dollar paycheck.  The earned wage access industry has become one focused on giving employees virtually unlimited access to their wages with the talk track of 'it's your money, use it when you need it.' However, Immediate feels this approach is predatory in nature as it encourages an abundance of transactions which deduct further from an employees paycheck. Furthermore, it promotes enablement for team members rather than responsible financial access with a focus on financial wellness.   Immediate practices what it promotes - financial wellness through responsible access to earned wages with need-based transactions while keeping funds with the employee and furthering their journey to financial freedom.
column43: Immediate is a voluntary, group benefit that has no required cost to the employer. Employees have multiple options which don’t carry any direct cost to them either. There is no fee to transfer funds to a gift card or to the Immediate card.  The only direct cost to the employee is if they choose to push funds directly to their personal bank account or debit card. In this scenario, standard pricing is $3 per transaction.   Furthermore, Immediate offers a solution for employees to support off-cycle paychecks to simplify the payroll team's processes. This model may carry a $1 - $3 fee depending on how (and if) the company utilizes this solution. It is not a requirement to utilize this service.  Immediate does not have any minimum utilization requirements, minimum spends for employers or employees, not contract term lengths or exclusivity requirements.   The easiest way to think about Immediate's services is a no cost/no obligation service for the employer to offer their employees where employees have the option for multiple free options to access their earned wages.

column55: Customer satisfaction is paramount at Immediate and our results speak for themselves. In our history, we’ve never lost a customer and currently maintain an 88 NPS score. Our support team is all U.S. based and is available 24/7/365, with an average issue resolution time of 12 minutes.
column56: Regarding standard onboarding, every employee goes through a background check in addition to security and privacy training. column67: Our goal is to make our system as easy to implement as it is to use. Standard implementations typically take six to eight weeks and require less than 10 hours of total time from the client's staff. Due to the increase in complexity, large, enterprise level implementations may take 16-20 weeks. For all projects, we schedule a virtual introductory and kick off meeting for the project team and all stakeholders.  The Immediate project team will be made up of an Implementation Manager, Integration Engineer, Account Manager. In addition, in-person implementations and launches are available for enterprise level clients as well.   The Implementation Manager will customize a project plan based on your needs and guide you through Integration, Training, Soft-Launch, and Go Live. We believe change management is essential to an effective rollout and will work with your team to develop a multi-channel communication plan that ensures all stakeholders and employees are well prepared on Launch Day. Because on-demand pay is often a net-new benefit for many organizations, we have capabilities to send all communications automatically via multiple channels (email, text, in app notifications as well as physical printed materials to locations). We will also provide any communication templates to the employer customer to distribute internally. We offer multiple types of training sessions, customized for your audience, and use advanced analytics to measure success of the roll out. After Go Live, you will be transitioned to your permanent Account Manager, and our 24/7 Customer Service team, for ongoing support.  Deadlines, tools, etc. will be defined based on the client's desired timeline, payroll and time tracking systems and availability.   Immediate can share a project roadmap, sample timeline, data requirements and more if desired.

We notify employees and employers about banking holidays throughout the year to help in managing the types and timing in accessing their earned time during these days.

column40: GIThrive is the leading all-in-one digestive health solution for employers. It delivers science-based medical, nutrition and medication therapy programs directly to members’ fingertips.   Key features include:  •        Technology-enabled triage: GIThrive delivers the right care at the right time by pairing innovative technology with all-in-one gastrointestinal (GI) care. The platform helps members who are experiencing everything from high-acuity issues like undiagnosed inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) to low-acuity issues like food sensitivities. GIThrive provides personalized, clinically validated treatment plans and interventions to help them get healthier and stay healthier, gut first.  •        Comprehensive care team: Our expert team of clinicians includes Health Coaches, Registered Dietitians, Internists & GI Specialists. Effective end-to-end support for a wide range of GI patients providing clinical support, education & guidance. Vivante is the only digestive health solution able to service members in all 50 states.  •        Therapeutic nutrition: For members with chronic GI conditions, GIThrive offers clinical nutrition plans proven to reduce inflammation, ease symptoms and, in some cases, achieve or maintain disease remission. Each member has a dedicated registered dietitian assigned to them to maximize adherence and results.  •        Dedicated support: Within minutes of enrolling, members have direct access to a dedicated team of health experts who work to understand their health goals and challenges. The care team’s NPS score reflects the outstanding experience members have with the team.  •        24/7 Gut-Side Assistance™: GIThrive’s all-inclusive platform not only helps triage members already experiencing gut health issues, it can also help anticipate conditions before they begin. With machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI), the platform’s algorithms work 24/7 to provide members with the care they need. This helps prevent acute events such as ER visits and severe condition flare-ups

column55: More than 70 million Americans experience gastrointestinal (GI) conditions; many are alone, suffering in silence - we intend to change that. Vivante Health is an innovative digital healthcare company reinventing chronic condition management, gut first.  GIThrive is Vivante’s comprehensive virtual digestive health platform that delivers the right care at the right time to the end user by pairing data-driven technology with a coordinated clinical care team available nationwide. With clinically proven interventions, educational content, and self-guided behavioral modification lessons, members receive personalized, on-demand care for all GI related conditions and symptoms.  It is through our clients that we impact members' lives and our clients count on us as trusted partners to deliver outstanding service. Each client has a dedicated Implementation Manager, Client Success Manager, and Member Marketing resource. Our Client Success Team has a proven track record of delivering exceptional customer service with a 2023 NPS of 95!   We believe that a timely response is critical to great customer service therefore we track the following SLAs.  - Response within 24 hours for client support inquiries - Response within 48 hours for member support inquiries
column56: Gastroenterologist Qualifications:  Currently board certified in Gastroenterology by American Board of Internal Medicine Role/Scope: Diagnoses and treats acute illnesses and chronic diseases and conditions in the field of gastroenterology, including IBD, IBS/FGID, GERD, liver disease, GI cancers, and other GI conditions Manages complex and/or refractory digestive symptoms, such as abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, gas, bloating, nausea, vomiting, reflux, and bowel control issues Serve as medical specialist for internist/primary care physician Prescribes or administers medications, therapy, and other specialized medical care to treat or prevent illness, disease, or injury Provides synchronous or asynchronous care, including review of results, ordering of tests, communication with patients, and other care interventions, as appropriate.  Refers to in-person or virtual specialty care (eg, gastroenterologist), PCP, or other clinicians when appropriate based on clinical scenario or protocol  Internal Medicine/Family Practice/Primary Care Physician Qualifications: Currently board certified in Internal Medicine or Family Medicine by relevant US Boards Role/Scope: Initial assessment and diagnosis of GI conditions, with a focus on IBS, GERD, liver disease, functional GI disorders, GI screening; as well as managing and providing diagnosis on digestive symptoms, including abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, reflux, gas and bloating, nausea and vomiting and incontinence. Takes the lead (in collaboration with GI when appropriate) on the development of diagnoses and personalized treatment plans for patients Complies with guidelines as outlined within clinical protocols Provides synchronous and asynchronous care, including review of results, ordering and diagnoses of tests, medication prescription, communication with patients, and other care interventions, as appropriate Refers to in person or virtual specialty care (eg, gastroenterologist), PCP, or other clinicians when appropriate based on clinical scenario or protocol  Registered Dietitian Qualifications:   Required Qualifications Minimum of Bachelor's degree Registered dietitian status certified through CDR Proof of required licensure as stated by the RD's home state Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree in Dietetics or Human Nutrition Certified Health Coach: NBC-HWC credentials preferably, Wellcoaches, International Coach Federation, Duke Integrative Medicine, National Society of Health Coaches, American Council on Exercise. Multi-state licensure Role/Scope:   Provides one-on-one HIPAA compliant telephonic, video, and instant message coaching to members seeking improved digestion and relief from chronic digestive conditions. Provides individualized and holistic health coaching based on member’s primary concern, including but not limited to: stress management, mindfulness, healthy sleep, medication adherence, self-advocacy, physical activity, self-monitoring, and assistance with the app, GIThrive. Provides Medical Nutrition Therapy to members based on state(s) licensure and based on the member’s primary concern, including but not limited to: Crohn’s Disease, Ulcerative Colitis, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Ostomy Nutrition, Short Bowel Syndrome, Diverticulitis, Chronic Constipation or Diarrhea, Gastroparesis, Elimination Diets, FODMAP Diet, Food Allergies and Intolerances, SIBO, and Malnutrition. Applies evidence-based strategies to promote symptom relief, condition treatment, and behavior change. Provides education on a variety of topics. Manages dietary supplements and probiotics. Manages symptoms related to gastrointestinal and other comorbid disease conditions. Assists members in setting health goals and supports accountability for goal attainment. Assists members in maintaining engagement with GIThrive, Vivante Health’s learning and engagement technology platform.  Health Coach Qualifications:   Required Qualifications Minimum of Bachelor's degree in Social Work, Psychology, or other Health Enhancement field OR completion of an intensive health coaching certification program and achievement of NBC-HWC credentials Preferred Qualifications Certified Health Coach: NBC-HWC credentials preferably, Wellcoaches, International Coach Federation, Duke Integrative Medicine, National Society of Health Coaches, American Council on Exercise. Scope of Practice:   Acts as the main point of contact for Vivante Health members, coordinating ‘whole person’ care and helping the members navigate through Vivante Health chronic disease management program. Provides one-on-one HIPAA compliant telephonic, video, and instant message coaching to members seeking improved digestion and relief from chronic conditions. Provides individualized and holistic health coaching based on member’s primary concern, including but not limited to: stress management, mindfulness, healthy sleep, medication adherence, self-advocacy, physical activity, self-monitoring, and assistance with the app, GIThrive. Determines need for Medical Nutrition Therapy (MNT) based on MNT escalation plan. Refers members to dietitians when MNT is necessary.  Aids in the administrative burden of caring for a chronic disease and supports the member with developing self-efficacy and self-advocacy.  Applies Vivante Health’s Member Engagement Model and Practice Guidelines to promote symptom relief, digestive condition treatment, and behavior change. Provides education on a variety of topics. Assists members in setting health goals and supports accountability for goal attainment.  Nurse Triage Service  24/7 nurse coverage for acute assessment of symptoms and clinical issues based on standard triage protocols Referral to appropriate care venue (eg, ER) depending on clinical situation  Care Coordinator Serve to coordinate care for medical and other clinical teams, provide medical assistance when needed

column67: Each client has a dedicated implementation manager (IM), client success manager (CSM), and member marketing contact. The IM owns the relationship from implementation kick-off until 30 days post launch. IMs work with the client and their vendors to set up EDI, billing, and GIThrive. The CSM owns the client relationship 30 days post launch but typically engages sooner. The member marketing POC works with the IM, CSM, and client to create custom marketing plans based on Vivante and client best practices.  Total implementation timeline is 60-90 days  GIThrive program implementation has 3 phases: Scope, Build, Launch. Scope: ~2-4 weeks, involves documenting program features, implementation plan, and key milestones Build: ~8 weeks, involves set up of claims, billing, landing page, marketing and reporting Launch: Involves employee outreach campaign start (email, web, phone, print)

column79: Vivante Health is built on a foundation of science and around compassion and personalization. From setup to ongoing care, the primary goal is to understand each individual's unique goals, stressors, challenges, cultural and socioeconomic factors, etc., so we may meet each member where they are and personalize to an n of 1. Our digestive health solution is tailored to each member, along with the ongoing support delivered by care teams. By employing a highly diverse workforce with an internal focus on diversity and inclusion, Vivante Health is in the best position to embrace 'differences' and 'similarities' to lead to outcomes defined by the patient and their care team, no matter race, creed, gender, socioeconomic status, religion, etc.  Our program is built to address Social Determinants of Health (SDOH), as we know that these determinants are often the most critical drivers in improving health outcomes. Our program does not have any out-of-pocket costs for participating members, removing a key barrier to care for many. We develop and present our content at an 8th grade level, facilitating understanding of our materials across all levels of health literacy. In addition, at intake, we ask members about their ability to afford medications, as this identifies a population that is at higher risk of worse outcomes. During the course of a member’s visit with their dietitian and health coach, our team gains a deeper understanding of any food insecurity issues and helps address these issues where relevant. We have also provided food via our partners to members as part of an initiative to support member’s health and re-engage them with our program.

column40: Fairfax Wellness stands out in the realm of wellness solutions by offering a unique and personalized approach to each client. Committed to fostering mental and physical wellbeing, Fairfax Wellness goes beyond conventional methods. Their distinctive approach and comprehensive platform make them a turnkey solution for companies seeking a holistic and customized wellness experience for their employees.  What sets Fairfax Wellness apart is their commitment to tailoring wellness programs to the specific needs and preferences of each client. Recognizing that no two companies are alike, the team at Fairfax Wellness conducts thorough assessments to understand the unique requirements of every client. Whether addressing mental health challenges or promoting physical fitness, their approach is characterized by a personalized touch that ensures optimal results.  From physical fitness sessions to mental wellbeing sessions every single aspect can be customized and personally adjusted to the needs of your company.  Our wellbeing platform is unique as it is completely adjustable from logo and accent colors to content and livestream options.   We pride ourselves in offering a bespoke custom experience for each of our clients.

column55: Fairfax Wellness stands at the forefront of the wellness industry with its unique and custom approach to client care. We support HR teams,

column74: Our communication strategy varies from company to company as no company is the same. Your inbox is a central hub for information, accessible wherever you are. Emails ensure that you have easy access to wellness resources, tips, and event details, promoting a seamless and convenient experience. We can incorporate visually appealing content in emails, such as infographics, videos, and success stories. Receive invitations to wellness events, challenges, and exclusive opportunities directly in your inbox, making it easier for you to join in and take full advantage of the program. column79: The name of our company "Fairfax Wellness" is directly inspired by Los Angeles' famous Fairfax district. The Fairfax district in Los Angeles is known for its cultural and ethnic diversity, making it a vibrant and inclusive community. The name "Fairfax" could be associated with diversity and inclusivity because of the neighborhood's history and demographics. By choosing the name Fairfax, an entity may be attempting to evoke the positive connotations associated with the diversity of the district. It could be a way of symbolizing a commitment to inclusivity, cultural exchange, and a welcoming atmosphere. We pride ourselves in highlighting diversity and creating new incentives and events to move into a more diverse direction.  For current and past clients we have created several events, talks and sessions to highlight cultural, ethnical and sexual diversity.  And our goal is to further do so, as we believe in equality for everyone.

column101: Fairfax Platform/ App: Our tailored Fairfax app, designed exclusively to cater to the unique requirements of your corporate team, serves as a comprehensive solution for consolidating all aspects of employee well-being within a single platform. This resource-rich application not only offers a wide array of live and on-demand wellness classes and engaging challenges but also functions as a gateway to seamlessly access a range of trusted wellness vendors and their services. With this virtual well-being portal, we aim to streamline and enhance your team's health and wellness experience, promoting a holistic approach to employee well-being while simplifying access to valuable resources and activities, all conveniently housed in one user-friendly platform.  Consulting: Our goal is to create a comprehensive wellbeing program that aligns with your company culture and values. We understand that every organization is unique, and thus, we tailor our services to meet your specific needs. Our team of experts will collaborate with you to design a program that supports the physical, mental, and emotional health of your employees.  From fitness challenges to mindfulness workshops, we offer a wide range of activities that cater to different interests and abilities. We believe that investing in the wellbeing of your workforce is critical to boosting productivity, reducing absenteeism, and enhancing overall job satisfaction. All to proactively counteract results of burnout and mental health issues.   Nutrition services: With a licensed nutritionist leading the charge, we embark on a systematic evaluation of your current office snack and meal offerings. This process extends beyond a mere assessment; it serves as the bedrock upon which we build a healthier, more nutritious dietary landscape tailored to your unique company culture and budget constraints.  We empower you to take charge of your employees' health and nutrition through interactive and engaging programs. The same expert nutritionist can lead Lunch & Learn sessions, providing valuable insights and practical advice on healthy eating. Additionally, they offer one-on-one nutritional coaching, providing personalized guidance to employees looking to make sustainable changes in their dietary habits. In doing so, we create an enduring foundation for well-being within your organization, where healthy choices become not just a practice but a way of life.  Off-sites: For company off-sites, we transform the traditional corporate retreat into a holistic well-being experience. From mindfulness sessions to team-building activities that promote health and wellness, we provide a tailored approach that aligns with your organization's goals and values. These off-sites not only serve as a platform for team bonding but also as an opportunity for employees to learn valuable well-being techniques that they can carry forward into their everyday lives.  This includes strategies such as incorporating health-conscious catering options, offering relaxation spaces, and even organizing wellness-focused workshops or activities. Our aim is to create an environment where your team can thrive, fostering a culture of well-being that extends far beyond the meeting room.  Wellness Classes: These sessions each lasting up to 90 minutes, encompass a wide array of subjects and classes designed to cater to the diverse wellness needs of your team. Whether it's unwinding after a high-pressure team meeting or energizing before embarking on an important project, our classes are meticulously crafted to facilitate both relaxation and rejuvenation. For instance, you can opt for a soothing meditation session to de-stress and center your team's focus, or perhaps a stretching class to alleviate tension and improve overall well-being. Similarly, our exercise classes are structured to enhance physical fitness and vitality, ensuring that your team is not just productive but also actively engaged in a healthier, more balanced lifestyle. At the heart of these offerings is our unwavering commitment to your team's well-being, offering them the knowledge, skills, and tools to thrive both in and out of the workplace.  Speaking engagements: We believe that by bringing together people from diverse backgrounds, we can create a community that is inclusive and supportive. Our expert panels and fireside chats are designed to be engaging and informative, covering a wide range of topics such as mental health, physical fitness, nutrition, and mindfulness.  In addition to featuring popular talent, we also believe in empowering individuals within your own company to become strong public speakers and moderators. That's why we have volunteer moderators from your company teams work alongside us to develop these skills. This not only benefits the individuals involved, but also contributes to a more dynamic and engaging event. We believe that everyone has something valuable to contribute to the conversation around wellbeing, and we are committed to creating opportunities for all voices to be heard.  Wellness fairs: Wellness fairs are a great way for individuals to learn more about their health and wellbeing. By partnering with our trusted instructors and vendors, we are able to provide them with the resources and knowledge they need to make informed decisions about their health.  At these events, attendees can expect to find a variety of health-focused activities and resources, such as fitness classes, healthy cooking demonstrations, and informative seminars. Our goal is to empower individuals to take control of their wellbeing and make positive changes in their lives.  Gym management: Providing employees with access to a gym or wellness center within the office space can have a significant positive impact on their physical and mental health. However, managing the center and ensuring that the equipment is well-maintained and up-to-date can be a challenging task. That's where we can help - we specialize in managing the center experience and taking care of all the details, so you can focus on your core business.  Investing in a gym or wellness center within your office space is a wise decision that can have long-lasting benefits for your employees and your business. With our help, you can ensure that the center is managed efficiently and effectively, while providing your employees with the tools they need to lead healthier and happier lives.

column40: "GRAIL's unique differentiators include:  GRAIL's Galleri test is the only multi-cancer early detection simple blood draw test widely commercially available to patients today. Galleri has the ability to detect a signal shared by over 50 cancers, 45+ of which do not have recommended screening tests currently available. It also detects the cancer signal of origin with 89% accuracy, all with a low (0.5%) false positive rate.   The Galleri test uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to detect a cancer signal in the blood and predict the tissue or organ from which the signal originated. GRAIL is the only solution provider currently offering a comprehensive program to employers for the early detection of multiple cancers with a single blood draw. With complex machine learning algorithms, GRAIL's technology platform is developed based on a rigorous scientific approach to cancer biology and years of research. Our population-scale clinical study program is believed to be the largest of its kind, with over 300,000 participants and counting. To support and validate our technology, we are partnering with leading community and academic medical centers around the world. For details about our clinical studies, publications, independent medical education, externally sponsored research, publications, and more visit the link below: https://grail.com/clinical-expertise/ The Galleri test has been commercially available since 2021, with over 140,000 commercial tests completed and nearly 9,000 ordering providers. Galleri has been adopted by more than 80 self-insured employers across various industries, including some of the most prominent organizations in the Fortune 50. Galleri has also been adopted by over 20 prominent health systems and payers, such as Point32 Health, HCA, Providence, Intermountain Healthcare, Mercy Health, Henry Ford Health System, and Ochsner Health. "
