column101: "GRAIL currently offers two commercial products: - Galleri is a multi-cancer early detection test that detects over 50 types of cancer through a routine blood draw, as a screening test for adults with an elevated risk for cancer, such as those aged 50 and older. It is currently commercially available as a laboratory developed test (LDT) in the United States. - GRAIL post-diagnosis cancer research use only solution, providing BioPharma companies the opportunity to test novel, high-potential clinical research applications with access to our blood-only liquid biopsy assay for estimating tumor burden.  GRAIL plans to focus product development in the following areas over the next several years: - Developing a regulated version of the Galleri test for FDA approval - A diagnostic aid for cancer test (DAC). DAC is designed to accelerate diagnostic resolution for patients for whom there is a clinical suspicion of cancer, and is currently in late-stage development. - A minimal residual disease (MRD) test, designed to enable blood-based detection with or without tissue, and without the need for a personalized assay, as well as other post-diagnostic applications.  GRAIL's unique differentiators include: - GRAIL's Galleri test is the only multi-cancer early detection blood test widely commercially available to patients today. - Galleri has the ability to detect over 50 cancers, including many cancers that do not have routine screening tests available. It also detects the cancer signal of origin to inform a diagnostic evaluation, all with a low (0.5%) false positive rate. - GRAIL is the only solution provider offering a comprehensive program to employers for the early detection of multiple cancers. - GRAIL has undergone the largest clinical study program in genomics or oncology as far as we are aware, demonstrating strong performance and ensuring the technology is ready for population-level deployments. - With complex machine learning algorithms, GRAIL's technology platform is developed based on a rigorous scientific approach to cancer biology and years of research."

column40: Many employers are recognizing the need to better serve women 40+ (a population that represent 45% of the female workforce). This is especially important in retaining top leadership & talent, and preventing the 'brain drain' & 'silent quitting' that happens when qualified women leave the workforce due to menopause.   Evernow is a virtual concierge care platform to support women in perimenopause, menopause & beyond. We provide unlimited access to dedicated menopause-certified providers, prescribe insurance-covered & evidence-based therapies, and have a digital platform (and mobile app) where women can get ongoing care anytime, anywhere. Understanding that menopause is often a 10-20 year journey, we have developed a subscription-based care model (with plans starting as low as $29/month). This allows us to provide dedicated and high quality, longitudinal care to women navigating an evolving suite of menopause symptoms -- providing highly individualized care and improving long-term outcomes.  In our space, you will see two main competitors -- telehealth companies that offer virtual visits for menopause, and fertility benefits companies that have developed shallow point-solutions as an extension of their care platforms. Neither is well positioned to effectively serve the complexity of a woman's transition through menopause.   Evernow Differentiators  1. Medical care from menopause specialists: Nearly 80% of PCPs / OBGYNs have expressed that their medical education was insufficient in preparing them to care for women in (peri)menopause, with <6 hours of menopause training during 4 years of residency. The symptoms are complex and required highly specialized care. All of Evernow's providers are licensed in the U.S. and have pursued additional certifications through The Menopause Society (formerly NAMs).  2. Longitudinal care model: Many women begin experiencing menopause symptoms -- (ie. brain fog, anxiety, weight gain, sleeplessness) as early as their 40's -- far before they hit 'menopause'. For some, the transition to menopause can last 5-10 years, which means navigating difficult symptoms over a long period of time. Telehealth companies and single-providers are set up to have a video visit and write a script. By pairing women with a dedicated menopause specialist, we are set up to care for women across their menopause journey in a high-touch and personalized way  3. Technology-driven care platform: We recognize that to best serve your employees and to be able to grow with you, we need to be highly scalable and accessible. Unlike other telehealth models -- that would have trouble rapidly scaling up to meet capacity -- we leverage an asynchronous care model for greater scalability, better accessibility & faster response to member needs. This, alongside our proprietary EHR system and mobile-app, puts us in a unique position to leverage technology for better care. Our EHR system helps every provider better serve their patients. And our mobile-app, where members can manage their experience (message their provider, track their symptoms, update their prescription, access exclusive content & more) allows us to meet your employees where they are and drive rapid response and accessibility when they need it most.  4. Data-driven personalization: We know that providing high-touch, personalized care is important to consumers; and can help drive better outcomes in the long term. Unlike some competitors, we are making deep investments in data and research, to be able to personalize care and optimize outcomes for every individual on our platform. To date, we have amassed the largest proprietary data set on (peri)menopause symptoms & resolution with treatment. Our research within this data, has already identified opportunities to tailor protcols around race, ethnicity and BMI that we are putting into practice, and leveraging to steer a new standard of care.   5. Affordability, convenience & insurance: Many telehealth companies that have partnered with insurance companies charge upwards of $200 per visit for those that are un-or-underinsured. On the contrary, the price of our monthly memberships (between $29 - $49/mo depending on your plan duration) are designed to be affordable, whether or not someone has insurance (our membership fees are also FSA & HSA eligible). Likewise, our medications are prescribed through your local pharmacy, so that you can conveniently apply commercial insurance & other discounts, and pick them up at your convenience.

column55: At Evernow, we define customer service as a commitment to understanding and addressing the unique needs of each individual woman we serve. Our approach is rooted in empathy, responsiveness, and expertise. We recognize that menopause is a personal and often complex journey, so we ensure our entire team is not only medically proficient, but also attentive and compassionate.   We believe in providing accessible, personalized care. Leveraging the latest technology within our platform allows Evernow to meet women exactly where they are in life's journey- physcially, mentally, emotionally, and on her terms of time and availability. This means women can reach us conveniently through our telehealth platform via our app or website, ensuring timely and effective support when she needs it. We actively listen to each woman tailoring our treatments, advice, and service to her specific symptoms, lifestyle, and needs.   At Evernow our customer service extends to continuous education and support. Perimenopause, menopause, and post menopause are often times with many questions, concerns, and changes; thus, we prioritize offering clear, evidence-based information and guidance as well as support from our community of women sharing many of the same menopause symptoms and journey. We strive to create a safe, understanding, and empathetic environment where women feel heard, cared for, and empowered throughout their health journey and discovery. Our customer service is the very basis of who we are.

We take pride in the fact that all of our practitioners are certified by The Menopause Society, a leading organization dedicated to enhancing the health and quality of life of women during midlife and beyond, through an understanding of menopause. This Menopause Society certification ensures that our providers are equipped with the latest knowledge and evidence-based practices in menopausal health, as we strive to uphold the highest standard of care for our patients.

column79: One of the ways we most support a diverse workforce is making sure that women don't transition out of the workforce due to the challenges of menopause. Our research shows that menopause is driving women out of the workforce, with more than 85% reporting an impact on productivity, and over 60% tempering career ambitions due to menopause — passing on promotion, quitting or retiring earlier than planned. When women pursue effective treatment, however, this trend reverses -- 70% of women were effectively able to manage symptoms, reporting improved workplace outcomes, productivity and well-being.

column119: For health and wellness program compliance: Legal Compliance: •	We prioritize compliance with key laws like the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) during the setup. This ensures the program is legally sound and aligns with privacy and non-discrimination standards. •	The program is tailored to adhere to legal standards, promoting inclusivity and avoiding discriminatory practices. Privacy and Confidentiality: •	The program complies with HIPAA regulations, ensuring participant health information is handled securely and confidentially. •	Participants receive a Notice of Privacy Practices outlining how their health information is used and protected. Accessibility and Inclusivity: •	The program is structured to accommodate individuals with disabilities, ensuring accessibility to all activities and services. Communication and Training: •	We conduct training sessions to ensure HR and management teams are well-versed in compliance best practices. Ongoing Compliance Monitoring: •	Regular audits are conducted to ensure continuous compliance with laws. We also keep clients informed about any regulatory changes that may impact the wellness program. This approach ensures that the health and wellness program not only meets the employer's goals for employee well-being but also operates within legal frameworks, providing peace of mind and legal security. For any specific concerns or additional details, feel free to reach out to our team.

column40: The company was founded about a decade ago. We received our first FDA clearance for OTC use in 2014. Since then, we started selling our devices direct to consumers through e-commerce sites like amazon and retail stores across the US. We introduced subscription services (review of ECGs by cardiologists, advanced AI, and more), virtual cardiologist visits to consumers and subscription services for employers and payors to offer to their employees/members between 2020 - 2022.  KardiaCare Plus, consumer subscription service to manage both hypertension and arrythmias was introduced in 2022.  In 2019 we launched the world's only OTC 6L personal ECG device, followed by a single lead device in a credit card form factor in 2022. Our customers love and trust our products which has an NPS score of 66 and amazon rating of over 4.6 stars with 18K+ reviews. We have over 2.6 million lifetime users, 195K+ subscribers, 710K+ quarterly active users and products are cleared in 42 countries. With over 185 peer reviewed articles, our solutions are the most clinically validated personal ECG solution and referred by physicians.  Cardiovascular disease has the highest human and economic cost in the US. It's estimated to be around $352B, exceeding the cost of Diabetes, Alzheimer's and other chronic diseases. 1 in 2 adults in the US have hypertension (HT) and about 6M are diagnosed with Atrial fibrillation (Afib). The cost of HT and Afib together is about $175B. 80% of cardiovascular disease is preventable. This is where AliveCor's products and solutions come in. Our solutions help address these cost issues and improve outcomes by providing the most trusted and clinical solutions to manage and monitor cardiovascular conditions for our customers. Our solution is differentiated by the depth of clinical services, AI algorithms and one of its kind user friendly clinical devices that none of our competitors have. Apart from our large direct to consumer channel, we have fortune 500 companies like GE Healthcare, Omron Healthcare, HP, CVS and others who are our customers and partners. We are well positioned to service individual consumers to large companies and everything in between.

column55: At AliveCor, our commitment to our customers extends far beyond just offering state-of-the-art products. Here's how we define and approach customer service: Putting Customers First: As a health technology company, the well-being of our users is always at the forefront. This drives our entire customer service philosophy. Open and Honest Communication: We believe in maintaining transparency with our customers. Whether it’s addressing concerns, providing information, or acknowledging feedback, we strive for clarity and honesty in all our interactions. Continuous Learning and Improvement: Our approach to customer service is not static. We actively seek feedback and use it as a tool for continuous improvement. By understanding the changing needs and concerns of our users, we adapt and evolve our products and support services accordingly. Swift Response Times: We recognize the urgency and importance of the queries we receive, given the nature of our products. As a result, our support team is trained and equipped to respond promptly and effectively. Educating Our Customers: We're not just here to solve issues; we're here to empower our users. Building Trust Through Quality: Quality assurance isn't just a product concern for us – it's a service concern too. We train our teams rigorously and maintain high service standards, ensuring that every interaction adds value and reinforces trust. In summary, AliveCor defines customer service as an unwavering commitment to the well-being, trust, and satisfaction of our users. Like Sequoia, we also pride ourselves on our ability to come through for our clients, no matter what, by delivering service that's as dependable and innovative as our products.

column40: FOLX Health is an LGBTQIA+ health care provider offering a variety of specialized services including virtual primary care, gender-affirming care,  sexual-health services, and mental health care.  FOLX ensures your employees have access to clinicians they trust, a strong connection to the broader LGBTQ+ community, a myriad of support resources and an organization armed with the support to be truly inclusive. There is a fundamental lack of healthcare options for this underserved community and we have yet to see any competitors that are truly matching what we do.  We specialize in only LGBTQ+ care, while others may have it as a small percentage of their offering.  Our services include: Virtual LGBTQ+  clinical network solving the provider access issues that plague employers and those in the community Gender affirming care for transgender and non-binary employees VIrtual care for the entire LGBTQ+ population and support for parents of LGBTQ+ youth In-person, in-network referrals to affirming care providers and specialists Access to the FOLX Community Platform providing a safe space for interaction, education, and community for LGBTQ+ employees and the co-workers and family members that support them Employee Resource Group (ERG) support with education, speakers, and content co-creation Integration into existing benefits ecosystem including medical plans, point solutions, PBMs, and more
column43: PEPM ranging from $0.35 - 1.25 PEPM depending on size of group Flat rate fee for groups under 1000 employees is between $5000 - $15,000 per year Case rate available for some jumbo groups

column55: FOLX Health is designed to help patients overcome the challenges of being part of one of the most underserved communities.  As an organization built by and for this community, we understand the issues that many of our members come to us with.  We have built a model of care, safety and comfort for members that come to us and offer a deep level of care navigation to these members.  Most of our front line team is built of members of the community which allows us to share in the lived experience of our members, this provides a great level of understanding and comfort to our members that we treat.
column56: Our team has a variety of backgrounds including Internal Medicine, Family Medicine, OBGYN, hematology/oncology, pediatrics, public and population health. Licensure and credentials include: MD’s, NP’s, PMHNP’s, PA’s, RN’s, MA’s. Many of our clinicians have spent their entire careers providing healthcare to the LGBTQAI+ community, and over 50% of them have published health research on this community, and are regular advisors and contributors/presenters at LGBTQIA+ health conferences.  All of our clinicians are trained on using and referencing our evidence-based protocols during onboarding, and our EMR templates provide reminders to guide clinicians through care plans.  In addition, we have a robust internal training program to provide evidence based updates to our clinical practice bi-weekly. Prior to launching a new service, we require all clinicians to be trained and assessed on their clinical competencies–for instance, with our recent launch of primary care services, we provided weekly trainings over the course of 4 months to cover all topics necessary to providing primary care through telehealth.   Over 81% of our clinical team are part of the LGBTQIA+ community

column40: Origin is the only financial wellness employee benefit on the market to offer: 1. Integrated tax filing 2. No-fee investment accounts 3. AI-powered financial chat.   4. Will/trust/estate planning is on our H1 2024 product roadmap.    We maintain a higher standard of care which includes not only coaching but direct financial advice.  This requires that Origin is registered as an investment advisor at the state and federal level which eliminates limitations on the direction and assistance we can deliver to employees.  We do not gate access to our network of licensed financial professionals or encourage a 'chat first' approach.  Employees can immediately and directly book time with a licensed financial professional of their choice.   Origin has the largest independent network of licensed financial professionals across the globe. We operate in 52+ countries and allow employees to meet 1-on-1, virtually, with their own dedicated financial professional in their specific jurisdiction.   Our planners speak the local language, are familiar with the local financial, tax and benefits systems, and have been thoroughly vetted and trained by our in-house team of Certified Financial Planners. Because of the network of licensed financial professionals we've built, we are able to put the human at the forefront of our offering and allow employees to book time directly on their financial professional's calendar, to work with the same dedicated financial professional over time, and provide options for employees to request to work with a financial planner with whom they can relate.   A critical differentiator for Origin is the fact that we incorporate employee benefits, retirement plan details, and other relevant information into the licensed financial professional-facing application. By integrating this information into the workflow of the Planner, we ensure that they highlight relevant benefits provided by the employer and write them into the customized financial plans that are created for each employee. Origin has raised over $70 million in venture capital funding from investors such as General Catalyst, Founders Fund and Felicis.  We have invested in building the world's largest network of financial planning professionals, as well as a team of 70+ product and engineering team members (alumni from Uber, Goldman Sachs, Citi, Spotify and Deloitte to name a few) to ensure that we are providing employees with a best-in-class experience.  Origin's philosophy surrounding diversity, equity and inclusion is to provide every individual with financial tools and resources regardless of race, gender, background, financial literacy or net worth.  We take a human-first approach by connecting every employee 1:1 with a Certified Financial Planner through a diverse network that is 22% more diverse than the US Certified Financial Planner community and represents a higher concentration of female, BIPOC, LGBTQ+ and bi-lingual financial planners.  Our network is also diverse by way of specialty areas such as divorce, single parents, military members and faith-based planning to name a few.   Origin's strong commitment to diversity and inclusion is reflected by Origin's Diversity Program whose mission is bridging the financial literacy gap by providing diverse financial planners and financial education to underserved communities including scholarships for aspiring CFPs.  Origin has realized an average of 31% engagement across our book of business.  Origin has developed an ongoing, multi-channeled approach for employee engagement which includes various modes and frequencies of communication.  All customers are assigned a dedicated Customer Experience Team with the distinct focus of delivering an exceptional customer experience that drives engagement.  We begin by providing a custom launch campaign which includes launch flyers in multiple languages, a benefit guide that contains FAQ's and drip campaigns, welcome invitations sent to employees on activation day, launch webinars and benefit announcement language to be included on the customers' intranet.  Ongoing engagement tactics include monthly emails to all eligible employees with rewards and topical financial news, Teams integration for Origin education application, joint press releases and referral programs.
column42: We serve employers of all shapes and sizes. The minimum pricing for Origin is set for employers with 150 benefits eligible employees. This would be $7,290 annually (4.05 PEPM) for Sequoia clients.
column43: Our standard pricing model is a PEPM fee. The PEPM is reflective of the number of benefits eligible employees at our employer client. There is a sliding scale for larger groups to receive a lower PEPM. When an employer elects the Origin tier which includes (PFM, Tax Filing, Trust & Will, Brokerage, AI Chat) it comes with a utilization based model that is typically employee paid. We offer flexibility to accommodate the employers budget.   The PEPM is also differentiated based on US vs International employees as there are nuances to the Origin offering based on those populations. The PEPM is slightly higher for international employees as there is a premium for Origin building the largest planner network on the globe with local planners in over 50 countries.   For jumbo groups of 10,000+ employees we have custom pricing and are open to discussions around potential for a utilization based model but that is determined on a case by case basis.
column54: Origin is a fully remote company and does not provide call center support. Employees can access our dedicated support team through the Origin website via Live Chat or Email. Support hours of operation are M-F 9am - 8pm EST for both Live Chat and Email support.   Our primary goal is to provide prompt and effective solutions to your inquiries. With a committed service level agreement (SLA) response time of just 60 minutes, we are dedicated to swiftly addressing all of your concerns.  In the event that a specific issue demands escalated attention, our specialized technical team is ready and waiting to engage in thorough investigations and provide the necessary assistance
column55: Origin is aligned with Sequoia in our ability to provide world class customer service for our employer clients and their most valuable asset, their employees. Origin has a comprehensive system in place to track and measure our service delivery, ensuring that we meet and exceed our clients' expectations. Our approach involves using various key metrics to assess performance and accuracy. Here's an overview of our process:  1. Key Metrics:    - Service Level Agreements (SLAs): We establish SLAs with our clients to define response times, resolution times, and other service-related commitments. These SLAs serve as critical benchmarks for tracking performance.    - Customer Satisfaction (CSAT): We regularly collect feedback from our clients through surveys to measure their satisfaction with our services. This helps us understand their experiences and make improvements.    - Net Promoter Score (NPS): NPS surveys are used to gauge client loyalty and overall satisfaction. We track NPS scores over time to identify trends and areas for enhancement.    - Incident Resolution Time: We monitor the time it takes to resolve specific issues or incidents reported by our clients. This metric ensures that we address concerns promptly.    - Accuracy of Deliverables: We assess the accuracy of our deliverables through various means, such as comparing data output to client expectations and conducting quality control checks.  2. Data Gathering:    - Ticketing System: We use a robust ticketing system to track and manage client requests, incidents, and inquiries. This system collects data on response and resolution times automatically.    - Client Surveys: We regularly distribute client surveys, including CSAT and NPS surveys, to gather feedback directly from our clients.    - Quality Control Checks: Our internal quality control processes involve manual reviews and validations of deliverables to ensure accuracy.  3. Calculation of Metrics:    - SLA Metrics: SLA metrics, including response times and resolution times, are calculated based on the timestamps recorded in our ticketing system. We compute these metrics using predefined formulas.    - CSAT and NPS Scores: CSAT and NPS scores are calculated based on the responses received from client surveys. CSAT is typically measured on a scale of 1-5 or 1-7, while NPS is based on a 0-10 scale.    - Incident Resolution Time: This metric is calculated by measuring the time elapsed from the initial reporting of an incident to its successful resolution.  Our commitment to data-driven decision-making allows us to continually assess and improve our service delivery. We regularly analyze these metrics, identify trends, and collaborate with our clients to implement process enhancements and ensure the highest level of service quality and accuracy.  Additionally, members can send a message directly on the Origin platform via live chat. For customers seeking immediate assistance through our Live Chat feature, we guarantee a response within 1 minute during our regular business hours. In case the Live Chat request is made outside of our regular business hours, or while an agent is on break, we will respond within 1 minute of the start of the next business day. Members can also email hereforyou@useorigin.com if they have questions. Our team is dedicated to responding to customer emails promptly. We commit to providing a resolution or acknowledgment within 60 minutes of receiving the email during our regular business hours. If an email is received outside of our regular business hours, the response will be provided within 60 minutes of the start of the next business day.
column56: Origin's network of licensed financial professionals includes 350+ globally. All of our US and international financial professionals, where applicable, hold the Certified Financial Planner designation which is maintained by the Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards. This designation is regarded as the highest level of certification for members of the personal financial planning community. In countries where the CFP credential is not available, we have made every effort to employ financial professionals that have an equivalent financial certification or advanced degree in a financial discipline. Members of our network of financial professionals must adhere to our code of conduct and complete a multi-step process that includes proprietary training and ongoing supervision.   A key differentiator for Origin is that we can create a network of financial planners in new countries within 90 days.  Origin sources financial professional candidates ourselves via referrals from our current network and proactive outreach.  Should these individuals meet our stringent vetting requirements, we invite them to our proprietary training program with a target go-live date within 90 days.    A Brief overview of our process is as follows: 1. Direct and referral-based licensed financial professional sourcing 2. Interview Process 3. Credential Verification 4. Platform Onboarding 5. Training & Test Flight 6. Ongoing Review  Additionally, Origin maintains a waitlist of licensed financial professionals in conjunction with ongoing capacity modeling to indicate when and where we need to scale presence to meet the demand of our customers and maintain a 48 hour time to appointment service level agreement.
column67: Origin establishes an extensive, customized implementation guide for each customer which defines objectives, responsibilities, timelines and due dates and a dedicated Customer Success Manager, Director of Customer Success, Technical/Implementation Engineer and Lead Financial Planner to facilitate delivery. column73: Origin requires a client to notify us 30 days before the annual renewal for termination. We do not have a termination for convenience clause in our MSA's.
column74: Origin has developed a customized and multi-pronged onboarding program with our employer partners to ensure high utilization of the Origin offering. This includes: -Customized launch kit with communications from Origin and Employers about our financial wellness offering -Benefit guide that contains key FAQs, drip campaigns -Welcome invitations that are sent to employees on activation day to create accounts -Launch Webinar(s) that provide an overview of the Origin Platform  The entire Origin experience is customized for each client. This process starts with onboarding, where Origin collects key benefits, retirement, and compensation data for each company.   This information is incorporated into each "instance" of the Origin platform for each customer so that every employee can understand their total compensation, unique benefits and how those should be woven into their financial plan. Further, benefits, retirement and compensation information are shared with and incorporated into the workflow of our planners so that they can answer questions and promote all of the outstanding existing benefits available to our clients' employees.   The Origin provides financial support for every stage of life and a wide range of financial profiles. Origin's platform and educational resources have solutions for employees of all different levels of income and for those in every part of their financial journey. Additionally, Origin's Planners are 100% Certified Financial Planners (CFP), the highest-level certification in the Planning industry. When combined with our platform, it creates an employee-centric experience that offers value to all employees. Origin CFPs frequently comment on the benefit and joy of working with Origin members; rather than focusing solely on high-net-worth individuals, they have the opportunity to advise people across all walks of life, including many junior employees who benefit most from financial planning early in their careers.

Our network is also diverse by way of specialty areas such as divorce, single parents, military members and faith-based planning to name a few. column101: Origin's philosophy is that every employee should have access to high-quality financial guidance, regardless of income, title, or location. Origin has raised over $70 million in venture capital funding to make this happen. We've built the world's largest network of financial planning professionals, along with a cutting-edge platform for cash flow management, equity guidance, total rewards, tax services, and holistic money management. Our platform delivers a complete financial wellness experience to every employee, regardless of background or income. The Origin platform includes:  - 1:1 meetings with an Origin Certified Financial Planner (or local equivalent)  - Personalized financial roadmap to achieve short-term and retirement goals  - Equity strategy, tax guidance, and benefits selection advising  - Total Rewards Dashboard incorporating employee compensation and employee benefit offering  - Tax Guidance and Preparation Services  - Personal money management tech platform - Zero-fee personal investment accounts  - AI-powered Financial Planning  - Tax & Will preparation - Monthly webinars and workshops that are recorded and provided back as evergreen content  - Access to Origin’s library of financial wellness articles and guides  - End-to-end white glove implementation services with minimal time commitment from broker and client
column104: Origin is a financial wellness employee benefit that does not provide traditional retirement, pension or welfare benefits, and as such, is not subject to ERISA.  Additionally, (i) participation in Origin is voluntary and there are no adverse consequences for not participating, and (ii) Origin does not involve the purchase of employment-based financial products (such as insurance).
column107: As a private-sector employer, we are subject to COBRA.  However, the Origin financial wellness benefit is not subject to COBRA as COBRA primarily addresses the continuation of group health insurance coverage. The Origin product focuses on providing education, resources, and tools to help employees manage their financial well-being, and does not involve the continuation of health insurance coverage. As such, it falls outside the scope of COBRA requirements.
column118: The tax treatment of the Origin product is at the discretion of the client, and we provide no opinion on a client's particular tax circumstance.  The Origin product, which focus on improving employees' financial health and providing resources for better financial management, is not explicitly listed as fringe benefits in the IRC. Instead, these programs are typically considered part of an employer's broader compensation and benefits package.
column119: Origin is a registered investment adviser registered with the SEC.  As such, we have a regulatory obligation to share certain disclosure materials, including our Form ADV, and disclaimers.  We provide all such required materials and disclaimers to the client directly.
column124: We direct clients to our legal and regulatory team and make them available to answer any questions or speak to any concerns they may have.
column127: The tax treatment of the Origin product is up to the client and their broker consultant, and we do not consult on the way a particular client should treat the Origin product for tax purposes.

column40: eHealthScreenings provides high level biometric health screening service delivery and reliability to clients and partners on a national scale.  Through a strict set of core values, protocols, procedures, and advanced technology, we provide an impeccable screening experience for clients, partners and participants.  Our overarching value proposition lives through our key industry differentiators including: SATISFACTION High service reliability and unparalleled participant experience coupled with an established hallmark reputation of exceeding client expectations. NATIONAL COVERAGE Serving all 50 states with our network of 3,000+ certified in-house certified Wellness Technicians, ~2,200 offsite lab clinics and a licensed Physician in each state. SUPPORT TEAM All projects are assigned a designated project management team who will tailor events towards your population needs and manage implementation from start to finish. PARTNER INTEGRATION Flexible system architecture with customization capabilities including: SSO build, branding, data export, white labeling, custom reporting, custom programming and API connections. SCREENING OPTIONS We offer numerous modalities for participants to complete a screening from onsite workplace, offsite lab, direct to Physician, at home concierge screenings, and home test kits including both finger stick and venipuncture methodologies. VALUE eHealthScreenings prides itself on the ability to offer the most robust screening program at competitive pricing that delivers benefits of economies to scale. TECHNOLOGY Advanced technology, system functionality and features including an award-winning tablet technology (e.b.i.t), online Participant results portal and Client facing portal. SECURITY The highest privacy standards: continuous security training, annual HIPPA staff certifications, daily QC process, system audits and regular pen testing.

column40: Our company's value proposition is centered around innovation, adaptability, and a team that is driven by a relentless pursuit of providing exceptional service to our clients and families. Our curiosity fuels our excitement when challenged with the question, "Is there a better way?" As a newer company, we are uniquely positioned with agility to meet the evolving needs of both families and employers. We are not anchored by legacy mindsets, policies, or financial modeling. We believe that the status quo is no longer sufficient for the demands on working parents. Instead, we approach every situation with a growth mindset, always seeking opportunities for improvement and advancement. Transparency is integral to our approach, ensuring clear and open communication with our clients.  We distinguish ourselves from others by offering:  • Flexibility for families to access a combination of programs to meet their needs (In Home + On Campus, Back Up, Virtual Tutoring, etc) • Flexibility for employers, with no long term commitments, no minimums and no PEPM or "use it or lose it" pricing model. • Exceptional quality of programs, with all teachers being vetted, full time employees with college degrees, salaries, benefits and equity; • Coverage for employers across age groups (0-18), modalities of care (full time, back up, in home, virtual, financial) and geographies (globally) on a single platform across which they can open access to all services equitably.  Most importantly, we take immense pride in our exceptional employees, who we fondly refer to as "Vivvians. They are at the heart of our success and embody our value proposition. With Vivvians as our driving force, we are equipped to deliver outstanding services and exceed expectations for clients. Their dedication, forward-thinking mindset, problem-solving abilities, and commitment to continuous learning make our company a dynamic and transformative force in the industry that distinguishes from others.
column42: Vivvi’s global platform of services supports employers and families across all life and career stages, with unrivaled flexibility, that DOES NOT include:  - multi-year commitments  - minimum investments - “use it or lose it” pricing - overage fees or subscription fees
column43: Vivvi's platform leverages a utilization based pricing model that allows employers to provide employees with access to the services that best match their evolving needs. We believe a utilization based pricing model aligns best with the goal of Employers, to provide cost effective caregiving support to employees without sacrificng quality of coverage or quality of experience. Vivvi provides all three by operating on a credit system for employees to access care and learning for their families.  The Vivvi Credit System affords employers maximum flexibility to determine subsidy amounts across all offerings. Credits are applied according to a predetermined subsidy schedule (i.e. - 1 day of center based back up care is 1 credit, 1 day of in home back up care is 2 credits); Credits never expire, and there are no minimum investments; Credits as a pool belong to the employer, and we do not have a per employee per month structure unless specifically requested by the employer. Ultimately, the cost to the Employer is driven by utilization, copays and solutions offered. On Site programs are operated on a cost-plus basis.
column54: To deliver the highest level of quality, we provide our families access via phone, text message email and web portal to the dedicated Concierge Team whose job it is to make sure that your families receive the right type of care when they need it most. With coast to coast coverage, families will receive a response from a live Concierge Team member between the hours of 6 AM EST - 12 AM (Midnight) EST, including weekends, who will start working right away to place their request with the appropriate caregiver. Overnight requests will be answered immediately the following morning.   Our goal is to be a reliable partner for families and organizations, offering child care solutions and support that align with today's diverse work schedules and lifestyle needs.
column55: One of the biggest values of the Concierge Team is the human touch and white glove approach that our team demonstrates for all families. Our Concierge Team works as a true partner for families to help them identify care options in their area like nearby centers as well as work to secure an in home caregiver for a family. Rather than a marketplace where a family must independently spend significant time searching and interviewing caregivers to then wait for a confirmation, our Concierge team handles all of the heavy lifting and hard work behind the scenes to deliver a simple, seamless experience for the user. And lastly, in areas where parents may live in a childcare desert (like an exceptionally rural or remote area), Care Cash ensures that all parents are supported and parents are able to tap into their trusted local village to support their care needs.
column56: Vivvi's Client Success Team leads the implementation and launch for all caregiving benefit programs. The team has over 15 years on average of professional experience, in child care, early education and hospitality, all having worked with institutional clients across all industries. The retention rate of our Client Success Team is 100%.  For employees and partners providing care - Vivvi is dedicated to the ongoing monitoring of center/provider performance, and maintaining a network with the highest quality child care centers and in-home providers available.  Vivvi has stringent recruiting and credentialing for all providers prior to joining the Vivvi back up care network. We require that all providers have the following: an employment screening process that is consistent with state licensing requirements, including criminal background, education/credential, and reference checks; health & safety protocols; and CPR/first aid training. Vivvi’s  provider compliance team performs continuous monitoring to ensure the highest level of constant quality is delivered. Updated criminal background check every 12 months for all Provider Staff.
column65: Vivvi's parent satisfaction results are amongst the highest in the industry. We are proud to share our all time average NPS of 91 with a 6-month NPS of 98.
column67: Implementation for most programs can be expedited within 30 business days from contract signature, depending on the program components and any customized needs defined by the Employer. The program will be managed holistically by our Client Success team. The Dedicated Client Success Lead will provide high-touch, best in class service to ensure a smooth transition from program development to launch and beyond. In addition, the client will be supported by our Marketing team to identify communication channels, create marketing collateral and employee communications to maximize engagement and utilization of your new Vivvi program.   The Employer will have access to our Client Success team throughout the launch process. Together with the Employer, Vivvi will structure a program launch schedule to ensure a timely and organized program implementation. Pre-launch meetings will include our Client Services, Operations, Client Success, and Marketing team members to determine key milestones and target organizational needs and goals to achieve. Vivvi’s launch plan will be formally presented to the client team, as well as additional strategies to support long-term engagement and utilization in our customized, co-branded Employer Toolkit. We strive to to provide white glove service that requires minimal time to the Employer's team.
column73: Termination notice periods vary by program and employer.
column74: As part of the standard program launch materials, employers are provided a curated toolkit with an array of indispensable tools and resources tailored to activate the Vivvi benefit. The primary aim of this toolkit is to facilitate an experience that aligns with our overarching objective, which is to meet our clients precisely where they require our assistance.   Together, we will embark on a comprehensive onboarding session during which we will delve into eight high-level strategies that can be strategically deployed across your organization at various points throughout the year. These opportune moments may include open enrollment periods, new hire orientations, peak business seasons when parental support is paramount, or even during holiday periods when conventional childcare solutions may be less accessible. In tandem with this, we will collaborate to craft and execute a meticulously planned 12-month communications strategy, strategically delivering content at key points in a user's journey.
column79: A priority initiative in Vivvi's DEI roadmap is training and education.  We are committed to providing ongoing training and education to staff on topics such as unconscious bias, cultural competence, and inclusive practices. This includes workshops, webinars, and other professional development opportunities.
column82: At a minimum, we only require the eligible employee’s first name, last name and email address, though most employers opt to provide all of the information noted here:                                                                                        • First name                                                                                         • Last name                                                                                         • A unique, non-recycled ID such as an employee ID (this will be asked only at the time of registration)                                                                                         • Work email                                                                                         • Hire date                                                                                         • Full-time or part-time status                                                                                         • Work zip code                                                                                         • Home zip code                                                                                         • Additional reporting fields
column92: Vivvi is committed to ongoing analysis and reporting of leading and lagging data to our employers in three key areas: Engagement, Enrollment & Utilization. We examine the following leading data as an indicator of how well caregivers are receiving the benefit, and to make recommendations that iterate on our initial strategic plan.These reports will be provided on a monthly and quarterly basis, along with a year-end review. There is no charge for requesting ad-hoc reports.  Leading Data: 1. Engagement from the total (eligible employee population?) addressable market  2. Enrollment & Utilization among the total addressable market 3. CSAT scores at different points during the enrollment process and ongoing experience 4. NPS 5. Job satisfaction related data 6. Enhancements / Expansions (i.e. increasing a schedule or enrolling siblings) 7. ROI Lagging Data: 1. Retention 2. Absenteeism
column101: Vivvi's full suite of caregiving services include:  - On and Near Site Child Care Centers: Vivvi works with employers to manage the entire process of building, licensing, staffing, budget creation and management, and center operations management  - Back-Up Care Network: Vivvi's global network of over 3,500 vetted child care and elder care partners (center-based and in-home) provides families with access to emergency backup care across the US, Canada and the UK.  - Care Cash: Care Cash is a financial subsidy product that allows employees to directly claim subsidies anywhere in the world for care secured independently, including through family members, friends, and trusted members of their community. This can be used for everything from child care to pet care and more.  - Virtual Tutoring: Connects students with vetted expert educators to support academic enrichment and test prep with dedicated weekly sessions.  -Disability and neurodiversity: Education and training through Vivvi's partnership with Joshin.  -College Preparation: Vivvi partners with Collegewise to offer a comprehensive suite of services and resources to support employees with children who are preparing for college  -Network tuition discounts: Discounted tuition is available at Vivvi campuses and partner locations in the Vivvi network.  -Nanny referral: The Vivvi Concierge will support the family to connect with a location agency that can assist with the placement process.  -Concierge Team: Families may email, text, or call to directly connect with a Vivvi Concierge Team Member who will secure care on their behalf.  -Bambino: Included in Vivvi's solutions for employee caregivers is a partnership with Bambino which offers a large network of on-demand caregivers throughout the US.  -Ongoing parent resources and webinars: Vivvi supports parents with regular, relevant programming and events to support their needs across subjects such as Kindergarten admissions, literacy, financial planning and social emotional development.

column74: sona: music as medicine app for mental health  When was the last time you restored your brain with neuroscience-backed music? Try sona to increase in alpha & theta brain waves for improving sleep and lowering stress levels.   Sona's mission is to help people experience music as medicine. Sona uses science-backed music to improve mental health. A startup based out of Los Angeles produces and distributes original music made in collaboration with grammy-winning producers and neuroscientists at UC Berkeley and Nielsen. The music is designed to increase alpha and theta brain waves and reduce stress hormones in minutes. Sona personalizes your playlist based on your symptoms, listening habits and time of day.   Start your 14-day free trial today.

column101: sona is an award-winning mental health app, using neuroscience-backed music designed to improve sleep & anxiety - naturally and efficiently. nothing to learn or practice, no headphones required.   relax your mind. listen to personalized sleep & natural sounds made by grammy-winning producers. calm your anxiety in minutes, enjoy soothing restorative music and fall asleep fast.   how it works:   sona is at the forefront of technology, neuroscience, and music therapy - providing natural, efficient, and affordable mental healthcare.   sona has been tested by leading neuroscientists at uc berkeley, showing an increase in alpha & theta brain waves and reduced stress hormones in minutes.   sona personalizes your playlist based on reported symptoms, time of day and listening habits. just complete the two-question mental health survey during sign up to get your ‘listening prescription’.   a sleep timer automatically starts when you press ‘play music’, so you can enjoy original, curated, relaxing music and breathing exercises to help you unwind and destress.   how to use sona:   use sona at night before sleep or during the day in a quiet environment. try listening for at least 10 minutes, or as long as you need to feel relief. be still, close your eyes, and minimize distractions for better results. you may use the app while you meditate or practice breathwork and mindfulness. it's also a perfect solution for putting your child or baby to sleep.   press the ‘play music’ button and let sona do the rest. listen from your phone, headphones or bluetooth speaker. for kids, use an external speaker or mobile device placed at a distance to protect the child’s hearing.   sona premium (paid) features include:   - sleep timer  - premium breath guides  - unlimited listening sessions  - save favorite songs  - schedule reminders  - weekly listening analytics

column40: We are unique in the digital nutrition space for a few reasons:    1) We focus a lot on the combination of culture + food through behavior science. We understand that counting macros is not sustainable for the rest of your life (nor is rapid weight loss!), so we give users lifelong confidence to create healthy habits that stick. We take out the shame so no food is forbidden, and teach users to find balance so they can enjoy life to the fullest every day.    2) We have higher calorie recommendations than others in the space and are not solely focused on weight loss = more sustainable in long term    3) LifeScore: one simple metric that helps users to understand a full picture of their health and wellbeing  Gamification and rich content experience to increase engagement and adherence

column40: Fringe offers a true lifestyle benefits marketplace that reduces stress, gives back time, supports the family, and sparking joy for the employee - while equally simplifying administration, streamlining the program choices, and providing tangible data to effectively scale the benefits.  Fringe has true partnerships with the brands on our marketplace, which gives users access to perks/benefits not available to the general public; or at a reduced cost in some cases.  Users can change their redemption choices on each site visit, while the company can change their programs often, without adding to their workload.
column42: There is a $200/month minimum platform fee (over 50 employees, there is a Per Employee Per Month fee structure).  For groups <100ee, there is a minimum program funding of $300/ee/year (as a program aggregate).

column55: Fringe is a people-first company and offers solutions that make customers feel empowered and impactful in the lives of the people in their organization.  Customer Service is paramount to everything Fringe offers.  Fringe provides our customers with a Customer Success Team, along with a Customer Support Team to streamline any issues and ensure both users and admin teams have a positive experience.  Part of the qualifications for being a brand on the Fringe marketplace is ensuring customer service is prioritized and all of our brand partners have agreed contractually.  Fringe has a live chat support that resolves issues for users 24 hours/day, 7 days/week as well as a mailbox that triages requests and resolves them timely.  Fringe also very much prides ourselves in our ability to "come through for our clients, no matter what".
column56: The qualifications of team members who provide service to clients starts with their understanding that Fringe puts customers first.  In the interview process, Fringe prioritizes candidates who have experience in delivering a high-quality of service.  Ongoing, Fringe requires team members to take paid time off (which aligns with our company policy), wellness days, volunteer days (as an individual and a team), and various training to keep client services the main priority of their work.
column67: Along the lines of making a positive client experience, Fringe ensures the implementation process is a very low lift for the client.  Once they decide to move forward and partner with Fringe through signing the MSA (contract), the implementation process starts with an email that introduces the Implementation Team to the client.  They are given a deck that goes through next steps, and we sent a Typeform Onboarding form that confirms their program (funding, use cases, eligibility, etc.) and our onboarding team sets up the accounts.  Fringe conducts a kickoff call prior to the launch to make sure setup aligns with the client needs and is on track for launch (including HRIS integrations, SSO, Program Use Cases, etc.).  Fringe advertises 2 weeks or less for implementation once the Onboarding Form is completed.  [https://fringe1717.typeform.com/onboardingform]
column73: Fringe does not require a notice; Clients can update that in real time.
column74: Fringe has a User Engagement team that communicates with the users ongoing via email, based on their usage.  Users receive periodic platform updates that share new brands, trends, and news related to Fringe, while also receiving reminders of their marketplace usage (example: a user who has not spent points in a while will receive more notifications reminding them of their points balance, brands to select, etc. than a user who frequently uses the marketplace).  In addition, all users receive a notification (email, SMS, etc.) every time they get new points - with examples/trends on where the points can be spent.  The idea of the comms is to improve the overall user experience and not overwhelm the user with irrelevant information.
column79: Fringe has an internal DEIB (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging) group that is spearheaded by the Steering Committee and shares tools, resources, articles, training opportunities, etc. to continue to promote a diverse workplace for our employees.  Fringe has intentionality in developing brand/vendor partnerships with women-owned (40%) and minority-owned businesses (13%) on our marketplace.  Fringe is committed to continuing to building more direct partnerships with minority-, women-owned -, and socially responsible businesses to expand their reach, and to support our broader DEIB efforts.  100% of Fringe's Senior Director team consists of women/minorities and 87% of the Director team consists of women/minorities.  Fringe not only believes in supporting a diverse workforce as a company who supports all employees, but also thrives in 'walking the walk' in terms of actions.

column101: Fringe is a curated and user-friendly, self-contained lifestyle benefits marketplace that allows companies to offer 150+ unique products and services to travel (Airbnb, Uber, Delta, Southwest), have food/groceries delivered (DoorDash, Instacart, Shipt, Uber Eats), go to therapy, have childcare, pay student loans, donate to charity, or stream online using Twitch, Spotify, or Hulu.  Being self-contained significantly reduces the administrative burden and allows the company to create funding programs for birthdays, anniversaries/milestones, new hires, retention bonuses, wellness stipends, etc. very seamlessly.  Once the program is designed, the employee selects the perks or benefits that save them time, reduce stress, support the family in a meaningful way, or just spark joy - thus having Power in Choice for their lives.  By providing humanized benefit offerings for all personas at the organization, companies are seeing employee engagement over 80% and 8 in 10 employees self-report an increased loyalty to the company. Fringe not only provides offerings all 5 generations of the workforce can benefit from, but it also drives positive business outcomes and impacts recruiting efforts and reduction in turnover.  For more information, Fringe can provide a Vendors & Services Overview document that provides additional context.
