column55: At Exubrancy, we live by the motto "find a way or make one". We don't believe there's a one-size-fits-all approach to employee wellbeing or company culture, and thus we blend hospitality, high-touch account management, and strategic expertise to deliver a concierge-style experience for our clients. We are deeply committed to going above and beyond for our clients, and we are dedicated to curating custom solutions to meet our clients' needs.
column56: All of our team members hold credentials in their respective fields including MDs, Licensed Massage Therapists, Registered Dieticians, Health Coaches, NASM/ACE Certified Personal Trainers + Group Fitness instructors with extensive experience at boutique studios such as Equinox, Barry's, etc.
column67: Exubrancy Relationship Managers work closely clients to plan and launch wellbeing programs. We typically requires a minimum of 2 weeks of lead time to confirm a program, though we always appreciate as much runway as possible. Depending on the extent of the program or event, we may be able to execute events in under 2 weeks on a case by case basis. Exubrancy prides itself in extremely flexible cancellation and adjustment policies so that clients can fine tune their programming to meet the needs of their population. We communicate via calls and emails. Once confirmed, your dedicated Exubrancy Account Manager sends booking confirmation details to the client, and ensure that all logistics leading up to the event(s) are coordinated and will be available for any support or preparation. Marketing materials are also available upon request. Depending on the type of event, we may recommend an on-site visit or a virtual prep call to set up our clients for success.
column73: Clients will not be charged for fitness, meditation, or chair massage events canceled or rescheduled with more than 48 business hours notice. Clients will not be charged for workshops, seminars, or team events canceled or rescheduled with more than 10 business days' notice. Events canceled, rescheduled, or adjusted outside of the aforementioned timelines will be charged in full. In the case of COVID-19-related closures or inclement weather we must still adhere to the above timelines without exception. For a full cancellation of any weekly subscription programs, client cancellations are required one month (30 days) in advance of the termination of services.
column74: We work with our client contacts to determine the right strategy to publicize our programs and experiences internally. This often includes a combination of calendar invites, manages sign-ups, flyers, and internal messaging app (e.g., Slack) communication. We typically do not communicate directly with employees.
column79: We have a Code of Ethics and an internal monthly DEI forum with our corporate team to discuss current trends, challenges, and ways to iterate as a company to support DEI. We also offer a variety of events and workshops designed to support DEI and ERG initiatives (e.g., Behaviors of Inclusion Workshop, Black History Month Trivia, Lunar New Year Tea Tasting).
column81: A signed Independent Contractor Agreement and/or Certificate of Insurance (as required by each property)
column92: We do not have an admin portal but can share sign-up / utilization data as requested.
column101: On-Site and Virtual Fitness Exubrancy brings sought-after group fitness instructors right to your workplace, whether virtually or on site, for dynamic, all-level workouts. Choose from a variety of different class formats including Yoga, Pilates, Bootcamp, HIIT,  Barre, Chair Yoga, Zumba & more!  On-Site and Virtual Meditation Exubrancy’s expert-led 30-minute meditation sessions are designed for stress reduction and include guided meditation, breathing exercises, and seated stretching. Help your team cultivate calm with Mindfulness Meditation or Sleep Meditation training.  The Anatomy of Anxiety // Virtual: $2,250 // Onsite: $2,750 New York functional psychiatrist Dr. Ellen Vora will take us through a paradigm-shifting approach to managing anxiety. Participants will learn how to eliminate unnecessary anxiety and discuss how to utilize purposeful anxiety. We’ll then wrap the session with ample time for Q&A with Dr. Vora.  Blocking and Boundary Setting // Virtual & Onsite: $2,550 Toxic behavior, media, energy vampires and societal norms can all drain us of our power. This session, led by high performance coach Jennifer Cassetta, will empower attendees to block negativity and set boundaries. We'll also cover powerful communication and how to master our inner dialogue.  Clean Eating Made Simple // Virtual & Onsite: $1,250  In this educational and informative workshop, Board Certified Holistic Nutritionist Jennifer Hanway shares her tips, tricks and strategies to help you and your family eat a healthy, clean, nutrient dense and delicious diet, whilst enjoying your favorite meals, treats and snacks.  DEI: Recognizing and Combating Implicit Bias // Onsite: $5,250 Unconscious bias can impact your professional and personal life as well as influence the way you unintentionally communicate, behave and act toward others. Join expert Jennefer Witter to define what implicit bias is, how it is threaded throughout virtually every aspect of our lives, and how to address it.   Digital Wellbeing Workshop // Virtual: $1,500 // Onsite: $1,850 In a world that's gone virtual, it's more important than ever to find balance in our personal and professional use of digital devices. In this workshop led by digital wellbeing expert Prerna Manchanda, you'll learn to develop a more conscious relationship with your devices and the technology surrounding us.  Ergonomics 101 Workshop // Virtual & Onsite: $1,050  Learn how to set yourself up and improve your posture so you can be your best and feel comfortable and productive on (and off) the job! Topics covered include healthy postures (sitting and standing), desk setup guidelines, stress free movement techniques, stretches and equipment interface training.  Feed your Mental Health with Dr. Ramsey // Virtual: $2,250 Looking for nutrition-based solutions to help combat stress, anxiety, or depression? Backed by extensive research in the Nutritional Psychiatry field, this groundbreaking workshop with Dr. Ramsey dives into concepts such as inflammation and the microbiome and how they play a role in mental health.  How to Avoid Burnout // Virtual: $2,250 // Onsite: $2,750 Struggling to maintain a positive work-life balance? This seminar, led by a Holistic Psychiatrist Dr. Vora, introduces participants to actionable strategies to boost their day-to-day energy and productivity. Dr. Vora will also give participants the chance to ask questions and connect with each other!   Meal Prep and Planning Workshop // Virtual & Onsite: $950+   Does meal prep and planning seem overwhelming? Led by an expert nutritionist, this workshop will focus on teaching strategies for planning  ahead to promote healthy eating habits throughout the week. Tips and tricks will be provided along with guidance for a successful meal prep plan!  Meditation and Mindfulness 101 // Virtual & Onsite: $750  Led by an expert Exubrancy Meditation Instructor, this workshop will kick off teaching employees about the foundations of meditation and mindfulness and its research-backed benefits. Participants will then be led through calming breathing exercises, grounding stretches, and a guided meditation.  Mindful Eating Workshop // Virtual: $950 Food trends come and go but bringing mindfulness to meal and snack time is a tool that will stay forever. Led by expert RD Sydney Greene, participants learn how mindful eating not only helps with body acceptance but it has been shown to decrease inflammation and food anxiety and improve digestion.  Optimizing Your Microbiome // Virtual & Onsite: $1,550 Discover the path to optimal gut health with Exubrancy RD Adiana Castro! Learn how to regrow your microbiome and the essential differences between prebiotics and probiotics. Uncover the impact of lifestyle factors on your gut, empowering you to make informed choices for overall well-being.  Power of Habit // Virtual & Onsite: $2,750 Empower your team with the knowledge to harness the science of habits in our dynamic, results-oriented workshop led by renowned executive coach Amina Zamani. We will unveil the challenges that keep us anchored to detrimental patterns and provide strategies for overcoming these hurdles.   Power of Setting Goals // Virtual: $1,750 // Onsite: $2,950 We’ve all heard that goal setting is important for our wellbeing and success, but the practice of strategically setting goals can be a challenge for many people! If you feel that your own goal setting has gone flat, this workshop will reinvigorate your intentions, which is a key to achieving your goals.  Self Care 101 Workshop // Virtual: $1,750 // Onsite: $2,950 Just like different species of plants need different amounts of water, soil, and sunlight, we need different ratios of movement, food, sleep, and contact. This workshop will explore ways to take care of yourself in a meaningful way and lead your through exercises to design a customized self-care routine.  Sleep Strategies Seminar // Virtual: $2,250 // Onsite: $2,750 In this seminar, Dr. Vora will bust myths and share tools for solving sleep problems. Participants will learn how shifts in their schedules, habits, and thought patterns can impact a good night’s sleep. They will leave with actionable and original strategies for improving sleep tonight!  Strengths Assessment and Workshop // Virtual: $2,000+ Have you ever wondered what makes you unique? In this interactive session, a Clifton Strengths expert will help you unpack your individual strengths and strategies and learn how to apply them to experience greater ease, joy, and excellence in your work and life.   Tai Chi Intro Class // Virtual & Onsite: $550 Sometimes known as "meditation in motion," Tai Chi is a gentle movement sequence and balance practice. Class participants will be methodically led through portions of the Tai Chi form with attention given to principles and proper bodily alignment. Multi-week series are also available!  Aromatherapy Blend Bar // Virtual & Onsite: $1,150+ Need a boost? Explore aromatherapy’s holistic benefits! Participants will learn how to reduce stress and increase energy levels in this walk-up blend bar with an expert Exubrancy Aromatherapist. Each participant will make n' take a mini rollerball or spray mist blend to enjoy at home or in-office.  Avocado Toast or Omelet Breakfast Bar // Onsite: $1,125+  Fuel up for your day with our personalized breakfast bar featuring Exubrancy's avocado toast or omelet options. Build your perfect breakfast with an assortment of veggies, seeds, and herbs on toast, or choose from an array of healthy savory fillings for your protein-packed, made-to-order omelet.   Beer Tasting with TALEA // Onsite: $1,250+ Bring your team together to sample local craft beers and learn about the finer elements of brewing! Tastings will be led by our experts from TALEA Beer Co., a female and veteran-founded brewery local to NYC. Each participant can sample up to four pours in this lively (and tasty!) experience.  Biometric Screenings and Flu Shots // Onsite: $1665+ Help your team stay on top of their health this season with biometric screenings and flu shots! Trained medical professionals will come on-site to administer screenings and shots, giving everyone peace of mind as we head into a new year.  Chair Massages // Onsite: $145 - $155 per hour  Your team has a lot on their shoulders! Chair massages are a quick way to relax and release stress and tension. Bring the spa into your office and let Exubrancy’s top Licensed Massage Therapists help your colleagues work out any kinks and accumulated stress they might be carrying.   Cooking Demo - Varies based on Season! // Virtual: $950+ Immerse yourself in the art of cooking as our expert chef guides you through a seasonal recipe. Learn insider tips, tricks, and techniques that will elevate your skills. Whether you're a seasoned chef or a kitchen novice, our cooking demo promises a flavorful experience that will leave your taste buds dancing.  Ergonomic Consultations // Onsite: $350 per hour Improve your overall comfort and productivity with our office ergonomic consultations. Exubrancy’s consultants will work with you to assess your workspace and recommend personalized adjustments to optimize your posture, reduce strain, and improve your overall well-being.   Farmers Market // Onsite: $1,750+  Support small-scale farmers and savor the finest flavors of nature with a pop-up farmers market from Farm to People! Sourced directly from sustainable farmers and delivering in NYC, choose from fresh-picked seasonal produce and more.  Flower Arranging // Onsite: $2,200+  Ever wonder how to recreate an amazing flower display from a special event? This floral design workshop teaches techniques on how to make artful arrangements with beautiful fresh flowers. Participants will explore different techniques for arranging and then take home their masterpieces to enjoy.  Grazing Board Demo and Tasting // Virtual & Onsite: $1,225+ In this interactive class, we'll show participants how to choose local, vibrant, and complementary ingredients for a fall grazing board, such as sourdough breads, unique homemade butters, meats, cheeses, olives, seasonal veggies, and unique dips.  Headshots // Onsite: $3,450+ Make a lasting impression with our professional corporate headshot service. Our skilled photographers capture the unique personality and professionalism of each employee, delivering high-quality images that exude confidence and credibility. We'll provide a backdrop or can even take your shoot outdoors!  Herb Bar // Onsite: $3,250+ Our herb bar is a fragrant journey into freshness and flavor! You will have an aromatic selection of hand-picked herbs, perfect for crafting custom infusions, refreshing beverages, and culinary delights. Our Herb Bar offers a sensory adventure, adding an exquisite touch of nature's finest to your gathering.  In-office Golf Simulator // Onsite: $4,500+  Work at improving your golf skills and foster team building with a golf simulator experience right in your office! A golf pro will be onsite providing instruction and guidance for your team, facilitating mini drop-by swinging lessons, or more structured competitions (your preference!).   KonMari and Your Dream Workday // Virtual: $1,100 Are you feeling stuck in your daily routines? In this refreshing workshop led by a KonMari expert, you will discover how to move from languishing to flourishing. You’ll learn how to optimize your daily energy cycles, and to incorporate mindfulness, environmental design and creativity into your day.  Manicures, Beard Trims and Blowouts // Onsite: $155+ per hour Treat your team to a day of convenient pampering with our premier services for hair and nails. Our in-office styling services are designed to enhance your personal and professional well-being! Elevate your workday routine with a moment of self-care and refinement.  Musical Mixtape Team Bingo // Virtual & Onsite: $950+ Challenge your friends and co-workers to this fun musical bingo extravaganza! You’ll jam out in this tune-filled customizable event that will test your music knowledge. Stay connected either virtually or in-person and keep your friendly competition heated in a brand new way.   Parfait Bar // Onsite: $2,950+ Indulge in our enticing Parfait Bar, where taste meets creativity! Elevate your event with a delightful array of fresh fruits, wholesome granolas, and yummy organic yogurt, allowing guests to craft their personalized, deliciously healthy parfaits.   Pop-up Coffee Bar and Barista // Onsite: $1,750+ Make a statement and provide a warm welcome for your team with an espresso cart for your office. We believe the coffee you connect over should leave an impact! Service includes a mobile espresso bar and a professional barista whipping up gourmet coffee and tea, made to order.   Roaming Magician or Show // Virtual & Onsite: $2,500 - $9,500 Prepare to be entertained as our mesmerizing magician takes center stage. Our magic show promises an unforgettable experience filled with illusions and tricks that defy explanation. For an extra touch of enchantment, our magician will mingle with the crowd, bringing the magic up-close.   Self Defense 101 // Virtual & Onsite: $1,350 Exubrancy’s Self Defense Expert will lead a hands-on workshop that will empower participants with the moves and confidence to help in any situation. This workshop combines drills, exercises and educational principles of tactical awareness. If you enjoyed this workshop, inquire about our Karate classes!  Smoothie Bike // Onsite: $4,000+ Get ready to spin your way to a delicious and healthy treat with our smoothie bike event! Our stationary bikes are equipped with blenders, allowing you to blend up a smoothie using the power of your pedaling. This interactive event is perfect way to promote healthy eating and exercise habits.  Soundbath Meditation // Virtual & Onsite: $850+ Exubrancy's experiential 60-minute sound journey and meditation includes a brief introduction to the art of listening, followed by breathing techniques, guided visualizations, and a collection of harmonically rich sounds made from gongs, Himalayan singing bowls, and tuning forks.  Sushi Making // Onsite: $1,900+  Led by our expert sushi chef, you'll learn the techniques and skills necessary to create your own delicious sushi rolls at home, as well as tips and tricks for creating beautiful presentations. Whether you're a sushi novice or a seasoned pro, our class is a fun and educational experience for everyone.  Superfood Smoothie Bar // Onsite: $1,050+ Our nutrition expert hand picks nourishing superfoods to create an office snack that's as healthy as it is delicious. Our expert will be blending your energizing smoothies onsite, so they will also be available to answer questions about healthy snack habits and provide creative smoothie inspo!  Team Paint and Sip // Virtual & Onsite: $1,400+ Unleash your inner artist! An expert art instructor will guide your group through a painting of your choosing from start-to-finish. We’ll bring the supplies (or ship them to your team members!). We just ask that you prepare for a fun filled experience and be ready to get your creativity flowing.  Tea Tasting and Blending // Onsite: $850+ Whether you're a tea aficionado or a skeptic, this class will be enlightening experience. Our tea expert will guide you through a tasting, teaching you about their origins and health benefits. Then, try your hand at creating your own blend to take home! Add on for energy bites or baked goods available!  Team Trivia Night // Virtual & Onsite: $950+ Welcome to the battle of the wits! This custom trivia game will challenge your intellectual side while digging into your pop-culture knowledge. You’ll also get to rank your top topics for our facilitator to make this event a perfectly unique experience for your team. Family and friends welcome!   Typewriter Poetry // Onsite: $550 per hour Unleash your creativity and emotions with our interactive poetry event! Our expert poet will craft personalized poems in 2-3 minutes based on your chosen topic. This surprise and delight event is perfect for a unique and unforgettable experience for participants to express themselves.  Vision Boarding // Onsite: $2,750+ Join us for an empowering session where you'll visualize dreams and goals through a creative collage of words and dried florals all tied together in a glass frame. Dive into self-discovery, craft your vision board, and manifest a roadmap toward your future success in a vibrant and supportive environment.  Watercolor Card Making // Onsite: $2,750+ Explore your artistic side in our watercolor card making workshop! Embark on a creative journey as you craft uniquely designed, personalized cards using watercolor techniques. Enhance your occasion with this interactive session, combining artistic expression and craftsmanship for a truly special experience.

column40: Boon is a B2B, personalized, 1:1 coaching platform that is bridging the gap between mental well-being and professional development in the workplace. Whether it's helping employees cope with stress & anxiety or to become a more effective leader in the workplace, Boon helps employees overcome life's challenges and reach their goals.  Our focus on both the personal and professional is a new angle at supporting employee development, growth all while reducing turnover by 50% for the employees that engage with a coach.
column43: We offer both utilization based and PEPM pricing models
column55: One of our core values is that we are customer obsessed. We personalize the coaching journey for every employee and align our program to be the right hand of an HR team.
column56: We have 150 coaches on our platform and they are ICF-Accredited or Master's Level Therapists
column67: We have a Boon customer portal that tracks all of the onboarding items we need to launch:  - Sign agreement - Receive Employee roster + optional dependents (First name, last name and email) - Add IP addresses to their allowlist - Schedule live launch call with employees - Schedule monthly performance reviews
column74: We have a multi-pronged communication strategy with a communications playbook for HR Teams, integration to customer sharepoint or employee benefit portal, an onboarding sequence, complimentary quarterly webinars and a monthly newsletter.
column79: We have coaches dedicated to lead DEI programming for our customers and we are intentional with hiring of a diverse pool of coaches (27.5% diversity across coaching base)
column81: We can accept an eligibility or demographic file from our customers, but it's not required. At a minimum we require an employee roster.
column92: We show monthly utilization reporting for our customers, which includes monthly session count, average sessions per employee, etc. We do not have an admin website for our customers.
column101: Coaching: One-on-one coaching for an entire organization Executive Coaching: Coaching meant exclusively for VP level & C-Suite 360 Reviews: Custom build, facilitate and coaching review with 360 assessments  Group Seminars: Topical seminars geared towards an entire organization and their needs  Manager Training: Cohort based middle-management training
column104: We are not a healthcare benefit, rather a voluntary benefit, that does not relate to pension or health benefit plans.
column107: We are not involved in healthcare benefit plans
column109: We are not a healthcare benefit plan

column119: When employees sign up for Boon, they review and e-sign and informed consent. Language included below:  Informed Consent  1) Standards and Expectations A. Coach agrees to maintain professional ethical and standards of behavior and to comply with applicable laws and regulations when providing coaching services to Client. B. Client is solely responsible for creating and implementing his/her/their own physical, mental and emotional well-being, decisions, choices, actions and results arising out of or resulting from the coaching relationship and his/her/their coaching calls and interactions with the Coach. As such, the Client agrees that the Coach is not and will not be liable or responsible for any actions or inaction, or for any direct or indirect result of any services provided by the Coach. Client understands coaching is not therapy or mental health care and does not substitute for therapy if needed, and does not prevent, cure, or treat any mental disorder or medical disease. C. Client further acknowledges that he/she/they may terminate or discontinue the coaching relationship at any time. D. Client acknowledges that coaching is a comprehensive process that may involve different areas of his or her life, including work, finances, health, relationships, education and recreation. The Client agrees that deciding how to handle these issues, incorporate coaching principles into those areas and implementing choices is exclusively the Client’s responsibility. E. Client acknowledges that coaching does not involve the diagnosis or treatment of mental disorders as defined by the American Psychiatric Association and that coaching is not to be used as a substitute for counseling, psychotherapy, psychoanalysis, mental health care, substance abuse treatment, or other professional advice by legal, medical or other qualified professionals and that it is the Client’s exclusive responsibility to seek such independent professional guidance as needed. If Client is currently under the care of a mental health professional, it is recommended that the Client promptly inform the mental health care provider of the nature and extent of the coaching relationship agreed upon by the Client and the Coach. Client acknowledges and agrees that Coach does not and will not provide mental health services or medical services of any kind. F. The Client understands that in order to enhance the coaching relationship, the Client agrees to communicate honestly, be open to feedback and assistance and to create the time and energy to participate fully in the program.  2) Confidentiality This coaching relationship, as well as all information (documented or verbal) that the Client shares with the Coach as part of this relationship, is bound by applicable principles of confidentiality. However, please be aware that the Coach-Client relationship is not considered a legally confidential relationship (like the medical and legal professions) and thus communications are not subject to the protection of any legally recognized privilege. The Coach agrees not to disclose any personal information provided by the Client without the Client’s written consent except as indicated below. The Coach will not disclose the Client’s name as a reference without the Client’s consent. Client understands that Coach will share information with Boon Health and certain, aggregate information such as total number of sessions for all employees, may be shared with Client’s employer. Confidential Information does not include information that: (a) was in the Coach’s possession prior to its being furnished by the Client; (b) is generally known to the public or in the Client’s industry; (c) is obtained by the Coach from a third party, without breach of any obligation to the Client; (d) is independently developed by the Coach without use of or reference to the Client’s confidential information; or (e) the Coach is required by statute, lawfully issued subpoena, or by court order to disclose; (f) is disclosed to the Coach and as a result of such disclosure the Coach reasonably believes there to be an imminent or likely risk of danger or harm to the Client or others; and (g) involves illegal activity. The Client also acknowledges his or her continuing obligation to raise any confidentiality questions or concerns with the Coach in a timely manner.  3) Limited Liability Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, Boon and Coach make no guarantees, representations or warranties of any kind or nature, express or implied with respect to the coaching services negotiated, agreed upon and rendered. In no event shall Boon Health or Coach be liable to the Client for any indirect, consequential or special damages. Notwithstanding any damages that the Client may incur, the Coach’s entire liability under this Agreement, and the Client’s exclusive remedy, shall be limited to the amount actually paid to Boon Health.This question is required.*

column40: FitPros has a LIVE Streaming Wellness Service, where many others are on demand content. We offer wellbeing support in many different categories, such as DEI, fitness, mental health, financial, and team building. We can provide clients with a turnkey wellness solution and/or a fully customized program. We also support health fairs both onsite & virtual.
column42: No minimum headcount. We have a $3,000 annual minimum spend on custom wellness programs.
column43: Custom Programs & Wellness Fairs = A la carte pricing, typically a 1 time fixed cost.   FitPros LIVE Platform & wellbeing app = PEPM ranging from $.50-$3.00/employee based on company size
column54: Standard Operation Hours are 8:00-5:00pst but we have employees online at all times to support global populations
column55: Each client has their own dedicated client success team including a lead manager, client success coordinator, and a sales consultant. This ensures our team knows our client needs long term.  We explore all needs, goals, and values of clients to prescribe the right programming for them. For clients that don't have a lot of experience in this space, we can also implement a survey to their employees to help extract data used to prescribe programs.
column56: Each service requires different requirements. All Pros must have 2+ years of experience teaching groups in person and virtually Example- MENTAL HEALTH: Master’s Degree in one of the following or similar: Social Work Psychology Counseling ✨ Bonus if they have a Ph.D. in Psychology or Marriage and Family Therapy or Counseling or similar to  AND / OR License or Certification in one of the following or similar: Clinic Social Worker Psychiatrist Marriage and Family Therapist Associate Marriage and Family Therapist Then they MUST have the following: Bachelor’s Degree 3+ years of experience with working professionals 2+ years leading talks/seminars/workshops for a corporate audience

column40: Vori Health is a specialty medical practice delivering a virtual-first musculoskeletal (MSK) solution to help employees overcome pain and get back to their lives faster. From medical evaluations and diagnoses to non-opioid prescriptions and personalized physical therapy, employers turn to Vori Health for convenient end-to-end care that reduces unnecessary surgery and controls costs while improving employee outcomes.  -Our physician-led model is different than any virtual-PT companies in this space -Our Claims validated ROI model sets us apart for the virtual-PT companies in this space -Our ability to offer nationwide hybrid care for members who prefer to be seen in-person
column43: Our standard pricing model is a Per Engaged Member Per Year case rate. We split this case rate up into engagement milestones for completed Clinical Visits. Typically, we charge 50% at completion of intake call, 25% at completion of 3rd visit, 25% at completion of 5th visit.
column54: Members have 24/7 chat access to their assigned Care Team. Call center operation hours are M-F 7AM-8PM CT.
column55: At Vori, our 4 internal pillars are: Lead the Movement, Humanity Comes First, Flex Your Curiosity, and Do the Right Thing. The main pillar that stands out for us is Humanity Comes First. Our focus is always on our customers, members, and their goals first and foremost. We take a comprehensive approach at the customer-level by aligning on what goals our customers would like to accomplish when working with Vori, and ensuring we execute tirelessly to reach those goals. At the member-level, we are ensuring we listen to each member with our Biopsychosocial approach in each member interaction. Instead of providing off-the-shelf care immediately when a member mentions low back pain, we practice motivational interviewing techniques so members can provide a clear picture for us: Where they’ve received treatment in the past, why they have put off care until visiting Vori, what their fears are, what motivates them to get better, and what they want to accomplish for their recovery. Aligning around the member’s goals and putting them first allows us to create a positive member experience and motivate members to get them back to the lives they want to live.
column56: MDs: All physicians are board-certified Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation Doctors, residency trained, with spine or sports medicine fellowships after the PM&R Residency; or Emergency Medicine Residency trained with a Sports Medicine fellowship.    All Physical Therapists are DPT’s and have received their Doctorate of Physical Therapy Degrees.    All Health Coaches are Nationally Board Certified Health Coaches with specific training in behavioral health.    Registered Dieticians: All Registered Dieticians must earn a degree from an accredited dietics program, complete a supervised practice requirement of 1,000 hours in a variety of settings, pass a National Registered Dietetics Nutritionists exam, and stay up to date in dietetics through continuing education after the National Exam.    All Vori Health Providers are continuously trained in Advanced Pain Education Training, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion for the Healthcare Employee Training, Security Awareness Training, and Sexual Harassment Training.
column67: Implementation is fairly low-lift: Earlier on in the process, we will align on Marketing & Member Engagement Workstreams, Eligibility file transfer, Integrations, and align around preferred Billing model. In the first month of Implementation, calls will typically take place once a week, and slowly taper off as we align on key workstreams. column79: Internally, we have a Diversity, Equity, and Belonging committee that meets regularly to ensure we are continually fostering an inclusive workforce company-wide. 60% of our Executive Leadership is women 33% is minority, and 45% of our Senior leadership is women and 31% is minority. All employees are owners of the company.  Externally,Vori’s hybrid solution is designed with accessibility in mind.  Our virtual first approach brings a convenient way for members to get help for their MSK conditions.  We bring a doctor to your members through a virtual visit within 48 hours for any of your members regardless of where they live and how close or accessible an orthopedic specialist is.  For people suffering from mobility related MSK conditions, they don’t need to pay for, or find a ride to their visit, or their follow-up PT visits which saves them on time and expense.  Our solutions are built out and fully available in English and Spanish and we use language translation services for all other languages, ensuring that members can communicate and get the care they need in their native language. We also ensure all collateral that is sent to members is kept below an 8th grade reading level. We do not standardly send out tablets or mobile hotspots as part of our process, but we absolutely do for members who need access to technology and/or have unreliable internet.

column101: Vori Health is a specialty medical practice delivering a virtual-first musculoskeletal (MSK) solution to help employees overcome pain and get back to their lives faster. column104: Vori Health is an MSO which provides to its group employer clients access to virtual MSK Medical Services and virtual PT provided by Vori Health's affiliated professional entities. Concomitantly, Vori Health provides administrative services at fair market value to the professional entities pursuant to executed administrative services agreements. As such, the group employer clients, as the sponsor of Vori services for their employees, and not Vori Health, would be subject to ERISA. Vori Health can work with its group employer clients to ensure compliance with ERISA.
column107: GIVEN THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN VORI HEALTH AND THE PROFESSIONAL ENTITIES, WHICH SUBMIT ELECTRONIC CLAIMS TO THIRD PARTY PAYORS, VORI HEALTH AND THE PROFESSIONAL ENTITIES ARE SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING HEALTH CARE STATUTES AND REGULATIONS: (I) FEDERAL ANTI-KICKBACK STATUTE (42 USC SECTION 1320A-7B ET SEQ AND ANALOGOUS STATE ANTI-KICKBACK STATUTES AND CONCOMITANT REGULATIONS); (II) FEDERAL STARK LAW (42 USC 1395NN ET SEQ. AND CONCOMITANT REGULATIONS); (III) STATE LAWS ON THE PROHIBITION ON THE CORPORATE PRACTICE OF MEDICINE; (IV) STATE LAWS ON FEE SPLITTING OF PROFESSIONAL FEES WITH NON-PHYSICIANS; (V) FEDERAL HIPAA (42 USC SECTION 1320D ET SEQ. AND CONCOMITANT REGULATIONS); AND (VI) STATE DATA PRIVACY LAWS. VORI HEALTH WORKS CLOSELY WITH POLSINELLI AND OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS TO ENSURE ITS POLICIES AND PRACTICES ARE COMPLIANT WITH ALL APPLICABLE LAW, RULES AND REGULATIONS.

column40: SavvyFi brings all student loan and education funding benefits together in one mobile/desktop experience to make this combined benefit simple to communicate and administer for employers, and easy to navigate and manage for employees.  We currently support student loan aggregation and 529 account origination, and we support numerous sources of funding for those accounts, including:  - 529 plan opening and management, with recurring contributions via employee's bank accounts - Employee contributions to 529 plans & student loans - Employer contributions to student loan and 529 plans - 401(k)/403(b) employer matching based on student loan payments (per Secure 2.0) - Wellness reimbursement, LSA, flexible benefit, PTO, sign-on bonus or performance bonus conversion to student debt or 529 savings - Friends and family gifting to student loans or 529 plans - Merchant-funded offers (cashback rewards) that can be applied to 529 savings or student loan debt   As an SEC-registered Investment Adviser, we are unique in that we can originate 529 accounts in a compliant way.  This cannot be done without an Investment Adviser registration and is key to running a frictionless, national 529 benefit program.

column40: What sets Disclo’s offering apart in the complex landscape of workplace accommodations is not only its unparalleled focus on ADA compliance and support but also its cost-effectiveness compared to traditional methods. The rise in litigation underscores the urgent need for organizations to adopt a strategic, in-house approach. By choosing Disclo, companies circumvent the financial burdens of employing Third Party Administrators (TPAs), hiring dedicated regulatory experts, and managing administrative teams.  Our solutions offer comprehensive tools and services that streamline the accommodations process, offering superior control, customization, and responsiveness. This approach significantly mitigates legal risks and elevates employee satisfaction, making Disclo a leader in accommodations management. Our platform ensures that organizations can effectively navigate the complexities of accommodations / workplace adjustments in a more affordable, efficient, and supportive manner, setting a new standard for excellence in the field.  Here are the key features and benefits that further differentiate Disclo's solutions in the market:  Dedicated Accommodations Solution: Disclo is the only dedicated ADA solution in the market, singularly focused on the complexities of ADA accommodations and the interactive process. Our approach is unparalleled, as we specifically cater to the nuanced demands of ADA compliance and interactive process management. Unlike other services that might offer ADA compliance as an ancillary feature or FMLA software companies that claim ADA capabilities without true expertise, Disclo specializes in accommodations and the individualized inquiry process. This specialization positions us uniquely, especially at a time when employers are increasingly recognizing the need for dedicated software and service to seriously address ADA accommodations.  Technology Powered, Human-Centric Support: Our platform combines automation for straightforward cases with personalized, expert support for complex situations. This unique combination ensures efficiency and comprehensiveness in handling accommodations. From automated request intake and medical documentation generation to a structured interactive process that includes documentation uploading and activity tracking, Disclo facilitates every step. Additionally, we offer automated third-party medical verification, streamlining the accommodations process further and ensuring a seamless, supportive experience for both employees and employers.  Unique Benefits of Our Software: - Real-time Analytics with Goal Tracking: Our software arms HR professionals and DEI leaders with powerful real-time analytics, offering unparalleled insights. It allows for immediate tracking of disclosure rates, request rates, and offers a granular view of metrics by department, disclosure type, and more, enabling strategic decision-making and fostering an environment of continuous improvement and accountability.  - Automated Request Intake and Medical Documentation Generation: Streamlining the accommodations request process, our platform automates intake, effortlessly generating the necessary medical documentation. This hands-free approach reduces administrative burden and accelerates the management of accommodations requests, embodying efficiency and simplicity.  - Structured Interactive Process with Documentation Uploading and Activity Tracking: Disclo’s platform enhances the management of accommodations through a well-organized interactive process. It enables easy documentation uploading and features detailed activity tracking, ensuring each case is managed with precision and clarity. This structure is pivotal in maintaining transparency and efficiency throughout the accommodations lifecycle.  - Automated Medical Verification: Our solution simplifies the verification process by automating third-party medical verification. This feature ensures a streamlined, efficient process for validating accommodations requests, minimizing delays and reducing the need for extensive manual intervention, thus enhancing the overall experience for both employees and employers.  - Integrated Compliance and Security: With a robust framework designed to meet the highest standards of security and compliance, our platform ensures the responsible management of sensitive information. Adherence to HIPAA compliance and SOC 2 Type II security standards is not just a benchmark but a foundation of our offering. This commitment safeguards organizational and employee data, establishing a trusted environment essential for managing accommodations effectively and confidentially.

column74: Below are the steps we take to assist the client in notifying employees about Disclo:  1. Initial Implementation Meeting: Our implementation team will collaborate with the client on a kickoff call to devise a comprehensive strategy for managing accommodations moving forward. This includes outlining the standard practices for communication, training, and education to ensure a seamless integration of Disclo.  2. Email Templates for All Employees: Initiate communication about Disclo with structured email notifications at intervals agreed upon with the client to ensure awareness and preparation for the program launch.    3. Handbook Language: Incorporate detailed descriptions of Disclo into employee handbooks and the internal portal to educate employees about the platform.  4. Live Disclo Platform Training: Offer specialized training sessions for Admins and Case Managers to navigate and utilize the Disclo platform effectively for managing workplace accommodations.  5. HR Staff Training: Conduct sessions to brief HR staff on the fundamentals of Disclo and set expectations for its implementation and impact on workplace accommodations.  6. Manager Training: Provide managers with a comprehensive overview of Disclo, including ADA compliance basics, to ensure they are well-equipped to support their teams.  7. column40: Neura Health is a virtual neurology solution that connects employees with top neurologists across the country to treat chronic neurology conditions like headache & migraine, sleep and pain disorders, epilepsy, concussion and MS. We offer faster access to quality care, better health outcomes and lower costs.  The solution includes:  * The first national network of tele-neurologists that provides evidence-based sub-specialty care.  * 1:1 Coaching support for managing lifestyle modifications and staying on track with a personalized treatment plan.  *A virtual care concierge team to help employees manage administrative tasks like prior authorizations, insurance paperwork, and more. *A proprietary digital platform to track symptoms in real-time so they are integrated with the patient’s medical record.  It also allows providers to proactively reach out when outcomes are trending in the wrong direction. (Personalized treatment plans and a customized educational curriculum, schedule video appointments with providers, and chat online with a dedicated care concierge.  How it works *Within 48 hours of signing up, an employee meets with their dedicated care team consisting of a board-certified neurologist, care coach, and care concierge. They stay with the same care team throughout their whole journey with Neura.  *Patients journal their symptoms in the digital tracker, and in real time their neurologist and care team are notified about symptom progress. If symptoms are worsening, the care team proactively reaches out to help the patient.  *Patients can hold video visits with board-certified neurologists, who can prescribe medications, order labs and scans, and recommend lifestyle modifications.  *The care team assigns personalized in-app care plans for each individual. Every patient on the platform has a dedicated care coach to support them as well as hold them  accountable to managing lifestyle changes in areas like diet, stress, sleep, physical therapy, and more.  *Throughout their care journey, the care concierge team supports patients with administrative tasks including the prior authorization process and insurance navigation, and patients get responses via online chat within 3 hours.

column55: Neura Health patients have unlimited access to a Care Concierge, who work closely with Neura’s providers and across internal departments with a priority of upholding our high standards of clinical care and customer service. We pride ourselves in going above and beyond for our patients and always go the extra mile to ensure that patients have everything they need in-between visits and as needs arise. We have a Service Level agreement of a response time that is within 3 hours, a 4.75/5 patient satisfaction score, and an 83 NPS.
column56: Our providers are all board-certified MDs, PAs or NPs, all of which have subspecialty experience. Our health coaches are NBC-HWC (National board certified health and wellness coaches).   We focus on only hiring PAs and NPs with 3+ years of experience in a real-world neurological care setting as well as experience within a neurological sub-specialty as well. Our PAs are closely supervised by our MDs, and each patient's care is overseen by a comprehensive care team, consisting of an MD, PA/NP, care coach, and care concierge. Our MDs regularly review questions, escalations, and complex cases across our whole patient base to ensure there is an adequate level of support in place.
column67: Please visit this link for additional details: https://neurahealth.notion.site/EXTERNAL-Partner-Implementation-Technical-Information-944681e0688149d38024eae38a509f43  Part 1: Requirements  We support 270/271 eligibility checks, or an eligibility file. If you choose to use 270/271 eligibility, then none of the following information applies to you.  1. **Eligibility file:**  1a. Supported formats: Comma-separated or pipe-delimited file (Eg: CSV file)  1b. Required columns: First Name, Last Name, DOB, Unique member ID, Eligibility start date, Eligibility end date. The dates can be in YYYY-MM-DD or MM/DD/YYYY formats only. 2. **Eligibility file transfer methods:** We can accept this file through API or SFTP (details below). Let the Neura team know which option you prefer and we will set that up for you. 3. **Eligibility file template:** We will need a template showing us an example of the actual eligibility file that you will send us, with columns in the same order as we should expect to see them. 4. **Contact Information:** A contact number or email that your patients can reach out to if they are unable to sign up for Neura through your dedicated landing page on Neura’s site. Eg: your HR department’s email, or that your customer service number/email.  Part 2: File Transfer Options  Option 1: File Upload API (Recommended)  1. This is the recommend option because it allows you to update the eligibility list as often as you want. It is fully automated and takes effect instantly. 2. We will create an API key for you and send it via 1Password. We will also give you a “partner name” that you will use as shown in step 4. 3. The API spec file is attached in link 4. cURL command example included in above link    Option 2: SFTP  1. We can only support SFTP uploads at a cadence of once a week (since it requires manual work from our team to apply the new eligibility list). 2. Neura will create a username for your company in our SFTP server and share that with you. 3. Please generate an RSA 4096-bit key pair, which can be done as shown below. `<output_file_name>` is the base file name for the key pair.    4. Share the public key with Neura so we can set that up on our SFTP server. 5. Anyone on your team who has the private key can log in using the following command to upload the file to our SFTP server.    Activation: Neura offers a variety of customizable activation materials to help activate eligible employees and their dependents.  From digital flyers to series of email outreach to direct mail to webinars, we provide a variety of educational materials to help encourage patients to try Neura, as well as educate referring providers on which conditions Neura can treat. We also create a custom landing page for each employer where employees can learn more about what we do and get started.   Operational Implementation: You will work with Neura's Director of Operations and support team to define Standard Operating Procedures for pre and post activation logistics. Prior to sign up, we'll need an understanding of how individuals discover Neura and are prompted to sign up, as well as how to check copays and verify insurance eligibility. We'll align on post-visit processes around where to send progress notes, referrals, scans, medications, labs, etc., how to submit claims for reimbursement, and a process around contacting your team in case our support team needs troubleshooting support from your team.
column73: 90 days, but preferably as long as possible to ensure continuity of care for patients.
column74: "Each partner has different preferences and we always accomodate what they think is best for their members/employees.  However, our recommended strategy is:  1) Email: Series of emails to all newly eligible members explaining what Neura is and who we are for. Longer series of emails to members with a previous ICD-10 code that matches our list of codes that we treat. These people will receive a more tailored email sequence focused on their individual condition category (such as epilepsy, for example) that we can treat.   2) Patient and Provider Webinars: Our Medical Director and marketing team will hold webinars for patients and a separate one for referring providers to explain the safety and efficacy of virtual care for neurology, how Neura works, what conditions we treat, our clinical outcomes data, and to answer questions from the community.  3) Digital Flyers and/or Direct Mail: These can be distributed by patients' PCPs or care navigators giving an overview of Neura's conditions treated, how it works and clinical outcomes stats.  We can also make a printed version and mail them to eligible patients.  4) Custom Landing Page: In order for members to begin using Neura, we build a custom landing page for each partner company explaining the benefits of Neura, and allowing new patients to get started."
column79: At Neura Health, we are committed to fostering an environment where all employees and patients feel safe, seen, heard, supported, and healthy. We embrace and celebrate the diversity of our team and patients, recognizing that it enhances our organization and the care we provide. We strive to create an inclusive workplace, valuing diverse perspectives and providing equal opportunities for growth and recognition. In delivering patient care, we prioritize equity, cultural competence, and accessibility across the globe. We are dedicated to continuous learning, improvement, and accountability in our journey toward diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. Neura Health is committed to building a future where everyone can thrive and receive the exceptional care they deserve. We believe that diversity is not just a checkbox, but a powerful catalyst for innovation, growth, and better healthcare outcomes.

column40: CuraLinc’s unique approach combines the best features of traditional EAPs, digital mental health programs and nuanced point solutions by offering a variety of distinct features, including:  • Optimized Plan Design.  CuraLinc’s model fills care delivery and UX (user experience) gaps that plague traditional EAP providers. An excellent example of this is the approach to connecting participants to care. While most EAP vendors send a list of providers to employees seeking care – and force them to call each one until they find a provider who is willing to accept new patients – CuraLinc’s concierge approach only maps participants to providers with confirmed availability. CuraLinc even offers to schedule the first appointment.  • Navigation.  CuraLinc’s licensed clinicians provide personalized guidance to the ideal level of care, modality or discipline, whether it’s within the EAP or another employer-sponsored program. • Personalized Access.  CuraLinc offers twelve different ways for employees to access treatment and support, including text therapy and digital cognitive behavioral therapy (dCBT). All modalities were built in-house, too, which eliminates problems associated with using third parties to deliver key clinical elements of a program.  • Immediate Support.  Every call into the program is answered by an independently licensed mental health clinician around-the-clock, 365 days a year. These clinicians are empowered to provide immediate care and support to employees with urgent mental health needs.  • Alignment with DEI and Health Equity Objectives.  CuraLinc’s culturally competent clinical and organizational services meet the needs of today’s diverse workforce. In addition, the program's approach to addressing social determinants of health (SDoH) minimizes healthcare inequities based on socioeconomic and community factors. • Speed to Care.  Participants can schedule ongoing support with counselors and coaches in as little as 24 hours (same day for emergency situations), either telephonically or through the program’s digital platform. The average speed to a first appointment is just 2.1 days.  • Psychiatry Support.  Participants who need medication or advanced treatment benefit from personalized advocacy and guidance to resources within their benefit plan or within the community, enhancing speed to care and quality. • Quality.  Evidence-based treatment is delivered by providers based on six distinct dimensions of quality, including satisfaction, Net Promoter Score, availability, case resolution and outcomes.  • Measurable Impact.  CuraLinc’s evidence-based approach leads to a measurable impact on employee health and productivity. CuraLinc uses a combination of clinically validated tools both for care planning and for measuring the effectiveness of the EAP on depression, anxiety, productivity, alcohol abuse and absenteeism.  • Support for Teens and Adolescents.  CuraLinc provides specialized resources and tools to improve teen and adolescent emotional fitness. • Flexibility and Customization.  Every element of the plan will be tailored to suit each client, from the technology suite to the promotional materials to the method by which the intake line is answered.  • Thought Partnership.  CuraLinc takes a collaborative and proactive approach to client service and thought partnership, including ownership, corrective action planning and thorough communication in the event of a problem or crisis.  • Innovation.  CuraLinc has an organizational commitment to developing services and features that extend the footprint of care and deliver mental health support in a meaningful manner to every participant.
column43: CuraLinc typically quotes pricing on a Per Employee Per Month (PEPM)/capitated fee arrangement.   Pricing will vary on a lot of factors, such as number of sessions, industry, number of employees, etc. for underwriting's consideration.  A range for pricing can vary from ~$1 PEPM-~$3 PEPM depending on the factors above.
column55: From both a clinical and account management perspective, CuraLinc incorporates a concierge, hi-touch approach with current clients and participants who enage in our program. We pride ourselves in our quick, quality responsiveness for both participants and clients.
column56: CuraLinc's clinicians (around the clock) meet the following minimum criteria:  • Masters or Doctorate degree in a mental health discipline from an accredited university; • Professional license(s) that is current, in good standing and issued by the state to practice independently; • Minimum of five (5) years post-graduate experience providing mental health or employee assistance (EAP) services;  • Ability to collect data, establish facts, define problems and draw valid conclusions during the initial assessment and throughout the course of treatment.
column67: CuraLinc’s structured approach to rolling out every employee assistance program starts with an implementation meeting, typically held 30-60 days prior to the program’s effective date. This meeting provides CuraLinc’s client services, marketing and operations teams with insight into each client’s culture, policies, communications channels, technology and EAP experience. CuraLinc will assign a designated Implementation Director to oversee the client's program launch.  Although CuraLinc follows a structured and uncomplicated implementation process that reflects best practices rooted in extensive experience, it is also flexible and collaborative to accommodate unique clients with custom program designs.  CuraLinc recognizes that each client is unique, with distinct policies, cultures, expectations, cultures and nuances.  That said, CuraLinc's implementation process includes a series of milestone meetings to deep into -- and truly understand -- each client's program and organizational structure so that program delivery is truly custom.

column73: CuraLinc's standard agreement includes a 90-day termination clause after the first year.  So, once notified of cancelation, a client can terminate with no penalties after 90 days.
column74: CuraLinc provides clients with a comprehensive marketing strategy focused on driving awareness of the EAP. CuraLinc will provide each client with a promotional calendar that is aligned with the client’s culture and existing marketing channels. CuraLinc tailors promotion to the unique needs of each client, which includes (but is not limited to) the following:  Brochures and Wallet Cards: The first quarter is marked for introductory brochures and wallet cards. Typically, each location will receive an adequate amount to cover every employee, plus an additional supply for new hires and turnover. Moving forward, each location can request more quantities at any time.  Posters: The first quarter is marked by CuraLinc's introductory worksite poster. Going forward, CuraLinc will provide clients with behavioral health-themed worksite posters either printed or electronically, quarterly. Generally, these are available on an unlimited basis.  Flyers and Newsletters: CuraLinc provides monthly electronic flyers which can be sent to the plan sponsor or directly to employees upon request. Quarterly electronic newsletters are published every three months with unique versions created for the employees and for the supervisors.  Personalized Communications: Mental health needs are as unique as the person experiencing them. CuraLinc can send normalizing and encouraging messages to connect participants to appropriate CuraLinc resources.  Additional Materials: eBlasts (custom by client), event-based promotions, and push messaging are also available.
column76: CuraLinc Healthcare - Sample Promo Calendar and Toolkit.pdf
column79: In addition to building a workplace distinguished by the effectiveness of our own diversity, equity and inclusion efforts, CuraLinc Healthcare has developed and delivered thousands of onsite and virtual trainings (live, webinar and on-demand), support groups, debriefings, crisis response sessions, management consultations and discussion groups for employees, managers and organizational leadership on a variety of topics related to diversity and social injustice to support the diversity initiatives of our clients and partners.
column81: CuraLinc requires the master services agreement to be fully executed prior to the program's launch date, which includes the EE headcount.
column91: CuraLinc can set up SSO access for clients in multiple forms to allow plan participants to travel seamlessly to the EAP digital suite from the client's intranet or from their other partner providers. SSO pass through links are included.  Programmed SSO connectivity may incur additional fees.
column92: CuraLinc has a unique ability to collect and report trends and data for the EAP. CuraLinc’s comprehensive reports, which are provided to clients quarterly, include a one-page executive summary that is reviewed with client plan sponsors on a regular basis. From this review, changes may be made to the company’s EAP promotional plan, training initiatives or integration with a client’s other health management benefits. • Executive Summary. Provides EAP clients with a snapshot of utilization and important trends. • Easy-to-Understand Data. Case Utilization, which illustrates unique cases opened within the EAP, and Program Utilization, which illustrates usage of all EAP components (training, consultation, etc.). • Return on Investment (ROI). Reports include a client-specific version of CuraLinc’s proprietary Financial Offset Dashboard. This ROI calculator measures the impact of the EAP on each client’s health care and human capital costs. • EAP Outcomes. CuraLinc ’s unique assessment and case management process embeds five tools, the SPS-6, WOS, PHQ-9, GAD-7 and AUDIT, to establish baselines and measure health and productivity outcomes from EAP participants. For additional information regarding CuraLinc’s impact on productivity, absenteeism and health, visit www.eapoutcomes.com.  • Integration Data. Utilization reports track the impact of EAP integration with a client’s other programs.  Clients can request a utilization report at any time from their Client Relationship Manager.
column101: Employee-facing resources within CuraLinc's EAP model include:  • Around-the-Clock Access.   CuraLinc provides around-the-clock access to mental health support through a variety of modalities: toll-free phone, video counseling, text therapy, digital behavioral health and live chat.  • In-the-Moment Clinical Support.   CuraLinc’s licensed mental health clinicians are on the front line of care, delivering immediate services to participants when they need it most.   • Comprehensive Assessment and Navigation.    Every call, email, chat or text into the program is answered live by a licensed and experienced mental health clinician, who will conduct a comprehensive assessment to determine the participant’s presenting issue(s) and problem acuity.  • Short-Term Mental Health Counseling.    Through CuraLinc’s nationwide network of licensed behavioral health clinicians, the program helps members identify and resolve depression, anxiety, grief, stress, relationship issues and substance abuse through face-to-face or video counseling.  • Mental Health Advocacy.    For participants with acute MHSA concerns, CuraLinc will not only coordinate care to a provider or facility within their benefit plan, but also transition management of the case to the medical management provider. • Technology Suite.   CuraLinc leverages technology to expand the impact radius of the EAP by providing clients with customizable web and mobile platforms, as well as a variety of integrated point solutions, such as text therapy, telebehavioral counseling, digital group support, and digital behavioral health (dCBT). • Sub-Clinical Resources.    Participants have access to a wide array of sub-clinical resources, such as legal and financial consultation, expert dependent care referrals and coaching for mindfulness, sleep fitness and meditation.   CuraLinc also provides resources for the organization, which include:  • Crisis Response Services.    CuraLinc provides onsite clinical support to assist clients that are impacted by crisis events, such as workplace violence, robbery, a natural disaster or a workplace accident. • Organizational Development.     CuraLinc offers a broad range of customized workshops and training modules designed to make a client's staff and managers more effective. • Management Consultation.    CuraLinc's management consultants provide supervisors with expert, confidential guidance and support for managing difficult workplace situations.  • Client Services.    Every CuraLinc client has a dedicated account service team and a single point-of-contact, who is responsible for driving awareness to (and value from) the program.
column104: Ultimately, it is the role of the employer’s corporate counsel to determine whether the EAP is an ERISA-covered benefit. Our general position is that typically it is not, since we are providing coaching, consultation and short-term, solution-focused support by licensed counselors – not ongoing mental health or substance abuse treatment. That said, a relatively small number of employers do choose to designate their EAP as an ERISA-covered benefit and include it in their SPD’s (summary plan description).
column106: CuraLinc will continue to provide services for as long as the employer keeps the former employee in the reported headcount.

column79: Hiring We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (""EEO"") Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of Zeera not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, caregiver status, unemployment status or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state and/or local laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation, training, working conditions, transfer, job assignments, benefits, layoff, and termination.  User Research When we conduct user research, we collect data on race and income of our users. We separate out racial demographics to understand, specifically, how different demographics resonate and respond to mental healthcare to ensure no demographic is biasing our overarching research and conclusions.   Product We are committed to diversifying our product team as the company grows to ensure a diverse workforce, across race, gender, and socioeconomic status. We are committed to diversifying our guest speakers.   External Comms and Brand We use inclusive language and imagery that captures a diverse range of gender identities, races, and body types. We promote our brand and product on platforms that reach a diverse audience, and partner with organizations that are centered around race, gender identity, sexuality, socioeconomic status, age, and/or geographic location. These include for-profit companies and non-profit organizations to bring our services to their existing communities in ways that feel mutually beneficial.

column55: At Avidon Health, our commitment to exceptional customer service is central to our mission and is a pivotal reason behind our high client retention rates. We understand that our clients' success is our success, and our approach to customer service is built around this principle. Here's how we define and approach customer service:  Rapid Response Times: We pride ourselves on our responsiveness. Our average first response time is under 15 minutes, ensuring that our clients receive timely support when they need it the most.  Efficient Resolution: Our effectiveness in addressing client issues is demonstrated by our ability to resolve 96% of all support tickets within the first hour. This efficiency minimizes disruptions and ensures that our clients can maintain their operational tempo without unnecessary delays.  Round-the-Clock Support: Recognizing that healthcare doesn't adhere to a 9-to-5 schedule, we've developed a 24/7 knowledge center. This allows our clients to access vital information and support at any hour, ensuring they have the resources they need to make informed decisions and address issues promptly.  Personalized Support: To further tailor our support, we provide dedicated client support staff to each account, ensuring that our clients have a go-to expert familiar with their specific needs and history. For larger clients, we also offer an executive sponsor, creating a direct line to our senior leadership for strategic guidance and support.  Our approach to customer service is more than just solving problems; it's about providing a seamless, supportive experience that empowers our clients to achieve their goals. At Avidon Health, we don't just come through for our clients no matter what—we set new standards for what our clients should expect from their digital health partners.

column67: The implementation process is planned and managed by our Director of Client Solutions and may take anywhere from less than a week to 2 months or more depending on size and complexity.   In addition to the self-developed configuration tools within our own Engagement Rx platform, we leverage appropriate administrative tools to plan, track, and collaborate. These vary with the complexity of each implementation, and at a baseline include Microsoft tools (Excel for checklists, Teams for collaboration, Planner, Visio, etc.). All tools meet the standards of our ISO 27001 certified ISMS.  Implementation is split into 4 phases, with the completion date of each phase acting as a key deadline: discovery/exploration, configuration, training/pre-implementation, and admin/coach implementation as needed. Please see the timeline page 6 the of the attached document, Sample Implementation Kickoff Meeting PPT, for more details.  To ensure a smooth and timely process, the implementation team reviews the status of all clients in the implementation phase in a weekly meeting held with Sales, Product, Operations, and Client Success.

column74: We tailor the communication and engagement strategy to fit each client's needs and capabilities. We provide some clients with comprehensive multi-channel outreach campaigns (email, text, outbound calls); others simply leverage our member engagement expertise and engagement tools (surveys, quizzes, landing pages, promotional flyer templates, custom user experiences) to support their own outreach efforts.  Our overall strategy is to develop our communications using the following key principles as guidelines:  - Audience-centric (considers demographics, culture, health status, socio-economics, etc.) - User-friendly (clear, simple language and warm, caring tone) - Intentional (benefit-driven, clear call-to-action) - "Sales funnel" approach (one action leads to another) - Multi-channel (email, text, outbound calling, etc.) - Regular (frequent enough to hit readiness-for-change cycles without being annoying)

column101: Using a new approach to data science and novel financial incentives, we help patients identify and access the highest-quality medical care. Garner provides health reimbursement arrangement (HRA) administration services, concierge services, and doctor search services, including services that enable its clients to reimburse their plan members’ medical expenses where such members use the Garner-provided app or concierge to select Garner-recommended doctors. Garner has a diverse customer base, as its services can be relevant to any employer that offers a group health plan to its employees within the US.
column103: SPDs: Garner provides template SPD language for client review. Nondiscrimination Testing: Employers can vary Garner HRA incentives by employee type so long as it doesn't have the effect of giving better benefits predominantly to highly-compensated employees. Garner does not complete NDT but can provide data for the client’s administrator to do so. Schedule A: Garner does not provide Schedule A to its clients, because the Garner HRA is a self-funded (self-insured) group benefit plan that is administered by Garner pursuant to an Administrative Services Only contract. Schedule A therefore does not need to be filed for the Garner HRA on its own. SBC: We will provide a template SBC to the client. Ultimately the SBC is the responsibility of the plan sponsor—i.e., the employer—to complete. The template that we provide is just guidance. If the employer would like to revise the SBC, that is their right. We only ask that such revisions be checked with Garner first to make sure they don't materially misrepresent the Garner HRA. Outside Counsel: Garner utilizes specialized outside counsel to proactively stay abreast to evolving regultory requirements, ensuring our adherence to ERISA standards and licensing obligations.
column106: If an individual elects COBRA continuation coverage, then the client is legally required to offer the Garner HRA for the duration of the COBRA coverage. For our fully-insured clients, the amount an employee can be charged is equivalent to 102% of the PEPM funding amount that the employer would have to set aside anyway. Our clients are welcome to consult their own benefits lawyers on this issue, and we can't offer legal advice to them about COBRA.
column109: PCORI: The way this requirement applies to them differs depending on whether the client has a self-funded or fully-insured major medical health plan:  Fully Insured: Employer will be subject to PCORI fees for the Garner HRA. Normally, when an employer only has a fully-insured major medical health plan, the insurer (e.g., Aetna, United, Cigna, etc.) pays the PCORI fees, and the employer doesn't have to worry about them. But the Garner HRA is technically a tiny self-funded group health plan, so the employer owes PCORI fees just for having Garner. (This is true even if the Garner HRA is layered on top of a fully-insured major medical health plan.) Third party administrators like us are not allowed to pay the fee on behalf of the client.  ASO: Having the HRA doesn't require employers to pay anything extra for PCORI. So those clients shouldn't need to do anything special to satisfy the PCORI requirement just because they have the Garner HRA. SPDs: Garner provides template SPD language for client review. Nondiscrimination Testing: Employers can vary Garner HRA incentives by employee type so long as it doesn't have the effect of giving better benefits predominantly to highly-compensated employees. Garner does not complete NDT but can provide data for the client’s administrator to do so. Schedule A: Garner does not provide Schedule A to its clients, because the Garner HRA is a self-funded (self-insured) group benefit plan that is administered by Garner pursuant to an Administrative Services Only contract. Schedule A therefore does not need to be filed for the Garner HRA on its own.  SBC: We will provide a template SBC to the client. Ultimately the SBC is the responsibility of the plan sponsor—i.e., the employer—to complete. The template that we provide is just guidance. If the employer would like to revise the SBC, that is their right. We only ask that such revisions be checked with Garner first to make sure they don't materially misrepresent the Garner HRA.
column111: SPDs: Garner provides template SPD language for client review. SBC: We will provide a template SBC to the client. Ultimately the SBC is the responsibility of the plan sponsor—i.e., the employer—to complete. The template that we provide is just guidance. If the employer would like to revise the SBC, that is their right. We only ask that such revisions be checked with Garner first to make sure they don't materially misrepresent the Garner HRA. Form 5500: Garner can provide clients with a Form 5500 letter detailing guidance on whether they may need to file the Form 5500; ultimately, it is the responsibility of the plan sponsor—i.e., the employer—to complete and file.

column127: The general rule is that employer reimbursements for health expenses through the Garner HRA incentive are 100% deductible as ordinary business expenses under Section 162 of the Code. However, Garner can’t comment on an individual employer’s tax situation (and there are limitations for self-employed individuals such as 2% shareholders of subchapter s corporations). Garner can't give tax advice and the employer should consult with a tax attorney who is familiar with the particulars of their business.
