column40: As a recognized thought leader, Crossover has remained at the forefront of innovation and best practices, including care delivery enhancements, health outcomes measurement, regulatory and compliance in the corporate practice of medicine, and demonstrating a return on investment for employer sponsors. While other vendors have had to focus a large portion of their development budgets into assimilating various technologies resulting from mergers and acquisitions, Crossover has been able to dedicate resources solely to increasing value for our customers over the last 13+ years. Several areas where Crossover distinguishes itself are outlined further below.  1) Simplifying the patient-provider relationship: We believe our greatest innovation related to patient care is that we have made it easy to receive care and restored faith in the patient-provider relationship. At Crossover, it is easy to schedule an appointment with your provider, easy to message, easy to check in, and easy to pay. There is no wait. It is easy to receive acute care, get referred to specialists, and maintain your health record across providers. It is easy to build a relationship with your provider and follow through with a recovery plan. All of the investments we have made in care delivery make it easier for employees to return to a state of wellbeing quickly and increase satisfaction because they know that every Crossover provider has their best interest in mind. For us, the simplicity of building great relationships with our clients' employees is the greatest innovation!  2) Primary Health as a platform: We believe in the power of our “Connected System of Health” to guide members through an entire episode of care, as an injury or illness can have an enormous impact on a company's medical spend due to the need for follow-up care or condition management. We believe our Connected System of Health brings a superior patient experience, enhanced clinical efficiency and quality, and provides the member with a concierge-esque experience that is managed with efficiency and cost control in mind.  3) One size does not fit all: We are not an off-the-shelf solution. Crossover is focused on operational excellence and has a number of proven, scaled systems and practices to ensure we are maximizing budgets and client-specific goals. However, we deploy an adaptable approach to engage a range of populations across all 50 states. We are honored to work with our clients every step of the way to increase benefit awareness and utilization. We thrive in partnering with health activist employers to continue creating innovative solutions and tailoring ideas and results for their unique employee subsets at every stage in their company's growth. Our flexibility to respond, create, and adapt for employers has become increasingly important as care teams become a critical part of addressing social determinants of health (SDOH) within a population through their trusted relationships with the members.   To note, Crossover's differentiators have afforded us the following outcomes: 98% client retention, 90 NPS, and 81% of users have named us their medical home.

Members are reassured that their after-hours care is provided by on-call Crossover providers who can begin and document an urgent care plan that the member's main care team can easily continue during normal operating hours. column55: Crossover takes a team-based approach to Account Management to ensure an exceptional level of customer service along with strategic discussions based on data. Clinical governance is also a key component of ensuring quality care is delivered and metrics are attained.  Crossover's Account Management team includes an Account Principal, Associate Account Principal, and Client Success Manager. The Account Principal is responsible for development of the client strategy and serves as an expert on Crossover best practices. The Account Principal will also serve as backup to the Associate Account Principal should they be out of the office on PTO or because of illness, etc. The Associate Account Principal serves as the client's direct point of contact and handles day-to-day initiatives/reporting on key performance indicators, etc. The Client Success Manager is responsible for driving engagement associated with the client's health center to include planning events, implementing campaigns, and deploying surveys to identify barriers in care. Every client has a designated (occasionally dedicated, depending on the partnership model) account team.   Crossover's clinical team takes a similar approach to supporting our clients as well as onsite health center services. Our Medical Directors along with Practice Managers work together to provide the clinical oversight and governance as well as provide additional clinical expertise for client-related questions.  In summary, the Crossover Account Management and Medical Group work together to ensure Crossover is achieving the "Quadruple Aim:” 1) highest quality of care, 2) decreased spend, 3) superior patient experience, and 4) strong employee/provider engagement.

All Positions Crossover Health completes a background check and obtains primary source verification of a minimum of two (2) references for initial credentialing and for re-credentialing, compensation reviews, and to handle any related medical verifications. We monitor for disciplinary actions in all states, criminal convictions, malpractice claims, and settlements with the national practitioner database, and disqualify candidates accordingly.
column67: At Crossover, our implementation program has been derived from our experience launching health centers over the past decade plus. We have an internally developed methodology that is designed to ensure successful launches with a minimal time commitment from our clients. We leverage project plans that are organized by workstreams, with clearly defined milestones to keep focus on our deliverables and timeline. To date we have launched 47 health centers in 11 different states, and with our 4 virtual care teams we are providing access to healthcare for our members in all 50 states. All implementations are workstream-based, timeline-focused, and design-oriented.   Our approach to implementations is based on The Waterfall Method - with our project requirements and activities organized by workstreams. We start with Procurement, where we leverage our contracts, in addition to information gathered from our implementation discovery work, to create our project plan. The additional workstreams build off one another and flow from Eligibility & Services, to Benefits, Staffing, Facilities, Technology, Engagement, which includes member communications, and ultimately Operations. We use the Operations Workstream to ensure that the full scope of our implementation is accounted for, planned for, and completed leading up to our launch date. Project milestones are scheduled based on the implementation discovery work as well as project requirements, and work is tracked via detailed implementation checklists throughout the course of the project.   One of the project management techniques that we apply to our implementations is the critical path method - where we identify the tasks that are necessary for project completion - and then work through their dependencies and time requirements. This helps us identify and mitigate risks, in support of keeping our schedule on track. There are typically eight critical paths that come into play with our implementations, including the minimum lead time required to complete each item, and the corresponding dependencies.

column74: The role of Crossover's Client Success Manager (CSM) and our in-house Client Marketing (Engagement) Team is to drive ongoing engagement by bringing awareness of health center services and wellness initiatives to a client's eligible employee and dependent population. Crossover seeks to partner with the employers to deploy a strategy based on what they have built to date, identifying best practices for communication and engagement.  In addition, Crossover can serve as a "force multiplier" of our customers' benefits ecosystem to coordinate and facilitate wellness programs and incentives. A recent example is a client's wellness coordinator had identified specific dates to hold mobile mammogram testing events. Our CSM was informed in advance and began actively promoting the event through her channels as well as through the health center to encourage strong attendance.   Typical launch communications for eligibles can include: • Virtual launch event • Launch toolkit: Potential for co-branding across creative assets and copy • Activation emails: Sent to all eligibles (details to be agreed upon in client plan) • Direct mail: To reach eligibles and dependents at home • Digital advertisements: Awareness ads across social media and selective/non-invasive retargeting ads • Additional collateral: Benefits flier provided in printable PDF form and on-campus signage • Support services: Access to Crossover support webpage, educational content, and live-chat and phone support  Crossover includes a full slate of ongoing communications for members post-opening in our pricing, such as:   • Welcome email: Co-branded design, automatically sent upon members completing their activation • Monthly member emails: Clinician-led content based on important health issues and highlighting specific services as appropriate • Invitations to live webinars: Hosted by Crossover providers discussing important health issues and resources available through Crossover • Automated, targeted emails by behavior (e.g., newly eligible, activated but not yet received care, etc.) • Care platform communications: To engage members 1:1 and deliver appointment reminders, personalized follow-up messages during and after care, post-care surveys, and relevant information on new services • Appointment confirmations and reminders • Post-care user surveys and referral emails • Survey and referral thank you mailings

column79: Research has shown that a diverse and representative health care workforce improves patients’ access to care, their perceptions of the care they receive, and their health outcomes. Studies also show measurable gains in access, quality, and health outcomes when patients’ health care teams mirror their personal characteristics, and that it can reduce medical bias and increase identification of diseases and conditions which are more likely to affect only a certain sub-population. Accordingly, Crossover prioritizes diversity in hiring.   With regard to outward-facing initiatives for diverse populations, we have clinical programs that can be tailored to the needs of specific segments. For example, we provide training and education on transgender care issues so that our providers are skilled at addressing the needs of this community. We also promote population-specific interventions, such as Hepatitis B screenings amongst those who were born in Asia or who have parents born in Asia.   Our environment encourages and enforces the following "operating behaviors:" respectful communication and cooperation between all employees, teamwork and employee participation, permitting the representation of all groups and employee perspectives, and employer and employee contributions to the communities we serve—all in order to promote a greater understanding of, and respect for, diversity.  We not only celebrate our diverse workforce at Crossover, we also embrace inclusivity and belonging through representation and action. Each year, employees across all teams have the opportunity to serve on the Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging (DIB) team. The DIB team curates speakers to help facilitate open BIPOC dialog, sponsors group challenges to share unique ethnic and LGBTQ+ experiences, and provides scholarships and awards for employees who exemplify the core mission of DIB.

column92: Crossover’s Tableau-enabled, on-demand client dashboard is made available for ease of reporting in order to provide real-time progress tracking and transparency into performance guarantees and other KPIs. All of these reports can be viewed by client, by clinic, and in aggregate: •Executive Summary View: Overview of the most requested key metrics, including member penetration, lifetime unique member count, current eligible members, and number of verified accounts; shows current net promoter and member satisfaction scores; illustrates overall trends in utilization and satisfaction •Visit Data & Utilization by Service Line: These metrics—number of visits, capacity, and utilization—are adjustable to specific date ranges •No-Shows & Late Cancellation Data: By service type and by member volume •Member Penetration: Members that have utilized the health center in comparison to the total eligible population •Post-Visit Survey Results & Comments: Including NPS, member satisfaction, and wait times, as well as qualitative de-identified comments from members •Utilization Breakdown: By new users and existing members •Secure Messaging: Number sent between members and Crossover providers and staff •Account Creation Metrics: Showing accounts that have been activated over time
column98: Director of Clinical Quality and Compliance
column101: Primary Care: At Crossover, we believe that Primary Care necessitates a longitudinal relationship aimed at addressing the holistic, interconnected needs of a member, with an emphasis on improving overall health and wellbeing. While many solutions address ~30 simple conditions, we offer a full range of Primary Care services, inclusive of preventive care and screenings, diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic conditions, and addressing social determinants of health (SDOH). Our integrated care teams can manage acute and chronic illness, routine check-ups, sick visits, prescriptions, and more.  Mental Health: Crossover's approach to Behavioral/Mental Health consists of evidence-based care that is goal-focused, measurement-based, focused on member empowerment and independence, and delivered in a culturally competent manner with an ongoing emphasis on reducing stigma attached to mental health struggles and treatment. Our Mental Health providers (psychologists, therapists, and social workers) are qualified to diagnose and treat a wide range of conditions and disorders that affect emotional wellbeing, including work-related stress and anxiety, personal and professional relationship issues, couples' counseling, sleep issues, depression and anxiety, trauma, and medication management.   Physical Medicine: Crossover's comprehensive Physical Medicine program offers industry-leading treatment efficiency and effectiveness benchmarking. Our physical therapy evaluation embodies all aspects of sound musculoskeletal care: in-depth history-taking, exploration for the cause of the member's symptoms, and customized treatments based on a thorough and thoughtful exam. Risk stratification tools, like the STarT Back Tool, help our therapists identify members who might benefit from immediate telehealth services (such as exercise instruction) and/or on-demand educational resources (such as those from our Be Well program) that do not require in-person visits.  Health Coaching: Crossover Health Coaches know that staying committed to a healthy lifestyle is not always easy. Experts in motivation, the coaches will learn what drives an individual and the behaviors that can shape (or challenge) their progress. They will help set realistic goals and inspire the member to stay on track as they work together—at the member's own pace and via unlimited coaching sessions—to reach them.  Occupational Medicine: Under the direction of our Director of Occupational Medicine, who is board certified in Occupational Medicine and has 10 years of experience, Crossover is expanding our scope to include a full complement of services for the prevention, screening, and treatment of work-related injuries and illnesses.   Pediatrics: Crossover’s virtual Pediatrics offering, provided by our partner Blueberry Pediatrics, supports unlimited pediatric urgent care services 24/7 (including holidays) via asynchronous messaging or synchronous virtual visits. Blueberry Pediatrics can provide services to most states and continues to expand their national footprint.  Navigation: Crossover’s Navigation services incorporate Member Support, Referral Management, and Benefits Advocacy. In short, Member Support helps navigate members within Crossover (e.g., answering questions about Crossover services); Referral Management helps navigate members to care and services outside of Crossover (e.g., referrals to in-network, lowest cost, highest quality specialists); and Benefits Advocacy helps address other member issue sets (e.g., questions on insurance, coverage and bills, and other employer-provided benefits).  Core “Primary Health” Services (available in Onsites, Nearsites, and Virtually): Primary Care, Mental Health, Physical Medicine, Health Coaching, Care Navigation  Sample Optional Additional Onsite Services: Dermatology, Allergy, Optometry, Pediatrics, Psychiatry, Fitness
column104: Crossover is not a health plan and is not subject to ERISA.
column107: Crossover is a healthcare provider, not a benefits plan. However, to the extent an employer makes Crossover's services available to its benefits plan members, the employer may be required to continue to provide access to Crossover's services to COBRA enrollees. We recommend clients consult with their own legal counsel on this topic/related topics.
column117: If an employer pays for all or part of the services Crossover provides to its employees and their dependents in exchange for services provided by the employee, then those services would likely be considered a fringe benefit under the Internal Revenue Code. Employers should consult with their own tax advisors and legal counsel to determine whether and to what extent the value of those services would be considered subject to withholding and employment taxes. This determination would need to be made on a facts and circumstances basis and Crossover cannot provide tax or legal advice to its clients.  The service we offer is health care, which when paid for by the employer is considered a fringe benefit. As noted above, Crossover cannot provide tax or legal advice to clients, and recommends they consult with their own tax and legal advisors.
column119: As noted previously, clients should consult with their own tax and legal advisors.
column124: Crossover has a Quality and Compliance Department and a Compliance Committee of senior leaders that support Crossover's compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, and that oversee Crossover's compliance policies and procedures. To the extent a client has a compliance concern, those matters can be escalated through the client's account manager to Crossover's Compliance Committee and Director of Quality and Compliance, which can evaluate and address such matters. In addition, Crossover's Legal Department supports Crossover's compliance functions by providing legal advice and participating in the Compliance Committee. While Crossover's Legal Department can collaborate with a client's legal counsel on compliance matters within our contracts and on operational compliance questions related to Crossover's services, pursuant to state bar association ethics rules, Crossover’s attorneys cannot provide legal advice to clients. We recommend clients seek independent legal advice about their own compliance requirements.

column55: At Bright Horizons, our mission is to provide innovative solutions that make a difference in the lives of others. This shared goal motivates our employees to aim for excellence in a supportive environment where we do work that makes an impact on hundreds of thousands of lives each day.
column56: Back-Up Care Care Consultants receive a minimum of 80 hours of in-classroom instruction on Bright Horizons services and policies, call-handling skills, internal processes/metrics, and the customer management platform. Our instruction methods include lecture, hands-on learning, game-based learning, peer-to-peer teaching, on-the-job observation, and reverse observation. Consultants are assessed at the end of training with a written test and call scoring. Upon completion, consultants spend an additional 80 hours of on-the-job training for iterative skill development, with dedicated peer assistance.  Our Provider Accounts team is dedicated to recruiting, credentialing, contracting, and monitoring our provider network. Providers are subject to an extensive review prior to being added to the network and are constantly monitored for performance through comprehensive relationship management and quality assurance program. We continually monitor utilization to create care supply to meet demand.  Our center-based care network is comprised of Bright Horizons managed high-quality centers, centers accredited by the National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC) operated by other providers, and centers that operate at teacher/child ratios and with teacher qualifications that could be accredited by NAEYC. All centers must conform to local licensing requirements for background checks and screening of criminal history, etc. Additionally, all providers in the network are required to submit valid licenses and certificates of the insurance they carry.  In-home agencies admitted into the extended network employ their own caregivers and conform to the regulatory requirements of the state in which they operate—including compliance with required staff credentials and background screenings. Staff credentials are governed in part by each state’s standards and by agency policies. We do not allow our providers to use independent/1099 individual contractors to deliver network Back-Up Care. This differentiates the Bright Horizons program from other solutions that are serviced primarily through caregiver database platforms or reimbursement models.  Family Concierge Our Family Concierge team members have an extensive background in a variety of family support solutions, including in-home care/nanny placement, early childhood education, newborn care, Bright Horizons benefit partners, benefits advising, social work, school family supports, special needs, and elder care. The team also includes people with previous experience in lines of business like College Coach and Sittercity.   Bright Horizons Elder Care Care Coaches are experienced guides, able to help families navigate the uncertain phases of elder care, identify the right specialists, and find answers that meet dependent and family needs. Our Care Coaches provide guidance and referrals to vetted sources only.  Each meets the qualifications to be an Aging Life Care Professional, although they are not required to maintain active certification with the Aging Life Care Association (ALCA). That experience typically includes: • At least one degree in an elder care-related field (e.g., counseling, gerontology, mental health, nursing, occupational therapy, physical therapy, psychology, or social work) • Work in the direct practice, administration, or supervision of client-centered services to the elderly and their families • 2+ years of post-degree supervised experience in elder care management • At least one ALCA-approved certification (Care Manager Certified (CMC), Certified Case Manager (CCM), Certified Advanced Social Work Case Manager (C-ASWCM), Certified Social Work Case Manager (C-SWCM)).  College Coach Our College Coach team includes more than 70 former senior admissions and financial aid officers come from some of the nation’s leading universities. The team represents more than 900 collective years of experience in college admissions and financial aid, having decided on more than 525,000 college applications and more than $2.75 billion in financial aid before joining Bright Horizons. This unique full-time team of professionals builds and delivers all content, provides one-on-one counseling, and answers all questions.

column79: We work with employers to reflect their organizational values and the needs/expectations of their community.  Bright Horizons is committed to creating inclusive environments because diverse backgrounds, cultures, and experiences contribute to a shared experience where we are all better together. We support clients’ missions for DEI and associated personal and social determinants of health and well-being by providing: • Solutions to accessibility to affordable, high-quality, and inclusive care and education for all ages. • Solutions that help level playing fields for all employees regardless of salary or representation. • Thought leadership on health and well-being shared with clients and families including our Modern Family Index, webinars, resources, and collaborations with ERG groups.  Our diversity and inclusion strategy has four pillars:  1. Leadership, Capability, and Accountability  2. Inclusive Hiring and Retention  3. Culture, Customers, and Community 4. Talent Enablement  We are committed to:  • Acting with intention to embrace diversity at all levels of the organization and to encourage inclusion and respect by fostering an environment of mutual respect and development.  • Celebrating and valuing all people, inclusive of their diverse identities including all races, ethnicities cultures, religions, abilities, sexual orientations, gender identity and expression, ages, family structures, and economic status.  • Supporting our clients around the world in achieving their business and inclusion goals.  Examples of how Bright Horizons supports DEI include: • Leadership: Focus on better representation in leadership roles. • Corporate Responsibility: Commitment to CEO Action, the Hispanic Promise, & Human Right’s Campaign’s Business Coalition for the Equality Act; OneTen Developer; & member of The Tent Coalition for Afghan Refugees. • Inclusion Steering Committee: Provides DEI strategy direction & governance. • DEI Center for Excellence: Enables & guides organization on DEI strategy & outcomes. • DEI Enablement Team: Ensures all parts of organization are informed & equipped to move forward on our inclusion journey • Supplier Diversity Program: Only includes certified suppliers (MWBEs and HUBs); tracks Tier One & Tier Two spend • Partnerships with HBCUs: Committed to creating EdAssist partnerships with HBCUs. • College Coach Scholarships: Free College Coach access makes higher education accessible for students from diverse backgrounds. • Employee Resource Groups: Foster connection & awareness across Bright Horizons. • Education and Training: Multi-level diversity trainings for employees and managers including DEI certifications. • Classroom Curriculum: Inclusive environments & learning to promote relationships & empathy. • DEI Champions: Divisional volunteers working with center leadership & colleagues to support Inclusion Vision.

column40: We are the only solution exclusively focused on heart health, the leading cause of death in both men and women. We are 100% digital and use technology and behavior science to empower people to understand in improve their heart health.   - Our engagement and enrollment rates average higher than other condition management programs. We estimate 20% or more of the impacted population will enroll in year 1, with a 60% retention rate into year 2.   - Our proven clinical outcomes are 2x greater than our competitors. Published in both the AHA's Hypertension Journal and JAMA Network Open showing a 21 point drop in systolic blood pressure for our highest risk users.   - Our proven financial outcomes are measured across our variety of industries, showcasing a 2:1 ROI for our clients that are also backed by 100% fees at risk performance guarantees.   - Lastly, our network of contracting and billing partners make our implementation process a breeze. We can easily bill Hello Heart through claims as a preventative service to ensure ease and transparency in billing. No hidden contracting or file fees associated.

We have found that many of these programs are underutilized and have low engagement, so have crafted our program to maximize engagement with a fully digital coaching application.

This scientific backing ensures that the mental health interventions are not only effective but also deeply rooted in credible research, providing a more sophisticated approach compared to typical VR-based wellness or meditation apps.  AI-Powered Personalization: The use of advanced AI algorithms allows Reulay to deliver personalized mental health interventions tailored to the unique needs of each user. This personalization enhances the effectiveness of the interventions by aligning them closely with individual user profiles, which include emotional and psychological data.  Multi-Platform Accessibility: Unlike competitors that may focus solely on mobile or VR platforms, Reulay supports a broad array of devices including desktops, tablets, and VR systems. This versatility ensures that users can access therapeutic content in whatever format is most convenient for them, enhancing user engagement and adherence.  Integration with Healthcare Systems: Reulay seamlessly integrates with existing healthcare and employee assistance programs (EAPs), enhancing continuity of care. This capability allows Reulay to not only serve as a first point of care but also to escalate cases to other healthcare services when necessary, thus providing comprehensive support.  Cost-Effective Solutions with Measurable Analytics: Reulay equips organizations with tools to monitor and improve the mental health of their workforce effectively. The platform provides analytics that connects user engagement with actual health outcomes, helping organizations to measure the impact of their mental wellness investments and potentially reduce healthcare costs.  High Effectiveness and Engagement Rates: The AI-driven therapeutics offered by Reulay are reported to be significantly more effective than traditional mental health interventions. This effectiveness, paired with a user engagement rate that notably surpasses that of other apps, underscores the platform’s ability to deliver quick and substantial improvements in mental health.
column43: PEPM and Utilization based:  Access to the Reulay app is priced on an annual subscription basis to Employers based on total active seats (PPPM) or total employee size (PEPM):  PPPM (Price Per Participant Per Month): This rate varies depending on the number of active seats (users) within an enterprise, starting at ~$4 PEPM (Price Per Employee Per Month): This rate is determined by the total number of employees within an organization, regardless of the number of active seats, starting at ~$1.50

column55: At Reulay, our customer service philosophy is deeply rooted in our Reulay principle of "Lead with Light," emphasizing transparency, integrity, and guidance.   Proactive Support: Reulay anticipates customer needs and addresses potential issues before they become problems. This is facilitated by monitoring system performance and user feedback continuously to ensure that services are always functioning optimally.  Rapid Response: The company commits to notifying clients within 24 hours of any software interruptions or issues, demonstrating a responsive approach. The escalation process involves multiple tiers of support, beginning with the Head of Customer Success and moving up to the Chief Business Officer and CEO if necessary, ensuring that significant resources are dedicated to resolving critical issues promptly.  Tailored Solutions: Each client receives a customized Statement of Work that outlines specific services and support according to their unique needs. This tailored approach ensures that all aspects of service delivery are aligned with the client's expectations and requirements.  Comprehensive Training and Onboarding: Reulay provides detailed training and onboarding for new users to ensure they can fully leverage the platform’s capabilities. This education extends across all devices and platforms the software supports, ensuring a seamless user experience.  Empowering Users: Beyond solving immediate technical issues, Reulay's customer service focuses on empowering users with tools and knowledge to improve their engagement and outcomes with the platform. This includes educational materials and regular updates on new features and functionalities.  Accessible Communication Channels: Support is available through multiple channels, including email and phone, ensuring that clients can easily reach out in whatever way is most convenient for them during the designated support hours.
column56: Srini Pillay, M.D., serves as the Chief Medical Officer at Reulay. He is a distinguished psychiatrist and brain researcher, previously heading the Outpatient Anxiety Disorders Service and the Panic Disorders Research program at the Brain Imaging Center of McLean Hospital at Harvard Medical School. Dr. Pillay graduated top of his class in medical school and completed his residency as the top overall psychiatry resident at Harvard. His deep expertise in applied neuroscience and psychiatry forms the backbone of Reulay's therapeutic strategies, which are designed to measurably improve mental well-being. Dr. Pillay is also an acclaimed author and speaker, recognized among the top 20 movers and shakers in leadership development globally by Training Industry and is a member of the Transformational Leadership Council. He brings a unique blend of clinical practice, musical artistry, and leadership development to his role, enhancing the scientific foundation and innovation at Reulay.  Ravi Netravalli is the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) at Reulay, where he leverages his extensive expertise in systems and networking to enhance the company's technology infrastructure. Ravi holds a Ph.D. from MIT and is an Assistant Professor in the Computer Science Department at Princeton University. His research focuses on improving large-scale distributed applications, including video systems, machine learning training and inference platforms, and mobile apps, in terms of performance, debuggability, resource efficiency, and affordability. Before joining Princeton, Ravi was an Assistant Professor at UCLA from 2019 to 2021, and he has been recognized with a Sloan Research Fellowship, an NSF CAREER Award, and several industry awards from Google and Facebook. His work at Reulay is pivotal in developing AI-driven recommendation engines and ensuring that the solutions are scalable and effective.

column91: SSO Capabilities of Tuned Services Tuned is committed to providing seamless and secure access to our services, and we achieve this through our robust Single Sign-On (SSO) capabilities, implemented using Auth0. Our SSO solution offers flexibility and security for both employers and employees. Key Features of Our SSO Implementation: Auth0 Integration: Tuned utilizes Auth0, a leading identity management platform, to handle SSO. Auth0 provides a comprehensive suite of authentication and authorization features, ensuring secure and reliable user access. Flexible Authentication Options: Employers have the option to configure their preferred authentication methods: SSO Only: Employers can mandate SSO as the sole method for employees to access Tuned services. This ensures that employees can use their corporate credentials to log in, providing a unified and streamlined authentication experience. SSO and Email/Password: Alternatively, employers can choose to allow employees to sign in using either SSO or traditional email and password. This option offers additional flexibility, accommodating diverse user preferences and scenarios. Enhanced Security: By using Auth0, Tuned leverages advanced security features such as multifactor authentication (MFA), anomaly detection, and breach detection. These features help protect against unauthorized access and ensure that user credentials are secure. User Experience: Our SSO implementation is designed to enhance the user experience by reducing password fatigue and login friction. Employees can seamlessly access Tuned services with their existing corporate credentials, eliminating the need to remember multiple passwords. Scalability and Compliance: Auth0’s platform is highly scalable and compliant with industry standards such as GDPR, CCPA, and SOC 2. This ensures that Tuned’s SSO solution can grow with your organization and meet stringent regulatory requirements. Conclusion: Tuned’s SSO capabilities, powered by Auth0, offer a secure, flexible, and user-friendly authentication experience. Whether opting for SSO only or allowing both SSO and email/password logins, employers can confidently manage user access to our services with the assurance of top-tier security and compliance.

column104: "We have reviewed the question whether Tuned Care would be considered a health plan under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (“HIPAA”). Under HIPAA, a health plan means an individual or group plan that provides, or pays the cost of, medical care (as defined in section 2791(2) of the PHS Act, 42 U.S.C. 300gg91(a)(2)).  45 CFR § 160.103.  In this case, Tuned Care is a technology platform that connects employees to audiologists. The medical care is provided by the audiologists, and the cost is paid by the employer.  As such, we do not believe that Tuned Care itself would be considered a health plan subject to HIPAA; rather it acts as a business associate to the providers that provide the care directly to the employees." Groom Law Opinion

column40: Livez is pioneering the new era of preventive care - “Autonomous Prevention”.   A comprehensive solution for Personalized, Predictive, Proactive, Prevention (P4 Medicine), automated on employee’s mobile phones.   Livez transforms the mobile phone into a screening device, preventing & detecting 85% of disease early, for 100% of employees, impacting 75% of claims.  No known companies deliver holistic clinical prevention on mobile phones. Livez covers 50+ clinical domains, and 120+ screenings & vaccines, per employee’s unique risks. This includes personalized prevention for all cancers, heart conditions, diabetes, mental, maternal, sexual, MSK, and more… in one holistic platform. There are white glove solutions in our space (e.g. Mount Sinai Lab100), single biometric screenings solutions (Catapult), or highly expensive home kits for early detection of some diseases (LetsGetChecked, Grail).

column40: We are differentiated on several dimensions: - Value-based pricing with upside and downside risk - Individualized treatment matching across full solution spectrum (IBT, pharmacotherapy and bariatric), enabling us to act as the single front door to care - Most comprehensive care model that includes mental health and peer-based support in addition to obesity management and registered dietitians - Enterprise capabilities, including claims-based billing capability and robust analytics and reporting

column43: We contract on a capitated monthly rate, based on actively engaged members (i.e. must complete monthly clinical visits).  This rate includes a minimum number of visits and we take risk on incremental individual needs (e.g., additional mental health visits for individuals struggling with binge eating, etc.).  In addition, we provide downside performance guarantees and align upside payments to broad health outcomes, altogether putting 30-40% of total fees at risk.    Our base program fee is customizable to company culture and financial needs but generally ranges in the $100-125 per engaged member per month.
column54: Our Customer Support team is available from Monday-Sunday from 7am-10pm EST.
column55: At Ilant, we define and approach customer service on two crucial levels, reflecting our commitment to exceptional care and support.  Firstly, at the company level, we maintain a dedicated customer success team comprising implementation managers, account managers, and SLAs . We go beyond mere service provision; we tie our fees to the satisfaction of our employer benefits teams. This ensures that our support not only meets but exceeds expectations, aligning our success with the satisfaction of those we serve.  Secondly, at the member level, we prioritize creating a supportive and outstanding experience. We extend our support beyond traditional hours, offering customer support and clinical visits during nights and weekends. Our SLAs ensure that 95% of messages are responded to within one day, with first appointment wait times kept under seven days. Moreover, we hold ourselves accountable by putting fees at risk for these metrics alongside member satisfaction. By embedding these practices into our service ethos, we guarantee that each member receives the attention, care, and responsiveness they deserve throughout their journey with Ilant
column56: Care team is onshore and employed (W2) with experience across obesity treatment modalities:  Obesity Medicine Physicians: board-certified in Obesity Medline, active medical license and DEA, experience with range of medications & bariatric patients and using protocols & care pathways  Dietitian (Nutrition): active registered dietitian license, obesity medicine and bariatric experience  Mental Health Specialist: licensed Therapist: PhD, PsyD, LCSW, LPC, LMFT, experience with behavioral modalities, eating disorders, and compulsive behaviors  Peer Navigators: lived obesity & obesity treatment experience, healthcare-related professional experience preferred  Nurses: active RN license, obesity medicine & bariatric experience  Care team must complete Ilant training (~2-3 days) and assessments before seeing any member. Ongoing oversight and learning through weekly case reviews, ongoing training, and regular audits.
column67: Purpose-built to work with employers, we have invested in backend integrations to simplify implementation and have a structured process in-place to support robust transitions.  Each client has an assigned Implementation Manager (and Account Manager) that is responsible for delivering a successful implementation..  Implementation is conducted across three core workstreams:  1) Benefit Elections and Setup (completion expected 30-60 days after Kickoff): Initial efforts focus on finalizing benefit selections, including eligibility criteria for the Ilant Health program, executing the Master Services Agreement, and determining the billing method for rendered services (claims or direct billing) as well as member cost-sharing and any program incentives.  As part of this work, we confirm our ability to process eligibility via our Availity back-end integration.  2) Health and Wellness Benefit Coordination (completion expected 60-90 days after Kickoff): Starting two weeks after the kickoff, this phase involves integrating with relevant client Health and Wellness Benefit Suppliers of the employer. Key milestones for this workstream include: identifying Ilant Health providers with the PBM to enable seamless approval for anti-obesity medications (i.e. modifying PBM prior auth/stop), working with health plans/centers of excellence to understand existing networks and policies for lab orders (facilitated for Labcorp and Quest via our integrations) and bariatric surgery, coordinating with onsite clinics (where available), developing and distributing communication materials across health plan, PBM, and relevant vendors, and setting up warm transfer and coordination protocols across all benefit vendors (e.g., to mental health, from health plan care management, etc.)  3) Communication Strategy (completion 60-90 days after Kickoff):  Recognizing that employer will lead all the communication efforts, our goal is to provide materials that enable clear, non-judgemental information that aligns with the employer’s values and culture.  We provided recommended communication timelines and cadence as well as materials which are modified to use language that will resonate in the client environment (for example, we found for our tech/tech-adjacent clients "obesity treatment" and "metabolic health and wellness" resonated while for a manufacturing client we are currently rolling out, that was confusing and "weight loss" was better language.)  An important element of our communication strategy is to provide materials to proactively engage those in obesity treatment (e.g., on obesity medications) today as they may have more questions on a transition (and logistically need to ensure continuity of care).  The communication strategy is established early (by day 30-45) and launched prior to going live.
column73: Generally we would allow for termination on an annual renewal with a 90 day notice.
column74: For initial outreach, we find a multi-channel approach (e.g., email, mailer/postcard, benefits site, live webinar sessions, on-site signage) works best. Style of communication is critical - our messaging is non-judgemental and focuses on suggesting engagement to learn more (versus to start prescribed solution). Ability to use personal email and engaging through individuals with lived experience is helpful to reduce hesitancy (from concerns of being identified or judged).   A differentiator of our program is sustained engagement through concierge peer navigators. Borrowing from mental health and addiction, leveraging peer support with lived obesity experience increases trust between members and our program. Our peer navigators meet monthly with members via synchronous video visits, and proactively outreach via phone, text, email to members in between visits with reminders, encouragement, and educational support.
column79: We support DEI in several ways: Our treatment recommendations take into account who our members are and their Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) (e.g., are they able to regularly eat food with medications, can they manage nausea while on their job, etc.)  Our approach to nutrition and movement is culturally competent and socio-economically sensitive. We recognize some members may eat largely from fast food/cafeterias, may buy groceries at dollar stores, or may need to make meals palpable for the whole family. We focus on enabling better choices within the context of a member’s life, not prescribing specific requirements.  Our peer navigators are matched by affinity, and our overall care team is as diverse as the members we serve, with 45% of our care team identifying as white, 36% black, 9% hispanic, and 9% asian.  We are also proud to share that many members of our leadership team and care team have lived obesity experience and many are from diverse groups (women, LGBTQIA+).

column40: Ahara identifies your 3 key nutrients for symptom reduction and tells you where to find those nutrients. We are not selling you food, costly testing, or a weight loss culture. Our solution focuses on optimizing health and productivity instead of a number on a scale. Ahara is different than other solutions in key ways:  Personalized – Our proprietary algorithm mimics and physician nutritionists consult and generates different recommendations for each person based on health history, diet, environment, and selected goals. (An individual can also choose to layer on biomarker, genetic and epigenetic tests for added precision, plus nutritionist consultations.)   Food First – Nutrients are best absorbed through food. Supplementation is recommended only where nutrients cannot be achieved through food alone.     Science Backed – Mapping the latest research to symptoms to nutrients. Ahara’s algorithm was developed by an international team of physician nutrition specialists, researchers, and PhD’s in nutrition science.   Accessible. $10 per year for our Foundational Plan.

column40: It’s about Time; 73% of U.S. workers have some level of caregiving responsibilities and 80% of those caregivers admitted that their caregiving responsibilities affected their productivity at work. This work is not divided fairly, and this dynamic is making families miserable, burning out primary caregivers, and it’s costing companies trillions of dollars. It’s time for a solution.  Persist solves these individual and corporate problems by combining psychology and technology to make households function better; unlocking TIME for its users by more efficiently distributing domestic responsibilities.  Persist is a tool that creates shared awareness of all the work it takes to keep a household functioning, along with resources to help distribute that work more fairly, and outsource when there simply isn't enough time.

column40: INTRODUCING DOKTORCONNECT  ABOUT DOKTORCONNECT (HEALTH AND WELLNESS PLATFROM)     DoktorConnect offers a comprehensive digital health platform that leverages personalized medical care through wellness-based assessments, genetic analysis, mental health screening, and advanced technologies. By analyzing genetic data and wellness metrics, we create evidence-based lifestyle management plans for individuals. Our platform enables virtual consultations with licensed doctors, therapists, dieticians, and health coaches, along with real-time vital signs tracking using smart medical IoT devices. We also integrate AI-driven methodologies to promote healthy behaviors, lifestyle modifications, medication management, and tailored exercise regimens.     Doktorconnect Digital Assets   Website   www.doktorconnect.com/us www.doktorconnect.com/ng  MOBILE WELLNESS UNIT  https://bit.ly/mobile-wellness-van  https://bit.ly/wellness-on-the-move  PREVENTIVE HEALTH AND WELLNESS SAMPLE RESULT  Sample result of our wellness report  - https://bit.ly/wellnessreportsample   Sample result of DNA report  https://bit.ly/dna-analysis-report   APP DEMO  Doktorconnect App Demo - https://bit.ly/DoktorconnectAppDemo  REMOTE MONITORING AND DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS  LifePro Body Composition SmartScale - https://bit.ly/BodyCompositionSmartScale  6-in-1 Health Monitor - https://bit.ly/6-in-1HealthMonitor  Lifepro Sleep Monitor - https://bit.ly/LifeproSleepMonitor  Wellness Portal training   https://bit.ly/demo-doktorconnect  AI Vital Update  https://bit.ly/healthyfai-demo  RPM SAMPLE RESULT WITH INTERPRETATION   Sample result of RPM monthly report with a six-month doctor’s review - https://bit.ly/MonthlyHealthHistoryReport   We are about to launch in Marseille, France and Doha, Qatar.  USP  Doktorconnect's unique selling points and competitive advantages lie in several key areas:  STRENGTHS  1. Comprehensive Wellness-Based Approach: Doktorconnect sets itself apart by taking a holistic approach to healthcare that encompasses physical, mental, and emotional well-being. This approach helps in addressing the root causes of health issues and promoting overall wellness. 2. Genetic Analysis: By offering genetic analysis services, Doktorconnect enables personalized and precision medicine tailored to each individual's genetic makeup. This can lead to more targeted treatments and prevention strategies for various health conditions. 3. Mental Health Assessment: Doktorconnect's inclusion of mental health assessment services demonstrates a commitment to addressing the often overlooked but critically important aspect of mental well-being. This comprehensive approach helps in identifying and managing mental health issues effectively. 4. Remote Patient Monitoring Capabilities: Doktorconnect's remote patient monitoring capabilities provide convenience and accessibility for patients, allowing for continuous monitoring of health metrics and proactive interventions when necessary. This can lead to early detection of health issues and better management of chronic conditions.  Overall, Doktorconnect's unique selling points and competitive advantages lie in our proactive and comprehensive approach to healthcare, personalized genetic analysis services, focus on mental health, and convenient remote patient monitoring capabilities, all of which contribute to improved patient outcomes and overall well-being.

Onboard the company onto our dashboard. 3. Initiate the onboarding process by having employees download the app. 4. Verify individual profiles with HR or Sequoia. 5. Allow the scheduling of appointments within the app. 6. Deploy onsite wellness as per employer request.  Critical Deadlines:  1. All new hires must be onboarded within 30 days. 2. Any terminations or resignations must be reported within 72 hours. 3. Eligible employees must be notified two weeks prior to the annual wellness screening. 4. Eligible dependents must be submitted in writing by the employee and verified by the employer two weeks before the annual wellness screening. 5. Any other critical deadlines will be industry-specific.  Tools Used:  HR management tool as per Sequoia or the direct employer.
column74: Communication Strategy for Wellness Benefits  To enhance employee wellness and ensure that each member of our team is aware of the benefits available to them, we have developed a comprehensive communication plan. Here is an overview:  1. Each employee will receive a personalized welcome email from DoktorConnect, introducing our wellness program and services.  2. Detailed information about DoktorConnect and the services we offer will be electronically shared with all employees.  3. Employees will be informed about the specific wellness benefits covered under our program.  4. Guidance on how to prepare for the annual wellness screening will be provided to help employees make the most of this opportunity.  5. Individualized results from wellness screenings will be shared with employees in a confidential manner, ensuring their privacy is respected.  6. Employees will also be informed about additional services available to them, either covered by the employer or as optional benefits they can choose to utilize for their well-being.  By implementing this communication strategy, we aim to promote employee well-being and encourage active participation in our wellness program.
column79: To support diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) within Doktorconnect or any organization, there are several resources and ways to provide support internally and externally:  1.Diversity Training: We offer training sessions or workshops on DEI topics to employees at all levels. This can help increase awareness, understanding, and respect for diversity within the workforce.  2. Diverse Recruitment: Implement inclusive recruitment practices to attract a diverse pool of candidates. This can include using diverse job boards, removing bias from job descriptions, and having diverse interview panels.  3. Employee Resource Groups (ERGs): Create ERGs that provide a platform for employees to come together based on shared identities or interests. These groups can offer support, networking opportunities, and advocacy for underrepresented employees.  4. Mentorship and Sponsorship Programs: Establish mentorship programs where senior employees can mentor and support junior employees from underrepresented groups. Additionally, sponsorship programs can help advance the careers of these employees by providing visibility and advocacy.  5. Regular DEI Check-Ins: Conduct regular check-ins to gauge the effectiveness of DEI initiatives, gather feedback from employees, and make necessary adjustments to ensure inclusivity.  6. Partnerships with Diverse Organizations: Collaborate with external organizations that focus on diversity and inclusion to exchange best practices, participate in events, and broaden the network of diverse talent.  7. Policy Reviews:  Review company policies and procedures to ensure they support DEI goals. This can include policies related to recruitment, promotions, compensation, and employee benefits.  8. Transparency and Accountability: Communicate openly about DEI efforts, progress, challenges, and goals within the organization. Hold leadership and teams accountable for actively supporting DEI initiatives.  By implementing these resources and approaches, Doktorconnect can actively support a diverse workforce and create an inclusive environment for all employees.

column40: Our differentiators include:  Comprehensive Program Offerings: We provide a wide range of programs including Healthy Weight, GLP-1 Companion, Weight Maintenance, Clinician-Guided Therapy, Health & Wellness (Prevention), Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP), Diabetes Care Program, and Hypertension Care Program. Each program is designed to address specific health needs and includes personalized coaching, live coaching visits, and customer support.  Technology Integration: Our programs leverage digitally connected devices such as weight scales, glucometers, test strips, lancets, and blood pressure cuffs to provide real-time data and personalized coaching.  Evidence-Based Approach: We use clinically validated screeners and assessments, such as PHQ-2 for depression, MAQ for medication non-adherence, and CDC prediabetes risk assessment, to ensure our programs are based on industry best practices and evidence-based guidelines.  Customization and Flexibility: Our solutions can be customized to meet the specific needs of participants, ensuring that each member receives the most relevant and effective support.  Extensive Support Network: We offer live webinars, recorded content, and program-specific online peer support groups to provide continuous support and engagement for our members.

column54: Hours of customer support operation are 6:00am-5:30pm PT (9:00am - 8:30pm ET), seven days a week.
column55: For members, Lark's Customer Support experience strives to be a compassionate extension of Lark. Members can contact Customer Support via email, webform, Facebook, automated chat, or schedule a phone appointment with our team. Hours of customer support operation are 6:00am-5:30pm PT (9:00am - 8:30pm ET), seven days a week. After a user contacts our Customer Support team, we open a ticket in our ticketing system and are dedicated to resolving it quickly. Any ticket will remain open until the member issue has been resolved in full. Member satisfaction is measured after each closed inquiry, with a current satisfaction rate of 90% over the last six months. Lark tracks and reports on Customer Support trends during business reviews.   For partners, Lark's dedicated Account Manager serves as a single point of contact for escalations, issues, and action items. The Account Manager is accessible via phone call, email, or text message and typically responds the same day.
column56: Lark AI Coach Credentials: Lark is certified as a qualified health educator through the Department of Health and Human Services (NPI: 1114438157). Lark’s AI coaching, educational curricula and outcome measures are all are designed in accordance with guidelines from leading healthcare institutions, including the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), American Diabetes Association (ADA), American Heart Association (AHA), Health and Human Services (HHS), Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), American College of Cardiology (ACC), the Diabetes Education Accreditation Program (DEAP), Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA), and the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ). Additionally, our weight management programs are built on the pillars of our Diabetes Prevention Program, which is fully recognized by the Centers for Disease Control (CDC).   The Lark AI Coach is the foundation of the member's care team delivering 24x7x365 personalized, holistic coaching.  Live Health Coaches  Credentials: All of Lark’s Health Coaches meet the minimum requirements of a CDC-recognized Lifestyle Coach certification but may have further training and education.  Lark’s Health Coaching services are performed under direct supervision of a Certified Diabetes Care and Education Specialist (CDCES) who is under direct supervision of an MD. When members choose to pursue live coaching they are assigned to a primary coach Affiliated Provider Network Clinicians  Credentials: In Lark’s Clinician Guided Therapy program, members have access to US-based, board certified providers (with individual NPI numbers) who are trained in primary care as a specialty, at a minimum. This includes MD and DOs.   Providers within the affiliated network are credentialed to NCQA standards and receive a background check upon hire. They are trained on HIPAA compliant processes and Lark programs, policies and guidelines, technology, and overall expectations. All care is subject to a rigorous clinical quality assurance program.
column65: Lark's NPS scores range between 43-64, with variation among various program configurations and user populations.
column67: A Lark implementation is primarily led by a dedicated Implementation Manager with oversight from our Director of Operations.   The Implementation Manager is responsible for guiding Lark's clients through the implementation, managing the implementation timeline, and identifying and communicating identified risks during the implementation timeline. Your Implementation Manager will review the timeline and plan milestones on a weekly basis during the status calls.   Additionally, the assigned Account Executive and Account Manager participate in the implementation process beginning with the kick-off meeting and throughout the project to ensure a seamless transition of account knowledge and high-level of client support post implementation.  Lark subject matter experts from Marketing, Clinical Operations, Customer Support, and other teams may join the calls to support if there are specific topic areas that require in depth review.   Behind the scenes, your implementation will be supported by the entire Lark team including teams from Marketing, Finance, Engineering, Product, Customer Support, Operations, Legal and Security.  Please find a copy of the template Implementation Kick Off presentation attached. This presentation is customized based on the scope of the project.  Lark also maintains templates for requirements gathering sessions to walk customers through the configuration options. This includes visual aids of the decisions, discussions of trade offs of each decision, and Lark’s recommendation for your specific use case. The goal is to enable our customer teams to quickly make an informed decision about the Lark implementation options.
column73: Due to implementation costs associated with launching new customers, Lark does not typically agree to termination for convenience provisions. However, we can negotiate a termination for convenience provisions on a case by case basis.
column74: As with all of our solution components, Lark strives to make member awareness and enrollment as intuitive and seamless as possible.   Lark helps partners drive awareness through a variety of online and offline touchpoints that can be leveraged by Sequoia at benefit fairs, and through HR-driven communication channels, email, direct mail, and SMS. These touchpoints are designed to introduce Lark as a brand and outline the benefit, highlight the incentives, and drive home the importance of the health-related outcomes to drive prospective members to the enrollment flow.   Lark can send these communications on your behalf,enabling us to use our test learnings and scale to improve response rates.  Our enrollment process guides members from initial campaign touchpoint to in-app coaching within a matter of minutes.   After engaging with a Lark campaign via QR code, SMS, or web link, members need only complete a simple eligibility verification before creating an account and downloading the Lark app.   Lark has leveraged a/b testing to optimize the messages, channels and calls to action to maximize adoption and trial; for example, we see double digit click through rates in SMS on our enrollment messages.   Our strategy has also been proven at the population level:  when we took over partner's marketing and communication strategy, we enrolled 5x their prior monthly average in our first month.
column79: Fostering diversity and inclusion is a top priority at Lark. We start with an inclusive hiring process that ensures we are reviewing candidates from various backgrounds before we make a decision on who to hire (we call this pipeline enrichment). We are proud to say that just over 50% of our workforce is female, which is a significant achievement in the tech industry.   As new employees are onboarded, we clearly communicate Lark’s corporate values and our expectations that all Larkers live up to them. We’ve added details for the values that tie directly to inclusion and belonging:   Lark Values 1. Innovate to Better Health 2. Driven to Impact 3. Act with Compassion: We believe that every person deserves care and compassion.  We honor the humanity of our patients.  We foster a culture where everyone is met with respect while showing up as their authentic selves. 4. Together, We Win: We recognize that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. As a team, we engage with positive intent, offer candid feedback, and collaborate with kindness to achieve our shared goals. 5. Freedom to be Awesome: We are trusted to take risks, are expected to be curious, and have fun along the way.  We have the freedom to be awesome!   Lark frequently measures our employees’ engagement and satisfaction, and we look at the data from the lens of gender, race, and age to ensure there are no inconsistencies. The People Operations team also runs a Diversity & Inclusion Council with Larkers from around the company to share what we’re doing to foster diversity & inclusion, and to plan activities for the company, like Pride Month celebrations, etc. Our data shows that the vast majority of our employees of all backgrounds feel included and that they belong at Lark.

column92: Our standard reporting is designed to help Sequoia understand utilization, trends, and insights, including quarterly and monthly business reviews. To support deeper insights, Lark can provide user-level data to support analytics by your data analytics vendors or benefits consultant. We can also provide custom analysis upon request or offer Sequoia access to consulting time with the Lark Business Insights team to answer ad hoc questions.   Examples of the types of ad hoc reports we can provide include: Year-in-review reports for specific non-standard intervals requested by the client; subgroup engagement/outcome analyses by metrics such as sex, age, geographic location, etc.; and detailed medication adherence information.   Lark is able to support many of these types of ad hoc data requests as long as reasonable notice is provided.   If the request involves metrics that are not currently included in reporting or involves building entirely new dashboards, there may be an additional cost to be scoped in advance for Sequoia.
