column40: Lively is the only organization to have started as a digital-first, direct-to-consumer HSA provider. Lively's beginning of focusing on the end-user experience and working into the employer market over the years has allowed us to bring the product-market fit with account holders to help solve the education gap that employers face as it relates to their employees understanding the benefits they are being provided. Lively unique value proposition is that we built our own recordkeeping platform using modern and proprietary technology which has allowed us to: 1. Be more nimble than our competition - we can iterate our product experience to meet the needs of our clients and account holders much faster than legacy providers 2. Our servicing was built directly into our recordkeeping platform so issues are resolved faster than our peers 3. We started with the end-user so we know how to help people maximize their benefits 4. We've built flexible technology to help shift the burden from our employer clients over to Lively  Lively is the fastest growing HSA provider of all time with over $2B of HSA assets on our platform.
column43: As this section looks to be a solution discovery for all solution pricing we have included our standard pricing below for HSA, FSA, HRA, LSA  and COBRA  IMPORTANT NOTE: Lively will never lose on price, but also don't want to win because of our price. What is listed below are standard prices. With our preferred broker partners and in many cases for Employer clients, our prices are reduced to ensure match the needs to the value we provide.   Standard HSA pricing is as follows:  HSA - $2.95 per participant per month (PPPM)  Monthly minimum: $50.00   Standard FSA pricing is as follows:  General Purpose FSA - $3.95 PPPM  General Purpose + Dependent Care FSA - $3.95 PPPM  Limited Purpose FSA (LPFSA) - $3.95 PPPM  Dependent Care FSA - $3.95 PPPM  LPFSA + Dependent Care FSA - $3.95 PPPM  There is only one FSA cost when multiple Lively FSAs are selected.  Monthly Minimum Fee- $100.00 for FSA only, or FSA + HSA combined;  $200.00 for FSA + any other Lively benefit(s)   Standard HRA pricing is as follows: 0 to 100 employees:  $4.75 per participant per month (PPPM) 101 to 250 employees: $4.50 per participant per month (PPPM) 251 to 500 employees: $4.25 per participant per month (PPPM) 501 to 1,000 employees: $4.00 per participant per month (PPPM) 1,001+ employees: $3.75 per participant per month (PPPM) Monthly Minimum: $100.00 for HRA only or HRA + HSA; $200.00 for HRA + any non-HSA Lively product  We charge on a “per participant, per month” basis. The administration fee includes monthly reporting, standard eligibility and contribution files, online employer dashboard, smart debit card adjudication, and ongoing customer support to help employees maximize account utilization. The optional ‘Integrated Enrollment Platform Fee' will be added to this fee, if selected.   Standard Lifestyle Spending Accounts (LSA) is as follows: LSA Administration Fee: $1.95 per benefit eligible employee per month (BEPM) Monthly Minimum: $100.00 for LSA only or LSA + HSA; $200.00 for LSA + any non-HSA Lively product  Medical Travel Account (MTA) MTA Administrative Fee: $3.00 per participant per month (PPPM) Monthly Minimum - $100.00 for MTA only or MTA + HSA;  $200.00 for MTA + any other Lively benefit(s)   Commuter Commuter Administration Fee : $4.00 per participant per month (PPPM) Lively ‘Reconnect’ LSA Administration Fee* : $4.00 per participant per month (PPPM) * The Lively ‘Reconnect’ LSA ‘Per Participant Per Month’ fee only applies to employees that do not wish to enroll in Lively Commuter and only wish to enroll in the ‘Reconnect’ LSA. Monthly Minimum Fee: $100.00 for Commuter only, Commuter + Reconnect LSA, or Commuter + HSA;   $200.00 for Commuter + any other Lively benefit(s)  Standard COBRA pricing:  Depending on the number of employees, prices range from: $0.60-$0.95 per benefit eligible employee per month (BEPM).  Monthly minimum: $100.00 for COBRA + Direct Bill only or $200.00 for COBRA + Direct Bill + any non-HSA Lively product.   Standard Direct Billing pricing:  Depending on the number of employees, prices range from: $3.75-$4.75 per pending and enrolled participant per month.  Monthly minimum: $100.00 for COBRA + Direct Bill only or $200.00 for COBRA + Direct Bill + any non-HSA Lively product.
column54: Our Member Support team is available Monday - Friday, 6:00 am - 6:00 pm Pacific Time (PT) excluding federal holidays. Our Interactive Voice Response (IVR) system and secure messaging are available 24/7.   Online chat is also available.
column55: At Lively, customer service is at the heart of everything we do. Our support philosophy is based on Lively’s core values. With every contact, we aim to represent Lively. We define it as going beyond expectations to ensure each client/participant feels heard, supported, and valued, no matter the circumstances. We take pride in being responsive, proactive, and empathetic, tackling challenges head-on to find the best possible solutions. Our approach is based on strong communication, being available when clients need us, and consistently delivering results that align with their goals. Ultimately, we view each interaction as an opportunity to build trust and long-lasting relationships.  Lively’s “One Team” approach is defined as all Member Support Associates (MSA) being fully trained to handle all aspects of account holder support through phone, email, secure messaging, and chat. When additional assistance is needed for the MSA to resolve the account holder's inquiry, the team utilizes our Knowledge Base and internal collaboration tools real-time, to provide accurate and consistent support. This approach allows all team members the ability to review the questions and answers to increase their education, as well as an opportunity to identify any documentation needed that is not documented in our online resource tool.    Each employer, regardless of group size, will be paired with a dedicated Customer Success Team who will act as their day-to-day point of contact, providing active support during implementation, and beyond.  Employers with 250+ benefit eligible lives will receive an assigned Customer Success Manager (CSM). The CSM will work with the employer from account setup and onboarding, and throughout the length of the relationship with Lively, up until account termination. The employer will have both a direct telephone number and email address for their assigned CSM.
column56: The preferred qualifications for our Customer Success Managers include a minimum of 5 years of client-facing experience and a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university, or equivalent work experience.  The preferred qualifications for our Member Support Team include a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university, but not required.
column65: CSAT score - 96%
column67: Once contracts are signed, most implementations are completed within 60 days, dependent on 3rd party involvement. In any scenario, Lively is able to load files into our system if the 3rd party isn't ready to do so on their end for reasons outside of our control which prevents delays. Lively prefers to begin as early as possible to ensure proper time is available for adequate open enrollment communication. A dedicated CST/CSM is with you every step of the way, providing proactive guidance and staying engaged even after onboarding is complete.     Lively's onboarding process prioritizes clarity and communication at every step. There are many variables to consider for plan configurations, but each employer can rely on their dedicated customer success team/manager to help them navigate any complexities. Customer success remains a constant year-round to maximize program success. A summary of our onboarding process is described below:  Step 1: Employer Sign-Up  Step 2: Kick-Off Call with Customer Success Team Step  3: Plan Configuration Step  4: Employee Enrollment  Final Step: Health Plan Effective Date  We would be happy to provide a Sample Implementation Timeline upon request.  Onboarding material varies by product.  We have uploaded the HSA Employer Quick Start Guide.
column73: 90-day written notification per Lively’s standard contract terms.
column74: Lively’s robust and comprehensive online tools take the burden of education off of employer administrators and makes it easy for employees to learn about their accounts, during open enrollment and throughout the plan year.    Lively also offers a self-guided decision support experience, LivelyIQ, that helps employees understand and compare their benefits offerings. LivelyIQ makes it easy for employees to compare health plans and other benefits taking into account their own personal and family healthcare needs. The comparison includes clear, easy to understand, structured information while also enabling the employee to ask LivelyIQ questions about the plans and gain further understanding tailored towards their own needs -- all at NO additional cost!    Self-service online resources include educational webinars and videos, timely blogs and 101 guides, eligible expense checker, and savings calculators. These, along with personalized account guidance, are also delivered directly via email so employees can stay one step ahead.    Administrators can access a curated resource center from the convenience of their Employer Dashboard. These can be easily shared for employee questions or targeted communications, and are available in English and Spanish.    Examples include: https://support.livelyme.com/hc/en-us, https://livelyme.com/resources/, and https://learn.livelyme.com/employer-resource-center/
column79: Lively has a diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) charter that outlines Lively's commitment to DEI, as well as our people practices and programs. Our DEI charter includes a DEI statement of intent and our business decision-making framework.
column82: Lively utilizes a proprietary solution called a Universal File. With the Universal File, an employer client can send Lively the already existing file they have configured for any of our competitors and Lively can automatically map that file to Lively's standards without the need configure a new file. This drastically cuts down on the time and reliance on a 3rd party. Our goal is to take the process from months down to possibly days with cooperation from the 3rd party BenAdmin systems.  Clients can also utilize our standard file if they don't already have a file in place.  We have included our standard HSA and Reimbursement enrollment file below.
column91: Lively does offer SSO capabilities. Lively will work with the Employer to determine the best way for account holders to single sign-on into their Lively account and back into their Employer's existing Member site.
column92: Our ready-built reports help cut through the clutter and bring clarity to benefit administrators. By understanding how employees engage with benefits, they can make informed decisions about payroll and benefits strategy.    HSA reports for benefit administrators include: Employee Enrollment - Details of all eligible employees and their enrollment status. Contribution Details - Details of all contributions over a specified period of time. YTD Contributions - Overall snapshot of any year-to-date contributions made within a given tax year. Cash vs. Investment - Summary of the cash and investment balance across open employee accounts YTD. Spenders vs. Savers - Shows how funds are spent or saved year-to-date. Program Features - Summary of program features currently utilized, such as accounts with a debit card, authorized users, security measures enabled, and more. Payroll Tax Savings - FICA savings for your company YTD.   For all other Lively reimbursement accounts such as FSA, HRA, Lifestyle & Wellness, and others, the list of reports include: Spend Details - Provides employee level claims and debit card transaction details throughout the plan year to help employers ensure that employees are utilizing their plans appropriately. Plan Summary - Provides employee level account detail of elections/benefits and YTD available balance throughout the plan year to help employers understand utilization. Funding - Provides an itemized list of funding details throughout the plan year to help employers review on a YTD or custom date range basis how much and what they have been debited for from Lively. Card Status - Provides employee level FSA/HRA debit card details such as order date, activation, spend, etc. to help employers better answer employees that have questions about accessing Reimbursement Account funds. Calendar Year Spend - Provides a calendar year view of employees’ RA election and reimbursements for W-2 reporting purposes.   And because we own our technology, Lively has the ability to create custom and/or ad hoc reports upon request.
column101: Lively, Inc. is a provider of flexible employee benefits and Health Savings Accounts (HSAs) for businesses and benefit consultants. All of our products are available directly via web and native mobile apps (highest rated mobile apps in the benefits industry) including compatibility with digital wallets.    • Comprehensive Employee Benefits Suite: Lively offers a range of benefits designed to meet diverse employee needs, including:      ◦ Health Savings Account (HSA)       ◦ Flexible Spending Account (FSA), including general purpose, limited purpose, and dependent care      ◦ Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA), including a standard/integrated HRA, Dental/Vision only, and Post-Deductible      ◦ Wellness/Lifestyle Spending Accounts (100% customizable or can select a set of pre-packaged versions)      ◦ Commuter/Parking/Transit      ◦ Medical Travel Accounts      ◦Continuation of Health Coverage (COBRA)       ◦Direct Bill
column104: 1.2 It is the intent of the Parties that HSAs will (i) not be administered as, or otherwise considered, an employee benefit plan subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 as amended (“ERISA”), and (ii) not be a part of the HDHP. The assets held in custody by the Custodian in HSAs, or in connection with HSAs, shall not be plan assets subject to the provisions of ERISA. In order to avoid the implication that Employer has fiduciary obligations with regard to HSAs and other ERISA implications, Employer agrees to limit its involvement with HSAs in accordance with DOL FAB 2006-02, and Employer will take no action that will or could arguably cause an HSA to become subject to ERISA.
column106: If Lively is administering COBRA benefits, the client will have the ability to terminate active employee status via the Lively employer dashboard or through a file feed and include the terminated employee on the COBRA eligibility file to Lively. The qualified beneficiary will receive COBRA enrollment material to elect FSA, if they so choose. If elected, Lively will turn the FSA plan back on for the COBRA participant.   If Lively is not handling COBRA administration, employers will terminate employees via the Lively employer dashboard or through a file feed. The FSA debit card will be suspended at the time of termination. Depending on the plan configuration, employees may have an additional period to submit claims incurred prior to termination. Lively can provide you with our COBRA operations team contact information to provide to your COBRA provider who can reach out to us with any COBRA enrollment or termination information.
column111: Lively will provide a draft Summary Plan Description (SPD) for the employer to review, edit, and execute. The SPD draft is included within our one-time Implementation Fee.
column117: Lively offers a range of benefits designed to meet diverse employee needs, including:      ◦ Health Savings Account (HSA)       ◦ Flexible Spending Account (FSA), including general purpose, limited purpose, and dependent care      ◦ Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA), including a standard/integrated HRA, Dental/Vision only, and Post-Deductible      ◦ Wellness/Lifestyle Spending Accounts (100% customizable or can select a set of pre-packaged versions)      ◦ Commuter/Parking/Transit      ◦ Medical Travel Accounts      ◦Continuation of Health Coverage (COBRA)       ◦Direct Bill  Lively has a robust Legal and Compliance Team, which is comprised of attorneys as well as compliance professional who are responsible for Lively’s Compliance Program. Lively receives regular updates on IRS changes that may impact its business. Lively is also a member of the HSA council, which is comprised members of HSA providers, and this body is aware of potential changes and changes to the regulatory landscape. Further, Lively’s platform is configured to adhere to compliance and regulatory requirements.   For Members, Lively provides all required tax forms including 1099-SA and 5498-SA reporting (if applicable). We notify Members when these become available for download from within the Member dashboard during the annual tax season.
column119: Lively’s platform is configured to adhere to compliance and regulatory requirements. Legislative and regulatory updates affecting Lively's product offerings and/or customer needs are instantiated into the product as appropriate, communicated in emails and marketing materials on the website, and as appropriate, explained directly to customers by Lively's Customer Service Teams.  Lively's SPDn and plan document templates are owned by the Legal and Compliance Team and each document is customized to a plan sponsor. The Legal and Compliance Team has regulatory change management protocols in place to remain abreast of the latest updates.  We would be happy to provide client facing materials upon client requet.
column124: Your customer success team (CST) / Customer Success Manager (CSM) will collaborate with the Legal & Compliance team, as needed, for any questions or concerns.
column127: Lively covers all tax related items with the client upfront as part of implementation. Additionally, for HSA programs, when tax forms are ready to be produced, clients will be informed by their Lively CSM as to what to expect within the Member experience and dashboards

column40: ✔ End-to-end platform that delivers support for improved outcomes across multiple care journeys; fertility/family building, preconception & prenatal care, maternity, parenting, menopause, behavioral health, condition management  ✔ Predictive analytics catalyze early intervention using health assessment data that identifies risks for management and preventive care  ✔ High member engagement (including vulnerable populations) with 30-70 touch points per user per month  ✔ Clinical value that includes true results, evidenced by our 20+ health plan clients  ✔ In-house care team that delivers individualized care ,greater ROI, member engagement, & 1:1 care for diverse populations & supports all paths to parenthood  ✔ Integration with top health plans, vendors, & aggregators to include: Apree/Castlight, Virgin Pulse, Sharecare, Alight, etc.   ✔ Validated ROI supported by 10 years of claims reduction, 50+ published studies  ✔ 50+ comprehensive multi-condition & DEIB programs to include hypertension & preeclampsia, perinatal mood disorders  ✔ Prevents unnecessary fertility treatment utilization with up to 65% ART reduction  ✔ Simple, & flexible, fertility & family building benefit that includes adoption, surrogacy, ART, egg freezing  ✔ Commitment to advancing DEIB & clinical standards; a recent example includes a co-developed validated tool to measure and report out on respectful care of black women

column54: 7 days a week, 365 days a year
column55: Ovia Health's approach to customer service is consistently serving our members through every aspect of their journey as a 24/7 advocate.  Ovia provides immense value to your employees by providing peace of mind and filling information and support gaps prior to care or in-between visits.   Members can engage in a high touch, personal model with a care advocate and unlimited access to in-house experts in women’s and family health, empowering them with psychosocial support to combat burnout, identify mental health needs and other risk factors earlier, and gain clinically-backed knowledge to feel confident in decisions for their or their family’s health.   Our daily support system and guidance powers the opportunity for equitable, inclusive experiences as members navigate their health and family building choices, supporting priorities for a family-friendly culture to retain and attract highly valued talent.  Finally, we can share personal testimonials from your own members’ conversations with our Care Team. These are particularly powerful because they demonstrate the variety of topics that members depend on Ovia Health for, 365 days a year, to influence positive behavioral change and enable proactive improvement of outcomes at each stage. For example, we can share instances when a Health Coach emotionally supports a Fertility member struggling with subfertility, proactively reaches out to discuss a Pregnancy member who reported dizziness in her Daily Log Page, or assists a Parenting member in developing a strong return-to-work plan that works for her and her family.
column56: Ovia Health's Care Team are all Ovia employees and not contracted staff. Across of care team, the subject matter expertise averages 10+ years in their respective areas of professional experience.   Our Care Team is inclusive of our Health Coach team and our Care Advocate team. These area of specialities are as follows:  Health Coaches/Experts: (available 12 hrs/day, 365 days/year)  - Certified nurse midwives  - Nurse practitioners  - Fertility, Labor & delivery, NICU, and Pediatric RNs  - Lactation consultants  - Infant/child sleep coaches  - Nutritionist/dietitians  Care Advocates: (available Mon-Fri.)  - Perinatal mental health certification (PMH-C)  - Health Education Specialists  - Public Health experience  - Doula experience  Care Advocate Team Training:  - Minimum of Bachelor's degree  - Trained in general mental health  - All Perinatal mental health certified (PMH-C)  - Reproductive health/fertility training   - Family Building/Family Planning Training  Care Advocate Team Experience:  - Benefits Navigation  - Public Health  - Community Resource Navigation  - Connecting people to healthcare and mental health providers
column67: All Ovia Clients are assigned a dedicated & experienced Account Manager.   Process: Once an agreement is signed, the Ovia Sales Team will hand off the client to the Client Operations Manager to lead implementation. The assigned Account Manager will also ride along during the implementation to get to know the client and ensure a seamless transition into the account relationship. The Client Operations Manager will ensure that the project is following timelines and will bring in the right subject matter experts along the way. Once the client goes live, the Account Manager will take over as the day to day contact. The Account Manager is supported by a Client Success team lead and rolls under the VP, Client Success. The Client Operations Manager and the Account Manager will bring in different stakeholders based on the client needs to support including executive sponsors, marketing/communications and technical resources as required to ensure exceptional service delivery is achieved.   The Implementation is lead by the a Client Operations Manager who will be accompanied by the designated Account Manager for the customer. The Client Operations Manager leads the project, driving to successful launch and ensuring our client's program launches on time. As we prepare for launch, we ask that your stakeholders meet with our implementation team at least once every two weeks for 30 minutes, but we may decide to meet more regularly or for a longer duration depending on the scope of the project. Key deliverables from the customer will include: information about benefits available, eligibility file confirmation, logo in .png or .eps format, and various approvals throughout the build. During the implementation process, our Client Success team will work with the customer to build upon proven engagement methods by integrating knowledge about their organization’s culture with assets to maximize engagement. The team leverages the expertise of Ovia Health's Marketing and Product Teams to evaluate workforce demographics, environmental factors, corporate communication infrastructure and culture to determine the best approach to achieve optimal engagement and outcomes for our clients.   Once the program is launched, the Ovia Health Client Success Manager facilitates regular, recurring meetings with the client for status updates, issue identification and resolution, and can also attend employee facing meetings for program promotion as appropriate. These meetings may also include the Director, Client Success, marketing/communications and technical resources as required, to ensure exceptional service delivery is achieved. Creating a forum for ongoing evaluation of our client’s goals and objectives, Ovia Health is committed to quarterly strategic meetings with key client stakeholders including executive sponsors, program manager, marketing/communications/PR, and IT/Tech. This meeting serves as an opportunity to review program goals, progress against those goals and ensure strategic alignment is maintained.   Implementation typically takes just 8-10 weeks and Ovia Health works to minimize the implementation burden for our clients by streamlining processes through our Client Operations Manager, the quarterback of your implementation. We schedule 30 minute bi-weekly calls leading up to the implementation and only ask for 4 milestone items during the build process:  1. client logo  2. completed benefits checklist (a list of benefits you offer to build out custom benefit modules in the Ovia solutions, directing members to your benefit ecosystem at their fingertips)  3. establish an eligibility file (Ovia typically works directly with the eligibility file source, taking the lift off the customer)  4. review the Ovia-written benefit modules  During implementation, Ovia meets on a weekly basis. Upon go live, Ovia will host check-ins at a minimum of monthly for the first quarter. Based on the needs and preference of the client, we typically meet Quarterly with a deeper review of the data and check-in on the marketing plan. We also complete an annual look back and strategy review with each client.  Pending the client logistics, this annual meeting can occur in person. Some clients prefer a different meeting cadence and we are flexible to accommodate scheduling based on specific client needs.
column74: Ovia has digital content toolkit in the forms of brochures, flyers, digital posters, print posters, internet banners, postcard, FAQs, one-pagers, launch email, videos and webinars. Our multi-channel collateral is updated on a quarterly basis with hot topics relevant to our membership, and is conveniently accessible through a self-serve enrollment microsite to communicate with employees and managers onsite, through events and fairs, or digitally throughout the year. (at no cost)  The Ovia solutions will be branded with the client's logo throughout the mobile experience. For example, employer branding is reflected on a participant's home screen, as well in the employer-specific benefits hub in-app. An important aspect of the Ovia solution is to make sure associates and their families understand the investment the client makes in all of the benefits that are intended to improve their lives and overall well-being.   Partnering with Ovia represents an important opportunity for the client to communicate its commitment to women and families within its workforce. Custom marketing project requests will be scoped on a client by client basis, additional fees may apply.   Client communications are customized with logo inclusion as well as additional customized content, as needed. When supplying branded content, Ovia will develop [Client Name] branded digital content in the forms of brochures, flyers, digital posters, print posters, internet banners, post card, FAQs, one-pagers, launch email, quarterly email campaigns, videos and webinars to be leveraged both onsite and online. In addition to packages uniquely curated for you and your team, Ovia has capabilities to do direct outreach to your populations, including email, direct mail, social and digital advertising and more. Direct campaigns are coordinated with you and your team based on your needs.  Custom marketing project requests will be scoped on a project basis, additional fees may apply
column79: DE&I initiatives and commitments to our members  focus on inclusive, accessible, and personalized support.   Ovia Health is committed to making a healthy, happy family possible for everyone. Each component of the Ovia Health solution — clinical education, coaching and services, adherence tools, and product features is designed to be accessible, inclusive, and customizable to members’ preferences and needs.  This is inclusive of but not limited to the following: Birth equity: Birth equity is the assurance of the conditions of optimal births for all people with a willingness to address racial and social inequalities in a sustained effort. In partnership with leading research institutions, Ovia Health aims to identify and address the driving forces behind racial disparities to improve outcomes for Black mothers and babies.  The Ovia Health solution engages pregnant and postpartum members multiple times per day through virtual maternal & infant health programs, concierge navigation to local doulas & providers, and an in-house coaching team to improve birth outcomes.  LGBTQ+ support: Ovia Health provides specific, comprehensive programming for LGBTQ+ members, including IUI, IVF, adoption, and surrogacy programs. Clinical pathways direct members to relevant resources and benefits as they navigate the family building path. And when members have questions — how to select a sperm donor, take part in a surrogate’s pregnancy, or introduce a child to an adopted sibling — Ovia Health has the answers they need.  Dads and partners: Ovia Health offers programs for working parents, AAP guideline-driven children’s health education, and inclusive coaching for lactation, baby sleep, returning to work, and parental wellness, as well as account sharing functionality.  SDoH: Ovia Health works to improve health outcomes and reduce health disparities through research and product initiatives. The Ovia Health Clinical Research Group has partnered with University of Wisconsin, Madison to better understand how individual and environmental factors influence outcomes. The Ovia Health solution considers the interplay between various SDoH and provides accessible, empathetic, personalized programming. • Economic stability: Ovia Health provides education and navigation to public programs to help women access food supplementation, breastfeeding resources, nutrition education, formula, and other healthcare or community-based services. • Education: Ovia Health increases health literacy through digestible, clinical education written at a middle-school reading level in both English and Spanish to limit communication barriers to crucial healthcare information that drive health disparities. The solution is accessible for those with disabilities. • Social and community context: Ovia Health’s Community feature allows members to safely, anonymously connect through shared experiences. Simultaneously, clinical pathways, educational content, and health coaches destigmatize aspects of healthcare that are often considered taboo and empower members to address healthcare concerns with their providers. • Health and healthcare: Ovia Health’s Care Finder program connects members to quality, values-aligned, in-network healthcare providers. Within the solution, members can access daily health insights and tracking tools to plan for prenatal visits. Ovia Health’s coaching team provides personalized, actionable advice 7 days a week.
column82: Setup and Requirements: Ovia Health supports SFTP as the means of obtaining eligibility files.  The requirements around Ovia Health’s SFTP and eligibility file setup are: File Format:  CSV  Standard fields generally include the following depending on the complexity of the file type: unique ID, first name, last name, DOB, postal code, subscriber unique ID, relationship, country code, email address
